Job Description:
Fixed Term Contract

We're currently seeking Data Scientists based in and around Leamington Spa with experienced of processing large scientific data sets to work within a state of the art, high output diagnostics laboratory environment as part of the UK's NHS Test and Trace programme.

As well as playing a vital role in supporting society's return to a more normal way of life by helping to break the chains of COVID-19 transmission, you will also gain invaluable experience and exposure to some of the country's most highly skilled individuals in the scientific community.

This represents a once in a lifetime opportunity to go above and beyond to support public health, while also extending your already accomplished scientific data skills and positioning your career for further success and growth.

If of interest and you meet the criteria of the below, please apply via the following link - https://bit.ly/34DZEaT.

Your responsibilities:

In the role of Data Scientist, you will be responsible for the analysis of sample data and correct tracking and recording of the analysis in the appropriate LIMS database, to the lab's accreditation standards. You will be expected to process large data sets accurately and to identify anomalous results.

Your priority will be to manage the flow of data out of the laboratories, resulting in correct patient sample reporting. You will also analyse non-clinical data as part of process optimisation and escalate any quality control issues relating to reagent performance to the quality manager.

Your experience:

In order to be successful in the role, you'll need the following education and experience:

Education:

BSc Honours degree in a biological science

Experience:

Proven track record in processing large scientific data sets accurately
Previous experience working with PCR datasets
Knowledge of diagnostic test, particularly PCR
Previous experience within a laboratory environment
Expert use of database and data analysis tools
For a Lead role - you will also need experience of line management and have the ability to delegate workloads and work across a remote platform.

In addition, the following experience is also desirable but not mandatory:

Experience

Practical experience using or administrating Oracle, MS-SQL and Postgres SQL databases.
Experience with Sportfire, R or other visualization and analysis packages.

In return:

As well as a competitive rate of pay (with a 20% uplift applied for night working and end of contract bonus), you'll receive comprehensive training on relevant lab procedures and equipment.

This role will work on a shift pattern and will include day, evening and weekend shifts. Please speak to our team to learn more.

You will also be joining a diverse and hugely welcoming team. Diversity is about reflecting the communities we serve, holding the principles of equality and inclusion at the heart of everything we do and all that we stand for, embracing differences, creating possibilities, and growing together. We aim to foster a culture where individuals of all backgrounds feel confident in bringing their whole selves to work, feel included and their talents are nurtured, empowering them to contribute fully to our purpose.

This is literally a once in a lifetime opportunity to join a team of highly skilled individuals, all focussed on delivering the best possible outcome.

If you're ready for a new challenge and want to be part of the team delivering this essential lab work, please apply today via https://bit.ly/34DZEaT.

PURPOSE OF THE ROLE

PerkinElmer is on the frontline of fighting Covid 19. Our complete workflows with standardized equipment and kits are available to help labs address their SARS-CoV-2 testing challenges. We are recruiting staff for 12 month fixed term contracts at a new greenfield laboratory based in Charnwood.

The site Logistics Manager acts as the primary coordinator for global inbound flow of goods from PerkinElmer and vendors to PerkinElmer operated Labs within the UK. Primary responsibilities will be to interface with various internal and external partners (e.g. PerkinElmer shipping sites, suppliers, PerkinElmer receiving Labs, PerkinElmer Planning, Transport Carriers and Customs Brokers) for timely delivery and customs clearance of product. Additional responsibilities will include problem research and resolution to deliver site operational support

RESPONSIBILITIES

Own, manage, and coordinate the logistical support required to site overseeing the planning of needs, procurement of needs, from products coming in, the stocking, movement of workflow and removal of waste.
Supervise assigned suppliers, materials and commodities to ensure on-time delivery, high quality items and services, at optimized costs.
Manage the site materials team to support the complete supply chain. This includes forecasting demand, inventory management and releasing both internal and external orders.
Work alongside a second Logistic manager to take ownership of key dual occupancy site role
Maintain and use of logistical spreadsheet to give clear feedback and update briefings to senior management
Facilitate consistent and timely customs clearance and delivery of the above orders via track, trace, and problem resolution as well as obtain and distribute Carrier Proof of Delivery information as needed.
Provide shipping status and order visibility information as required to both internal and external clients, monitoring ship information, closing of shipped orders, etc.
Ensure lab needs are met to ensure daily throughput
Act as the control tower / primary escalation for questions related to inbound shipments: Including research and resolution of delays, site escalation, and carrier and customs broker escalation when needed and escalating urgent requests and challenges as needed across the org to overcome roadblocks.
Interface with internal and external partners to process shipments. Partners routinely include Super Territory Distribution Centers, Manufacturing Sites, Freight Forwarders, Global Order Fulfillment, Sales and Service managers, International Trade Compliance, and Accounting.
Close interaction with Building Service Director/Manager
Create, monitor, review, and reconcile key performance reports for each Lab location incl. collecting and analyzing data related to carrier and warehouse performance.
Perform other tasks and activities, as needed, to support our PerkinElmer Operated Labs, suppliers, PerkinElmer shipping sites, Planning Team, and our Internal and External Partners.
Ensure the site remains fit for purpose, clear of waste and non-productive products
Aside from managing the daily import clearance process, this position is responsible for ensuring that the site has the proper internal controls and that they are documented in an import management system, especially customs broker management.

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor Degree or documented working evidence and a minimum of 5 years’ experience in customer order / import / export / distribution processes/ trade compliance.
Experience working with SAP ERP systems and multiple modules (e.g. planning + sales and dist. + warehouse management)
Good working knowledge in Microsoft Excel, Outlook, and other Microsoft Office applications is strongly preferred
Working knowledge of key International Trade Compliance regulations.
Experience in work for a Health Care industry and handling / managing diagnostic, biopharma and life sciences commodities will be an advantage.
Good time management and prioritizations skills to balance shifting priorities
Ability to interact effectively & respectfully in a global, multi-lingual, multi-cultural environment.
Strong capability to effectively communicate, verbally and in writing, in English is required
Strong interpersonal, facilitation, multi-tasking, collaboration, and self management skills
Flexibility to work in a global environment where night and weekend (and even holiday) support is routinely required
Exceptional multi team management knowledge

Working Environment

Clinical and research lab environment; exposure to blood borne pathogens; must wear protective lab gear including lab coat, gloves and completely closed footwear.
Employee may be requested to work shifts other than daylight depending on the needs of the laboratory. Weekend rotation may be required.
Travel is not required.
Ensure safety, security, and the environment in all aspect of the daily activities, and any potential safety hazards are addressed and corrected immediately.
Understand ergonomic relationship between people, equipment and working environment.

PURPOSE

PerkinElmer is on the frontline of fighting Covid 19. Our complete workflows with standardized equipment and kits are available to help labs address their SARS-CoV-2 testing challenges. We are recruiting Clinical Laboratory Managers for a 6-12 month fixed term contracts at a new greenfield laboratory based in Newport and another in Charnwood, nr Loughborough that will eventually run on a 24/7 schedule.

This is an exciting opportunity for an independent, creative, service-oriented individual to help build clinical sequencing laboratory services. The candidate will be responsible for daily supervision of a high throughput clinical laboratory including oversight of laboratory technologists, technical trouble-shooting validation and testing processes, reviewing lab results, developing and writing operational procedures, monitoring laboratory key performance indicators, quality metrics and the QC program, timely reporting of quality event reporting to the laboratory director and to quality management, and provide regulatory, due diligence and internal auditing support. Must have experience and be able to apply regulations to clinical diagnostic operations.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Manage the daily operations of assigned laboratory personnel to ensure that specimens are properly shipped and received, tests are performed accurately and efficiently, and results are reported in a timely manner.
Perform pre-analytical, analytical and post analytical test process and evaluate results produced relative to the diagnostic assessment.
Evaluate data for accuracy and verify any questionable finding with proper documentation, thorough investigation, and appropriate follow-through.
Assist with designing processes and procedures to ensure efficient turn-around time and accuracy of results.
Prepare and manage laboratory budget.
Coach and mentor staff on technical expertise and assist in evaluation of employee competencies.
Engage in continuous process and service improvement. Make and implement recommendations to improve operational efficiency and implement new services for areas of responsibility.
Requires strict adherence to quality control guidelines to ensure integrity of laboratory specimens and accuracy of results.
Ensure all work is in accordance with state and Federal regulations, organizational policy, and accreditation/compliance requirements.
Assist in maintaining CAP and other accreditation and regulatory agency standards and regulations.
Performing bench work and other duties as required including shift work.

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in biology or related scientific discipline and a
Extensive experience of clinical molecular experience
Previous Supervisory/Management experience in a clinical laboratory setting.
Quality Assurance and Quality Control applications in clinical diagnostics
Must be detail oriented, organized, with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to troubleshoot technical applications and work independently under pressure of deadlines and a fast paced, high throughput team environment.
Practical knowledge of routine laboratory equipment and procedures.
Experience with LIMS and laboratory automation highly desired.

WHAT WE OFFER YOU:

Fixed term contract with competitive remuneration package
Stimulating role in startup
Purposeful & inspirational environment
Access to cutting-edge expertise and solutions contributing to the wellbeing of the local community
Being part of a highly qualified team that is committed to excellence

See yourself being part of a large, transformational change? This could be the role for you!

Iress is continuing to hire for roles during Covid-19 with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually. Everyone new to the team, along with our current staff, will temporarily work from home until it is safe to return to our offices.

The role

As a Business Development Manager, you will be actively involved in helping to drive new revenue growth for the Iress Trading & Market Data division. This role will involve face to face solution sales of our Trading & Market Data product suite, working closely with a variety of internal teams across Iress including Client Solutions, Account Management and Product.

What you will be doing

Developing and executing sales plans to support business strategies and goals across the sector

Working closely with the Executive General Manager of Trading & Market Data in new business activities

Articulating and demonstrating our Trading products value proposition both internally and externally

Having hands-on involvement with new business tenders and remaining fully involved in throughout the sales and delivery process with new clients

Contributing to the marketing strategy to ensure the generation of lead flow, and self generate where necessary.

What you will need

You will be driven and self-motivated, with a desire to win.

Experience of working to tight deadlines with consistent quality output is essential

Demonstrable ability to achieve results and work in a constantly changing environment, with a hands on approach to driving new business and building strong relationships with prospective clients

Detailed knowledge of the key business drivers for Financial Services companies with special reference to technology and business change.

Knowledge of the Trading & Market Data sector is essential and experience selling solutions within this industry is key

Excellent communication and presentation skills, with a need to be able to communicate effectively at all client levels, including the Executive level.

Proven track record of closing sales and hitting targets

Data Science Lead - 12 month Fixed Term Contract

The Data Science Lead role provides an exciting opportunity to join the Demand Estimation team here at Xoserve. The team play a crucial role in the delivery of analysis and development of gas demand models/profiles which support daily balancing and invoicing processes within the gas industry.

Reporting to the Business Process Manager, the Data Science Lead is responsible for delivering a range of analytical services to internal and external customers including data extraction and statistical analysis, demand modelling, problem investigation, performance improvement and reporting. The Data Science Lead will be responsible for ensuring that all work is carried out to appropriate and defined standards whilst seeking to introduce continual improvements and demonstrating effective controls. Along with this, the Data Science Lead will work with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders to ensure high quality service delivery and work in collaboration with project teams of their specific business area.

Role Accountabilities

· Act as primary point of contact for internal and external stakeholders for the purpose of delivering the Demand Estimation team’s contractual obligations of producing robust gas demand models and completing related analytical assignments.

· In conjunction with the Business Process Manager, assess the customer’s requirements for each analytical assignment, determine the data and resource needs for the assignment, and select the most appropriate approach to the completion and documentation of the assignment.

· Evaluate the changing needs of the Demand Estimation service, liaising with internal and external customers to identify areas for improvement using the latest data analysis techniques. Make recommendations for service improvement and implement to the satisfaction of internal and external customers.

· Ensure that the team observes and follows established processes, procedures and policies within remit of responsibility adhering to agreed Key Performance Measures, Service Level Agreements and quality standards to maximise customer satisfaction.

· Contribute to operational or business change projects from requirements identification through to user testing and implementation.

· Plan and monitor progress of contractual obligations and analytical assignments and report regularly to the Business Process Manager, anticipating future problems and taking preventative action.

· Engage with other team members and the wider business to ensure processes within own remit of responsibility are consistent and fit for purpose. Share and adopt best practice.

Specialist/Technical Expertise

· Demonstrated experience in one or more of the following in a complex and dynamic environment: code development, data extraction and statistical analysis; demand modelling; problem investigation; performance improvement; reporting.

· Degree level education or the equivalent in either a numerate or science discipline, highly desirable.

· Knowledge of data analysis with hands on experience of working with large volumes of data using a range of analytical toolsets, preferably SAS and/or ‘R’ or Python

· Experience of using Machine Learning to develop new / improve existing processes is highly desirable

MOO set out to shake up the world of print back in 2006. And we’ve come a long way since. Today we’re a 300 + strong team (we’re thinking of getting matching jackets) who create print and digital products for companies of all sizes – from Google and AirBnB to the guy who makes those amazing prints you found at a craft fair.
Our global HQ is in London, UK, while we also have premises in Dagenham. In the US, you’ll find us in Boston, MA, as well as Lincoln, RI and Denver, CO.

We’re making new and exciting things – and we could really do with your help.

We are continuing to build on creating an amazing People operations team and so we are looking for an experienced People Operations Manager. Someone who is passionate about high quality people experiences and driving day to day operations in our People Team across our global network. We have an employee consumer focus by designing and building people products and experiences that our employees want to interact with, and, which also delivers business results. We have a strong people team foundation, and yet, still early in our quest to build scalable, high quality people experiences, of which you will be integral to our future.
Responsibilities include:
Ensure we have a high quality people operations experience across MOO worldwide
Ensure People services and processes are repeatable, efficient, scalable and engaging
Create new and innovative ways to better our service proposition
Responsible for defining, monitoring and reporting on HR operational delivery as part of agreed KPIs and SLAs
Creation, maintenance and embedding People policy and practice
Implementing an effective self service tiered model
Contribute to the continuous improvement of all HR systems and practices in the organisation (Bamboo, Cultureamp, JIRA, ADP, Small Improvements)
Produce reports and provide clear, meaningful metrics around human capital like headcount, engagement, development and attrition to Leadership and Exec
Responsible for the on boarding process and experience including both the transactional and the learning experience. Transactional including overseeing the generation of offer letters, contracts, reference checking and inductions
Ensure HR System data is up to date, accurate and complies with legislation at all times
Review and upkeep our Policies in line with our standards, values and current legislation.
Own all MOO benefits including communication, review and annual renewal
Oversee the payroll administration and compliance in a timely manner along with reviewing and implementing process improvements
Ensure that all candidates have the correct Right To Work documents and advise and oversee any visa application required to ensure compliance for Sponsorship
Drive and administer the Company’s performance management system including probationary reviews, annual performance reviews, annual salary reviews, performance improvement plans, disciplinary & grievance meetings, and terminations
Manage and develop the People Operations team
Manage and work with internal stakeholders to deliver legal submissions (gender pay reporting, 401k audit)
About You
Strong people operation experience ideally in an ecommerce business
Proven capability at improving and scaling people operations team and services
Have Managed People operations across multiple geographies (ideally USA and UK)
Able to lead and influence internationally and sometimes without direct line management
Have a customer-focused approach to People
Proactive, solutions based HR style
Excellent eye for detail, you make sure all the t’s are crossed and i’s dotted!
Experience managing and working on a global HRIS (Bamboo and ADP)
Strong analytical and reporting skills
Strong visa process knowledge UK and US
Experience working with pension/401k auto enrolment compliance schemes UK and US
Advanced communications skills
Current generalist experience and knowledge of employment law and best practice
Must be highly organised, flexible team player with excellent prioritisation and strong follow-up skills.
Experience of working to and setting SLAs/KPIs within a team.
Strong focus on continuous improvement
What’s it like to work at MOO?
MOO’s the kind of workplace where you can really be yourself. Dye your hair purple. Hit the sofa with your laptop. Whatever helps you feel comfortable and happy at work. We want to help you grow in your career and set you up for success – while also recognising the importance of a healthy work/life balance.

That’s why we offer 25 days holiday rising by one day for each year here (for 5 years), a matched pension scheme, MOO’s share option scheme, and paid parental leave. We’ll offer you private healthcare, life insurance, a season ticket loan, subsidised gym membership and a cycle to work scheme. Finally, we’ll treat you to breakfast and fresh fruit every day, lunch on Fridays and all the ice cream you can eat (just watch for the brain freeze).

Diversity Statement
We are working hard to create a representative, inclusive and super-friendly team, because we know that different experiences, perspectives and backgrounds make for a better workplace. And that creates a better experience for our customers. MOO doesn’t discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion or belief, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital status, disability or any other protected class.

Actuarial Manager: Our Ageas actuarial department are looking to bring on board an experienced candidate to join our busy Eastleigh office. Initially working from home, with flexible working options when it is safe and appropriate to return to the office. The role would suit an almost-qualified or recently qualified Actuary, although other candidates with suitable experience will be considered.

Our actuarial department is responsible for pricing, reserving, capital modelling and forecasting our business lines and the Actuarial Manager will be playing a leading role within the Commercial lines team. This is a mixed pricing and reserving role, working regularly with colleagues in finance, claims, risk and underwriting. The Actuarial manager will support the Head of the team and the Chief Actuary in all aspects of the team's work across multiple areas, therefore experience managing and mentoring others to ensure the team develops and delivers consistently high-quality output is crucial. A proven track record of preparing and presenting a wide range of actuarial analysis to other stakeholders is also highly desirable.

The Actuarial Manager would suit someone coming from a consultancy background who wants to make a move into industry or for someone who has some relevant experience and wants to broaden their role and take the next step in their career. The role offers a high degree of autonomy and the Actuarial Manager must be a confident self-starter with the ability to prioritise work, be a confident decision maker and have a flair for manipulating and interpreting data to help deliver high impact, intelligent solutions.

The main responsibilities of the Actuarial Manager:

Oversee elements of the quarterly and monthly reserve review exercises, prepare high quality reports explaining the results as well as additional claims related analyses.
Support in the development and maintenance of effective statistical models and MI in relation to the company's underwriting performance and pricing strength.
Review work prepared by other team members and prepare clear and effective communications to present the results.
Line management responsibilities for up to two team members initially, providing regular and effective feedback and supporting all aspects of their development.
Conduct and oversee regular and ad-hoc pricing analyses to support UW teams, communicating results and their implications.

The successful Actuary Manager will have the following:

Strong general insurance knowledge & experience with a sound understanding of reserving and pricing analysis and principles and experience of a wide range of technical issues, ideally 5 years actuarial experience.
Experience managing and mentoring others with the ability to lead by example, maintain a visible leadership presence.
Experience of managing and addressing performance consistently and ability to delegate effectively ensuring appropriate participation and support.
Strong communication skills, experience of preparing and presenting technical reports for non-actuarial stakeholders.
Good project management skills. Good risk evaluation skills. Proactive and innovative.

Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy within the Actuary Manager role based in Eastleigh:

A competitive pension for which Ageas will pay twice the amount.
Generous amount of holidays with the option to buy up to 10 additional days.
Annual Salary review.
Discretionary annual bonus based on personal and company performance.
Life assurance of 4 x salary with the option to flex up.
Return to work programme scheme.
Flexible benefits package (private medical insurance, health and dental plans, free life assurance policy, discounted gym membership, cycle to work scheme as well as discounts with a wide range of retailers through our partner Perkz.com).
Support groups- well-being activities, yoga, mindfulness sessions, Sports and Social Club events and more.

At Globality, we're proud to embody the core values of innovation, collaboration, and trust in both our culture and product.

We're creating ground-breaking technology utilizing a world-class, AI-powered Platform that revolutionizes how businesses buy and sell services. We are an open, inclusive, and diverse organization and our employees are at the heart of the great products we create.

We've raised over $172M and are supported by an impressive group of prominent investors, including Al Gore and SoftBank Vision Fund. Our co-founders, Joel Hyatt and Lior Delgo, are seasoned entrepreneurs who bring an extensive business-building experience to our organization. Our impressive board includes Dennis Nally (former Global Chairman of PwC) and Ron Johnson (former SVP of Apple).

We're excited to deliver the best in both innovative technologies and customer-focused experiences to realize our mission of creating a more inclusive global economy. Come help us build something great!

Role Summary:

Are you experienced, passionate Product Manager looking to join a fast-growing company? Are you seeking dynamic role, career growth, and substantially contributing to the creation of a more inclusive global economy?

We are looking for a senior product manager who is passionate about working on cutting edge technology and user-experiences, and bringing them to scale. Our product efforts include adaptive conversational interfaces, AI powered interactions and knowledge graph, combining human experts with machine-intelligence, and habit-forming and habit-changing product dynamics.

What you will be doing:
Own a critical area of the Globality product, an AI-powered solution revolutionizing how businesses buy and sell services.
Work with enterprise customers and internal experts to understand customer challenges and conceptualize solutions.
Define user stories and product requirements that align to company objectives. Prioritize a backlog of features and ideas for your product area.
Employ product management techniques to validate that you are building the right solution (e.g. design thinking, analytics, user testing, prioritization frameworks...)
Be a trusted product leader of your cross-functional team of designers, project managers, and engineers. Maintain high quality standards, focus, and urgency.
Communicate goals, plans, status, and results across the organization.
Serve as primary product subject matter expert on your product area of ownership within the company.
You will be based out of London, UK location and will collaborate closely with colleagues in Menlo Park, CA (HQ), and Bozeman, MT.
What we are looking for:
Has 5+ years of experience as a product manager developing Procurement or Finance SaaS products.
A results-driven cross-functional leader that thrives on accountability. Maintains clarity and focus through effective communication. Knows the big picture and stays on top of small requirements and execution details. Builds team spirit and common sense of purpose.
Has a proven track record of building relationships and influencing without authority at all levels of the organization.
Well-versed in design thinking, adept at observing and analyzing user behavior, is an experienced design collaboration partner.Eager to learn and to share knowledge with others.
BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Finance or related

About Syngenta:
Syngenta is leading science-based agtech company; dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture.

The role:

Working within our Product Metabolism & Analytics Science team the successful candidate will serve as a key scientific contributor providing expertise to project teams and other areas as required. We are looking for individuals with a background in metabolism, whether it is plant, environmental or mammalian. This is an opportunity to develop your career in Product Metabolism & Analytics and join a high performing team.

The successful candidate will:

Serve as a key scientific contributor within the ADME, Dietary and/or Environmental functions of Product Metabolism and Analytical Science (PMAS) providing expertise to project teams and other functional areas as required.
Lead and coordinate the delivery of business critical data generated at contract research organisations, being responsible for protocol design, evaluating data and reviewing/authorising company reports.
Represent the department at various project meetings to address metabolism-related issues and provide guidance for decision making purposes about compound progression.

Accountabilities:

Manage studies placed with external suppliers to ensure delivery of data of the appropriate quality to time and cost.
Co-ordinate the delivery of studies conducted internally or externally to ensure project needs are met.
Independently provide technical assistance and innovative solutions to external suppliers, where appropriate, to facilitate transfer of technical know-how.
Communicate the meaning of data and its implication to projects.
Through participation in project teams, contribute to key decisions and aid compound selection.
Work with colleagues in other functions to support the use of data sets generated by PMAS to optimise study design and overall understanding of the compounds behaviour.

Qualifications

Knowledge

Minimum of a degree (or equivalent) in biological or chemical sciences.
Background knowledge of metabolism (either environmental, plant or mammalian) studies and objectives.

Experience

Experience of working in multi-disciplinary project teams.
Experience of accessing services through third-party organisations.

Technical, professional and personal capabilities

Strong analytical thinking, excellent communication skills and the proven ability to work independently as well as effectively within a team environment.
Active scientific participation and collaboration with colleagues in industry, contract research and regulatory agencies.
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English.

Syngenta will offer:

The opportunity to grow with the world's leading Agribusiness company, operating within a challenging international business environment
An open, supportive, and collaborative working culture
Great opportunities for personal development and career progression
A permanent, fulltime role, based on-site at our Jealotts Hill Campus, Bracknell, England
Competitive salary and benefits scheme

Are you looking for opportunities to work on high profile rail projects and advanced technology alongside experts from the UK, Europe and Japan? Come and join the fastest growing rail

business in the world!

Hitachi Rail is a fully integrated, global provider of rail solutions across rolling stock, signalling, service & maintenance, digital technology and turnkey. With a presence in 38 countries across three continents and over 13,000 employees, our mission is to contribute to society through the continuous development of superior rail transport solutions. We are working to Inspire the Next – and this is your chance to be part of it.

Your new role

We are currently recruiting for a talented Performance Manager (West), we are happy to consider candidates based in London with regular Travel to our Bristol location. In this exciting role you will be responsible on behalf of the Head of Contracts & Performance (West) for the management of operational and fleet technical issues associated with the delivery of Train Services Agreements (TSAs), and the maintenance and support of the AT300 fleets in order to drive continuous improvement and support fleet reliability growth.

Specifically, you will be responsible for the following deliverables:
Act as the initial point of contact with the customer for train performance and provide support to AT300 fleets whilst in service.
Act as the lead for the train performance and reliability growth of the AT300 fleets.
Manage the investigation, escalation and resolution of technical incidents attributed to the train.
Monitor the operational performance of the AT300 fleet in line with contractual obligations.
Identify, evaluate and understand operational and fleet performance issues and capability gaps through research and operational analysis.
Develop and own the Performance Management System and associated KPI metrics to drive performance improvement.
Management of data and information within the SAP maintenance management system and SOROS fleet management systems.
Lead the necessary daily, weekly and monthly fleet performance meetings and drive the accountable support functions in order to deliver performance growth.
Monitor fleet availability and reliability, as well as the KPI and presentation standards under the IEP TSA throughout the operational day in order to inform contractual requirements.
Develop and manage the Fleet Performance Improvement Plan (FPIP).
Build and maintain key datasets and performance indicators, and the identify trends to drive reliability growth, performance improvement and associated maintenance costs
Analyse requirements and develop scope and options for continuous operational improvement.
Design, develop and deliver innovative solutions that focus on the holistic management of operational capability across all functions and contracts.
Lead the Period Contract Performance Reviews and create the supporting Performance Reports (including the Paymech for IEP).
Lead a multidisciplinary team in relation to operations, contracts and fleet performance.
Identify, manage and resolve risks and issues and initiate appropriate corrective action.
Develop and maintain professional relationships with key stakeholders and maintain a customer focus.
Liaise with contractors and external repair agencies in order to drive performance improvement.
Lead on the performance management of Generating Units (GUs) and drive MTU to deliver improvements.
Report progress, prepare performance reports and give verbal briefs and presentations as required.
Promote, support and comply with all health and safety practices in the workplace.
Undertake Continuing Professional Development (CPD) in accordance with Hitachi’s new business demands as required.
Any other duties as directed by the Head of Contracts & Performance (West).
About you

Essential
Astute contractual and commercial awareness and demonstrable business acumen.
Extensive knowledge and experience of operating within UK rail industry.
Strong customer focus.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experienced in working with data sets, understanding and manipulating them.
Proven background in presenting complex information up to senior executive level.
Proven and demonstrable understanding of reliability growth.

Experience operating in an engineering/technical environment.
Behavioural
Be highly organised and structured to meet challenging deadlines.

Excellent leadership and ability to influence diverse teams.

Able to represent Hitachi in a professional manner at all times.
Ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with key stakeholders.
Capable of working in challenging environments for long periods.
Desirable
Advanced IT skills – Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint.

Lean Six Sigma.
Why Hitachi Rail?

At Hitachi Rail you will find a passionate and collaborative environment. We operate according to our values of Harmony, Sincerity and Pioneering Spirit. As such, we work closely as a team and empower our colleagues to take ownership and become creative in our pursuit of excellence. We take pride in the contribution we make to society and we always act with integrity and fairness towards our customers, suppliers and colleagues.

We offer a competitive salary and annual leave entitlement as well as a generous benefits package. This includes a pension scheme with contributions up to 9%, health insurance, and many more perks for you to choose from within a flexible plan that will meet your specific needs and lifestyle.

If you like the sound of the above and feel energised by the idea of joining a great brand at a moment of exciting expansion, please apply now. We look forward to hearing from you!

Role Purpose

The Senior Data Engineering Manager is a hands on role that is also responsible to manage our Data Engineering team that covers data modelling, manipulation, transformation and loading of the Data Lake technology layers. The team is responsible to build knowledge of all data resources within Newday and prototype new data sources internally and external to Newday. Building a knowledge of all existing data manipulation within both data warehouse systems and within the business marts.

The Senior Data Engineering Manager will manage a team that builds and maintains all of the data transformation and load processes through the various layers of the Data Lake using Big Data open technologies such as Kafka, Spark, Scala and associated AWS tooling.

The Senior Data Engineering Manager will manage a team to deliver a high volume, performant environment, structured to enable the Data Science roles to run modelling and insight activity and the core Data Warehouse users to build insight.

The role holder will need to ensure the best coding practice is followed within the team, thorough code review is taken place and own our CI/CD approach to development within an Agile framework.

Key Accountabilities

Specific lead accountabilities of the Senior Data Engineering Manager role:
Manage a small team of 3 permanent data engineers plus a few contractors
Oversee the design and code data transformation and load processes through the various layers of the Data Lake using Big Data open source technologies such as Kafka, Spark, Scala and associated AWS ETL tooling
Own all of the Data Content, manipulation, business rules and associated processes within the Data Lake
Responsible for the overall code quality and simplicity in the system and leading the enforcement of quality within the data landscape
Ensure the team within an Agile framework using the industry best practice agile methodology tooling that controls our development and CI/CD release processes
Building knowledge of all data resources within ND and prototype new data sources internally and externally
Building a knowledge of all existing data manipulation within both data warehouse systems and within the business marts.
Monitor and profile performance and oversee the improvement work where appropriate.
Championing the new Data Lake technology across the organisation to address a broad set of use cases across data science and data warehousing
Researching, testing and recommending new layers or products in the Data Lake stack as these fast moving technologies develop, keeping Newday at the forefront able to attract the best talent
Educate and train other resources in the organisation as appropriate
Additional Responsibilities
Become a leader in the AWS Big data space, mentoring the team
Act as a deputy and surrogate for the Head of Data Platform Solution
Working as a peer of Senior Data Design Manager to ensure the data solution is designed and built in a consistent and efficient way
Proactively contribute to and act in line with the NewDay values: Partnership, Accountability, Excellence, Spirited and Integrity; encourage a high performance cultural environment, facilitate continued and improved company reputation and success.
Act in a professional and customer-focused manner in line with the company values at all times with both internal and external customers; facilitate continued and improved company reputation and success.
Identify new risks to the business, apply appropriate risk mitigation actions by reviewing on a regular basis those controls in place and processes/activities within your span of control.
Skills and Experience

ESSENTIAL
Proficiency in Big Data data integration technologies such as Spark, Scala, Kafka
Excellent Scala/Java engineer with knowledge of and experience with container frameworks
Excellent API and library design skills
Proficiency with traditional database SQL technologies (Oracle, SQL Server, DB2)
Experience with integration of data from multiple data sources
Writing high-performance, reliable and maintainable code.
Good knowledge of No SQL database structures, theories, principles, and practices.
Analytical and problem solving skills, applied to Big Data domain
Experience of CI/CD best practice
Good aptitude in multi-threading and concurrency concepts
Experience with cloud deployment
Familiarity with the fundamentals of Linux scripting language
Team leading experience and technical mentorship
DESIRABLE
Previous proficiency with ETL technologies (e.g. Talend, Informatica, Abinitio)
Previous exposure to Python and Cython
Exposure to building applications for a cloud environment
Knowledge of workflow/schedulers like Yarn & Oozie.
Experience with NoSQL databases, such as HBase, Cassandra, MongoDB
Experience with various messaging systems, such as Kafka or RabbitMQ
Good knowledge in back-end programming, such as HTML, python, java, C, C++, JS, Node.js and OOA
Personal Attributes
Attention to detail
Keen to learn and enhance the existing processes
Structured, organised, process driven and outcome oriented
Personable, credible, with good communication skills
Good interpersonal & written communication skills. Ability to present ideas in business-friendly language
Self-motivated, able to work in a high-pressure environment
Strong organizational, planning and time management skills
Ability to build strong and effective working relationships on an ongoing basis
Ability to embrace company culture and embed into day-to-day interactions
Passionate, keen and energetic with demonstrable enthusiasm and commitment.
Pragmatism in design decisions

Job Description

Where you’ll fit in & what our team goals are….

In this role you will report directly to the Head of Regulatory Capital Management (EMEA and Asia). You will provide effective and efficient capital management services including regulatory reporting to Columbia Threadneedle Investments (EMEA and Asia) as part of the broader Ameriprise Group.

The Regulatory Capital Management team currently comprises two individuals in London. You will be based in London working closely with the Risk, Legal and Compliance teams together with subject matter experts across the business. You and your team will work closely with the Ameriprise Treasury team in the U.S.

Responsibilities

How you'll spend your time....

Your day to job would include but not limited to:

Capital management – ongoing
Consideration of impact of business and regulatory developments on regulatory capital and liquidity requirements
Prepare monthly and quarterly capital management briefing papers for relevant committees
Co-ordinate financial planning and stress testing by Finance (LFO) team as required
Plan, coordinate and assist in delivery of operational risk workshop program through the year
Assist in liaising with external provider of stochastic modelling of risks
Monitor regulatory developments around capital management and Solvency II
Develop and maintain strong working relationships with other Finance departments, Risk and business areas.
Ability to work with data from multiple systems and experience with reporting tools. Experience in Business Objects and RStudio preferred although not essential.
Capital management – annual regulatory reporting
Assist and take responsibility for delivery of ICAAP, ORSA and annual Solvency 2 documents to a high standard
Liaise with all contributors to ensure full understanding of requirements
Co-ordinate delivery of contributions from all stakeholders including review and challenge of contributions
Write sections of documents owned by Treasury (ICAAP, ORSA, SFCR, Pillar 3 Disclosures)
Assist in management of contribution from external advisers
Assist in continual improvement and evolution of process and documents in line with industry practice
Take responsibility for delivery of high quality, complete and accurate documents on time to Treasury and Finance leaders for review
Prepare high quality, timely and relevant reporting for senior committees
Develop and maintain ICAAP/ORSA related internal documentation, policies and procedures.
Design and develop new reports as required.

Required Qualifications

To be successful in this role you will have....
Chartered Accountant or equivalent preferred
Clear planning and project management
Interpersonal skills required to co-ordinate input from other business areas
Challenging and inquisitive mindset with attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work under tight deadlines
Good working knowledge of MS Office applications including advanced Excel skills

Preferred Qualifications

If you also had this, it would be great….
Understanding of risk management, prudential regime for investment firms and capital regulations at the enterprise level
Understanding of Solvency II regulations
Experience with ICAAP, ORSA and regulatory reporting
Prior experience in Banking/Asset Management institution or consulting firm

Are you an experienced Food Manufacturing Manager with Food FMCG knowledge and exceptional leadership skills?

Come and help us Nourish the Nation!

You will be responsible for one of our food manufacturing sites on the Chichester Food Park in beautiful West Sussex.

We are one of the largest employers in the Chichester area, with 4 manufacturing sites employing more than 1,200 talented individuals.

Our employees say it’s our people that make NWF a brilliant place to work, come and find out for yourself!

A day in the life of a Manufacturing Manager:

We make delicious salad meals, coleslaw, potato salad, bagged salads and leafy salad bowls. Our products are stocked by leading Retailers, supermarkets & restaurant chains and consumed by millions of customers in the UK, so you may well have eaten something made by us!

We have 4 sites and as Manufacturing Manager you will have complete responsibility for Production Operations on your site.

Your team will include Production Management and operations teams so you will be overseeing a complex site of up to 200+ people.

You will have strong commercial acumen, ambition and the ability to take your team with you on your journey.

You will need to be passionate about data to drive improvements and champion quality products, never accepting anything less than the best.

You will be supporting our brilliant place to work culture by overseeing the production operation, utilising inspirational leadership skills and driving team engagement with collaborative ways of working.

The ongoing development of the individuals in your team is a key part of working at Natures Way Foods so you will be inspiring your team, giving them stretch targets and proactively supporting them to work on their future career goals.

Your key KPI’s will include quality, retention, health and safety, productivity, service levels, yield, labour, meeting customer expectations & manufacturing targets as well as thinking about the future development of the site.

Fresh produce food manufacturing is a fast paced and exciting place to be, we aim to be ahead of the curve and need a forward thinking individual to drive the ambitions of this site forward.

Although it is a 24/7 operational site, your key hours will be between 7am – 4pm. Flexibility may be required on occasion.

Covid update: We can carry out video interviews and all of our sites are Covid secure.

If you are an exceptional leader with FMCG manufacturing experience who wants to make a difference then apply today and let’s get the conversation started!

Your impact:

Business Operations:

· Clear accountability for delivery of all KPIs for your area

· Fully understand and be able to interpret production and labour data to drive opportunities for improvement

· Accountability for direct reports - Production Team Managers to ensure they deliver KPI’s.

· Deliver Service levels of >99.5%.

· Develop and implement a production plan to meet the goals of the site and overall site strategy ensuring all key stakeholders are involved and aligned. Continually review and adjust the plan in line with internal and external changes.

Value:

· Accountable for the financial production performance of your site.

· Deliver sustainable production and labour efficiency, while reducing waste.

· Ensure Team Managers are set and held accountable for their KPI’s and expectations through regular review and coaching

· Accountable for the optimisation of all aspects of production including Direct and Indirect costs

· Ensure successful launches of new products on time, with the right quality standards and in line with budget

· Analysis of data to drive Continuous Improvement actions to improve performance and eliminate loss issues including waste and labour.

Quality:

Deliver perfect product to customers every day

People:

· Set high standards outlining what good looks like, holding your team accountable whilst supporting and coaching any development needs to drive a high performing team

· Align and lead the Team Managers to ensure they are engaged, high performing and meet KPI’s.

· Create a continuous learning culture to ensure daily focus on observations, training and coaching by the teams to build and maintain a skilled workforce and drive high standards

· Encourage an environment of support and challenge amongst the team and a sense of pride and passion.

· Manage on going performance and succession of direct reports. Build teams through skills assessment, training, coaching, feedback and support.

· Responsible for driving the culture of a safe and quality driven workplace.

· Responsible for ensuring an ethically compliant operation that is truly a ‘brilliant place to work’.

· Champion safety in the workplace

· Your voice – NWF Employee Rep forum – Be present – Leading and Engaging employees – encourage people to attend and action outcomes.

· Work force planning, FTE and Agency

Continuous Improvement:

· Drive site performance improvement by utilising data to understand key losses, actions and benefits

· Deliver improvement actions and monitor the improvement to sustain the shift in performance

· Work with CI and Engineering to enable an effective and continuously improving operation

· Ongoing participation of continuous improvement and lean projects and promotion of the tools and methodology across the site offering your full support to all initiatives – champion manufacturing excellence strategy for the site.

· Optimisation of labour and planning schedule.

· Thorough analysis of performance data to identify performance gaps, trends and improvement opportunities. Communicate internally and plan / develop improvements.

Customers:

· Maintain and improve our excellent relationships with our customers at all levels of their organisation.

· Ensure the site is audit ready at all times and in line with our customer expectations.

· Carry out plant/ process/ product focused site tours

· Work in collaboration with NPD and plant trials to accommodate these in a timely manner.

· Ensure consistent supply and demand driving efficiency levels through the optimisation of the production plan.

Your journey with us…

This is a great opportunity to continue growing your career in Manufacturing Management within an ambitious and fast paced FMCG business.

We have an in-house L&D team who facilitate learning from soft skills to bespoke training for your area of expertise.

We champion internal promotion and your career aspirations will be fully supported. As we continue to grow as a business, so will you.

About us:

We are Lovers of the Leaf, Kings of Coleslaw and proud of our Stunning Salad Meals!

As a private label and branded food manufacturer, our customers are at the heart of what we do. Our products are sold in Retailers (including – Tesco, Sainsbury’s, Morrisons, Aldi) and Foodservice businesses (including McDonald’s, Pret and Itsu).

Our manufacturing sites are centres of excellence and have grown significantly since 1994. 2020 saw the launch of our very first brand, a saucy salad meal kit called FLiNG and we have plenty of exciting projects still to come so watch this space!

Natures Way Foods has a core foundation in the Chichester area, employing over 1,200 talented individuals that all have a part to play in our success story.

We are also a social bunch and get involved in a regular charitable and community projects such as Field to Fork and raising money for our chosen charity of the year.

If you want to grow your career with a supportive manager, talented colleagues and a company that champions equal opportunities - Lettuce know!

Snapshot

We're hiring for a passionate quantitative analyst to work at the intersection of insights and engineering, improving DeepMind's internal decision making!

About Us

DeepMind's mission is to "Solve intelligence. Use it to make the world a better place."

The Data & Analytics team builds on this with an objective to "improve decision-making through relevant insights to achieve our mission". We work closely with partners across the company to:

Deliver insights and improve decision-making
Cultivate DeepMind's analytics culture & community
Contribute to our analytics infrastructure

Success across these areas will have a material impact on the company's operations and management, offering exciting opportunities to dive deeply into a wide array of technical analysis, collaborate closely with talented partners throughout the organisation, and apply/grow your skill set.

Some examples of the types of work you might encounter on a day-to-day basis:

Mine large-scale datasets to understand patterns in compute demand and help plan future capacity
Analyse our recruitment process, conducting statistical tests to validate experimental changes to interview funnels
Present insights to senior management, translating analysis into the 'so what?' and identifying possible actions to take as a result
Partner with teams company-wide to understand key indicators of progress, develop and validate accompanying metrics, and visualise via dashboards / other reporting tools
Engineer tested, robust ETL pipelines to improve the availability of key data sources internally
Develop and deliver training on SQL, Python, data visualisation practices, and more
The role

We're looking for someone who is skilled at and motivated by helping to make and enable sound organisational decisions using quantitative data.

'Making' in the sense that you'll often be tasked to conduct rigorous analysis, using a variety of tools, to deliver meaningful insights. 'Enabling' in the manner that you're excited to help mentor and coach others in their own analytics efforts, and possess the skills to help bring greater consistency and robustness to our data sources and analytical workflows.

This role is technical in that it requires use of a diverse array of techniques and technologies to extract and prepare high-quality analysis. At the same time, there is a great deal of flexibility in your ability to focus on a subset of our team's broad mission and grow your skill set accordingly, whether that's in rigorous project management, deep statistical analysis, or robust pipeline engineering.

As a group we want to enhance the way DeepMind as a whole makes decisions and takes action, so there are many different ways team members can further this aim.

A core set of the responsibilities this role encompasses:

Work with partners to identify relevant high-level business questions and propose relevant data-focused analysis
Write queries and conduct rigorous, verifiable analysis (SQL, Python) to answer those questions
Communicate via presentations and written reports to a wide variety of stakeholders (with varying levels of seniority, technical and domain familiarity) – following through to ensure impact
Identify work appropriate for regular tracking, building appropriate reports and dashboards for consistency and ease of access
Manage several projects simultaneously, exhibiting good project management skills (timelines, expectations, progress, etc.)
Recommend changes to product/engineering roadmaps to improve data quality in source systems
Submit tested code into source control for review
Coach and mentor others in their own use of analytical tools and technique
About you

What we are looking for in the ideal candidate:

You excel at analytical problem solving with a 'nose for data', knowing which questions to ask of it, how to go about answering those questions, and how to ensure that your answer is correct.

You enjoy using a variety of technical tools to answer the question at hand. You recognise that there are lots of potential ways to approach a problem, and enjoy choosing the right tool for the job. You enjoy learning new technologies and techniques when appropriate.

You consider yourself 'business savvy'. You have proven experience working with various internal partners, and an intuition for which questions are most important to hone in on in service of our mission.

You are passionate about 'storytelling' with data. You're great at translating deeply technical analysis into insights and conclusions that everyone can grasp, independent of prior context or expertise. You know how to optimally express uncertainty in your conclusions, and key assumptions that have gone into the analytical process.

Qualities that are an asset

You are comfortable extracting and manipulating data via SQL (especially BigQuery and Google's StandardSQL implementation) and Python and the PyData stack (e.g. Pandas, Scikit-learn, Scipy, NumPy, Jupyter)
You might be familiar with some other aspects of ETL management (e.g. Apache Beam, Apache Spark, Airflow, Luigi), data modelling (e.g. DBT, Snowflake), and data visualisation (e.g. Tableau, Data Studio, d3.js, Matplotlib, Vega, Altair, etc.), or are at least excited to learn more
You like to 'work quantitatively', and have at least a basic solid understanding of statistical concepts that let you express ambiguity in your analysis and assumptions
You've previously taught yourself new tools/techniques to expand your skillset
You have experience partnering with senior decision-makers in a professional setting
You consistently strive to see 'beyond the data' and understand what your analysis represents in terms of actual reality/experience
You enjoy collaborating widely, and partnering with others to empower action and change

If you don't think you embody all of the above criteria, please still seriously consider applying! This role (and therefore the requirements) is broad, and we'd be excited to discuss how you see yourself contributing across it!

What we offer

You will join a diverse and vibrant environment where you can influence and have impact on groundbreaking research results. You will enjoy a creative and stimulating work environment and direct access to world-class researchers!

We constantly iterate on our work environment. It has been crafted to help you lead a balanced life. This goes from providing you excellent facilities (healthy food, music rooms, gym, faith rooms, terraces, spacious desks, etc) to enabling your manager to make special work arrangements if you need them. Our managers are being supported by our People and Culture team ensure we do our best to suit your needs. We also provide baby bonding leaves for both parents. Our list of arrangements is pretty extensive, so please do discuss this throughout the process.

Opening date: 10th November 2020

Closing date: 8th December 2020

DeepMind welcomes applications from all sections of society. This role will play a critical role in a globally distributed start-up team (https://www.freelancer.com/enterprise) within an established technology company that is radically changing the future of work. The enterprise team vision is to create an UnLimited World. Our mission is to generate $1B in income and economic opportunity for our freelancers, enabling them to work with the best and biggest brands in the world.

We are looking for a Product Manager to join the Freelancer Enterprise team. Our team works with leading Fortune 500s and the world's leading organizations including Facebook, NASA, Deloitte, Harvard and Airbus, to name a few. In this team, you will have exciting opportunity to drive growth, shape the future of the digital transformation of work and increase the adoption of Freelancer.com Enterprise.

Product managers are the CEO of the product they manage, leading teams of engineers, data scientists, growth hackers, designers (and other roles). They are responsible for every aspect of the product including user research, UX/UI design, engineering, quality, data analytics, marketing, and growth.

About Us:

Freelancer Limited, the ASX-listed company that owns Freelancer.com, Escrow.com is hiring. Freelancer.com is the world's largest freelancing and crowdsourcing marketplace, which connects millions of employers to freelancers across the globe. Escrow.com is a global fintech industry leader in secure online payments, having handled over US$4 billion in transactions buying and selling boats, cars, airplanes, jewellery, fine art, and even trips to the planned Aurora space station in 2021.

Requirements

Experience leading product discovery, creating product vision, and contributing to the overall product strategy & roadmap in support of company wide goals and objectives
Proven experience managing a high performing team of a software product
Experience designing simple and intuitive user interfaces - ability to create wireframes and mockups
Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies
Ability to process and analyze complex data sets, and interpret them to make business decisions (Ideally using SQL)
Preferably have a technical degree (computer science, engineering, math, science, etc.) or equivalent experience

Not mandatory but bonus points if you have any of the following (let us know!):

Experience gathering requirements and scalable building products in collaboration with large enterprise customers
Previous experience in logistics or operations
Have worked with two-sided marketplaces
Managed content marketing creation at scale
Have overseen A/B testing experimentation
Management consulting experience

Benefits

This won't be a cog-in-the-machine job; you will be joining a global technology company that is a meritocracy, so if you are looking to make a difference and be rewarded for your efforts, this is the place for you.

We also offer a fun atmosphere working with smart people in an awesome office with fully-stocked kitchens, social events, hackathons, and more.

If you love pushing the boundaries of web products, and are passionate about having a real impact on a global (and growing) technology company, then we want to hear from you!

For more information see www.freelancer.com/careers

Reference: 667034

Charles Taylor Adjusting - Quality Assurance & Training Manager - London - Competitive Salary & Package

Charles Taylor Adjusting is one of the leading international loss adjusting businesses. We focus on commercial losses and claims in the aviation, energy, marine, property, casualty and special risk markets, many of which are large and complex in nature. These include onshore and offshore energy claims, maritime casualties, aircraft losses, large infrastructure claims and financial lines losses.

We are now recruiting a Quality Assurance & Training Manager to work with and assist CTA’s Business Change & Operations Manager and Operations Director in the delivery of key strategic projects and initiatives across CTA. The successful candidate will work as part of the CTA Exec team but must be prepared to work with other teams and staff at all levels globally.

Responsibilities:

As part of the deployment of eCases to CTA’s teams globally, this person will be responsible for the following activities:
Design, development and deployment of the Quality Assurance process and associated control reports to ensure Adjusting files are maintained in line with expected standards.
Oversight of QA process and liaison with local managers to proactively monitor and ensure process compliance e.g. Open and Closed file reviews
Training adjusters and administrators in the use of SharePoint and Macroview
Becoming a “super user” of CTA’s core Case Management & Accounting (CMA) system to enable them to provide training for new teams and to provide support to existing users in any day to day system and process questions
Development of training material in multiple formats for specific training courses and use as reference material thereafter e.g. eCases and CMA QRG’s. Maintenance of the same to ensure they remain effective and up to date
Development and deployment of relevant CMA QA reports and control processes to enable local managers to proactively monitor and ensure process compliance
Developing expert knowledge of the end-to-end life cycle of a CTA managed case and the associated business processes involved in same
Developing a working knowledge of CTA’s MI reporting capability and analysis of the same to enable issue identification
Regular analysis of system data and control reports to ensure compliance with processes and system controls and maintenance of data quality e.g. correct use of data fields and “right first time” reviews.
Maintaining records of quality reports, statistical reviews and relevant documentation
Building strong relationships with adjusters and other key stakeholders around the business

Person Specification

Proven experience as a quality assurance manager or relevant role
Training of staff at all levels in either a 121 or classroom environment
Experience of working with users both in the UK and overseas
Results and solutions orientated, who takes pride in getting the job done “Right First Time” and to the highest standards possible
A strong team player, who is also able to work with the minimum amount of supervision
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with adjusters and colleagues at all levels quickly and efficiently
Strong organisation skills
Knowledge of insurance processes and terminology
Use of Microsoft tools such as SharePoint
Experience of Macroview desirable
Microsoft Excel to at least an intermediate level

Equal Opportunity Employer

Here at Charles Taylor we are proud to be an Inclusive Employer. We provide an environment of mutual respect with zero tolerance to discrimination of any kind regardless of age, disability, gender identity, marital/ family status, race, religion, sex or sexual orientation.

Our external partnerships and the dedicated work we do in promoting a transparent and fair recruitment and selection process all contribute to the successful, inclusive and diverse culture and environment which we are proud to be a part of at Charles Taylor.

JATO are hiring!

JATO products serve many needs in the entire automotive sector that depend on data, insight tools and business process automation solutions variously delivered through API’s and User Interfaces.

As a Programme Manager, you will report to the Head of Global Delivery Services and work for a vertical business area, driving one or more major product releases through the entire lifecycle including analysing, implementation and customer rollout ramping down only when all customer deployments are transitioned into continuous support.

Ensure high quality in all Epic documentation especially Features which are planned into Product Delivery teams

Maximise local autonomy, skills and resources to unblock issues/risks (RAID) so that escalations are exceptional
Commission/create all necessary tools to allow program members and stakeholders to contribute and work together
Define and manage governance in line with the SAFe framework and operate as an Epic Owner within the framework
Drive all status reporting across all key product epics, and communicating status up to the senior management team and other governing bodies
Lead business engagement and management of communications with all stakeholders
Capture and drive closure of Risks / Issues / Actions / Decisions
Initiating extra activities and other management interventions wherever gaps appear
Prepare and deliver dashboard KPI’s and monthly Programme Board presentations

Experience in leading B2B technology/data solutions programs working with SaaS, Cloud Computing, and/or emerging technologies
Experience of Lean Agile, SCRUM and Scaled Agile Framework
Cross-functional experience across engineering, sales, and marketing teams in data/cloud computing or related technical fields
Ability to manage the expectations, demands, and priorities of multiple internal stakeholders based on overarching purpose/vision
Proactive and action oriented who can lead teams through ambiguity in an organised fashion.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, and to adapt flexibly with the changing needs and direction of a rapidly-growing organization
Experience in various tools i.e. JIRA, MS Project for management and planning
Solid communication skills having previously work with senior leadership teams (written and verbal)

Role Overview:

Responsible for development and management of projects at assigned pharmaceutical clients. The projects will include clinical data quality services (IRT) for said pharmaceutical clients.

Key Accountabilities/Decision Making & Influence:

Project Management (50%)

Manage all phases of each assigned project, including budget, invoicing, staffing, project plan and client deliverables
Manage multiple projects concurrently, maintaining project schedule and quality deliverables in a dynamic environment
Coordinate with other Client Services personnel as well as Professional Services and Technical Delivery resources to ensure the timely and quality preparation of project deliverables based on assigned scope-of-services
Oversee development and approval of study materials
Manage team of Project Specialists and/or Project Assistants to facilitate project tasks
Ensure all project deliverables are of high quality and exceed client’s expectations in compliance with Quality Management governance procedures
Oversee study management and coordinate study status with project sponsors
Manage resources and tasks to ensure all logistics, materials and technologies necessary as defined by scope-of-services
Coordinate with project sponsors to ensure all project expectations are met

Data/Site Management (30%)

Manage identification and resolution of clinical trial data inquiries/data changes and communication to internal and external multi-function resources within project teams
Manage communications with client (e.g. pharmaceutical sponsor, CRO) and site personnel regarding site/study details
Facilitate data review meetings with clinical trial study team leaders
Own in-study/maintenance transactional project activities throughout entire project lifecycle, e.g. project variable fees, inter-department workflow assignment, issue escalation
Set up master systems, additional study hardware, study site folders, and data folders for clinical trial execution
Design and configure unique project systems and manage data for each assigned project, utilizing proprietary IT applications (e.g. RDA, IR2, CDR PRISM, etc.)
Produce data reports (e.g., weekly, interim, final, etc.) for submission to pharmaceutical clients

Account Management (10%)

Communicate new opportunities, as identified, at existing clients for Bracket encompassing Change Orders and new projects
Facilitate new Change Order creation and socialization for assigned projects in cooperation with Business Development Operations
Manage relationships within assigned client accounts including routine written, telephone and face-to-face communication
Provide account updates to Bracket account management teams

Administration (10%)

Provide ongoing career development, mentoring and performance feedback for supervised Project Specialists and/or Project Assistants
Track monthly and quarterly metrics (variable fee budgetary items) and provide to Project Manager for invoicing
Enhance the Bracket business model by institutionalizing business processes, implementing best practices and templates, and seeking ways to work more efficiently
Contribute to the development, enhancement and testing for enterprise IT applications (e.g. EDC, ePRO, IxRS, RDA, IR2, PRISM, CDR System, etc.)
Coach, counsel and provide mentoring and guidance for direct reports

Dedication and commitment to promote diversity, multiculturalism and inclusion in all work activities
Ability to collaborate in diverse teams to foster productive outcomes.

Experience

Project management experience

Required

College degree (B.S., B.A.)/University Degree for EU candidates or equivalent years of experience.
