The multi-screen streaming video and the interactive TV space is growing rapidly. Accedo delivers rich media apps on multiple platforms ranging from Smart TVs, gaming consoles, Set Top Boxes, Roku, Apple TV, Android TV, Chromecast, Web, Smart phones, tablets and more.

At Accedo, you will be part of a diverse and multi-disciplined development team, gaining exposure to cutting-edge technologies. This means working with some of the largest global media brands in the industry, e.g. Netflix, Spotify, BBC, HBO and Deutsche Telekom, just to name a few. Working in a highly collaborative and international environment, you will help transform requirements and designs into high performing feature rich applications on a wide variety of web based platforms and devices.

Who are we?

We are Accedo and have more than ten years of experience helping hundreds of TV platform operators, broadcasters, media companies, and consumer electronics manufacturers across the globe to design, deliver and manage the next generation video user experience across a vast range of connected devices.

Accedo offers a truly global working environment, with offices all over the world, including Stockholm, London, New York, Silicon Valley, Sydney, Hong Kong, Guadalajara, Toronto and more.

At the end of the day, our employees are what make us who we are, which means we work hard to create a good working environment with plenty of opportunities to grow and develop within Accedo, wherever they want to be in the world. We are on a journey, and are always open to ideas and individuals that want to contribute to making that journey a success.

Accedo is looking for talented Quality Assurance Engineers to join its growing Quality Assurance team in London. At Accedo you will be part of a diverse and multi-disciplined team, gain exposure to cutting edge technologies and can work with some of the largest global media brands in the industry. Working in a highly collaborative environment, you will help transforming requirements and designs into high performing and feature rich applications on a wide variety of web based platforms and devices.

Objective of role: Primarily responsible for project testing of Accedo’s multimedia and streaming applications. You will play a key role in ensuring the quality of media applications and games being developed for world famous brands. The role will involve a close relationship with software development teams in Accedo.

Main tasks

Defining, developing and deploying quality assurance initiatives throughout entire software life cycle, including development, enhancements or maintenance
Provide appropriate planning and execution in regression testing, performance testing, integration testing, and other non-functional testing to ensure successful application deployment
Designing and executing test plans, cases and scripts to ensure that products of exceptional quality is delivered, aligned with business objectives on various platforms such as mobile, web, smart TV and game console
Collaborate in a cross-function delivery team to ensure that all aspects of quality are actively discussed and addressed during the delivery process
Work with clients to help convey issues around quality and build a relationship surrounding QA on the respective project

Updating and maintaining best QA procedures and standards, including test planning, test data preparation and test automation
Defining and analysing performance objectives and measuring against data QA compliance metrics and ensuring targets
Test lead on a project managing multiple platforms, interacting with customers on a daily basis, working closely with developers, Business Analyst, Project manager and Product Owners.
Define the test strategy, automation strategy and write test scripts and automate UI and API
Provide input to the QA Manager/Team lead for all QA related activities and dependencies

P.S: The recruitment process is on a rolling basis

Audit Management

Excellent written and verbal skills

Capable to interpret information/data to provide guidance regarding superior business solutions, largely in the form of influencing strong corrective and preventive actions as a result of audit/inspection findings

What's involved with this role:
The post will be to support The Quality Assurance Manager with data checks, putting together data and quality assuring data. To be responsible for ensuring reliable and accurate systems are in place for the monitoring and collection of all SEND Data (including SEN2 data and data relating to performance indicators). Responsible for producing the source data, for calculation and compilation and for the maintenance of appropriate records to support audit. Produce a regular up to date SEND Data Dashboard or similar for SEND strategic board. This dashboard should draw together a range of SEN indicators into a concise, graphical report. Comparing LA performance with national and statistical neighbours, as well showing trends over time. It should be used to: - identify relative strengths and weaknesses in performance - plan and commission services - inform self-evaluation and set targets - demonstrate impact and effectiveness. This is to be used in preparation for and during an Ofsted inspection, as well as informing planning throughout the year. Conducting regular quality assurance of all SEN data and supporting the development of effective systems to facilitate quality of service delivery across the SEN Teams. Maintaining accurate budget monitoring data working closely with finance and using the Oracle Planning & Budgeting tool for the purpose of revenue budget monitoring. Ensuring that SEN pupil placement and funding information for all Lambeth SEN pupils’ remains accurate and up to date. To undertake statistical analysis, research and produce appropriate reports, discussion papers, briefings and other documents on behalf of SEND. To contribute to the improvement of strategic planning and policy development in SEND through the production of timely and accurate information on education demand and strategy. Key Tasks include:
Support the management and review of information systems for reliably tracking the progress of pupils undergoing assessments or holding EHCPs.
Lead responsibility for Data management and up keep on all database systems. Including the termly production of pupil lists for monitoring and management team to ensure that Annual review reminders are sent to all agencies.
To keep up to date with changes in legislation impacting on the area of special educational needs.
To make statutory returns as required to the DfE and similar bodies including SEN 2 data returns.
To ensure reliable and accurate systems are in place for the monitoring of Performance Management targets and Performance Indicators.
To ensure that reliable and accurate systems are in place for financial monitoring information.
To carry out such other duties as may be required from time to time to meet the needs of the section.
To be able to work flexibly, with occasional weekend working.
Responsible for the development and maintenance of quality assurance mechanisms to ensure that Panel decisions are actioned within agreed time limits.
Ensure that all SEN data is accurately recorded on Mosaic any other centrally used databases.
To ensure systems are in place for SEN Panel arrangements to ensure consistency and quality of service.
Support regular quality assurance checks with regard to Panel decisions, as well as supporting the development of effective systems to facilitate quality of service delivery across the SEN Teams.

The Role:
Quality Manager
Permanent Role
Salary Negotiable DOE

Our client is a Technology business specialising in providing mission-critical systems, traffic management systems and data science-led solutions, primarily in the rail and transport industry.

Overview
Our people are critical to our success and as our Quality Manager, you will passionately drive a culture that focuses on the right things, with a right first-time mentality, in our software, SAAS and data-driven environment.
You will be responsible for our Quality Management System (IMS), ensuring it delivers a meaningful and appropriate framework for world-class delivery of our products, enables innovation, and drives our ongoing success through continuous improvement of our processes.
As an integral part of our operations, you will establish and implement an internal and external audit and certification programme, to assess the ongoing effectiveness of our IMS and maintain our key company accreditations as an integral part of the business.
Through these responsibilities you will play a key role in delivering the excellence, assurance, safety, and quality required to deliver high-integrity systems and drive our success.

What are the key objectives?
Review, develop, update, and control our Integrated Management System (IMS), ensuring our documents integrate and our processes are efficient, appropriate, and meet current and future business requirements efficiently
Work collaboratively across our business to develop an approach to embedding principles of quality within all our operations
Work with our Directorates to develop, measure and monitor key performance indicators for the lifetime of our products and services
Support our external facing colleagues to understand how we incorporate our customer's requirements into our products and services
Lead our relevant, externally accredited, ISO certification processes: significant experience of ISO9001 is a primary requirement for the role, a developing experience of ISO27001 would be a distinct advantage
Ensure we maintain our key external supplier registrations and accreditations
Establish and implement internal and external audit programmes, ensuring availability and deployment of suitably competent audit resource
Ensure formally identified actions for continuous improvement are captured and closed out successfully, revisiting to assess effectiveness
Design and delivery of individual/group/Company-wide safety briefings
Manage the delivery of service and performance of available resources, day-to-day direction of contracted professional advisors, etc.
Operate in a confidential manner, recognising the sensitivity of the information/data obtained, processed, and held, and apply appropriate security/access controls internally and externally
Top Internal Relationships
Reports to the Business Safety and Services Manager
Directorate Leadership/Management and Project Realisation
QSE team and external resources
Central Function Managers
Person Requirements
Qualified to undertake audits
Significant and relevant operational experience in devising, implementing, maintaining and assessing quality management processes
Excellent interpersonal skills
Ability to draft clear, concise and accurate quality procedures, policies and supporting communications
A champion for our values and behaviours, particularly around right first time, quality of delivery
Our Values and Behaviours
It's the 'how' we do things together with the 'what' we do that differentiates us. We want our people to engage with our vision and display our values and behaviours in their day-to-day activities.

Vacancy Name Stock Compliance Manager (Farfetch)
Vacancy No VN259
Recruiter Stephanie Tziallis
Recruiter Title Talent Manager
City London
Description Our Operations team power the movement of our stock! The Farfetch Group stock pool is global, high value and complex to navigate. We have thousands of items being imported, exported, and transferred between our sites every single day. Now we are a publicly listed company experiencing phenomenal growth, Farfetch have a responsibility to ensure the processes that underpin stock movements reporting are SOX compliant. It’s our ambition to be 100% SOX compliant always, without exception, to reduce any risk to our business.

This role reports into the Farfetch Head of Fulfilment (Europe) and you will work alongside our Global Operations teams and our network of global fulfilment partners.
The purpose of the role is building a blueprint for SOX compliance specific to stock management. Applying your expertise in SOX compliance you will be instrumental in implementing and championing best practice. Applying an auditor’s lens to everything you do, you will identify and remedy any risks which compromise the integrity of our stock data and audit results, building long term solutions to drive continuous improvement.
Key Responsibilities • Define the parameters and specifications required to achieve 100% SOX compliance, building a view of what success looks like and aligning the team to this vision.
• Partner with internal stakeholders across the Farfetch Group such as the Operations and Audit teams and external stakeholders including Auditors, to gain insight of current challenges and risks to compliance.
• Build the compliance roadmap for the Operations team, prioritising efforts and laying the foundations for excellence.
• Define and coach internal and external stakeholders on the responsibilities they have to influence stock movement and stock reporting as defined in the SOX register, highlighting the importance of SOX compliance.
• Conduct regular audits of the processes being carried out internally and externally (3PL’s), implementing new processes concerned with the reporting of stock movement wherever there is room to improve compliance.
• Learn from best practice stock management and reporting being carried out in any corners of our business, driving synergy and applying this best practice to the wider group.
• Operationalize the compliance roadmap by introducing a comprehensive suite of compliance data and best practice compliance reporting, familiarizing the team with this data and building dialogue around the insights on a continuous basis.
• Be guided by high quality data, flagging and escalating any risks to the relevant operations team for full investigation, being accountable for risks until they are resolved.
• Drive and influence behavioral change around how tools and systems are utilised by internal and external teams, driving a ‘system first’ response to allow for accurate reporting on our stock position at any point in time.
• Plan and prepare the business for periodic audits, driving a shift towards continuous auditing practices.
• Facilitate quarterly and yearly meetings with our third-party auditors, delivering the results of the Farfetch stock audits and actioning any feedback stemming from audits carried out by our external auditors.
Skills and Experience ● Experience in Retail and E-commerce, with a focus on multi-channel environments.
● Experience in SOX procedures for publicly listed companies.
● Comfortable in a logistics and operations environment, with previous exposure to a warehouse or with auditors.
● Natural ability to build effective relationships throughout the business.
● Excellent organisational skills.
● Skilled at presenting data in an impactful way.
● Professional demeanor, reliable, flexible, strategic with a hands-on approach, with the ability to stay calm under pressure.
● Strong warehouse management system and ERP knowledge.
● Knowledge of luxury fashion retail advantageous.
● Senior stakeholder management skills with an ability to influence all levels of the organisation.
● Ability to think strategically and innovatively and to that in to a viable, operational plan
● Strong commercial and financial acumen, with an ability to speak business language.
● Excellent communication skills with proven track record of building effective relationships with senior leadership teams.
● Ability to challenge and influence at all levels and work collaboratively and efficiently with large groups of stakeholders.
● Agile and decisive.
● Thrives on complex challenges with a problem-solving approach.
● Analytical, able to interpret opportunities, trends and issues in data.
Employment Type Full Time Permanent
Benefits

Ensuring that the workplace based assessment strategies are up-to-date and represent best practice

Job Title: IA Technology - Data Quality - Snr Audit Manager
Job Description: The Senior Audit Manager is a senior level management position responsible for managing a complex and critical unit within Internal Audit, in coordination with the Audit team. The overall objective of this role is to develop and execute a robust Audit Plan, and direct complex audit activities for a component of the business at a regional or country level. This role directs the timely delivery of complex high quality, value added assurance and audit reports for a portfolio of business activities, which meet the requirements of the Boards of Citigroup and Citibank, their affiliates and of Citis respective regulators, globally. The Senior Audit Manager Technology Data Quality manages and delivers the Data Quality audit plan, providing independent third-line assurance that the end-to-end Data Quality processes at Citi have been properly understood, assessed and mitigated via first line programs and second line assurance activities. Key Responsibilities: Develops and executes (and ongoing update) a robust Data Quality audit plan by reviewable entity, that provides thorough, risk based coverage (including issue validation for regulatory and audit issues) for addressing Data Quality risks across Citi, in accordance with Internal Audit standards, relevant government statutes and regulations and Citigroup and Citibank policies. Executes independent assessments of end-to-end Data Tracing capability that provides assurance over accuracy of critical data in key regulatory and management reports. Delivers on time high quality audit reports, Internal Audit and Regulatory issue validation and (where appropriate, branch examinations, as well as business monitoring and governance committee reporting. Directs complex audit activities for a component of a product line, function, or legal entity at the regional or country level including a portion of the audit annual plan. Applies comprehensive expertise in one or more of the corporation's businesses and leverages this knowledge into a leadership role in one or more teams. Proactively advances integrated auditing concepts and use of technology. Closely follows latest trends in own field and adapts them for application within own job and the business Manages a complex and critical unit within Internal Audit, including a medium sized team of Internal Audit professionals. Recruits staff, develops talent, builds effective teams, and manages a budget. Possesses a broad and comprehensive understanding of different Internal Audit standards, policies and local regulations; applies a broad and comprehensive knowledge of high risk areas including: Consumer or Investment Banking, technology management; project/program management; regulatory compliance or supplier management. Leads the professional development of Internal Audit staff. Develops effective senior line management relationships and has a strong understanding of the businesses. Applies an in-depth understanding of the inter-relationships of business and support units throughout the corporation and how they impact the overall control environment and the audit approach. Uses excellent communication skills in order to influence a wide range of internal audiences including respective product, function, or regional executive management partners. May negotiate internally often at higher levels on matters which will have a major impact on the area managed. Demonstrates strong judgment, political astuteness, and sensitivity to cultural diversity. Possesses strong project management and interpersonal skills, makes sound decisions, exhibiting initiative and intuitive thinking. Consulted often by others for advice and opinions and recognized as a leadership role model. Participates in major business initiatives and pro-actively advises and assists the business on change initiatives. Frequently involved in matters that require complex judgments and solutions based on sophisticated analytical thought such as identifying solutions for a variety of complex and novel audit control issues. Analyzes reporting findings; Recommends appropriate interventions where needed. Proposes creative and pragmatic solutions for risk and control problems. Partners with Directors and Managing Directors to develop approaches for addressing broader corporate emerging issues. Serves as lead reviewer for all types of reviews, including the most complex. Reviews and approves Business Monitoring Quarterly Summaries. Qualifications and Competencies BA/BS or equivalent. Related certifications (CPA, ACA, CFA, CIA, CISA or similar) are a plus. Statistical, Computer Science or Computer Engineering qualifications will be an advantage. Senior level experience in a related role with experience in business, functional and people management, with proven abilities in taking responsibility for executing concurrently on a portfolio of high quality deliverables to stakeholders according to strict timetables. Specific subject matter expertise regarding Data Quality control disciplines. Demonstrates experience in managing teams and managing integrated internal audit and assurance delivery within a matrix reporting environment. Effective negotiation skills, a proactive and 'no surprises' approach in communicating issues and strength in sustaining independent views. This individual must be an articulate and effective communicator, both orally and in writing, with an energetic, charismatic and approachable style. Strong interpersonal skills for interfacing with all levels of internal and external audit and management. Experience in the following areas would be considered to be advantageous: Finance especially US Regulatory reporting Technology (including Technology audits) and data analytics Data management standards and principles, data tracing Exceptional candidates who do not meet these criteria may be considered for the role provided they have the necessary skills and experience. Valuing Diversity: Demonstrates an appreciation of a diverse workforce. Appreciates differences in style or perspective and uses differences to add value to decisions or actions and organizational success. Diamond Search Recruitment are delighted to be supporting our client, a world-leading and well established organisation. A respected employer who really value their teams, offer great benefits along with a focus on employee well being and engagement.

Recruiting for a *Data Quality and Automation Specialist/Technical Product Manager/Data Quality Product Manager* we are seeking a candidate who is passionate about the power of data and insight to solve environmental and societal issues. Someone meticulous over data quality, and with the vision to see through complex methodologies to design and deliver smooth, efficient (automated) and connected data capture and management systems to underpin the organisation's products and services.

The Data Quality Product Manager works at the helm of the organisation's strategic evolution and expansion program. They will work across the division and team, but specifically with the Digital and Product Management Teams, to shape the development of the data quality and insight value propositions and associated service lines. They will also oversee the implementation, and subsequent operation, of data quality protocols and the automation of procedures; helping to foster a data driven mindset and culture.

Duties Include:

• Work with relevant stakeholders; internal (Digital Products, Legal, Growth, Product etc) and external to define and evolve our data and insight ‘services to market’.

• Own subsequent new market offers throughout their launch phase and into operation

• Work with relevant stakeholders; internal (Digital Products, Legal, Growth, Product etc) to weave automated data capture and quality management within the development and technical operation of the product portfolio including:

o Oversee the team’s definition of ‘good’ data and insight to ensure completeness, accuracy, timeliness and overall fit for purpose

o Develop and apply robust and transparent methods for data assessment and modelling to derive credible benchmarking and insight.

• Co-ordinate the development of enhanced analytics, visualizations and analysis to support decision making that enables better sustainability and ESG performance
• Take ownership of discrete and/or strategic work packages relating to your technical area of expertise (e.g. Net Zero, Circularity, Health etc.) to ensure that customer SLA’s and other expectations are met/exceeded.

• Monitor and uphold the health, safety and well-being of yourself, team and any external visitors with who this role is accountable for.

The Ideal Candidate:

This role would suit someone who enjoys working with large data, improving data quality to showcase what good should look like. Experience of management systems and working with service providers in an automation space with a digital focus is ideal.
A self starter and leaner, capable of delivering projects and ‘owning’ initiatives to quality and timescales.
Experience in digital and automating technology diffusion across the built environment; emerging and existing supply chain actors.
Proven abilities in data quality management and visualization; and a strong desire to solve complex global issues using these skills
Advanced data modelling and Excel skills
Cognizance of the corporate real estate markets and factors including their ESG data needs
Experience and knowledge of the built environment specifically future trends; BIM, MMCetc.
Educated to a degree level in a related degree (for e.g. asset/real estate management, data/analytics and/or building level environmental/sustainability performance)
This role truly represents an incredibly exciting opportunity! Apply today!

Technical Operations Manager

Role Purpose

Be responsible for the technical governance and maintenance of the Mechanical and Electrical infrastructure of Data Centres.
Responsibilities will cover Design, Build and Live Data Centre Operations.

Duties include:
Supervising the maintenance and operational activities across Data Centres
Commissioning and testing of new infrastructure including the review and approval of associated documentation.
Management of the Planned Preventative Maintenance schedule (PPM).
Managing and approving maintenance spend in-line with budgets
Change Management
Business Case preparation
Project Management associated with infrastructure upgrades
Life Cycle Replacement planning activities.
Key tasks and responsibilities:
Ensuring that each new building / data centre meets the quality standard required for transition from construction into the live service.
Review and monitor the maintenance contractors and third party supplier’s activities to ensure they have achieved the required quality standard.
Ensure Service availability and contracted Service Levels (SLA) are met across the site.
Manage and oversee the maintenance requirements
Ensure that all risks to data centres M&E are effectively managed.
Maintain safe working practices and ensure that Health and Safety objectives are met.
Roles and responsibilities:
Ensure that there is adequate information available allowing the operational teams to deliver the maintenance successfully.
Work with incumbent maintenance contractors and third party suppliers to ensure a fully managed and costed lifecycle management programme.
Provide technical support and assistance to operational staff in the progression and closure of incidents.
Ensure that all incidents are logged and correctly progressed in accordance with ITIL Framework.
Assist in Route Cause Analysis (RCA) reviews as outlined within Incident Management best practices and governance.
Ensure all operational changes are impacted and implemented in accordance with ITIL Framework.
Work closely with 3rd party contractors to incorporate lessons learned into future designs.
Contribute to an on-call escalation rota to provide enhanced technical support 24/7.
Ensure all technical knowledge is transferred from the design and build phase to the operational teams in the live environment.
Salary - Upto £55,000 per annum
Location - Wiltshire

Exinity Group is a new global wealth management organisation with an ambitious mission to create a new generation of empowered investors and traders. At Exinity, we believe in the freedom to succeed. It’s not just a promise we make to our clients and partners, but to our people too. Sales & Marketing: working with the marketing, sales and customer support departments to ensure they understand the products effectively to promote to the end customers.
Responsible for further development and growth of the app in existing and new markets. Senior Quality Assurance Manager

An excellent opportunity to join Richmond Pharmacology, the UK’s largest early Phase Contract Research Organisation (CRO) based in central London. We conduct early phase healthy volunteer and patient clinical trials for our pharmaceutical clients to help in the development of innovative medications. Our experienced and world-renowned teams and our global reach contribute to making Richmond Pharmacology an exciting and dynamic place to work.

We are recruiting for a Senior Quality Assurance Manager to join our QA team and contribute to our important work while expanding their existing skills within the clinical pharmacology sector. This is a permanent role (40-hour week) and will report to the Executive Board.

You must have the ability to direct and oversee the QA activities at Richmond Pharmacology to ensure the delivery of quality documents, processes and data to our global client base using GCP compliant processes. You must be able to work in a fast-paced working environment, prioritise effectively, and ensure compliance with regulatory standards including SOPs, ICH-GCP and other guidelines.

Key Skills & Responsibilities:
• Up to date knowledge of clinical trial regulations and guidelines.
• Ensure all operational processes are compliant with regulations.
• Provide appropriate QA responses to client’s queries.
• Responsible for training and development of QA staff.
• Responsible for updating all staff with changes in regulation.
• Responsible for overall management of Quality Management System.
• Responsible for scheduling and management of client and regulatory audits.
• Responsible for ensuring timely internal and external audits.
• Responsible for ensuring follow up of audit and issue CAPA's.

Academic Qualifications
• BSc or other relevant degree
• QA Qualification preferable

Personal Experience
• A minimum of 10 years’ GCP experience within academia or industry, at least 5 at a senior level
• Auditing clinical trials to international GCP standards is essential
• Advanced level of knowledge of all relevant industry guidance and standards (e.g. FDA, EMA, ICH, PMDA)
• Evidence of implementation of new processes and information in relation to best practices and standards, as well as emerging pharmaceutical industry guidance, enabling our QA processes to remain leading edge and competitive

Management Experience
• Strong written and verbal communication skills to clearly articulate QA requirements to various audiences.
• Driven, persuasive and able to influence and have an impact at all levels of the organisation.
• Experience and ability to manage QA activities and effectively liaising with sponsors, other CROs and service providers.

Tasks & Responsibilities
• Recruit, manage and develop entry level to senior team members to ensure quality of early phase clinical trial projects within Richmond Pharmacology
• Liaise closely with Principal Investigators, internal clinical and operational teams, pharmaceutical sponsors, regulatory authorities and other stakeholders
• Ensure effective and efficient scientific standard operating processes are implemented and maintained in order to meet all regulatory requirements for all studies
• Drive collaboration and innovation within the QA team as well as cross-functionally by interacting with other departments and externally
• Provide essential quality assurance (QA) training to the operational teams at Richmond Pharmacology
• Ensure inspection readiness is maintained

Remuneration
We offer a competitive remuneration package, including life assurance (3 x salary), private single medical and dental insurance and a generous holiday allowance, starting at 25 days, excluding bank holidays, increasing by 1 day per annum, up to a maximum of 30 days.

Application
Please provide both CV and a covering letter, the covering letter should include your availability, suitability for the post, interest in the role and eligibility to work in the UK.

Company Description

As the world’s leader in digital payments technology, Visa’s mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company’s dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.

At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.

You’re an Individual. We’re the team for you. Together, let’s transform the way the world pays.

Job Description

Team Summary

The CardinalCommerce Global Customer Services team (GCS) is dedicated to ensuring an excellent Customer experience throughout the design, implementation and ongoing support of our authentication and data solutions, which we offer to both merchants and issuers alike.

What an Implementation Manager does at Visa:

As an Implementation Manager you will be expected to create an excellent Customer experience from post-sales through integration of our products and services. The position will focus on new Customer implementations of Cardinal’s services, ensuring Cardinal’s Customers can leverage our solutions quickly and effectively. Success will be measured based on the quality of the activation process, Customer experience, partner / distributor perceptions and meeting defined Customer Support SLA’s.

In this role, you are expected to:
On-board Customers onto Cardinal's various eCommerce authentication solutions
Configure Cardinal Platforms, work with Customer's technical teams on implementation, testing, troubleshooting, certification and launch
Responsible for maintaining a multi-project pipeline, ensuring accurate forecasting and successful project delivery to Management team
Follow established/standardized implementation best practices
Work with downstream payment service providers, card networks & other 3rd parties
Act as a liaison between Customer Services and other Visa Department functions
Be an active participant in process & technology improvement efforts internally
Why this is important to Visa

The implementation manager is responsible for the successful configuration and launch of the Authentication Solution(s). In today’s constantly evolving payment technology & authentication landscape, a successful implementation manager is a subject matter expert who has the capability to guide our customers through implementing complex browser and native application (SDK) authentication flows.

Qualifications

What you will need:
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or University, within a Business, Finance or Technology discipline, or equivalent experience
Successful technical support and/or relationship management experience
High degree of proficiency in MS Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
Ability to work in a virtual environment while travelling; i.e. solid time management, organization, negotiation and influence skills
Basic understanding of web-based software development technologies: PHP, ASP, .NET, JavaScript, HTML, XML, JSON, REST APIs
Proven analytical and decision-making abilities
Superior teamwork, interpersonal and communication skills
Candidate must be a self-starter with the ability to function independently and in a team environment
Demonstrated strong project leadership capabilities and interpersonal skills
Ability to translate technical communications from engineers into client facing material
Strong organization skills including resolution management and follow up
What will also help:
Payments industry knowledge
Experience working in fast paced, high-growth start up environments a plus
High degree of proficiency in SalesForce preferred
Projects you will be a part of:

In many geographies, authentication is a requirement for online payment processing and is a critical point in the transaction flow. These projects will give the Implementation Manager an opportunity to engage with a variety of different technical teams for each client, and an opportunity to showcase their knowledge and expertise to internal and external stakeholders.

Additional Information

Working Hours: Incumbent must make themselves available during core business hours. May require occasional meetings outside of core business hours to connect with global partners and clients.

Travel Requirements: This position requires the incumbent to travel for work 0-10% of the time.

PURPOSE

IQVIA is at the forefront of healthcare innovation and delivery. With the current COVID-19 crisis we are working tirelessly to support our clients and customers to develop vaccines and therapies. The Quality Manager, Lifecycle Safety, is responsible for quality, compliance and deviation management across global Lifecycle Safety functions including ICSR case processing, Regulatory reporting, Medical Information, endpoint adjudication and aggregate reporting. This leader will partner with Lifecycle Safety functional specialists and/or management to assess quality trends, processes and procedures for continued improvement opportunities including CAPA management.
This pivotal quality expert will support Lifecycle Safety Functions with preparation, including training for audits and inspection, hosting of those audits and inspections and will support CAPA owners to resolution. Utilising your experience and expertise you may also support our Lifecycle Safety clients with Quality Management activities on their accounts.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Adopt and implement the Global Quality Management Plan within the scope of the assignment; this will include: planning and executing the Quality Management activities; risk identification and assessment through data review and quality control processes either remote or on site; providing support in risk mitigation, in planning corrective/preventive actions and guidance for improvement;
Review Non compliance & Deviation reports for accuracy, RCA and CAPA plans.
Cooperate closely with the relevant Heads of business and other stakeholders, support maintaining focus on quality in project delivery. Contribute to the development and implementation of a Regional/Delivery Unit/Sponsor specific Quality Management Plan and Risk Management Program, monitor the implementation and deliver.
Provide advice and support to functional operational teams within the Lifecycle Safety Department including ICSR case processing, Regulatory reporting, Medical Information, endpoint adjudication and aggregate reporting
Work in close cooperation with operational teams to manage non-compliance, quality issues; assist in planning corrective/preventive actions, as applicable according to SOPs.
Inform Heads of Quality Management, Heads of the assigned business line and Quality Assurance of quality issues according to SOPs.
Work closely with Quality Assurance and assigned business staff in case of suspected misconduct; as required by the applicable SOPs.
Provide assistance during audits and regulatory inspections to the operational teams to the extent agreed with the Head of QM and as required by the applicable SOPs.
Act as the primary contact for Quality Assurance on clinical quality matters – on the level of the assignment -, attend meetings/teleconferences.

Want to join a team with a mission to improve and save lives?


We continually look for motivated and skilled individuals who are interested in supporting our customers – healthcare professionals who use our products to help patients and their communities.

We currently have the following opportunity available - please contact us for more details!

Description


Elekta Group operates a centralized category and business driven procurement function operating across four main direct material countries: situated in UK/Netherlands/Sweden/China, and 3 indirect regions Americas, Europe and China/APAC. The Procurement function is structured as a matrix organisation with centralized leadership for Direct Purchasing/ Indirect Purchasing/ Supplier Development & Quality, Process & Systems and the Local Management in each of the regions for direct and indirect material.

The requirement for Supplier Development and Quality activities varies with site and as such this role may report into a Supplier Development and Quality Manager or into the local Head of Procurement. The role of Head of Supplier Development and Quality will drive the global direction of the Supplier Quality and Development teams through the direct management position.

The purpose of the Supplier Development and Quality Engineer role is to be a specialist in the tools, processes and management of supplier quality and development processes. Indirectly managing and leading others, driving improvement initiatives spanning multiple areas of the organization and geographical locations.

Responsibilities


Management of supplied material quality issues raised by the factory/installation/supplier and customers through NCR and CLM processes. Working with suppliers to ensure quality problems are effectively Contained and Root Cause analysis conducted using appropriate problem-solving tools, including 8D, 5-Whys, Fishbone and DOE. Ensure effective CAPA is implemented to prevent reoccurrence, including horizontal deployment across other product lines.

Develop proactive quality plans with suppliers and promote a zero-defect culture that reduces the need for upstream inspection and testing activities.

Develop positive relationships with internal and external interfaces, including suppliers, strategic buyers, category heads, procurement heads, R&D, manufacturing and service ensuring customer requirements are understood and achieved.

Plan, conduct and fully document part approvals on new and changed parts to ensure compliance to the drawing specification in accordance with Elekta agreed process. Where required, conduct physical part inspections, process audits and document checks at onsite and offsite locations.

Where appropriate, use Core Quality Tools (APQP, FMEA, MSA and PPAP) to proactively build quality into supplied product quality.

Knowledge of ISO13485, 9001, 14001 and their application to Elekta and Elekta supply chain.

Conduct approval, surveillance and capability audits of suppliers QMS, parts, processes and documentation to ensure compliance with relevant ISO13485, 9001 and Elekta’s Quality Agreement requirements (QAA), including the identification and escalation of quality and business risk. Writing of audit reports, audit non-conformances and opportunities for improvement. Follow up of actions at both supplier and internally at Elekta within agreed timescales.

Write, issue, negotiate and manage Quality Agreements with suppliers (QAA’s)

Provide quality management and manufacturing engineering support to category strategy and sourcing board initiated projects

Support internal, external, QMS and cross functional process improvement initiatives. Update Elekta QMS documentation as required.

Drive supplier development initiatives and A3 projects which will help meet procurements QCDIM targets and requirements. Train suppliers in best practice tools, processes and initiatives, including LEAN, Six Sigma, Value Stream mapping, Value Engineering, DFM, DFA, PFMEA, Process Validation and technical/manufacturing capability. Address, efficiency and output gaps where required.

Actively engage and participate in NPI, PCP and Elekta Programmes/Projects to promote DFM/DFA. Proactively drive quality into products through active participation in the Engineering change process, bridging suppliers, engineering and historical quality performance of parts to improve the quality of design. Raise Demand Management and Engineering change requests where required.

Use formal risk assessment tools to assess new manufacturing and supply chain processes and implement mitigation action plans as required to meet business objective and targets.

Support the selection and implementation of new suppliers according to the sourcing process and maintain the integrity of the approved supplier list and supplier data in relevant systems. Ensure supplier approval, supplier management and compliance documentation are maintained so we always remain audit-ready.

Provide manufacturing engineering expertise, supplier development and quality resource to support procurement cost down initiatives.

Support the management of suppliers QCDIM performance, including measurement tools and processes.

Manage supplier raised changes/escalations and deviation approvals (concessions) through to approval stage.

Complete QMS Training and QMS document reviews as required.
Location: Crawley, West Sussex, South East England, England

Job Description:
Our mission

Want to make a difference in this world and work on something meaningful? At Chronomics we enable people to quantify how their environment and lifestyle is affecting their health to live healthier and happier lives… all from their DNA. Right now we are also focusing our efforts on COVID-19 and have developed a innovative saliva based test and online platform.

The role

At Chronomics, we’re rapidly growing and you’ll bring a structured mind, rolled up sleeves and a positive attitude to enable us to execute successfully! You’ll be working closely with suppliers, customers and the internal team to ensure there is seamless delivery of products and services. You’ll manage execution with operational partners (suppliers and labs) and track key operational metrics to ensure they are met from a cost, time and quality perspective.

You’ll work with the internal team to manage forecasts to enable planning and execution to enable continued scaling of testing capabilities. Since we are a customer centric organisation, you’ll also be the operational point of contact for customer delivery. Finally, we are continuously improving our processes so you’ll work on other improvement initiatives related to financial, legal or customer processes or other exciting areas of the business requiring more support!
Essential skills
Ability to independently mobilise new initiatives
Highly organised with extensive project management skills
Able to operate effectively both in a collaborative team and autonomously
Data driven to manage KPIs and drive continuous improvement
Sleeves rolled up attitude, ready to get stuck in
Driven, energetic, tenacious and willing to learn fast
Excellent communicator
Nice to have
Experience in a high growth start-up
Benefits

Share options so early contributors benefit from our success.
Epigenetic test!
Flexible office or home working.
Friday pub sessions (even if virtual)

About Us

Chronomics is an ambitious health tech start-up that believes people should be in charge of their own health. Health management should be proactive, not reactive and it should be personalised. We are using longitudinal biological data to bring about this revolution. A revolution where not only will people be in control of their own future but also in control of how they contribute to the future of humanity through the use of their data.

This product is just the first step towards a platform technology that will serve as the interface between the biological and digital world. It's an incredibly exciting time to come on board where you can really make a difference. Find out more at www.chronomics.com

Come build the future of entertainment with us.

Are you interested in shaping the future of movies and television? Do you want to define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching?

Prime Video is a premium streaming service that offers customers a vast collection of TV shows and movies - all with the ease of finding what they love to watch in one place. We offer customers thousands of popular movies and TV shows from Originals and Exclusive content to exciting live sports events. We also offer our members the opportunity to subscribe to add-on channels which they can cancel at anytime and to rent or buy new release movies and TV box sets on the Prime Video Store. Prime Video is a fast-paced, growth business - available in over 240 countries and territories worldwide. The team works in a dynamic environment where innovating on behalf of our customers is at the heart of everything we do. If this sounds exciting to you, please read on.

Amazon Live Video (part of prime video offering) delivers Live TV and Live Events, including many sports leagues (NFL, ATP, AVP, UFC) to Windows and MacOS PCs, portable devices, gaming consoles, and smart TVs. Today, we serve customers in the US, Japan, UK, and Germany.


The Live Operation team delivers consistent, elite customer experiences which "just work" for everyday consumers. We build reliable, high performance live experiences, and we take ownership of the end-to-end live streaming experience-- from the live encoding core platform out through AIV's client applications. Our team makes a big impact because nothing is more important to us than pleasing our customers, continually earning their trust, and thinking long term. If you crave a sense of ownership, this is the place to be.
Our charter includes building and operating large-scale, low-latency live streaming services (24x7 channels and live events) using Amazon's industry-leading cloud encoding and origin infrastructure. We use A/B experiments to dive deep and learn what works best for our customers, and we gather data to inform our decisions. We improve and simplify our services to get ahead of customer needs, and we expect to raise the bar for customer expectations with our innovations. We intend to outperform traditional broadcast networks with greater selection, lower latency, industry-leading live delivery and quality, and unsurpassed value. We are proud to be part of an exciting growth area within Amazon.
Our team delivers results and value for customers while simultaneously investing in each team member's career and skill set. We embrace the challenges of a fast paced market and evolving technologies, paving the way to universal availability of content and pushing the envelope of streaming video quality. You will be encouraged to see the big picture, be innovative, and positively impact millions of customers, and help lead an growing operations team that executes at the highest level.


You will:
· Work within Global Live Operations to enable and execute the growth of the live operations business globally.
· Lead an operations team to execute and maintain highest standards
· Attract, recruit, manage, and mentor great Live Ops engineers maintaining a high bar of performance
· Promote innovation and provide clear and challenging vision and ensure that the right resources are in place to deliver.
· Define and continuously improve success metrics
· Manage continuous improvement in quality and satisfaction by ensuring appropriate quality processes that meet internal/external customer requirements.
· Perform frequent quality reviews
· Investigate and recommend approaches and systems that meet quality, performance and sustainability criteria
· Create operational run-books for events and services; automate where possible

Basic Qualifications

· Experience running operations teams with run books, SOPs, and escalation procedures.
· Proven abilities and passionate about mentoring and leading a team for live video operations and delivery
· Excellent communication skills·
· Experience of hiring and managing a team of high caliber Engineers working on Live Events

Preferred Qualifications

· Deep understanding of live streaming, broadcast operations
· Operation experience for large scale live events
· Knowledge of video codecs, video playback and common streaming protocols.
· Proven record delivering large audience events for news, sports and entertainment.
· Background in developing and supporting new methods for live video delivery.

We're looking for a driven and enthusiastic Operations Manager to join our operations team. About Feedr:

Feedr is an online platform connecting offices to fresh, healthy meals from 120+ of the best artisan vendors in London. Feedr is redefining the workplace food landscape, using technology to build personalised menus and launch company lunch programs. In addition to our marketplace of vendors, we provide software solutions to digitise the office canteen with Compass Group.

Feedr has raised two rounds of capital, backed by world class angel and VC investors and was recently acquired by Compass Group. Feedr has also been named as one of the top 100 UK startups in the Startups 100 list two years running. We’re a mission driven team and looking for passionate people to join us in redefining workplace food.

Role

Instill a ‘continuous improvement’ culture and lead on projects across the operations team designed to improve efficiency. Achieving savings by removing waste or unnecessary steps in the logistics process, whilst maintaining high levels of quality and service.

Perrigo Company is dedicated to making lives better by bringing high quality and affordable self-care products that consumers trust everywhere they are sold. Help us do it.

Company Background

Ranir is the global leader in private label oral care and is a division of Perrigo Consumer Self-Care International (CSCI).

Perrigo Consumer Self-Care International (CSCI) is a world leader in developing, manufacturing, marketing, and distributing well-known European self-care brands in the natural health and vitamins, cough, cold and allergy, oral care, smoking cessation, personal care and derma-therapeutics and lifestyle categories.

Ranir is an added value player in the oral care business, predominantly in private label, and considered a consultative seller partner to many big retailers in Europe. Since becoming part of Perrigo in July 2019 Ranir has expanded capabilities to deliver significant growth through its branded oral care portfolio, with the N1 US oral care brand Plackers (www.plackers.com). Ranir follows very aggressive growth ambitions, accomplishing the target by organic growth and M&A.

Germany is the fastest growing market for Ranir with significant contribution of global top and bottom line growth. To be successful in hitting their targets, Ranir is looking for an ambitious and driven category manager to join the team, managing and driving channel and customer plans to the next level.

The Role

Reporting directly to the Customer Marketing Director the category manager will play an important role creating the category vision and strategy managing continuous insights and developing category plans with key customers in relevant channels. Working in conjunction with the sales and marketing teams you will be responsible for delivering the annual volume, profit and market share targets within the DACH markets.

Specifically but not exclusively, you will be responsible for:

Support the Category Lead to define and implement the category strategy and plans
Develop and own the category development relationship within the customer, taking the EU vision for the category and tailoring it to your customer you will influence key retail contacts (category / commercial) to implement the key category growth initiatives.
Deliver insight driven category plans in all elements of the customer plan
Analytical support in the form of market data and competitive reviews providing insights on category opportunities, pricing and promotional strategy
Preparation of account category reviews and insights in order to influence the range stocked by customers;
Convert business and category opportunities into channel and customer specific selling stories
Collaborate closely with sales and marketing teams to ensure development and recommendations of joint customer plans and implementation of shopper/consumer marketing activities that drives Ranir products visibility, ROS, recruitment, and market share within retail and online channels.
Leadership of price and promotional activation through customers and channels. Including development of category price and promotional guidelines and working in partnership with sales to make changes to improve business unit results delivering against KPI’s
Identify market opportunities by understanding customer requirements; defining market & competitor shares; competitor strengths and weaknesses; ad hoc research support.
Monitor business, market, brands, and competition trends with setting of clear measures of success and KPIs
Be an ambassador for championing the category voice and proactively supporting the EMEA&APAC category team

The Person

You will take on responsibility for a selection of retail customers with primary focus on Germany, in conjunction with the Customer Marketing Director EMEA&APAC, therefore fluency in German will be an absolute must to guarantee success within this role.

You will have built a solid experience in category management and acquired a strong understanding of the German and European retail FMCG environment. You will be comfortable analysing and drawing insights from most type of market, category and consumer data.

Minimum of 4 years’ experience preferably within FMCG, ideally health & beauty categories.

Uniquely you must have also shown the ability to work among the systems and structure which comes with being part of a global group but also balance this with the creative, entrepreneurial team spirit and ethos of a small team based at Finchley Road in London.

Competencies and skills:

Successful track record at key retailers within category management /Trade marketing
Excellent analytical, communication and presentation skills
Solid multi-channel shopper/consumer marketing activation experience within FMCG
Good commercial understanding
Proficient in different type and sources of data (panel, epos, consumer research and market place reporting tools)
Digital marketing knowledge or experience
Fluent in German and English
Experience interacting with both internal and external customers
Team orientated, ability to connect and work cohesively with the team

About Wonderbly

Wonderbly is a unique, award winning startup that designs, sells, prints and ships super high quality personalised books and toys for children and grown up’s.

Our books are designed to instil a sense of boundless self-belief in the children that read them, and allow grown up’s to show how much they mean to each other.

Wonderbly have sold millions of units and we want to sell millions more so we can influence the lives of the next generation to be more curious, kind and courageous than any that has come before.

Equal opportunities employer

Our team are committed to providing equal opportunities for employment regardless of of race, religion or belief, ethnic origin, disability, family structure, socio-economic status, age, nationality or citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis (it's the law, but it's also just the right thing to do).

Life in Operations at Wonderbly

The Operations department is responsible for the physical aspects of the Wonderbly business. The Ops Team source raw materials and / or finished products, move them to 7 different factory locations around the globe, and then manufacture and / or dispatch those items to customers as Orders are received at our factory partners.

We are currently looking for an “Operations Manager” to help us launch new products, re-buy existing stock, and manage our third party factory performance. So in a nutshell; help us launch new products, locate and negotiate the best costs for repeat buys, and make sure that our factories are smashing their targets!!

If you like the cut and thrust of a busy supply chain and procurement department, you’re a can-do / solutions person, and you know how to keep third party suppliers and factories on their toes, then read on. :-)

New Product Development (NPD)
Receiving briefs from the Product Team, and then;
Providing feedback on product feasibility
Sourcing new products from UK, Europe and Asia
Negotiating costs for new products
Gaining quality 3rd party quality testing and approval for new products (e.g. CE certification)
Managing and owning critical paths with suppliers - UK and overseas
Setting up sku codes and completing end to end testing on internal tech systems
Procurement / sourcing
Repeat buys on existing products;
Carrying out tenders (UK, Europe, USA and Asia) on existing stock lines (e.g. packaging, gift wrap, toys)
Negotiating competitive cost prices
Liasing with the Forecasting Team to create global roll out and pashing plans for inventory.
Managing and owning critical paths with suppliers - UK and overseas
Presenting small business cases for stock purchases
Manufacturing and fulfilment
Working with the wider Operations Management Team to challenge factories;
Minimise late orders
Maximize high quality output
Using facts and figures, and strong stakeholder management skills, to challenge, and maintain pressure, on the factories to make sure that they are achieving the agreed SLA’s / KPI’s.
Requirements

Candidate skills:
Highly tenacious
Great attention to detail
Comfortable and articulate with data (intermediate / strong Excel skills)
Calm under pressure
Good negotiation skills
Fast learner / quick thinker
Candidate experience:
Used to dealing with external stakeholders and / or third party service and product providers
Used to presenting mini business cases re cost / benefit
Some experience of project management
Sourcing experience useful - especially overseas sourcing
Procurement experience - used to buying an comfortable with buying best practices (retros, early settlement discounts, DDP vs FOB purchase etc)
NPD - experience of taking products from conception through to launch

About parcelLab:
parcelLab is the leading Operations Experience (OX) platform for engaging post-sales experiences and communications. We already enable over 500 brands, online retailers and distributors (B2C/B2B) like MediaMarkt, IKEA, Nespresso, Puma, Lidl and many more to regain control over their end-to-end customer journey, thus ensuring an excellent post-sales customer journey.

Instead of handing over the customer relationship to third parties like DHL, UPS, FedEx, etc., with parcelLab, businesses retain all customer touchpoints in a curated manner within their own ecosystem, ensuring a consistent brand experience, proactive customer care and maximised cross-selling through automated communication during the post-sales customer journey.

Come be part of our growth – contribute your ideas and share in our success. Help generate new business with top-name companies, and enjoy being part of our amazing parcelCrew!

Sound interesting? We look forward to hearing from you!

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Who we are...
Tableau joined the Salesforce Ohana in 2019 as an analytics trailblazer. Within Tableau Sales, the Global Services organization is supported by the Global Services Operations team which has a diverse purview including business analytics, procurement activities, business operational support, Tableau Education services, and the Tableau Services Subcontracting Program. In Global Services, we value an inclusive approach to attracting and growing talent. Whether we’re providing functional support, building programs, or rolling out the latest process improvements, we are focused on providing a great professional experience while continuing to develop an effective operational foundation for Global Services.
What you'll be doing...
We are looking for an Operations Manager to help us build out a new function within the Tableau Services Subcontracting Program. As we mature our subcontracting operations, you’ll manage our EMEA/APAC Professional Services and Education subcontractor relationships including performance management, develop growth and nurture plans, and iterate on the building of supporting processes. You’ll be responsible for tasks throughout the subcontractor lifecycle including onboarding, resource vetting, escalation management, and portfolio reviews. This role provides a unique combination of relationship building/management with an operational focus on developing a new function with an eye to effectiveness and efficiency.
Your Impact:
Success will be measured by the overall performance of the Tableau Services Subcontracting Program team to provide the Global Services organization with a cost-effective, high quality subcontracting network.
Assist with the development of the Subcontractor Manager role within AMER (EMEA/APAC) region
Develop and nurture strong relationships with key training and consulting partners in the EMEA/APAC region
Execute on subcontractor program functions throughout the subcontractor lifecycle including partner onboarding, oversight, logistics, and portfolio reviews
Monitor subcontractor performance in areas including process compliance, quality, revenue, and strategic fit
Oversee issue resolution and escalation management related to subcontractors in the EMEA/APAC region
Identify potential improvements that can enhance the overall value, efficiency, and effectiveness of the subcontracting program and subcontractor experience
Work closely with regional Account Partners and Delivery teams to ensure adequate subcontractor capacity and skill set coverage
Minimum Requirements:
Ability to build and sustain strong relationships with external partners
Experience monitoring metrics/data for trends and issues
Ability to address performance issues and escalations without damaging the subcontractor relationship
Experience with successfully managing a large, diverse workload such as managing multiple projects, accounts, and/or cases
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Strong cross-functional teaming skills and collaborative problem solving
Self-directed and resourceful with strong interpersonal, teamwork, and organizational skills
Ability to bring clarity and structure when managing fluid expectations and evolving demands
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Ability to balance thoroughness, high quality, and efficiency within a high volume of tasks
Preferred Requirements:
Experience in an operational role with success in identifying and executing process and program improvements
Ability to build, manage and utilize Tableau dashboards
Experience in a partner-related role in the software, professional services, or related industry
Proficiency in languages other than English

Supports the Connected Quality and Supplier Quality strategies in line with the Brompton Connected Quality vision. Ensures that the strategies are supported for the suppliers continual improvement of their processes in line with the design intent of Brompton and verify their systems to ensure they are compliant with the end customers needs. The purpose of the role is to support the Supplier Quality Manager, who is responsible for delivering all aspects of the Supplier Quality function relative to the Connected Quality vision. Work in a team environment acting as the conduit between internal and external Quality Teams to implement best practices that emphasise defect prevention, reduction in variation and waste and provide for continuous improvements in meeting all Brompton requirements. Collect Root Cause Analysis and provide corrective feedback to prevent line stops due to supply Issues.

Responsible for ensuring that the products produced meet quality standards required to minimise quality costs and maximise Customer satisfaction whilst ensuring that procedures and processes are adhered to. POSITION SUMMARY
This is an exciting senior management Quality Control role which will enable operations to meet its quality KPIs. You will establish procedures and measure after effects to assure quality.

You will have experience with quality management systems (QMS) and ISO 9001:2008 or greater as well as familiarity with GMP/cGMP environments, particularly around documentation and labelling practices.

The lead will be responsible for managing performance of quality KPIs such as right first time (RFT) and defects in parts per million (PPM. You will also have experience with and appreciation of continuous improvement with Lean and Six Sigma.

This position can be based in either London or Manchester, however, applicants in other UK locations will be considered.

#LI-DB
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Ensure that SGK production methods follow quality standards for customers and that quality is placed at the forefront of all workplace inputs, processes, and outputs
Develop, document, deploy, maintain, and improve a quality management system (QMS) inclusive of policies, procedures, processes, and practices
Lead and direct problem solving activities designed to improve quality performance
Provide subject matter expertise for GMP/cGMP requirements for label and documentation (GDocP)
Maintain and comply with ISO 9001, ISO 14000, ISO 28219; organise activities of sites to achieve ISO certifications as required
Enable the commercial and operations teams to deliver what the customer wants: shortest lead time, highest quality, and lowest cost
Interface with the business and customer (as applicable) as steward of quality assurance, quality control, and QMS
Monitor and report quality KPIs for the business (internal) and customer (external), as applicable, and determine the right KPIs to measure for health of quality function, e.g., DPMO, COPQ
Maintain the quality control database (QCDB)
Conduct internal and external audits on both scheduled and ad hoc bases
Create/revise and maintain quality training materials for deployment as part of new-user/employee orientation, annual training requirements (through LMS), and classroom-led training (as applicable)
Use Lean, Six Sigma, and other process improvement methodologies to build management processes, data foundations and tools to enable standardisation within quality function
Drive innovation, thinking outside the box to deliver new innovative solutions for global production within the assigned functional scope
Demonstrate partnership with Matthews International corporate quality leadership and team; maintain compliance with corporate policies and Global Compliance Platform
QUALIFICATIONS / REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s Degree in Business or related field
Experience with quality management systems (QMS) and ISO 9001:2008 or greater as well as familiarity with GMP/cGMP environments, particularly around documentation and labelling practices.
Continuous improvement experience would be advantageous
Occasional travel either locally, nationally, and/or internationally may be required.
High degree of proficiency MS Office Suite, Outlook & Internet applications

SGK is a global packaging and brand experience company. From idea to implementation, we deliver packaging solutions and brand experiences that give brands the freedom to speak louder, scale faster and grow stronger. We simplify marketing and amplify brands to deliver value. SGK is a Matthews International company.

Matthews International endeavors to make our employment website and application process accessible to all users and applicants. ABOUT US

DICE is the world’s most-loved discovery and ticketing platform for live shows and live streams, delivering exclusive, high quality entertainment to fans across the world.

We bring fans and creators together with our technology, working closely with the best artists, promoters and venues in music and culture. In April 2020 we launched DICE Live Streaming, connecting fans across the globe with the very best live events.

DICE is a place for people who are ambitious, humble and talented. For those who want to learn at pace and have a true passion for music and culture. Our HQ is in London, we have teams in New York, LA, Paris, Barcelona, Milan, Mumbai and Samara and we’re live in 139 countries. You can read more about what we’ve been up to here in our recent Forbes and Rolling Stone articles.

And now, we’re looking for a Marketing Operations Manager to join the B2B Marketing and Sales Operations team.

THE ROLE AND TEAM

This is an exciting opportunity to join the newly formed B2B Sales and Marketing Operations team, responsible for the entire sales funnel and partner acquisition strategy execution. The team is responsible for bringing DICE to new heights, supporting both the Live and Streaming teams in acquiring new partners and setting them up for success once acquired.

Having recently integrated Salesforce as our CRM and Pardot as our Marketing Automation platform, we’re looking for a B2B Marketing Operations Manager that can set our partner CRM strategy up for success. As well as setting the foundations of our CRM processes for B2B, you’ll work with the rest of the sales and marketing team to scale our efforts and optimise performance.

You are someone that enjoys looking at processes, identifying gaps and working to close them. You also love diving into details and have excellent project management skills as well as stakeholder management. You keep up to date with the latest Salesforce developments and find ways to use new technologies and releases to advantage the team.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
Develop the B2B CRM Strategy in alignment with the B2B division objectives, ensure alignment with the wider B2C CRM strategy
Engage stakeholders on B2B CRM programs, informing them on insights and learnings
Coordinate with stakeholders across the business and partner agencies to lead campaign briefings; agreeing objectives, measurements and reporting
Target audience segments to grow the marketing and sales funnel through the B2B marketing campaign calendar
Operationalise ways of working to drive efficiencies and best practice across local markets
Create campaign toolkits, such as email templates, to share with local markets to be able to repurpose content aligned to the calendar
Coordinate the database dashboard, reporting and insights
Manage all email and drip campaigns including dynamic workflows, lists, tracking and execution using Pardot
Grow new leads by converting website traffic through calls-to-action, landing pages and lead generation content
Optimise and segment the lead scoring, grading and nurturing processes
Establish closed-loop analytics to understand how marketing activity turns into customers, and continually refine our process to convert better-qualified leads
YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Proven experience in B2B marketing with strong expertise in Pardot
Ability to influence others through excellent communication and creative thinking
Strong project management experience, with the ability to use data to inform decisions
High attention to detail, organised with good time management,
Adaptable to change, with strong problem-solving skills and a good sense of judgement
Ability to present to executives to gain support for change management initiatives to seek an investment that delivers growth
Proficient with dynamic workflows and marketing automation software, (strong preference for Pardot experience)
Expert in Microsoft Office and working knowledge of Salesforce, Google Analytics and HTML
Pardot Specialist certification
