ABOUT US

DICE is the world’s most-loved discovery and ticketing platform for live shows and live streams, delivering exclusive, high quality entertainment to fans across the world.

We bring fans and creators together with our technology, working closely with the best artists, promoters and venues in music and culture. In April 2020 we launched DICE Live Streaming, connecting fans across the globe with the very best live events.

DICE is a place for people who are ambitious, humble and talented. For those who want to learn at pace and have a true passion for music and culture. Our HQ is in London, we have teams in New York, LA, Paris, Barcelona, Milan, Mumbai and Samara and we’re live in 139 countries. You can read more about what we’ve been up to here in our recent Forbes and Rolling Stone articles.

And now, we’re looking for a Marketing Operations Manager to join the B2B Marketing and Sales Operations team.

THE ROLE AND TEAM

This is an exciting opportunity to join the newly formed B2B Sales and Marketing Operations team, responsible for the entire sales funnel and partner acquisition strategy execution. The team is responsible for bringing DICE to new heights, supporting both the Live and Streaming teams in acquiring new partners and setting them up for success once acquired.

Having recently integrated Salesforce as our CRM and Pardot as our Marketing Automation platform, we’re looking for a B2B Marketing Operations Manager that can set our partner CRM strategy up for success. As well as setting the foundations of our CRM processes for B2B, you’ll work with the rest of the sales and marketing team to scale our efforts and optimise performance.

You are someone that enjoys looking at processes, identifying gaps and working to close them. You also love diving into details and have excellent project management skills as well as stakeholder management. You keep up to date with the latest Salesforce developments and find ways to use new technologies and releases to advantage the team.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
Develop the B2B CRM Strategy in alignment with the B2B division objectives, ensure alignment with the wider B2C CRM strategy
Engage stakeholders on B2B CRM programs, informing them on insights and learnings
Coordinate with stakeholders across the business and partner agencies to lead campaign briefings; agreeing objectives, measurements and reporting
Target audience segments to grow the marketing and sales funnel through the B2B marketing campaign calendar
Operationalise ways of working to drive efficiencies and best practice across local markets
Create campaign toolkits, such as email templates, to share with local markets to be able to repurpose content aligned to the calendar
Coordinate the database dashboard, reporting and insights
Manage all email and drip campaigns including dynamic workflows, lists, tracking and execution using Pardot
Grow new leads by converting website traffic through calls-to-action, landing pages and lead generation content
Optimise and segment the lead scoring, grading and nurturing processes
Establish closed-loop analytics to understand how marketing activity turns into customers, and continually refine our process to convert better-qualified leads
YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Proven experience in B2B marketing with strong expertise in Pardot
Ability to influence others through excellent communication and creative thinking
Strong project management experience, with the ability to use data to inform decisions
High attention to detail, organised with good time management,
Adaptable to change, with strong problem-solving skills and a good sense of judgement
Ability to present to executives to gain support for change management initiatives to seek an investment that delivers growth
Proficient with dynamic workflows and marketing automation software, (strong preference for Pardot experience)
Expert in Microsoft Office and working knowledge of Salesforce, Google Analytics and HTML
Pardot Specialist certification

The Senior Manager, EASA Modification Engineering directs and coordinates all activities with regards to the development of engineering data, leading to the approval of aircraft level STC’s, minor changes and minor repairs under the Company's EASA Part 21 subpart J approved Design Organisation approval.

As part of the team, the successful candidate will lead the company’s EASA approved design organisation, reporting to the Engineering Director for commercial modifications and bringing with them strong project leadership, technical mentoring, and decision-making skills.

He or she will be responsible for directing all engineering activities performed under the DO approval in close collaboration with the Head of Design Organisation, Avionic & Electrical system team, cabin interiors team, and structures team, while abiding to the DOA processes and procedures in compliance with EASA Part 21 requirements.

Above all, the candidate will perform their role with integrity and have a strong sense of responsibility and pride both in their work and the work of the broader team.

Engineering duties

Communicates effectively with customers, sales, and marketing teams on product capabilities and features.

Develops and implements plans and forecasts to achieve objectives for the engineering team as part of engineering services

Possess an understanding of engineering job practices, certification techniques, industry standards, principles, theories and concepts.

Effectively manages resources in collaboration with the global engineering team

Must have strong project management skills

Ensuring that the required documents are prepared within time frames to be provided to the Agency for approval

Providing guidelines for generation of engineering documents including drawings, bulletins and supplements

Ensuring appropriate training of all members of the engineering team

Be approved and work as a Compliance Verification Engineer (CVE) within their specialist technical field of expertise

Working in collaboration with the Head of Design Organization and Head of Office of Airworthiness to ensure design organization procedures continue to meet the quality and performance metrics of the business

Providing regular feedback to the Engineering Director on the performance of the team

Managerial Duties

Responsible for day to day project management of engineering activities related to EASA design organization projects, including time management and budgeting

Formulating departmental budgets in line with the established budget process

Functional management of Engineering Technical Documentation Department

Must be able to deal with management at all levels, both internally and externally.

Must act in a professional manner in order to protect and enhance the Company's reputation as a world leader in large aircraft manufacture and continued airworthiness

Willingness to take ownership of challenges within the business

Ability to drive change to working practices and procedures to improve and enhance the Company business model

Must be willing to mentor and develop the skills of the engineering staff by knowledge transfer

This requisition is for a locally hired position in the UK. Candidates must either hold or have the ability to obtain legal authorisation to work in the United Kingdom. Benefits and pay are determined at the local level and are not part of Boeing U.S. based payroll.

Required Qualification/Experience

Education to Degree standard, however other internationally recognized qualifications will be considered based on technical knowledge and experience

Demonstrated experience in a design & certification-related engineering role

While the production team focuses on the day-to-day, you look ahead and prepare the operation for growth, tackling reporting and data analysis to check on operational health.
You’ll help solve problems and enable great communication between teams and liaise with the operational leads around the world. As you get familiar with different models and workflows, you’ll connect the dots and help people to get better.
You’ll solve logistical challenges to make sure that makers can produce at full speed and great quality.
Operational responsibilities:
Support the business team in their reporting and financial planning.
Ensure that the core team are kept up to date with supporting materials, trackers, and administrative rigour.
Act as the interface between London producers, creative and business teams with the production and development hubs around the world, helping with reconciliations, audits and financial reviews.
Support the creation of documentation and training materials so we can get better with every go.
Workflows, systems and tooling:
Be part of a team that reviews, audits and streamlines our workflows and processes, and help to introduce new software where needed.
Work with the business and finance teams to ensure greater finance accountability and transparency across all teams
Think in infinite scalability by creating training documentation, tools, training sessions, train the trainer workshops ...
Become a top-notch OM

In return for your attention to detail, deadlines and deliveries, we offer an exciting place to work on amazing projects together with even better people. Working at MediaMonks means you’ll be part of a successful and super-fast-moving company on a global mission to become the best — and most humble ;-) — production partner in any field and market. If you fit this description, we’d love to meet you to tell you more about MediaMonks, our work and our culture.

Please be attentive to the requirements and accompany your application with a personal cover letter detailing why you’re the right Monk for the job

Requirements
We’re looking for someone who is first and foremost an excellent problem solver and coordinator, someone who knows how to hustle internal resources to meet external deadlines no matter what.
You need to have a highly organisational approach and mindset, one that handle multiple projects, tasks and workstreams at once, and be able to proactively problem solve with great clarity at speed.
Your 5+ years of experience in digital advertising, platform creation or production have made you fabulous at dealing with a fast agency environment, the tension that sometimes creates, and be phenomenal at communicating with clients and coworkers.
You have direct experience and understanding of managing creative production processes and work streams, and be able to review, evaluate and improve ways of working
You are a proactive problem solver and communicator, with the ability and stamina to tackle the same challenge from a wide variety of angles.

Job Title: IA Technology - Data Quality - Snr Audit Manager
Job Description: The Senior Audit Manager is a senior level management position responsible for managing a complex and critical unit within Internal Audit, in coordination with the Audit team. The overall objective of this role is to develop and execute a robust Audit Plan, and direct complex audit activities for a component of the business at a regional or country level. This role directs the timely delivery of complex high quality, value added assurance and audit reports for a portfolio of business activities, which meet the requirements of the Boards of Citigroup and Citibank, their affiliates and of Citis respective regulators, globally. The Senior Audit Manager Technology Data Quality manages and delivers the Data Quality audit plan, providing independent third-line assurance that the end-to-end Data Quality processes at Citi have been properly understood, assessed and mitigated via first line programs and second line assurance activities. Key Responsibilities: Develops and executes (and ongoing update) a robust Data Quality audit plan by reviewable entity, that provides thorough, risk based coverage (including issue validation for regulatory and audit issues) for addressing Data Quality risks across Citi, in accordance with Internal Audit standards, relevant government statutes and regulations and Citigroup and Citibank policies. Executes independent assessments of end-to-end Data Tracing capability that provides assurance over accuracy of critical data in key regulatory and management reports. Delivers on time high quality audit reports, Internal Audit and Regulatory issue validation and (where appropriate, branch examinations, as well as business monitoring and governance committee reporting. Directs complex audit activities for a component of a product line, function, or legal entity at the regional or country level including a portion of the audit annual plan. Applies comprehensive expertise in one or more of the corporation's businesses and leverages this knowledge into a leadership role in one or more teams. Proactively advances integrated auditing concepts and use of technology. Closely follows latest trends in own field and adapts them for application within own job and the business Manages a complex and critical unit within Internal Audit, including a medium sized team of Internal Audit professionals. Recruits staff, develops talent, builds effective teams, and manages a budget. Possesses a broad and comprehensive understanding of different Internal Audit standards, policies and local regulations; applies a broad and comprehensive knowledge of high risk areas including: Consumer or Investment Banking, technology management; project/program management; regulatory compliance or supplier management. Leads the professional development of Internal Audit staff. Develops effective senior line management relationships and has a strong understanding of the businesses. Applies an in-depth understanding of the inter-relationships of business and support units throughout the corporation and how they impact the overall control environment and the audit approach. Uses excellent communication skills in order to influence a wide range of internal audiences including respective product, function, or regional executive management partners. May negotiate internally often at higher levels on matters which will have a major impact on the area managed. Demonstrates strong judgment, political astuteness, and sensitivity to cultural diversity. Possesses strong project management and interpersonal skills, makes sound decisions, exhibiting initiative and intuitive thinking. Consulted often by others for advice and opinions and recognized as a leadership role model. Participates in major business initiatives and pro-actively advises and assists the business on change initiatives. Frequently involved in matters that require complex judgments and solutions based on sophisticated analytical thought such as identifying solutions for a variety of complex and novel audit control issues. Analyzes reporting findings; Recommends appropriate interventions where needed. Proposes creative and pragmatic solutions for risk and control problems. Partners with Directors and Managing Directors to develop approaches for addressing broader corporate emerging issues. Serves as lead reviewer for all types of reviews, including the most complex. Reviews and approves Business Monitoring Quarterly Summaries. Qualifications and Competencies BA/BS or equivalent. Related certifications (CPA, ACA, CFA, CIA, CISA or similar) are a plus. Statistical, Computer Science or Computer Engineering qualifications will be an advantage. Senior level experience in a related role with experience in business, functional and people management, with proven abilities in taking responsibility for executing concurrently on a portfolio of high quality deliverables to stakeholders according to strict timetables. Specific subject matter expertise regarding Data Quality control disciplines. Demonstrates experience in managing teams and managing integrated internal audit and assurance delivery within a matrix reporting environment. Effective negotiation skills, a proactive and 'no surprises' approach in communicating issues and strength in sustaining independent views. This individual must be an articulate and effective communicator, both orally and in writing, with an energetic, charismatic and approachable style. Strong interpersonal skills for interfacing with all levels of internal and external audit and management. Experience in the following areas would be considered to be advantageous: Finance especially US Regulatory reporting Technology (including Technology audits) and data analytics Data management standards and principles, data tracing Exceptional candidates who do not meet these criteria may be considered for the role provided they have the necessary skills and experience. Valuing Diversity: Demonstrates an appreciation of a diverse workforce. Appreciates differences in style or perspective and uses differences to add value to decisions or actions and organizational success. Our Milton Keynes based client is looking for a Data Quality Manager on a full time, permanent basis.

Position: Data Quality Manager

The job will involve…
Lead the Data Quality team and take ultimate responsibility for keeping turnaround times at a minimum.

The Data Quality manager will champion change, seeking to make continuous improvements via identifying customer needs and tailoring our offering.

Join us as a Data & Analytics Manager

This is an exciting opportunity to use your technical expertise to collaborate with colleagues and build effortless, digital first customer experiences
You’ll be simplifying the bank through developing innovative data driven solutions, inspiring to be commercially successful through insight, and keeping our customers and the bank safe and secure
Participating actively in the data engineering community, you’ll deliver opportunities to support our strategic direction while building your network across the bank

What you'll do

We’ll look to you to drive value for the customer through modelling, sourcing and data transformation. You’ll be working closely with core technology and architecture teams to deliver strategic data solutions, while driving Agile and DevOps adoption in the delivery of data engineering.

We’ll also expect you to be:

Delivering the automation of data engineering pipelines through the removal of manual stages
Developing comprehensive knowledge of the bank’s data structures and metrics, advocating change where needed for product development
Educating and embedding new data techniques into the business through role modelling, training and experiment design oversight
Delivering data engineering strategies to build a scalable data architecture and customer feature rich dataset for data scientists
Developing solutions for streaming data ingestion and transformations in line with streaming strategy

The skills you'll need

To be successful in this role, you’ll need to be an intermediate level programmer and data engineer with a qualification in Computer Science or Software Engineering. You’ll also need a strong understanding of data usage and dependencies with wider teams and the end customer, as well as a proven track record in extracting value and features from large scale data.

You’ll also demonstrate:

Strong experience in Tableau and other Data Visualisation tools, such as Power BI, SSRS, R, and developing best-in-class data visualisation dashboards
Strong understanding of data story-telling and presentation of key insights to senior stakeholders
Strong background in building automated reports using scheduling tools, e.g. SAS EG, SAS BI, SQL Server Management Studio
Strong data integration background, accessing data from disparate systems, as well as cleansing and enriching existing data through APIs and matching techniques such as fuzzy matching
Strong programming background in SAS, SQL and Python, with the ability to analyse and produce aggregated reports on large-scale datasets
Experience of ETL technical design, automated data quality testing, QA and documentation, data warehousing, data modelling and data wrangling
Extensive experience using RDMS, ETL pipelines, Python, Hadoop and SQL

It would be ideal if you have experience of using Oracle, Unix scripting, Java, cloud, API, NoSQL and Kafka.

QA Manager – Start Up Biotech Company – London – Permanent

Our growing Bio-pharmaceutical client who are seeking to deliver truly innovative, life-changing therapies for their patients are looking for someone to fill the role of QA Manager. Their vision as a company is to be a major global biopharmaceutical player bringing transformational and valued therapies for a range of autoimmune and inflammatory diseases.

The main purpose of this position will be to provide Quality support for the manufacturing operations. This position offers an excellent opportunity for an innovative and pragmatic quality professional to contribute to developing a risk based quality system which supports the development of a growing pipeline of assets in an exciting and highly dynamic environment focused on developing cutting-edge cellular therapies.

Key Responsibilities

Assist in the development of the PQS including establishing an eQMS
Perform routine QA duties to ensure manufacturing and testing activities comply with the local GMP facility processes where products are manufactured
Provide quality support to ensure starting materials are procured, tested and imported as required according to UK HTA requirements
Manage and monitor the following elements of the PQS relating to manufacture of cellular therapies including; Document control system, Change controls, Corrective and preventative actions (CAPA), Deviation & OOS reporting, Quality risk management, Qualification & validation, Internal audits, Vendor qualification, Batch record review prior to QP release and Product specification files for ATIMP’s
Draft, review and approve Quality and GxP related documentation
Trend and report quality performance metrics from the PQS
Inform Head of Quality and Senior Management of significant quality related matters or risks that could impact patient safety, product quality, product release or regulatory compliance
Provide Quality support for R&D processes in state-of-the-art R&D laboratories to ensure best laboratory and data integrity practices
The role may need to provide general support for quality related clinical operations under GCP
Organize training of quality system and deliver basic GMP training

Essential Qualifications & Experience

Min 5+ years’ experience in GMP manufacturing environment (in particular small scale e.g. ATMP’s, clinical trials or individualised patient products is desired)
Min 3+ years’ experience in a Quality Assurance related role
University degree in a biological science, chemistry or equivalent
Experience in providing scientifically sound, risk based and pragmatic quality advice to manufacturing and quality control functions
Extensive experience writing and reviewing GxP documents (including SOP’s, qualification/validation reports and batch records prior to QP review) to ensure good documentation, data integrity, essential GxP, quality and regulatory requirements are met.
Demonstrated experience in developing a PQS especially involving an eQMS
A good working knowledge of GMP relating to sterile production, cleanrooms, aseptic technique and hygienic requirements for sterile products
Exemplary attention to detail and record keeping demonstrating good documentation practices
Excellent interpersonal and English language communication skills (written and verbal)
Good working knowledge of using Microsoft office programs

Desired Skills and Experience

A working knowledge of regulatory requirements or processes that specifically apply for the manufacture and/or testing of cell therapy products and/or ATMP’s
A working knowledge of Tissues and Cells Directive and HTA requirements
Experience of electronic Quality Management Systems
Experience of quality aspects relating to GCP
Basic understanding of immunology

Vacancy Description

Develop, implement, and manage quality control systems designed to ensure materials that meet or exceed our customers’ expectations. Ensure that these quality systems meet or exceed the requirements of our ISO 9001:2015 and AS 9100 Certifications and are consistent with established standards, customer specifications, and production goals.

Major Responsibilities:

Develop, implement, and manage quality control systems designed to ensure materials that meet or exceed our customers’ expectations. Ensure that these quality systems meet or exceed the requirements of our ISO 9001:2008 and AS 9100 Certifications and are consistent with established standards, customer specifications, and production goals. Provide leadership, direction, and supervision to a team of quality engineers, quality control inspectors, technicians, or professionals. Define roles and responsibilities, communicate expectations, and hold direct reports accountable.

Essential Functions:

1. Ensure a high level of internal and external customer service. Investigate and correct customer issues and complaints relating to quality.

2. Create, document and implement inspection criteria and procedures.

3. Provide, and oversee, inspection activity for product throughout entire manufacturing cycle.

4. Develop and analyze statistical data and product specifications to determine standards and to establish quality and reliability expectancy of finished products.

5. Formulate, document and maintain quality control standards and on-going quality control objectives.

6. Ensure that documentation and design controls are appropriate for organization.

7. Coordinate objectives with production procedures in cooperation with plant managers and engineers to maximize product reliability and minimize costs.

8. Design, develop and implement quality control training programs.

9. Apply total quality management tools and approaches to inspection processes.

10. Maintain active role on internal Continuous Improvement Teams.

11. Perform internal audits.

12. Address Non-Conformances from all internal and external audits.

13. Follow-up on and close pending Preventive and Corrective Action Requests.

14. Overseeing established calibration and testing program.

15. Assisting the management team and provide QA support as necessary.

16. Performs other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications and Education Requirements

· B.S. degree in Material Science or Engineering is desired.

· Minimum 5 years related experience desired.

· Supervisory/management experience desired.

· Strong understanding of quality management systems in an ISO 9001/AS 9100 is preferred.

· CQE certification desired.

· Kaizen and Lean Manufacturing techniques preferred.

· Experience with developing/documenting procedures.

· Use of Quality Engineering methods in inspection.

· Computer proficiency.

Additional Requirements:

· Quality orientation and high attention to detail.

· Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

· Experience working with high performance teams.

· Problem analysis and problem resolution skills.

· Must be competent with Microsoft Word-Processing, Spreadsheet (Excel) software, and SPC software.

· Must be able to clearly present ideas and reports in written and verbal format

· Must be able to work well with subordinates, peers and superiors in all departments of the Company

· Must be able to work well with external contacts of the Company

· Must have good time management, planning and negotiation skills

· Must adhere to all Company policies

Physical Requirements:

· Must be capable of sitting and using a computer for the majority of an 8-hour workday

· Must be able to lift 35 pounds

· Must be capable of traveling within the US and Internationally

Job Description: Operations Manager*
_We’re building a community of people who gather in nature for fun, to learn and feel good_
Wild in the City *
Wild in the City was established in 2013 and was incorporated as an asset locked non- profit Community Interest Company in April 2016 to address the growing problem of disconnection from nature and generational loss of knowledge and skills, and to help make nature a meaningful part of everyday life.

We support the well-being of urban residents through relationship with nature in London and beyond. We offer programmes in hiking, woodland living skills, natural history and ecotherapy; using the skills of our ancestors to develop a deeper relationship with the natural world and nurture a sense of belonging to communities past and present.

We are a black led organisation with a focus on health and supporting Black and minority ethnic communities in accessing nature and the countryside, addressing the widely acknowledged lack of representation and lower levels of involvement of people of colour in nature based activity. We are a leading organisation in research and the facilitation of forums about race and nature.

We have an exciting vision for increasing the participation of people of colour in nature- based activity and highlighting black perspectives about the natural world through our core programmes;

• Nature Guides
• Nature Connectors
• Wild in the City Festival
• Black Nature Narratives
• Research and Consultancy
_Community Values_*
As a therapeutically grounded organisation Wild in the City aims to build a community which is emotionally healthy. Wild in the City places a strong emphasis on relationships and how we treat each other. We aim to provide a secure base for developing positive relationships in and with nature.

In building an emotionally healthy community Wild in the City acknowledges the challenge posed by the normalisation of narcissistic traits within social values and in individual behaviour, in part driven by the disconnect of social media.
Job Summary*
We are a small but growing organisation. We have recently secured 18 months of funding from the Ashden Trust to help build our core team and strengthen infrastructure and fundraising capacity.

_Role_: Operations Manager

_Working _35 hours a week
_hours: _

_Contract _Full time, fixed term 18 months (intention to extend post subject to
_type: _funding)

_Salary: _£34,000 - £36,500 depending on experience

_Holiday _28 days, plus bank holidays
_Entitlement: _

_Pension _5% employer contribution. Wild in the City offers enrolment through
NEST Workplace Pension Scheme, however we may be able to negotiate other arrangements

_Location: _Home based and occasional outdoor sites and office meetings throughout London and UK
The Role *
The Operations Manager will be responsible for day to day management of the organisation. You will be responsible for operations, office systems and functions, people, fundraising, budgets, project management and implementing strategy.

You will have business and financial acumen to ensure that current and future operations continue on a sustainable basis. You will ensure the efficient administration of programmes and problem solve operational challenges. You will ensure adherence to health and safety, and safeguarding procedures within the organisation.

You’ll be a great organiser who does not shy away from a challenge. Flexible, enthusiastic and highly motivated. You’ll have great communication skills with the ability to build relationships with a range of diverse stakeholders..

The Operations Manager will report to the Director.

This is a home based role, London travel will be required, to attend WitC meetings, to meet with partners, to support the management of onsite activities and to meet with WitC staff at outdoor locations. Occasional overnight stays and weekend/evening work may be required.
Main Duties and Responsibilities*
_Operations and Administration_

• Responsible for the day to day management of the organisation

• Develop organisational policies, procedures and operational plans

• Oversee the management of projects, including administration and evaluation

• Work with the Director to build constructive relationships with peer organisations and stakeholders

• Carry out any other duties commensurate with the role as required by the Director

_Finance_

• Responsible for setting and monitoring organisational and project budgets. You will be responsible for advising the Director and Non Executive Directors on emerging opportunities and mitigating risks.

• Manage financial operations including book keeping, bank reconciliation, accounts payable, accounts receivable, cash flow forecasts and monthly management accounts, oversee payroll and salary payments

• Prepare annual accounts and liaise with accountant and auditor

_Development and Fundraising_

• Develop and implement fundraising strategy, building relationships with our funders and prospective funders

• Prepare information for funding bids and commercial tenders

• Seek business and collaboration opportunities to meet growth targets and ensure sustainability

_Standards_

• Ensure compliance with health and safety and safeguarding policies throughout the organisation

• Ensure contractual and funder's expectations are met in a timely fashion

• Create a team culture which manifests our values

_Leadership_

• Provide high quality management to the team, motivating and inspiring them to achieve our objectives through clear communication

• Line manage a Project Administrator and further roles as we secure funding

• Lead on human resources function, including recruitment

_Marketing and Communication_

• Promote the work of Wild in the City positively and proactively, with the support of the Director, including communication with media

• Contribute to the design and delivery of a marketing and communications plan

• Represent Wild in the City at sector meetings

• Keep up to date with relevant developments in the sector and related fields
Person Specification*
_Knowledge, Experience and Skills_*
• At least 5 years experience in operations management, and experience in a similar role

• Strong experience in project management and delivering high quality services

• Strong experience of financial management, creating and monitoring financial systems and setting budgets; including control over income and expenditure and performance measures

• Ability to analyse financial information and to present this in an accessible way for internal use and external parties

• Experience of developing strategic partnerships, and/or developing commercial opportunities

• Experience leading a team including line managing staff, with the ability to motivate and develop people to deliver high levels of performance, and creating supportive work environments

• Experience communicating goals and impact

• Experience in presenting at high level meetings, and/or to funders

• Strong skills in office IT and team facilitation software

• Have an understanding of issues of race within the environmental sector

• Experience in monitoring health and safety or safeguarding procedures
_Aptitude and Approach_*
• You will have a great eye for detail

• Able to manage a varied workload

• Strong problem solving skills

• Ability to work under pressure, prioritise and to meet deadlines

• Flexible, able to respond positively to change

• Self motivated, proactive and imaginative, able to work with minimum supervision

• Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to create good working relationships and engage at all levels with diverse stakeholders

• Diplomatic, yet assertive and decisive

• Patient and friendly manner

• Able to co-create a culture of respect, self awareness and honesty

• Able to work within a mutually supportive team approach

• Able to work well in a remote team

• Be a reflective practitioner

• Willingness to partake in professional development

• Willingness to travel occasionally to locations within the UK and possibly internationally

_Safeguarding_

We take safeguarding seriously, staff are required to work within our safeguarding policies and to actively support a culture which prioritises safe environments.

The role may involve the candidate working with people from vulnerable groups, therefore an enhanced Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check will be required. Any job offer is subject to satisfactory clearance.
Application process*
To apply for this role please complete the application form in the link below where you will also be asked to upload an up to date CV.
https://form.jotform.com/202924083061347

The closing date for applications is 20 November 2020, interviews will be held on 4 December 2020. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted, unfortunately we are unable to offer feedback to unsuccessful candidates.
Data Protection*
Personal data provided will only be used for the purposes of recruitment. Data will be stored securely in password protected IT systems. Data related to unsuccessful applicants will be deleted within 6 months of the recruitment date.

Position Summary:

LGC, Biosearch Technologies seeks a driven critical thinker to join our team as a R&D Project Manager. LGC, Biosearch Technologies uses expertise in oligonucleotide chemistries, sequencing and PCR to enable scientists and companies to feed, cure and protect the world’s population.

The project management team has an evolving remit which currently aims to manage and deliver R&D projects which provide complex systems (Systems, Hardware, Biochemistry and Software) to customers.

The R&D Project Manager is responsible for driving execution of projects where the project team resources may span across both functional and geographic areas.

Areas of Responsibility:

The Project Manager will lead the project management of allocated projects on-time, within budget, to agreed quality standards and other stipulated criteria according to LGC Genomics’ project delivery approach.

Working with global cross-functional project teams including members from R&D, operations, marketing and sales and potentially business stakeholders and external partners you will deliver the project in alignment with overarching strategy.

You will use appropriate project management tools, communication plans and risk management techniques to create rigor in project planning and execution for specified projects at all development stages enabling project delivery in line with time, financial and quality requirements. You will enable project and portfolio-level reporting for the R&D Project Management Office.

You will be expected to influence the project delivery approach across the site and devise, produce and implement systems and processes to optimise more effective project management within the framework set by the R&D Project Management Office.

INDGB

Qualifications

Other Skills and Abilities:

Proficient stakeholder management building and maintaining strong collaborative relationships internally, externally and across organisational boundaries
The ability to influence individuals without having direct authority over them
Excellent communication skills in order to engage with stakeholders at all levels of the business
Cultural sensitivity and awareness in dealing with global customers, colleagues and suppliers
Have an entrepreneurial approach to problem solving and project opportunities
Ability to multitask and work to demanding and changing schedules and priorities
Highly organized and able to work independently on multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment

Qualifications:

Job Summary
Avantor is looking for a Quality Manager to join our team in the HPLC column manufacturing department at Hichrom. Hichrom has been firmly established in the field of chromatography for over 30 years, specialising in the development, manufacture and supply of high quality chromatography products, servicing both the UK and overseas markets. During this time we have built up a strong reputation amongst chromatographers for technical expertise, speed of delivery and competitive pricing.

The Quality Manager leads the efforts for implementation, maintenance and improvement of the Quality Management System and drives strategic activities of Quality management. You are responsible for providing supervision of inspection process and staff and ensure staffing levels and work assignments meet facility requirements. You assist in the administration of the Quality Assurance (QA) and Quality Control (QC) programs and ensure compliance with the Quality Manual as well as all applicable regulations and standards for which Avantor is certified to. Next to that you perform acceptance activities as required to ensure Company objectives are met.

MAJOR JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (List in order of importance)
Develop, implement, communicate and maintain a plan to keep the Company’s Quality systems and policies in compliance with Quality management system requirements.
Set up and maintain quality control documented procedures for the performance testing of HPLC columns.
Managing the Chromatographic Data system (HPLC) and setting up appropriate test methods for testing HPLC columns
Identify relevant Quality related training needs and deliver training.
Implement and maintain a local audit plan, coordinate audits based on the audit plan and perform internal audits.
Liaise with customers’ and external auditors and ensure the execution of corrective actions.
Coordinate response to customer questionnaires, quality agreements and specifications.
Maintain, collate and analyse performance data and charts against defined parameters.
Promote Quality achievement and performance improvement throughout the organization.
Investigates and documents CAPA inputs, including coordinating the return of non- conforming product for analysis and corrective action as applicable.
Leads a QC team ensuring product performance for manufactured HPLC columns
Complies with company policies, procedures, work instructions and training requirements.
Carries out responsibilities in compliance with the Quality Manual and applicable regulations (ISO 9001 (2015)) and ensure staff compliance to these regulations.
Supervises day-to-day activities of the column QC team and keeps Site Lead and Production Manager appraised of all situations and emerging trends; includes attendance, productivity, efficiency, payroll, disciplinary issues and staff motivation.
Attends all production planning meetings and reports relevant information to Leads.
Ensures all training requirements are met facility-wide, including identifying training needs and implementing training updates to minimize the number of errors affecting customers.
Reports activities, summaries and trends (e.g. quality metrics) to Director and other department heads as necessary.
Ensures that the development of NPIs follows the Quality procedures.
Leads quality improvement initiatives.
Performs other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS (Education/Training, Experience and Certifications)
Science degree or equivalent/applicable experience
cGMP and ISO 9001(2015)
Experience in Chromatographic Data Systems and HPLC technology
Leadership responsibility
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES & COMPETENCIES (Those necessary to achieve conformity of products and services)
Demonstrated knowledge of production process and prioritization in one or more business units
Ability to lead and motivate personnel
Ability to create and cultivate a team mentality
Attention to detail
Ability to prioritize required functions and ensure on time completion of all required tasks
Ability to manage time effectively and make sound decisions
Strong and effective verbal and written communication skills
Ability to liaise with different departments to ensure all business and process related tasks are compliant with regulatory requirements and daily Quality needs are met facility-wide
Computer literate including strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook)
OFFER

Alongside the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment this role also offers a competitive salary and benefits package.

Job Description

In Experian Digital, we create powerful tools that allow our clients to gain insights into their customers and markets enabling safer and lower risk decisioning. We enable tooling around affordability and safe lending which ultimately helps end users. This section of the business is growing and we are in the unique position to collaborate directly with large clients in banking who are eager to consume our services, as well as combine Open Banking and other data with advanced class-leading data science products and classic bureau data.

The Role

We are looking for a Product Owner with experience working in the digital sector, to lead one of our platform teams delivering new Api propositions to the financial market. Taking advantage of emerging technologies in the Fintech sector, and the wide number of data services in the Experian ecosystem to maintain our strong position in the financial technology services sector.

You should be confident collaborating in a fast-moving agile environment, quickly iterating and validating new ideas and opportunities. Each product domain has the functions to design, develop and own their products. Owning its vision and direction and continuously building upon knowledge they gain and the clients they enable.

Role responsibilities:
Grow and improve our API value propositions. Taking advantage of new markets and opportunities
Take responsibility for our client development experience
Ensuring the delivery team has a good understand of the customer needs and user journeys
Clear and visible roadmap that communicates desired outcomes and goals
Manage a prioritised backlog of features and improvement
Collaborating with business stakeholders on product strategy to align our platform future and its capabilities
Gather feedback from clients and product ecosystem stakeholders to continuously improve our platform products and features and integration experience
Usability and testing – regularly refine and improve the product using a range of best practice techniques with a focus on delivering a product that offers a differentiated and unique, quality user experience.
Compliance with Regulatory and Industry standards
This is a B2B role that utilises B2C understanding to support our knowledge of the challenges our clients face. The Digital Consumer Information business unit is a strategically important growth area, as such the role will achieve a high profile and suit an ambitious individual wanting to demonstrate their capabilities.

Core Skills & Competencies:
Previous experience working as a Product Manager or Owner on Digital Products
Experience of delivering products using agile development mythology techniques, working directly with developers
Leading discussions and workshops with product stakeholders to overcome challenges and find new opportunities
Analytical and know how to use data to influence decisions
A strong understanding of Restful Api and how they are consumed
Experience commercialising of new and existing products
Passionate about customer experience, technology and problem solving
Preferred Qualities:
A passion for technology, data and delivering high quality online products
Strong understand of data, metrics and analytics
Highly organised with an unforgiving eye for detail
Excellent collaboration and communication skills. Confident communicating with both tech and non-tech people
Why choose us?

Our colleagues’ health and wellbeing is a top priority for us, that’s why our reward, benefits and wellbeing programmes are designed so you can come to work feeling your very best self. Our benefits focus on health, money and lifestyle so you can tailor your benefits to your own personal needs. Whether it’s your physical and mental wellness, getting to work or planning for the future, we have a range of flexible options to have you covered!

We are committed to building an inclusive culture and to creating an environment where people can balance successful careers with their commitments and interests outside of work. Our flexible working practices support our belief that this balance brings long-lasting benefits for our business as well as our people. Some roles lend themselves to flexible options more than others, and if this is important to you, we are open to discussing agile working opportunities during the hiring process.

The role of the Operations Quality Manageris to ensure that all external and internal requirements are met before our product reaches our customers. You will be responsible for inspecting procedures and outputs and identifying mistakes or non-conformity issues.

Operations Quality Manager – The Role:

The goal is to assure the high quality of our operations and services aiming to the long-term success of our business.

The Role will report to the Operations Director and will involve the following:

• Devise procedures to inspect and report quality issues.
• Monitor all operations that affect quality.
• Supervise and guide inspectors, technicians and other staff.
• Assure the reliability and consistency of production by checking processes.
• Appraise customers’ requirements and make sure they are satisfied.
• Report all malfunctions to production executives to ensure immediate action.
• Facilitate proactive solutions by collecting and analysing quality data.
• Review current standards and policies.
• Keep records of quality reports, statistical reviews and relevant documentation.
• Ensure all legal standards are met.
• Communicate with external quality assurance officers during on-site inspections.
• Design and build a material inspection system that removes all on-floor supplier problems.
• Ensure that all production operators are trained and inspect for quality.
• Conduct routine inspections of critical components and production line.

Operations Quality Manager – The Person:

Our Quality Assurance Manager will require solid job experience as well as relevant qualifications and training. The ideal candidate isa reliable and competent professional whoseapproval will be necessary for the continuation of a business life cycle.

This is a hands-on role and the person appointed will: –

• Proven experience as a quality assurance manager or relevant role
• Excellent numerical skills and understanding of data analysis/statistical methods
• Good knowledge of MS Office and databases
• Outstanding communication skills
• Great attention to detail and a result driven approach
• Excellent organizational and leadership abilities
• Reliable and Trustworthy
• Excellent problem-solving skills to deal with issues in production

Benefits:

This position offers good terms and benefits including: – good basic salary, 21 days + Bank holidays annual holiday increasing with service, pension, healthcare, bike scheme and life assurance.

A Health charity based in West London is looking for an Operations Manager to deliver entertainment services to children with serious health issues. They currently bring play and distraction into more than 800 hospitals and hospices across the UK , by methods of toys and activities, gaming bundles, Hospital Pantomime and Storytelling tours. With family visits curtailed and play areas closed there has never been more demand for what they deliver.

You will ideally have operations/ service delivery experience within a health setting and have managed processes and procedures to ensure quality delivery of the work and performances in hospitals. Prepare and monitor budget and have oversight of staff to ensure that spend is controlled throughout the delivery of services. Ensure that service delivery and performance data including trend information is collected and regularly reported to senior managers. Strong project management / organisational skills are a must as well as experience of working with or alongside the NHS ideally in the children’s sector. Home based working due to COVID.

A brief overview

As a Product Manager at Collective Benefits, you’ll join our rapidly growing product and engineering team. While responsibilities and ownership will follow standard product processes, this role will focus primarily on partner delivery.

Our B2B business is growing rapidly and it’s essential that this growth is managed and delivered intelligently through stellar product work. What this means in practice is building the features necessary to provide customised solutions, and ensure the most meaningful and impactful solutions for our partners are scoped, prioritised, and delivered.

You’ll work closely with our Head of Product; as well as our accounts, engineering and design teams, to build functionality our users, customers, and internal team love.

Three reasons this role is great
You will join a smart and motivated team, and have the resources you need to deliver an industry leading digital product
If you are looking to make a mark in your career and learn and grow quickly - this is the opportunity for you. We have big ambitions for growth, move at a fast pace, and work autonomously with the support of startup founders and senior tech leaders who have done this before
You’ll make a difference - we’re building a business that will provide the protections that gig workers badly need
What will you do?

Partner with design, engineering, and user research to oversee the development of a product from problem definition to conception and launch (and then some).

At a fundamental level, we’re still a small team and are looking for an entrepreneurial Product Manager to help innovate and execute product initiatives, taking ownership of specific areas of our digital product from research through to development, testing, and iteration.

As stated previously, this role will focus primarily on partner delivery. This means systematically tackling our backlog and delivering the specific requirements, tooling & features to help us get there.
You’ll conduct research, interviews, and user feedback sessions
You'll review qualitative and quantitative data and build businesses cases
You’ll develop personas, write stories, and create wireframes
You’ll lead planning sessions, manage sprints, and perform retrospectives
You’ll take on specific delivery requirements and solve problems
You’ll design, you’ll build, and you’ll ship product
You should join us if
You have empathy for customer needs, but can also consider technical constraints and business goals
You have at least 3-5 years of product experience, ideally working with a top-tier tech company or digital agency
Your vision and your strong sense for details help to continually raise the bar of quality product
You have a research centric, design driven and detail oriented mindset
You have an incredible amount of drive, integrity, and passion for our mission
The nuts and bolts:
You must be comfortable with moving quickly from scoping and research to prototyping and shipping
Great communication skills whether it be face to face, through video, phone, or email
Smart, inquisitive, and have a willingness to sink your teeth into the role
Knowledge of (or a keen interest in) the gig economy is a significant plus
What will you get in return?
�� Competitive Salary based on experience
�� Employee Equity Options and Pension Contributions
�� Birthday day off, because no-one should have to work on their birthday
�� Personal development budget, to help you grow
�� A shiny new laptop
�� Keep healthy with 24/7 GP and Mental Health Support
�� Cycle to Work and �� Tech Scheme saving you money and spreading the cost
�� Deals & Discounts at major retailers, gyms, and more

Job Details


Kantar’s Worldpanel Division operates continuous consumer panels collecting purchase and usage information in the UK and Ireland. Panel members report their behaviour across a wide range of markets including grocery, personal care, snacking, fashion, entertainment and telecoms.

Our goal is understanding consumer behaviour in terms of understanding what people buy, where they buy it and why. Our client base is varied and includes product manufacturers, retailers, media companies and City institutions.

Kantar’s Worldpanel Operations division is responsible for the end-to-end process of producing our data, from collection and processing of raw data through to the production of end user databases and reports.

The quality of information provided by our panel members is critical and the department will ensure that quality standards are maintained, with improvements being identified and implemented as required.

KEY OUTCOMES

This is an entry-level role where you will gain a solid grounding in all aspects of at least one Worldpanel service. You will be part of a small, supportive team which is part of the larger Panel Quality team, with whom you will work with regularly. There are also plenty of opportunities for collaborating with other parts of the business.

You will work directly with our panels, and the data that they provide at various points on its journey to provide powerful insight to our clients, growing your knowledge of market research.

0 POSITION SUMMARY
Job Title: Quality Engineer
Employment Status: Permanent
Line Manager: Head of Quality
Location: Shoreham-by-Sea
Standard Working Hours: 37.5 hours, Monday – Friday
Holiday: 20 days per annum, rising to 25 days after 2 years’ service
Salary and Benefits: Competitive Salary, dependent upon experience – company pension scheme, health scheme (BUPA), life cover
0 JOB FUNCTION AND RESPONSIBILITIES
We are looking for a well-rounded Quality Engineer with a broad range of experience in all areas of quality assurance and continual improvement, who is able to demonstrate a good working knowledge of automotive quality standards and working practices.

The role will be interesting and challenging due to its varied nature. Reporting directly to Cox Powertrain’s Head of Quality, the successful candidate will provide support primarily to the Manufacturing Quality Team, but also to the Quality Systems and Supplier Quality Teams (including Inspection), as dictated by the changing needs of the business.

The Manufacturing Quality Team is responsible for ensuring that outgoing product is fully inspected against relevant product specifications, and that defects and nonconformances are escalated and dealt with appropriately.

The Supplier Quality Team is responsible for assuring the quality of components and sub-assemblies delivered to Cox Powertrain from its global supply chain, as well as working with the suppliers and Cox Powertrain Buyers to improve component quality and delivery.

The Quality Systems Team is responsible for ensuring fitness-for-purpose of Cox Powertrain’s Business Management System, as well as the implementation of the internal audit programme.

Daily duties of the successful candidate will include:

Supporting Production and the Manufacturing Quality Team (primary role):
Leading, coordinating and reporting on in-plant containment activities.
Participating in investigations into in-plant issues.
Collaborating on action plans to reduce causes of defects.
Leading and/or participating in Ishikawa and 5-Why workshops.
Conducting layered process audits in the manufacturing areas.
Supporting the BMS and the Quality Systems Lead (as requested):
Auditing and reporting out on Cox Business Management System processes.
Follow up on root cause analysis / corrective actions with the Process Owners.
Supporting the supply chain and the Supplier Quality Team (as requested):
Conducting vendor assessment and supplier surveillance audits.
Supporting suppliers’ PPAP activities.
Creating / updating component inspection plans.
Raising reject notes and requesting CAR / 8D responses from the supplier.
Supporting problem solving activities within the supply chain.
Supporting supplier development activities.
Reporting internally on supplier quality performance.
Providing sickness and holiday cover to the Goods Inwards Inspector (as necessary):
Inspecting incoming parts, materials and plating using specifications.
Conducting visual inspection and measurement where required.
Documenting inspection results by completing reports.
0 STANDARDS
A highly organised, self-starter and logical thinker.
Clear positive work ethic with a desire to get the job done.
Excellent communication skills: ability to deal effectively and considerately with a wide variety of individuals.
An enthusiastic, positive, calm and accommodating approach to work and changing priorities in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
A high level of attention to detail, with an aspiration to deliver technical excellence.
Commitment to achieving the company’s long-term business objectives and succeeding as a team.
Willingness to travel in UK and internationally.
0 SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
1 NECESSARY
ISO 9001:2015 internal auditor qualification.
Previous SQA/SQD experience within the automotive sector.
In-depth working knowledge of APQP and PPAP.
Well versed in quality tools and methods, including but not limited to:
8D, Ishikawa, 5-Why, SPC, Pareto, etc.
Metrology, inspection methods and equipment.
Understanding and interpretation of engineering drawings.
Understanding manufacturing processes.
Planning and prioritising activities and an ability to operate with a level of autonomy.
Ability to present data accurately and effectively.
Degree in an engineering discipline or equivalent and/or recognised Quality Management qualification.
Full clean driving licence.
1 ADVANTAGEOUS
IATF 16949:2016 qualification.
VDA 6.3 process auditing experience / qualification.
NPI project experience.
Knowledge of OHSAS18001 / ISO45001.
Knowledge of ISO14001.
Lean / Six Sigma Green Belt.
Lead assessor qualification.
CMM experience (Zeiss preferred).
FARO Arm experience.

ABOUT COX POWERTRAIN

Cox Powertrain is a privately owned engineering company based in Shoreham by Sea. Cox have spent the past decade developing a ground-breaking new engine, supported by £90m of private investment, for marine industry which is disrupting the global marine market. Cox Powertrain have over 120 permanent employees, with strong connections with the automotive industry.

The core engine module is a V8, 8 piston, 4-stroke turbo charged diesel with a capacity of 4.4ltr litres that delivers up to 300 hp (261 kW) per module. Principal beneﬁts are increased responsiveness combined with reduced size, mass and parts count when compared with conventional diesels of similar power output and improved fuel efficiency and storage safety compared to gasoline engines of similar power output.

Role Description

A bit about the role.

We are growing quickly. It's exciting. We are eager to feed more dogs and help them live healthier and happier lives. We believe that solving meaningful problems which will improve our customer experience, improve our operational efficiencies, and enable our teams to scale effectively is the way to do that. That's where you come in.

We’re looking for a Product Manager to own and drive the vision, roadmap and execution of our operational and internal tooling platform to deliver on team scaling, customer experience, and commercial goals.

As part of a cross-functional Product Engineering Team, you'll be reporting to the Head of Digital Product, and working closely with our Platform Software Engineers. You'll also be working closely with our Operations, Data, Customer Love teams and key 3rd party partners.

In this role you can expect to:

Work with key internal partners and leadership across the company to define the vision, strategy and execution of a best-in-class digital platform that enables and supports company growth and scaling.
Manage and prioritise a backlog of initiatives to deliver value to our customers and internal teams, with the right balance of short-term and longer-term goals in mind.
Champion internal teams' needs by generating qualitative and quantitative insights to inform the right priorities for the team to deliver on.
Clearly define, spec and manage the end to end delivery of key initiatives closely with your delivery team of highly-motivated and passionate Software Engineers.
Work closely with your engineering team to ensure the quality and reliability of our platform remains extremely high.
Define and analyse useful metrics to inform the success of products, features or improvements to the platform.
Communicate openly and clearly with the rest of the company, keeping them aligned on the direction of the platform.

A bit about you.

Obsessed with dogs. Naturally.
Passion for start-ups & Product Management.
You have a clear understanding of technical Product Management, working with APIs and 3rd party integrations.
You have strong project management skills, and know how to ensure a project is delivered on time.
You can show off a track record of delivering impactful products that have achieved commercial and customer goals.
Your communication skills are on-point and you can quickly and easily gather support for your ideas, and champion them with exec-level communication.
You have the ability to grasp long-term strategic plays & initiatives that drive customer engagement and company growth.
You can make tough decisions quickly, and you're right most of the time about them.

24 days holiday (plus 8 bank holidays)

Butternut Box employee discount.

Launched in March 2016 the Learning Academy is the central Learning and Development unit for the Office for National Statistics. GSS Analytical Learning is part of the Learning Academy and delivers a thriving programme of activities to support the objectives of both ONS and the wider GSS.

As a Training Manager, you will be responsible for a team of Trainers, who deliver high quality training programmes in essential statistical, data analysis and data science skills to colleagues from a variety of backgrounds across the ONS and other government departments.

This role can be based in our Newport, Titchfield or London office. Due to Covid-19 we are currently delivering via virtual classrooms and there is a possibility to continue delivering virtually, even when the whole UK will be back to normal.

This role is responsible for the design, commissioning, delivery and evaluation of high quality statistical, data analysis & data science training at an Awareness, Introductory and Intermediate level which meets the needs of the Government Statistical Service (GSS).

This role reports to the Head of GSS Analytical Learning and is part of the People Capability division within ONS.

Responsibilities
• Manage trainers to deliver quality training at an awareness, introductory and intermediate level
• Work with individuals and teams to conduct learning needs analysis for statistical and data science training and propose appropriate solutions
• Design and sign off high quality statistics and data science training solutions for internal and external clients ensuring they are adequately specified and documented
• Deliver statistical and data science learning to a range of workers at different stages in their development
• Evaluate the effectiveness of learning and maintain/update standards as necessary
• Continuously develop and keep knowledge up to date, collaborating with other business areas working on projects to gain/update practical knowledge
• Ensure the Statistical and Data Science training solutions continue to meet delegate needs by continuous review and stakeholder engagement
• Ensure that all members of staff, new and existing, within the ONS and external, are trained to an appropriate level
• Maintain currency with new and emerging statistical/data science and data analysis methodologies, and acquisition of specialist knowledge on data science subjects.
• The ability to adjust to changing priorities and to respond rapidly to operational tasking demands is required. They will be able to manage and inspire a team of trainers to deliver to the highest standard.

Person Specification:

Essential:
• Experience of statistics and/or data analysis in R and/or Python.
• Excellent communication skills, including the ability to communicate complex topics to a technical and non-technical audience
• Experience of working to tight deadlines without compromising quality.
• Excellent planning and organising skills
• Experience of working as part of a team and developing others
• Problem-Solving skills

Desirable:
• MSc in a related subject
• Experience in other programming languages suitable for large scale data analysis such as Pyspark
• Experience using Rshiny or DASH
Behaviours

We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:

Managing a Quality Service
Delivering at Pace
Developing Self and Others
Communicating and Influencing
Benefits
The Office for National Statistics is part of the Civil Service, and as such we share a number of key benefits with other departments, whilst also having our own unique offerings to support our 5000+ valued employees across the business.

Whether you are hearing about us for the first time or already know a bit about our organisation, we hope that the benefits pack attached (bottom of page) will give you a great insight into the benefits and facilities available to our employees, and our fantastic working culture.

We are an organisation that takes the well-being of its employees seriously and lives and breathes the desire to modernise the workplace of the future. Everyone, from our office-based staff in Newport, London and Titchfield, to our field interviewers and airports and ports passenger survey staff, are part of a diverse and inclusive family.

Inclusion & Accessibility

At ONS we're always looking to attract the very best people from the widest possible talent pool, and we are proud to be an inclusive, equal opportunities employer. As a member of the Business Disability Forum and a Disability Confident Leader we’re committed to ensuring that all candidates are treated fairly throughout the recruitment process.

Job Description:
The Quality Manager is a position in the Quality Systems, Quality & Compliance Department.

The Quality Manager facilitates the generation and revision of all Quality Management System (QMS) Documents; supports the risk assessment, Root Cause Analysis and Corrective Action Preventive Action (CAPA) Plan generation for all Quality Events; drives the completion of relevant quality sections of Request for Proposal (RFP)/ Request for Information(RFIs)/quality assessments; drives completion of Sustainability questionnaires; assists with the Computer System Validation (CSV) of all systems across the company; assists with external CSV audits and assessments and internal CSV/IT audits; assist with hosting external audits

This person has experience in clinical research and quality assurance and is able to provide support and advice throughout this area.

Key responsibilities:
Facilitates teams from across the company in generating / updating any QMS Documentation; driving the process to ensure no QMS document expires
Supports staff from across the company to complete accurate and detailed risk assessments and root cause analysis for all quality events, ensure all are completed on time and documentation is always suitable to share with clients as appropriate
Assists staff to prepare appropriate and robust CAPA Plans (for Quality Events) and track and managing these through to completion ensuring most CAPA are completed on the due date
Provides input into the quality section of RFI / RFP and quality assessments; maintains a library of questions and robust agreed answers
Drives completion of Sustainability Reports and associated quality system
Assists with hosting external audits, as appropriate (for systems and CSV)
Assists with all aspects of CSV for all systems across the company under the guidance of the Senior Quality Manager – CSV
Prepares and presents training as appropriate for CSV, systems and data integrity
Assist with the assessment of vendors where CSV is a key component
Assists with audits where CSV is a key component
Provide quality assurance advice and support to internal clients
Participate in internal meetings as required and liaise with other departments as necessary
Actively contribute to continuous improvement of the organisation and development of routines to enhance the work at TFS
Maintain required knowledge of applicable regulations and company GxP standards and procedures
Requirements
University/college degree or equivalent industry experience
Good planning, organisation and problem solving abilities
Fluent in English, both written and verbal
Awareness of the clinical trials area / pharma industry, including knowledge of GxP regulations
Two years’ experience in clinical research especially in the CSV field
Excellent interpersonal skills
CSV knowledge and experience preferable
Highly-analytical professional with strong attention to detail
Pro-active, recognizing and anticipating issues, addressing problems and developing solutions
Demonstrated ability to multitask, prioritize, and complete objectives
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Advance user of MS Office applications
Benefits
Private Health Coverage
Corporate Pension Plan
Life Insurance
Global General Liability Insurance
Global Travel Insurance
Home-based Allowance
Internet reimbursement
Flexible working schedule

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Ability to bring clarity and structure when managing fluid expectations and evolving demands

Duties/Responsibilities
EMCOR UK are currently recruiting for a Senior Quality Compliance Specialist to be based at our client site in Ware. This is a fixed term contract.

Working hours: 8:00 - 17:00

Job Purpose:

Working within a small Compliance team on an EMCOR client’s pharmaceutical site, you will ensure the delivery of compliant engineering services which support the manufacturing utilities.

Reviews EMCOR and subcontractor/ vendor operations which support the engineering facilities to the life science areas, and documentation for compliance with local and global regulatory standards. Must have a good understanding of Quality Systems and Compliance within a regulated engineering or manufacturing environment. Serves as a Quality Assurance (QA) resource to support engineering quality documentation and other compliance related activities. Helps to coordinate implementation of best practices tasks across departments, sites and regions as directed.

Serves as backup for Compliance team as required and provide compliance guidance and/or assistance to other team members in support of deviations, CAPA, Risks and change controls supporting the engineering areas. Support the Compliance team in implementation of business requirements around GxP needs, make decisions when needed and provide guidance. Provide compliance support for issues related to engineering equipment, utilities, instruments, processes and systems having significant risk to the client account. Assist in training sessions to ensure Engineering and Operational teams have the required understanding of quality and procedural requirements.

Digital Quality Manager

Business Area: Innovare

Osborne is one of the leading construction businesses in the UK. As a family-owned business, we have the freedom and flexibility to take a different approach. We focus on creating structures and spaces that provide an environment for people to thrive in and solutions for our customers that provide a better experience during the creation. From rail to road, housing to healthcare, however large the project or contract, we know that it is always personal to the people who use it and those that are responsible for it.

We provide an inclusive environment which is aligned to our core values of Quality, Integrity, Openness, Caring and Progressive. We value everyone as an individual and provide the opportunity to influence and change the way that we do things to ensure that we progress and evolve as a business. As a responsible employer we are also committed to promoting and protecting the physical and mental health of all our staff at all times.
The Opportunity

Due to growth within our Innovare business we are currently looking for a Digital Quality Manager. The purpose of the Digital Quality Manager is to ensure that the products or services Innovare provide are of high quality, fit for purpose, consistent and meets both external and internal requirements. This includes legal compliance and customer expectations. The Digital Quality Manager will coordinate the activities required to meet these quality standards, measuring and monitoring the performance of the quality management system, producing data and reporting on performance, and measuring against set standards. The Digital Quality Manager will liaise with other managers and staff throughout the organisation to ensure that the quality management system is functioning properly, advising on changes and how to implement them and provide training in tools, equipment and techniques to enable others to achieve Innovare quality standards.
What are we looking for?

We are looking for someone who understands quality within the Construction build process. You will have an excellent understanding of current building standards, and be able to use this knowedge to work collaboratively with the internal teams in ensuring that quality reamins at the heart of all we do. Ideally you will have used new technologies in assisting operational teams in ensuring that build stanadards are being met on site, intervening when they are not, and working collectively to solve problems that do arise. You will also ideally have a recognised qualification in Quality Management.
Our Benefits
Competitive Salary and Company Car (dependent on position)
Company Pension
25 Days Holiday
Gift Day off for your Birthday
Private Health Insurance (after qualifying period dependent on level)
Employee Assistance Programme
Life Assurance
Trade Discount Cards
If this sounds a lot like you, and your approach to your work is the same as ours, we would love to hear from you. If we end up working together, we will give you a great environment to work in with real opportunities for you to shine, deliver great work and develop your career.
Please note that we would also make reasonable adjustments where possible to ensure that our places of work are inclusive and allow us to support the creation of a diverse and engaged business.
