Job Description
Novartis UK oversees an extensive portfolio in excess of 160 drug molecules supplying the UK with more than 125Million packs in a variety of dosage forms from well-established medicines to innovative Biologicals, Cell and Gene as well as Radiopharmaceuticals.

As the Quality Manager-QP you will be part of a team providing leadership of compliant and efficient quality processes to support this extensive as well as diverse product portfolio. You will need to draw on all of your technical and soft skills to find successful solutions that always fulfil the needs of the patient along with external stakeholders through collaboration with global internal partners.

Your Responsibilities:

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
•Performing the role of the UK Qualified Person through certification and oversight of both IMP and commercial products. Working collaboratively with many stakeholders involved in the production and supply of the products from the extensive global Novartis supply network
•Carrying out routine risk/impact evaluations associated with product based decisions or the quality system and participating in escalation situations
•Ensuring that the GMP expectations of an MAH are fulfilled, including oversight of Periodic product reviews
•Coaching and leading local teams to assure understanding and successful execution of quality systems
•Communicating requirements as well as changes, acting as a content expert for audits and inspections using knowledge of associated systems
•Investigating, managing and actively resolving quality investigations as needed including the monitoring of compliance of the quality activities/systems owned locally
•Representing the UK in Novartis expert networks and/or liaising with global Centres of Excellence
•Actively contributing to the development and implementation of productivity as well as quality improvements. Leading implementation of quality initiatives & continuous improvements including project planning, milestone delivery and communication cross functionally, also within team

Minimum requirements

•Eligibility to act as a Qualified Person (QP) in the UK
•Robust technical knowledge of EU GMP and GDP, regulations and guidelines
•Experience of QMS operation
•BSc degree in Life Sciences
•Demonstrative Qualified Person experience
•Fluent English (oral and written)

Desirable requirements:

•Certification experience for multiple dosage forms
•Quality management system design and implementation

You’ll receive:

Competitive salary, Annual bonus, Pension scheme, Share scheme, Health insurance, 24 days annual leave, Flexible working arrangements, subsidized dining facilities, Employee recognition scheme, learning and development opportunities.

ROLE SUMMARY

Science is the foundation of all that we do at Pfizer. We are seeking a Manager, Data Science who will join a diverse team of dedicated professionals driven to significantly improve the lives of patients through his/her/their work at a company whose culture is committed to developing and nurturing diverse talent so that each colleague has the opportunity to build a fulfilling career.

Regulatory Quality Assurance (RQA) is an independent Quality audit function within the Compliance division, accountable to identify risks and non-compliance associated with Pfizer’s GxP regulated operations.

In this role, the Manager, Data Science will be responsible for the delivery and execution of the Good Practice (GXP) digital and data science projects in support of risk management, quality strategy, GXP audit strategy and governance goals and objectives.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES

Digital Strategy / Data Science
Supports development of data science infrastructure and capabilities including data lake build; data lake co-ownership to ensure robust/validated technical process
Supports the execution of a hypothesis driven analytics strategy across quality business lines that ensures a strategic, optimized and consistent approach (data standards) to metrics, thresholds, etc. that meet stakeholder needs
Works with QMS Oversight and analytics team to develop and construct complex analytics (KRIs / KPIs / other); communicates findings/insights/trends to applicable functions
Assesses and ensures data quality / validation procedures including documentation, storage (per policies)
Implements technology advancements including NLP, AI, etc. (including external benchmarking to pharma and other tech advanced companies)
Uses design processes to ensure integration data are connected to Risk Strategy processes
Provides objective assessments to assist leadership in prioritizing investments in data-science capabilities/projects
Assists GXP audit teams in exploring methodologies to enhance audit strategy based on emerging innovation and technology advancements
Manages and maintains dashboards and reports to support the business
Operational Excellence
Accountable for timely delivery of the digital / data science strategies
Collaborates with RQA peers and internal stakeholders to execute purposeful digital strategy
Works to ensure quality standards are consistently applied across the program or region
Proactively identifies opportunities for improvement within RQA
Maintains current knowledge of industry trends that impact data science capabilities and strategies
Monitors and maintains expertise in area(s) of focus
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Advanced academic qualification/degree in data science / statistics / computer science is required (e.g. PhD); equivalent relevant professional experience will be considered.
3-5 (manager) years of relevant experience in data science and analytical tools/techniques/technologies
Project management experience with proven accountability, and demonstrated excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation, influencing, and problem-solving capabilities a plus
Ability to function autonomously in a matrix model and in a team environment
Proven ability to think innovatively and to execute strategic plans pursuant to the responsibilities of the role
Knowledge of GXPs / quality

Sunshine Act

Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.
EEO & Employment Eligibility

Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer.

Hey �� I’m Plum. The AI assistant for your money!

Since we launched in 2017, we’ve been on a mission to make everyone, starting with our awesome Plumsters, financially better off �� We do this by helping them automate their savings, avoid overpaying on bills, and providing a simple platform for them to invest, if they’d like to try and grow their money for the future ��

The social aspect of what we do is also really important to us. We’re trying to change things for the better, by helping our users fight against a confusing financial system that is stacked against the most vulnerable in society (such as those on low income or the elderly) ��

Specifically, here’s what we’re trying to tackle:
11.5m people in the UK have less than £100 in savings
90% of UK savings accounts pay less than inflation
£4bn lost to the loyalty penalty every year
2/3 of UK adults say money stress has affected the health or wellbeing of someone they know.
In three years, we've grown from 2 co-founders sharing a rusty desk in Soho, to a brilliant, hard-working team of 65+, with offices in London (HQ) and Athens.

Now, with more than 1M people already using Plum, we could use a little help with our mission and that might be where you come in!

Requirements

Ideally You Will:
Be responsible for helping shape the creation of future trading and wealth products.
Finding the best solution for our trading and wealth products, including negotiating and securing deals with partners.
Conduct market and competitor research to ensure Plum has a market leading product.
Lead a team of talented product-minded engineers to achieve a common growth goal.
You Are:
Fintech & personal finance enthusiast, with background in the industry and having launched wealth products ideally on mobile apps in the past.
Able to manage a team of engineers, speaking their language and able to communicate business needs in a constructive & timely way.
Able to transmit your enthusiasm to your team and make sure you are all working effectively towards your goal.
Excited to work in a startup already disrupting the financial industry and see it grow.
Plum's Perks
Join one of the hottest fintech start-up in London ����
We're all in this together! Own part of the company through stock options ��
Flexibility to work from our Athens office (almost) whenever you want ����
25 days holiday a year, excluding bank holidays (33 in total)

About Threads Styling:


Want to help build the future of luxury fashion commerce? If so, you’ve come to the right place.

Threads is a creative, luxury fashion personal shopping and commerce business. Through social and chat-based media, we inspire our international client base to discover the rarest luxury items. We then search the globe to procure them for our clients; this is the future of retail.

Threads is in Tech City’s Future Fifty programme which recognises some of the UK’s fastest growing businesses, pioneering the best luxury shopping experience in the world!

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

About Us

The Financial Times is one of the world’s leading business news organisations, recognised internationally for its authority, integrity and accuracy. The FT has a record paying readership of one million, three-quarters of which are digital subscriptions. It is part of Nikkei Inc., which provides a broad range of information, news and services for the global business community.

We have offices in more than 35 cities, including London, New York, Hong Kong, Beijing, Manila, Sofia, San Francisco and Tokyo. Join us and find an inclusive and fast-paced environment with unique opportunities to support every step of your career.

Role Overview

An opportunity to join a rapidly growing digital subscription business, the Marketing Operations Manager will be responsible for improving the marketing effectiveness and productivity of the B2B marketing team. You will be responsible for the use of marketing automation technology, optimising processes, improving data quality and using reporting and analysis. The role supports and collaborates with our marketing acquisition and customer engagement teams.

What you will be responsible for

Define the business requirements for marketing technology and work with product and IT to deliver the marketing technology roadmap

Adapt systems and processes to meet business goals whilst adhering to GDPR, ePrivacy and other data regulations

Define and implement business processes to ensure systems are used correctly and consistently, and manage the quality of data

Build reports and dashboards to provide visibility of marketing campaign effectiveness, covering new business and engagement funnels

Better understand effectiveness of marketing activity (website performance, paid media, email campaigns, etc) and make recommendations to optimise funnels

Maintain data quality through rigorous data analysis/reporting, standards definition and improving data hygiene (contact management, health of customer database, etc.)

Create and run reports to identify quality issues and fixes, managing the work of four CRM data specialists based in Manila. Also manages B2B revenue analyst in London

Oversee data segmentation (list management) and drive the data quality of leads, existing readers and licence administrators

Analyse marketing, sales and existing reader data to identify key prospects and industries for targeting

Work with the CRM administrator and sales operations as required

Collaborate with key stakeholders to identify gaps in current processes and systems, and optimise workflows for marketing and sales productivity.

Experience/skills you need to be successful in this role

Essential

Around 5 years experience in marketing operations and revenue marketing

Extensive experience of working with CRM systems and marketing automation technologies

Highly analytical and data literate

Skills in process mapping and process optimisation

Excellent digital skills and understanding of marketing/online technologies

Effective communication skills and works in a collaborative way across multiple teams

Has worked in a business-to-business environment, particularly working with a direct sales team

Understands data/audience segmentation, user journeys and marketing funnels

High focus on delivering results and understands the importance of measuring marketing activity

Strong project management skills with attention to dates, deliverables and budgets.

Desirable

Direct marketing or marketing qualification

Power user of Salesforce.com and Marketo.

What’s in it for you? FT Benefits

Our benefits vary depending on location, but we are committed to providing best in class perks across all our offices as well as an inclusive environment to develop your career. Examples of our benefits include; generous annual leave allowances, flexible working, medical cover, enhanced maternity & paternity packages and subsidised gym memberships.

Further Information

The FT is committed to providing an inclusive working environment for all. We are an equal opportunities employer who seeks to recruit and appoint the best talent regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We also promote flexible working and will consider specific requests around flexibility for all roles where it can be accommodated. Please let us know if you require any adjustments as part of the application process or to enable you to attend an interview. If you would like to discuss your requirements, or have any questions, please contact a member of our HR team who will be happy to help.

Farfetch exists for the love of fashion. We believe in empowering individuality. Our mission is to be the global platform for luxury fashion, connecting creators, curators and consumers.
We’re a diverse and global community made up of Farfetchers, our partners and our customers, which we believe is at the heart of our success. Everything we do is centred around our values - Be Human, Think Global, Be Revolutionary, Todos Juntos, Be Brilliant, Amaze Customers - which define our beliefs and our actions. We welcome difference and foster a consciously inclusive environment for everyone. We are Farfetch For All.

Operations
We’re passionate about operational excellence, acting with our customers always in our heart. From Content Creation, to Payments and Fraud, to Delivery and Customer Care Services, we’re creating seamless and luxury experiences for our customers all around the world.

London
Our London office is located in Old Street, London’s tech hub, home to a broad range of teams including Commercial, Marketing, and Product. We have large open plan spaces and a feature staircase connecting our 3 floors, encouraging our collaborative and open culture. We also have a big outdoor terrace where we can have lunch and host social events when the sun comes out!

Our Operations team power the movement of our stock! The Farfetch Group stock pool is global, high value and complex to navigate. We have thousands of items being imported, exported, and transferred between our sites every single day. Now we are a publicly listed company experiencing phenomenal growth, Farfetch have a responsibility to ensure the processes that underpin stock movements reporting are SOX compliant. It’s our ambition to be 100% SOX compliant always, without exception, to reduce any risk to our business.
This role reports into the Farfetch Head of Fulfillment (Europe) and you will work alongside our Global Operations teams and our network of global fulfilment partners. The purpose of the role is building a blueprint for SOX compliance specific to stock management. Applying your expertise in SOX compliance you will be instrumental in implementing and championing best practice. Applying an auditor’s lens to everything you do, you will identify and remedy any risks which compromise the integrity of our stock data and audit results, building long term solutions to drive continuous improvement.
What you'll do
Define the parameters and specifications required to achieve 100% SOX compliance, building a view of what success looks like and aligning the team to this vision.
Partner with internal stakeholders across the Farfetch Group such as the Operations and Audit teams and external stakeholders including Auditors, to gain insight of current challenges and risks to compliance.
Build the compliance roadmap for the Operations team, prioritising efforts and laying the foundations for excellence.
Define and coach internal and external stakeholders on the responsibilities they have to influence stock movement and stock reporting as defined in the SOX register, highlighting the importance of SOX compliance.
Conduct regular audits of the processes being carried out internally and externally (3PL’s), implementing new processes concerned with the reporting of stock movement wherever there is room to improve compliance.
Learn from best practice stock management and reporting being carried out in any corners of our business, driving synergy and applying this best practice to the wider group.
Operationalize the compliance roadmap by introducing a comprehensive suite of compliance data and best practice compliance reporting, familiarizing the team with this data and building dialogue around the insights on a continuous basis.
Be guided by high quality data, flagging and escalating any risks to the relevant operations team for full investigation, being accountable for risks until they are resolved.
Drive and influence behavioral change around how tools and systems are utilised by internal and external teams, driving a ‘system first’ response to allow for accurate reporting on our stock position at any point in time.
Plan and prepare the business for periodic audits, driving a shift towards continuous auditing practices.
Facilitate quarterly and yearly meetings with our third-party auditors, delivering the results of the Farfetch stock audits and actioning any feedback stemming from audits carried out by our external auditors.
Who you are
Experience in SOX procedures for publicly listed companies.
Comfortable in a logistics and operations environment, with previous exposure to a warehouse or with auditors.
Natural ability to build effective relationships throughout the business.
Skilled at presenting data in an impactful way.
Strong warehouse management system and ERP knowledge.
Senior stakeholder management skills with an ability to influence all levels of the organisation.
Ability to think strategically and innovatively and to that into a viable, operational plan.
Strong commercial and financial acumen, with an ability to speak business language.
Excellent communication skills with proven track record of building effective relationships with senior leadership teams.
Thrives on complex challenges with a problem-solving approach.
Experience in Retail and E-commerce, with a focus on multi-channel environments, would be a bonus.
The purpose of the role is building a blueprint for SOX compliance specific to stock management. Applying your expertise in SOX compliance you will be instrumental in implementing and championing best practice.

Job Title: Manager CRM Operations London, United Kingdom Consumer
Job Description:
Be a part of a revolutionary change

At PMI, we’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business, and building our future on smoke-free products with the power to improve the lives of a billion smokers worldwide.

With huge change, comes huge opportunity. So, wherever you join us, you’ll enjoy the freedom dream up and deliver, better, brighter solutions and the space to move your career forward in endlessly different directions.

The Consumer Group is undergoing a critical overhaul as we look to transform into an agile, consumer-centric business that harnesses technological innovation to deliver better, science-backed alternatives to millions of adult smokers around the world. It is only by focusing on our strategic priorities and the right organization, fully enabled to deliver what matters the most for our consumers along their journey toward better alternatives, that we will be able to deliver a smoke-free future.

Here, you can make a difference. You can craft the consumer journey, from discovery and acquisition through to conversion and loyalty. And you can watch your efforts lead to meaningful change in the lives of smokers on their way to better alternatives. You’ll develop your skills; collaborating across functions, markets and regions. If you want to make a life-changing impact on consumers, there’s no better place.

For our Omni Channel Operations team in London, UK (Global Studio) we are therefore looking for a Manager, CRM Operations!

In this position you will be responsible for the day-to-day governance of subject matter experts specialists in CRM, deploying structured and data-driven CRM campaigns in 60+ markets. You will contribute to overall realization of business objectives by owning customer problems and finding opportunities for growth, and ultimately promoting data driven consumer centric approach across the organization!

You will:

• Partner with CRM Hub Leads to launch structured and data-driven automated campaigns that are triggered by consumer behaviours and delivered through CRM communication channels (e-mail, SMS, Viber, etc).
• Define CRM operational processes to be in line with PMI standards
• Drive operational efficiency by managing 3rd party resources supporting the Hubs, automating existing processes, where possible, and standardize campaign deployment to ensure multi-step communication that enhances global brand narrative, avoids customer friction and enhances the IQOS experience.
• Support CRM Hub Leads who are modifying CRM strategies to meet local requirements, working with multiple partners to build CRM capabilities within the market, and troubleshooting platform issues that may inhibit CRM orchestration.
• Overall proficiency in CRM best practices and market requirements where smoke-free future campaigns are being launched.
• Have hands on experience with data management, analytic frameworks and monitoring data quality.
• Act as a SME in the area of CRM functionality and usage.
• Understand the defined CRM and accompanying data strategy and decision framework in execution of CRM updates and processes.
• Maintain accountability for aligning to operational objectives and short-term planning for CRM usage.

We’re looking for someone with:

• Experience in CRM Management for a global brand or large agency.
• Running / coordinating CRM related projects with strong understanding of CRM systems, performance metrics and customer segmentation
• Experience on global CRM projects and can navigate in a matrixed organization.
• Proven experience managing system vendors (Salesforce Marketing Cloud preferred)
• Strong interpersonal, communication, influencing and analytical skills.
• Confirmed ability to lead multiple projects and consistently meet deadlines.
• Change management and project management experience.

What we offer:

Our success depends on the men and women who come to work every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress. Join PMI and you too can:
• Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We’ll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.
• Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.
• Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business – our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.
• Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to improve the lives of a billion smokers.

PMI is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Your role
This position supports the Deloitte Global Privacy Office (located within Risk) on global privacy and data protection compliance program management and related activities. The position will focus on supporting the design of guidance and the monitoring of key requirements to help facilitate compliance with privacy and data protection regulations and internal policies across our Member Firm network. This may include support of the annual iprivacy verification process for global, various consultations on data risk reviews acting as a subject matter specialist on a variety of current and emerging privacy risks across the global network including risks with processes, services and systems. This role may also support triage of privacy related incidents crossing multiple Member Firms and may include monitoring and review of the existence and effectiveness of approaches to privacy risk mitigation and compliance with privacy requirements in various Member Firms. The position is for a privacy professional who is looking to expand their knowledge and skills through exposure to diverse and complex data privacy regulations on a global basis.

Responsibilities:
•Help define and update, maintain and enhance privacy compliance program requirements within the global organization
•Support periodic review of applicable data protection policies in light of changes in laws, regulatory or organizational policy

About Deloitte

Our Purpose & Strategy
To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.
What do we do?
Deloitte offers global integrated professional services that include Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Legal, Risk Advisory and Tax Consulting. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities whatever the role, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.
Beyond the UK: Deloitte North and South Europe
The UK is part of Deloitte North and South Europe (NSE), the second largest member firm in the Deloitte network. Deloitte NSE combines operations in Belgium, Central Mediterranean (Italy, Greece, Malta), Ireland, the Middle East (Bahrain, Cyprus, Egypt, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Oman, Palestinian Ruled Territories, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates, Yemen), the Netherlands, the Nordics (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden), Switzerland and the UK. Deloitte NSE brings together 2,700 partners and over 50,000 people, combining our unmatched breadth and depth of capabilities in audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, and tax and legal across the region. Being part of Deloitte NSE supports our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services and will create more opportunity and growth for our people.
What do we value?
What brings us all together at Deloitte? It’s how we approach the thousands of decisions we make every day. How we behave, our beliefs and our attitudes. In other words: our values. Whatever we do, wherever we are in the world, we lead the way, serve with integrity, take care of each other, foster inclusion, and collaborate for maximum impact. These five shared values lead every decision we make and action we take, guiding us to deliver impact how and where it matters most.

Being a Leader at Deloitte
Cultural fit and purpose-led leadership is crucial for Deloitte. Our leaders always set the example and inspire their colleagues. They make quality time for people and take an interest in them. They know what matters to people - both inside and outside work – and value them as individuals; always finding opportunities to develop them while showing respect and appreciation.
We expect colleagues at all levels to embrace and live our purpose and our leadership culture by challenging themselves to identify issues that are most important for our clients, our people, and for society and make an impact that matters. We know leadership comes in all shapes and sizes, but our Leadership Charter helps all of our people understand what we’re looking for:

We live our purpose: we act as a role model, embracing and living our purpose and values, and recognising others for the impact they makeWe develop talent: we develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunitiesWe drive performance: we deliver exceptional client service; maximise results and drive high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and bordersWe believe positive influence can make an impact that matters: we influence clients, teams, and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships with increasingly senior peopleWe move, together, towards a strategic direction: we understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning people to objectives and setting priorities and direction.WPFULL SLICSS BAITEC CFTECH

Who we are

We are digital healthcare in the palm of your hand. We are clinical excellence in just a few taps. We are doctors, designers and data analysts. Software developers, managers and marketers. And we’re changing the GP experience – forever.

No more waiting for appointments. No more waiting rooms. With Doctor Care Anywhere, you speak to a doctor when it suits you, by video or phone call from anywhere.

But this is just the beginning.

We have ambitious goals and need ambitious people to reach them. If you’re talented, hard-working and make a habit out of dreaming big, we’d like to hear from you.

Your new Role:

This is an exciting opportunity for an allied health professional to work in a fast-paced health technology company. Doctor Care Anywhere’s vision is to be a global leader in the provision of the highest quality, integrated, and affordable healthcare. The post holder will work within the Clinical Product team to help build a digital healthcare platform that is clinically safe, innovative, and delivers beautifully designed functionality and transparency to our users.

The Clinical Product Manager will support the Head of Clinical Product in providing clinical expertise on the configuration, implementation, and adoption of the organisation’s digital health solutions. As an experienced clinician, the post holder will be uniquely positioned to truly understand the value a technology or digital health project can bring in the delivery care to our patients. The Clinical Digital Lead will use their clinical knowledge and work closely with our product, design, and technological teams to deliver solutions that result in patient and population care that is person-centred, ethical, safe, efficient, timely, and equitable

The key tasks in your new and exciting role with us:
Support the planning, developing, refining and evaluation of new digital health projects within the organisation by collaborating with our product, technical, and design development teams
Use your clinical expertise to offer clinical advice, negotiate with clinical and non-clinical management colleagues, and manage staff expectations relevant to project deliverables and outcomes.
Work closely with our clinical team to analyse the functionality of our digital platform and apply clinical and technological experience to define new areas of improvement.
Collaborate with staff at all levels, regarding clinical workflow and operations to ensure successful the implementation of technology that benefits patient care
Inform clinical stakeholders of major digital IT developments within the organisation and discuss the impacts of such projects upon their relevant business units.
Jointly lead on the, usability and end user acceptance testing, to ensure the system is clinically sound and any changes introduced meet clinically safe standards.
Communicate the content of new digital solutions with our training and workforce team and ensure the training truly and accurately reflects any new functionality or changes in functionality.
Assist the Head of Clinical Product, in addressing the clinical effectiveness or our digital platform, and implementing key clinical informatics projects into our platform.
Co-lead on the prioritization of new projects within the organization and apply your clinical expertise to quantify the clinical impact and risk of potential new projects.
Lead your own digital health projects, identifying the optimal staff engagement approach to ensure the success of the project.
Collaborate with our Clinical Safety Officer to ensure clinical safety considerations inform new or existing digital projects and escalate any concerns regarding clinical risk or the risk of harm to our users, to our Clinical Safety Officer for further investigation
Develop effective communication with other healthcare professionals to foster a good understanding of clinical informatics systems and the roles and responsibilities of staff who use them.
Hopefully a description of you and your experience!:

Education, Qualifications, Registrations
Clinical Professional Registration (Eg NMC, Allied Health Professional )
Masters or equivalent in a health-related subject OR Equivalent training and on the job experience
Change Management qualification or equivalent Formal leadership and management training (Desirable)
Experience and Knowledge
Significant post-registration experience.
Demonstrate leadership/management experience.
Understanding the role and function of digital systems in providing high standards of patient care.
Active involvement in at least one informatics or digital health intervention to improve care quality (Desirable)
Evidence of the ability to confront and manage challenging issues taking a problem-solving approach
Proven staff management experience with the ability to gain their support, motivate and develop them
Experience of independently managing and prioritising a varied workload under pressure and to deadlines, while recognising when issues need escalating.
Change management experience related to the planning and delivery of work in a clinical setting.
Risk management: training and/or experience in risk management sufficient to understand potential risks from informatics solutions from a clinical perspective.
Skills and Abilities
Ability to produce clear and concise written material, including data analysis using appropriate IT packages.
Ability to communicate and deal sensitively with contentious issues.
Self-motivated and resilient, with the ability to preserve order to achieve objectives and have the flexibility to take the views of others
Ability to perform effectively under pressure while delivering high quality outcomes within agreed timescales
Proven experience of working successfully as part of several teams
Willingness to undertake additional training as necessary
Ability to work under own initiative and plan and prioritise own workload.
Ability to manage internal relationships using diplomatic skills to navigate conflicts and challenging conversations.
Why you want to work here
4 x charity ‘Care in the Community’ days per year
Free Private Medical Insurance
Progressive environment with a focus on wellbeing
Doctor Care Anywhere subscription for you and 5 members of your friends or family
An environment where the ‘sky is the limit’ offering career opportunities and development
Flexible working environment with the option of coming into the office for a collaborative space
Open, transparent and dynamic environment, trusted to work independently but with a great team around you
Virtual Fitness classes three times a week
Bike2Work scheme (for all biking equipment - even if you don’t bike to work!)

At Amazon, we strive to be Earths most customer-centric company, where people can come to find and discover anything they might want to buy online. Amazon Flex works directly with independent contractors called delivery partners to make deliveries to our customers. With Amazon Flex, individuals can now be their own boss delivering Amazon packages. Amazon Flex is powered by a mobile app that works in concert with our advanced logistics systems that allows delivery partners to on board, schedule delivery times, guide them through their deliveries with in-app mapping and navigation, and more. The approach and technology are nothing short of disruptive, and promise to challenge traditional approaches, and change the way the industry operates.

Amazon Flex is continuing to build a high paced and lean European team to implement and expand Flex capabilities across key segments of the European business. Amazon is now looking to hire an experienced, passionate, dynamic, analytical, innovative, hands-on, and (most importantly) customer-obsessed Operations Program Manager.

You will drive performance across our EU partners (AMZL and GSF). You will be responsible for building processes, systems, and mechanisms to monitor performance across multiple Delivery Stations daily. You will drive execution and efficiency through data-driven decision-making and analytical problem-solving. You will be accountable for cost, customer experience, and delivery partner experience, both in daily execution and long-term step-function improvements.

Responsibilities:

• Responsible for the overall delivery quality, cost, and customer experience for all Delivery Stations and GSF locations
• Responsible for weekly planning, organizational staffing, and scheduling needs.
• Deep dive intra-day and intra-week tends and create action plans to address operational issues in coordination with Delivery Stations, Partner teams, and Field Ops
• Own taking proactive steps to ensure that best practices are shared across OE org


Basic Qualifications

This position requires a candidate with the proven ability to drive process improvements and the ability to keep pace with our explosive growth while motivating others to meet the challenges of an extremely deadline-driven environment.

• Bachelors Degree from an accredited university


• Experience with planning, creating standard work, performance metrics, and process improvement

• Candidates must be able to work a variety of hours as business demands, including overnight, weekends and holidays. Ability to manage and communicate across position levels and functions

Preferred Qualifications

• Business Analytics and SQL / Alchemy / Tableau dashboard knowledge


• Experience leading process improvement through Lean, Kaizen, and Six Sigma


• Enjoys analytical work and using data to provide thought-provoking and workable solutions

.

We are on a mission to help radiologists detect breast cancer earlier using deep learning.

Kheiron is a fast-growing, medical technology company that uses advanced machine learning to develop and deliver intelligent tools for radiologists, radiology departments, imaging centres and hospitals to improve the efficiency, consistency and accuracy of radiology reporting. We aim to save more lives by empowering radiologists in their role in diagnosis, treatment, and patient outcome.

We are proud that Kheiron is one of the winners of the first UK Government Artificial Intelligence (AI) in Health and Care Awards, announced September 2020.

The funding will accelerate the roll out and rapid adoption of Mia (Mammography Intelligent Assessment) to address critical challenges in breast screening services in the UK.

The Role

The Product Manager will be working to further develop our flagship product MiaTM to optimise commercialisation opportunities. This role reports to the VP of Product.

This is a Product Management role to work with a squad of engineers, data analysts, clinical team members delivering next generation software and services in a medical device regulatory environment.
What you'll be doing:
Assessing market feedback and post market surveillance on launch products.
Working closely with specialists in clinical, engineering, security, data analysis, commercial, quality assurance (QA) and regulatory affairs (RA) to determine any optimisation for Mia and other product solutions post-launch.
Successfully achieve new or updated regulatory clearances for any updated versions of Mia and other launched products in UK, EU, US and APAC
Coordinating prioritisation and delivery of additional features and services to serve our customers
Setting and to be accountable for assigned team key results
Quickly developing strong and effective relationships with colleagues, especially in Clinical, Engineering, Commercial, Data Science, QA, RA and Marketing
Attending conferences, trade shows and customer meetings as required
It'd be great if you have:
Medical device product development experience in a regulated environment (ISO13485)
Product development and deployment experience with software (ideally AI)
Extensive experience with product management and the end to end product development lifecycle
Demonstrable success in influencing internal and external stakeholders to help multidisciplinary project teams to deliver high quality product delivery or obtain executive buy-in
Exceptional written and spoken communications skills across diverse audiences
Passion for improving healthcare with cutting edge technology to help patients
What we can offer:
You can be part of a team that literally changes the way we care for patients and save lives
A fast paced, high impact environment in which you can learn and grow your skill set
A competitive salary including equity to make you a partaker of our commercial success
We care about your personal life - we offer extended parental leave, health insurance for your family through Bupa and mental health support through Spill
At Kheiron we celebrate diversity and inclusion, we strive for a work environment in which all individuals are treated fairly and respectfully, have equal access to opportunities and resources, and can contribute fully to the organisation's success.

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome everyone regardless of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, or marital status.

This critical role will lead and own a key pillar of our Product strategy team. Superb communication and stakeholder management skills will come naturally to you, and you will display excellent commercial, data and technical acumen, in defining your product strategy.You will be responsible to shape and deliver the Travel Experiences roadmap for your product, be a natural with data and have proven success of delivering KPI improvement. You will be creative by nature and can solve product problems with simple and clear strategies, combining option and impact analysis.

You will know how to collaborate with Product Owners, UX and Insights teams and maintain a laser focus on howto measure and communicate the impacts of your work. Experience of creating exceptional Go To Marketstrategies will also be a huge bonus

Key Responsibilities include:
Define product strategies and roadmaps to achieve product/market fit
Be experimental in your approach by identifying tangible POCs, tactics and strategies to implement product features with clear and measurable success criteria
Communicate impact of product deliveries and have demonstrable experience of working within a test and learn culture
Work closely with other Product Manager, Product Owners and Engineering Leads to define and plan the roadmap for strategic programs of work
Own the 6-12-month product development plan for your areas
Contribute to strategic conversations on clients, experience, feature development and investment opportunities
Have strong opinions on product innovation and an ability to question, understand, and challenge
Be an integral part of the Product leadership team and directly challenge and suggest ideas to improve process, prioritisation and planning
Maintain and build good relationships with external industry forums, best practice and partners to build richness in our data and thought leadership in its usage
Knowledge, Skills & Experience

Demonstrative product management experience
Experience leading teams and individuals preferred
Experience in multi-channel App and web development as well as physical product development
Technical aptitude with ability to communicate effectively with technical resources
Analytical mindset, with a data driven approach to problem solving to support decision making
Ability to see the bigger picture and strategize yet meticulous in the day to day detail to ensure quality of delivery and alignment to goals and vision
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously, prioritise workload with conviction and thrive in a dynamic and complex environment

Quality Assurance Manager
Job Description
The International Quality for Alexa team focuses on expanding Alexas capabilities on a global scale. We take on the unique challenge of understanding the nuances of how Alexa enabled devices can serve customers needs in different cultures and locations. If you are interested in shaping the future of Alexa for customers around the world, come and join our team.


As a Quality Assurance Manager, you will work closely with the Product Management, Software Development Engineering, User Experience Design, and Customer Support groups to understand the product vision, requirements and customer usage models and develop appropriate test strategies. You will be working on QA teams technical vision and roadmap , developing and tracking project schedules. The successful Quality Assurance Manager has strong customer focus and is obsessed with continuous quality improvement; they are experienced and highly committed to creating world class automation for feature testing and regression; they are able to develop and drive a high-level strategy, as well as to take a hands-on approach to implementing that strategy. They are dedicated to building a strong and high performing team.


Responsibilities:
· Working with business and development teams to understand product vision and requirements
· Understanding how all elements of the system software ecosystem work together and developing
· QA approaches that fit the overall strategy
· Developing test strategies and creating appropriate test harnesses
· Overseeing the development and execution of test plans, monitoring and reporting on test execution and quality metrics
· Working with a team of quality engineering professionals to ensure the highest quality product delivery
· The successful candidate is an experienced but hands-on manager who can grow the team and ensure it performs





Basic Qualifications

Basic Qualifications
· Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical discipline or equivalent
· Fluency in English and French
· 7+ years of relevant engineering experience
· 3+ years people management experience
· Experience leading a QA team that is responsible for end-end validation for a critical system or application
· Understanding of testing strategies including technologies for automated testing




Preferred Qualifications

Preferred Qualifications
· Deep hands-on technical expertise
· Experience in quality assurance for consumer electronics
· Excellent verbal and written communication skills
· Strong business and technical vision
· Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
· A deep understanding of quality assurance in a team, and a track record of shipping software on time
· A deep understanding of automation testing by leading engineers who can write automation scripts/programs that will aid in automated testing

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

We’re looking for an experienced Rev Ops to own the reporting and tracking of the metrics of the entire funnel, helping us having a clear visibility on our activities and building out a more predictable revenue model. You’ll participate in the definition of the KPIs alongside management, sales, marketing and CX, and will be responsible for setting up the tools tracking them, as well as building up the reports and putting together the analysis. Ultimately the role might encompass metrics across the entire company. You will be reporting to the COO, helping her make sure the organisation works as one machine towards a common goal.

Responsibilities
Support leadership with leading metrics to clearly connect customer and sales objectives, outcomes and activities to company and team KPIs
Generate regular and ad-hoc metric analysis for both the Sales and Marketing Leadership Teams to monitor performance across a range of key business drivers and both sales and marketing team performance
Collaborate with other sales operations teams and cross functional teams to drive business alignment across the organization
Assist in creation of variable incentive compensation models, variable incentive automation, and variable incentive performance calculations
Drive data quality, process and automation activities that improve workflow efficiencies
Provide critical business insight to business partners based on business acumen and data analysis, be able to identify issues and recommend action plans
Provide direction and training to Account Executives, Customer Success Managers, and Business Development Managers to onboard them into our workflow and pricing and customer agreement structure
Define, document, and maintain sales policies across geographies to encourage the right behaviour and alignment with our bookings policy and SaaS revenue model
Support client-facing teams in calculating appropriate pricing models for New customers, growth upon Existing customers and point-of-diminishing return on SaaS revenue
Define go to market KPIs from with functional leaders and continuously manage key performance metrics
Review and redefine pricing and packaging in partnership with product
Find opportunities to automate manual processes that improve customer experience and efficiency
Prepare and present business performance updates to the leadership team
Partner with engineering and functional leads to select and implement new tools and workflows across Marketing, Sales, and Post-Sales
Lead resource planning for all go to market teams based on revenue, forecast, and potential
You’ll start as an individual contributor but we may grow the team in the coming years.
Requirements
You have a strong experience of rev ops and have successfully set up and run the function for other startups with emerging GTM functions and a revenue from $10M with potential to scale to $30M
You are hands-on and possess enough software development experience to be able to implement the tooling and build integrations yourself
You have an analytical mind with a strong ability to extract insight from data, with an excellent commercial awareness
You are process driven and live by numbers
Your communications skills are excellent and you strive bringing people together around a single goal
You have a strong knowledge of CRM systems and tooling
The most important thing is that you understand we are a mission driven company, trying to grow an ecosystem with a long term view and that we are revolutionising the control people get over their online communication. .

Additionally we are looking for someone who is:
smart, curious and enthusiastic
an articulate communicator who takes great pleasure in helping others
empathetic, with both their colleagues and the end user
Is comfortable with the pace, trade offs and ambiguity of an early stage startup (specifically: how to take care of yourself and get your work done without working crazy hours).
We build things for everyone, and we know we can’t succeed without a diverse team. Our hiring process is designed to be respectful and give candidates the best chance to show us what you can do. If we ever fall down on this, please let us know.

Benefits

Why this role?
Now is a great time to join: We’re well funded and have rising revenues from a host of interesting customers— from The French Government and Mozilla to others we’re not allowed to talk about yet(!).
You’ll work on highly visible projects: Our early adopters are in the tens of millions and almost all of our work is open source and we receive regular feedback from our community of users. We’re figuring out how to best practise ‘open design’ in open source and you’ll be able to help shape that. We also speak regularly at conferences, meetups and talks.
You’ll be joining a small mission-led team with a supportive culture. In this role, you’ll report into the co-founder and COO

Benefits


Our general approach is to treat people like adults and acknowledge that by being flexible we create an environment for people to do their best work. For more details here is our manifesto. That said specific points that differentiate us include:
Generous holiday allowance, private healthcare for you and your family and opportunities for development and progression as we scale.
Family friendly environment, many of the team have small children and we look to accommodate that as best we can.
People tend to stay with the company for a long time, we take this as a sign that we have a cohesive, supportive culture, that we have engaging challenging work and that people can develop their skills and careers here for the long term.
Element does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, colour, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

Here at Gousto, we are on a mission to become the UK's favourite way to eat dinner

Delicious recipes, precise ingredients & a dollop of adventure, delivered to your door. We have invested into our technology, data capability and our product to ensure the customer is at the heart of what we do. Every aspect of our business is powered by our passion.

Whether it is innovation through our recipe development, building algorithms to optimise our recipe box journey or devising strategies to reduce plastic and food waste. All our teams play a part in our amazing growth in the UK!

Our DREAM? To be the most-loved way to eat dinner, and for every meal to leave the planet better off. Gousto is changing how people shop, cook and eat food at home. It’s an incredibly exciting time to join our team!

We’re so thrilled to be advertising this position. As Growth Manager, you will be responsible for driving frequency and retention across the inactive customer lifecycle.

Your impact will be huge in driving the business forward and we’re excited to see you:

Drive orders from lapsed and non-subscribed customers
Maximise subscription adoption from the inactive base
Run seasonal resurrection campaigns to drive high quality and profitable resurrections
Optimise discount spend to maximise ROI

You’ll put together a strategy and execute on it that leverages CRM, Digital Product and Brand to improve customer experience and drive orders.

CRM. You will take a hands-on approach to the design and build of comms touchpoints and channel strategy to target the inactive customer base.
Digital Product. You will lead the Resurrection Discovery Team, which is a part of the Growth Tribe (a wider cross-functional team that includes Digital Product, Tech, UX/UI, Data Science, Analytics, Finance, Insights, Marketing). You’ll be working with Digital Product Managers and Engineers to define the strongest opportunities to prioritise for driving incremental orders and improve customer experiences.
Brand. You will collaborate with Brand to continuously improve the quality of Resurrection comms, by introducing more engaging creative and valuable content.
You’ll drive positive and profitable behaviours across our customers and will deliver outstanding customer experiences, based on insights, data and an acute sense for impactful opportunities.

As part of the Growth team, you’ll report into the Head of Growth, and you’ll work amongst an amazing team of 6, who will support you along the way in order to drive strong decision making, develop resilience together and overwhelmingly scale growth at Gousto whilst having fun along the way.

Your success will be measured by hitting quarterly OKRs (revenue, profit, ROI) and by effective team collaboration (delivery of cross-functional projects).

Requirements

Relevant experiences in some of the following fields: Marketing, CRM, Retention, Digital Product Development, Business Strategy, Analytics & Insights.
Strong aptitude for numbers and extreme comfort with data analysis. Experience using reporting/analytical methods in your degree or in a previous role
Empirical way of working. We have insights managers, data analysts, data scientists and finance analysts specifically allocated to our Growth Tribe. Exhibiting evidence based reasoning and consequent hypothesis formulation is a must.
Strong communication & presentation skills. Experience building strategies and communicating them across a business. An ability to build great relationships with people from across the business
Leadership experience. Especially in cross-functional projects where you drove change across the business.
Tremendously ambitious: Think big. The opportunity is what you decide to make it. We want brave individuals who question “how can we?” and inspire the rest of the business to do the same. We want someone who can blow our customers' minds away.
Curious and proactive. Learning and discovery is what moves us. We seek to understand problems deeply and are proactive and fast in anticipating future needs (business and customers). Speed and clarity matter!
Resilience. We want a confident individual that pushes through in the toughest of times. Reflection, resistance and purpose is what will move you and the team forward.

Highly desired

Experience with best practice A/B testing. Running multiple experiments with excellent pre-test analysis, execution and a posteriori measurement
Experience working with a tech squad. Working alongside product to deliver meaningful outcomes for customers that moved metrics

Primary Responsibility

The Quality Manager provides support and guidance to the Adaptimmune staff regarding Good Manufacturing Practice (cGMP). Following Adaptimmune Quality Policies and Procedures, the Quality Manager participates in the activities related to material release, Quality investigations, auditing, change control, CAPA, documentation management & creation, and raw material, in-process and final material release at the Catapult Stevenage site. The role has accountability for the overall management of batch record review and lot release for the Stevenage site , is responsible for evaluating material deviations, reviewing executed batch records and drawing conclusions as to disposition for material manufactured.

Key Responsibilities
Prepare, where applicable, review and approve master batch records, procedures, validation documentation, specifications, reports and forms.
Initiate improvements to the Quality Management System, ensuring compliance to all relevant Quality Standards and regulatory requirements in conjunction with the Associate Director of Quality (UK).
Manages overall lot release process to ensure GMP requirements are met; Conducts record review of executed batch records for vector and drug material lots. Assures all Quality events, change controls, CAPAs and/or other required documentation related to the material lots are completed and closed prior to material/lot release
Review and proactively assist in process capability studies and statistical techniques as necessary, to support continuous improvement. Initiate updates/tracking on status of Quality Events and CAPAs as appropriate.
Participate as cross-functional team member for process verification and technical transfer projects.
In conjunction with MS&T, evaluate Quality Events / Non-Conformances. Support the identification of corrective and preventive actions; determine assignable root cause, complete failure investigations and follow up to corrective and preventive actions, ensuring adequate and timely closure.
Assist the Associate Director of Quality (UK) in the development and maintenance of Adaptimmunes Quality System to meet the requirements of the relevant regulatory authorities, Notified Bodies (if applicable) and ISO standards (as applicable) and all other applicable quality and regulatory standards.
In conjunction with the UK Quality Specialists prepares and issues certificates of compliance (CoC) and certificates of analysis (CoA) as required for manufactured materials; Audits vendor certificates (e.g. CoA, CoC) for completeness and compliance against approved specifications. Evaluates lot test results against trending data to identify any irregular behaviour.
Evaluates environmental monitoring results for conformance with ICH/GMP requirements in support of lot release.
Support in the preparation for regulatory submissions and inspections, as needed.
Qualifications & Experience

Required
Degree in a scientific discipline.
Hands-on experience in bio/pharmaceutical operations within quality operation roles.
Detailed knowledge of Quality Systems, such as Change Control, Investigations, and CAPA
Direct experience supporting development and technology transfer activities.
Excellent technical writing skills including SOPs and investigation reports
Knowledge of regulatory compliance for biologics manufacture, lot release, and quality systems (FDA/EMA).
Desirable
Knowledge of ATMP manufacture, especially viral production.
Qualified Person (QP)
Skills & Compentencies

Required
Excellent written and verbal skills
Ability to work and communicate internally and externally
Candidate must be proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, and MS Project.
Ability to work successfully in a cross-functional team and independently.
Strong attention to detail
Desirable
Able to manage multiple priorities
Excellent problem-solving skills
Able to exercise judgment to determine appropriate corrective actions
decision making authority

As the Quality Assurance operational representative at the UK Stevenage facility, the position will be making decisions regarding batch disposition, procedure development and approval, and routine interactions with Adaptimmune Senior Management both in US and UK.

Size and scope of team

Direct reports 2

Budget responsibility

Budget decisions for requalification activities and stationery as required

other requirements

The role is based in Stevenage at the manufacturing facility. In addition, the candidate must be willing to travel locally to the UK headquarters in Milton Park, Oxfordshire and internationally to contract service providers or suppliers as required. Initial travel approximately 25% reducing to 10% as facility and process becomes established.

At Space Ape, we are focused on building world-class player experiences. Our games are fun, fresh and brimming with personality, so we want to share them with everyone. We believe the best games are a combination of art and science, we pair analytical product people with creative skills for great results.

The Role


We are looking for a highly organised Product Manager to drive the product vision of one of our six games in development. The game team has an established vision and thesis but are on the search for someone to crack the code of what it will take to make the game a hit.

The game will be one where the economy design, balancing and analytical feature design will be a huge lever in the game’s success. In other words it will be the kind of game that will make best use of your analytical skills. Our studio DNA includes free to play, strategy and live ops based games, so there will always be a place where you can have a huge impact.

You will be responsible for ensuring the success and growth of the game by developing a product vision, strategy and roadmap. You will inspire, coordinate and empower designers, developers, artists and data scientists to evolve live games and deliver an optimised and personalised experience to millions of players.

This is a role for someone who sees career growth coming from being the first Product Manager on a game that becomes a global phenomenon, more so than someone who aspires to lead a product management organization spanning many games. That said, there will be plenty of opportunities to mentor and learn from some of the best in the business by collaborating with teams across Space Ape and the broader Supercell family.

Responsibilities
End to end management of product. Prioritise features based on business value, collect and analyse requirements, write clear and detailed specs, create wireframes and define A/B tests.
Drive experimentation and lead testing/tuning efforts for specific features.
Analyse results of the features, iterate based on data to improve performance.
Plan the long-term direction of the game. Set Milestones make sure they are hit.
Work with Tech to strike a balance between new features, tools, and technical debt.
Own the metrics. DAU, ARPU, D1/D7/D30 retention. LTV. Creating impact as a result of your changes.
Own revenue and other quarterly objectives by pushing initiatives and improvements to all teams.
Work closely with Dev. team to ensure release of relevant and timely content.
Prioritise features, content, and promotions based on development time and impact.
Work with designers on ideas, specs, and game design settings to create impactful features.
Review, create, and critique specs; providing real time feedback.
Requirements
Proven track record of improving metrics within a live game, as a Product Manager, Live Ops Manager or similar.
A proven track record of improving stats on a live game
Data driven and analytical with exceptional attention to detail. SQL experience an advantage.
Goal oriented, passionate and autonomous on projects
Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with all disciplines and departments.
Skilled expertise in software development methodologies and project management. Agile / Scrum experience is preferred.
Ability to juggle many things at once and bring order to chaos. Excellent problem solver.
Must have a background in a related field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Management, or Game Design.
Why Space Ape is right for you
Be a part of one of several small empowered teams who inspire and challenge one another in the pursuit of our mission
Autonomy to make your own impact with the support to help it happen
Designated ‘Ape Space’ creative time where you are free to work on game concepts and ideas away from your day to day
The freedom to further your skill set the way you want with a generous training budget
Competitive compensation and benefits
An award winning studio that in 2017, 2018, 2019, & 2020 was crowned one of the best companies to work for in the UK by gamesindustry.biz.
Help run and create games which bring joy to millions of players all over the world
4.7/5.0 Glassdoor rating - Check out our reviews
Entered a long-term strategic partnership with Supercell in 2017
This position is in London, but you're not? No matter where you would be moving from, our dedicated people will help you from beginning to end.
About Space Ape

At Space Ape we pride ourselves on our passion and the trust we place in our people. We look for driven, productive, team players who are relentless in their pursuit of our mission. There’s no bureaucracy here, we just get things done. Space Ape’s mission is to make the highest quality and most successful mobile games in the world. Founded in 2012 we’ve since launched four games that have been installed by over 100 million people and generated over $200m revenue. We currently have two games in soft launch [https://beatstar.com/] and [https://apps.apple.com/nl/app/id1520552339] and 3 more entering soft launch soon.

Our studio is currently 110 strong and built around the belief that small empowered teams make the best games. This philosophy enables us to innovate, move faster and have the creative ownership required to make the greatest games on mobile.

All communication regarding your application will be dealt with in line with our recruitment privacy policy

Company Description

OVERVIEW

A global leader in Communication the Groupe is positioned at every step of the value chain, from consulting to execution, combining marketing and digital business transformation. As a privileged partner in its clients’ transformation and journey to enhance personalization at scale. Through a unified and fluid organization, its clients have a facilitated access to expertise across 100+ countries and a its internal network of 83,000 professionals.

Publicis Production (Prodigious) is an award-winning production studio with 3500 production experts across 40 countries worldwide. We are proud makers, producing everything from CG animation to DOOH, to print and live action TVCs for some of the world’s leading brands.

Tag WW brings together world class craftsmanship across a full range of visual, verbal and digital techniques to create a production engine that turns ideas into high-impact creative assets that make brands stand out every time and everywhere. We have a presence in 195 cities across 40 countries and work with 40 of the top 100 global brands.

In July 2020, Publicis Production and Tag WW won the global account for GSK, to work as its production partner with innovation and problem solving at the core. In a hugely exciting development for the future of production we have created an entirely new production model to manage international demand through Circle.

Our model: Circle is an intelligent feedback loop of data, enabled by tech integration, where every decision, execution and reaction creates another layer of learning for our systems, ensuring content relevance and reduction of waste.

Our agency: Circle is the symbol of our seamless union – the partnership with Tag/ ITG and Publicis and the extension of our partnerships with GSK.

Our Mission as the partner supporting GSK to drive efficiency, effectiveness and reduce wastage. Going beyond the usual dashboard limitations of scheduled reviews and interventions by bringing production, data and media intimately and seamlessly together and building a data first, creatively driven solution for every brand, campaign and action.

We will defeat the crippling disease of wastage through informed decision making, consistently leveraging our knowledge of the market, audiences, channels, platforms, partners and formats in the creation of creative assets.

Job Description

The Global Operations Manager will provide leadership and direction for a specific workstream / group of work streams while also managing and continuously building on the client partnership. The role requires building and overseeing a delivery team to deliver key campaign assets across multiple brands and markets.

The Global Operations Manager will work with other roles in the service layer and the onsite teams supporting our client across various brands and delivering on their creative production needs. The service layer and onsite teams deliver a truly transformation work-stream for the specific region in a two-part production model. Agile onsite work as well as planned content production across all channels.

This is a very demanding and dynamic role that will require the Global Operations Manager to have strong experience in a similar role in their specific workstream, managing teams, key internal and external stakeholders as well as clients. Critical knowledge of the creative and production processes, understanding key timings for inputs as well as being able to mitigate risks, solve problems and deliver on brand consistency by being aware and collaborating with regional teams is essential.
The Global Operations Manager will have 10+ years' experience in a client facing role preferably within Consumer healthcare, FMCG or Beauty categories
Knowledge / Expertise within a specific workstream / multiple workstreams (Digital, Print / Packaging, Imaging, TV, Online Video)
Excellent data driven experience in managing operations
Be able to build and maintain key relationships with agencies, partnerships, clients and key stakeholders
Manage and oversee teams and client accounts, across multiple markets
Responsibility to ensure that the operational metrics of on time delivery and quality are met and we are consistently exceeding client SLAs across individual workstreams
Work in a collaborative way with teams locally and virtually to ensure knowledge is shared across the board in a timely manner and all content/assets are delivered on time
Work closely with the data insights team ensuring that learnings are discussed with creative agencies and clients at key points within the creative development process
Manage operational efficiencies through key metrics of utilization, productivity and 24-hour planning for resource management
Be financially minded able to work on business planning and forecasting
Contribute to the smooth running of the business overall, delivering against client KPIs
Have a leadership attitude, supporting teams as needed and working together to manage any challenges
Have excellent communication skills, ability to present with gravitas and engage the most senior clients and stakeholders
Critical work planning and time management skills, able to prioritize and manage multiple briefs/campaigns at the same time

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Who we are...

Tableau joined the Salesforce Ohana in 2019 as an analytics trailblazer. What you'll be doing...

You’ll be responsible for tasks throughout the subcontractor lifecycle including onboarding, resource vetting, escalation management, and portfolio reviews. This role provides a unique combination of relationship building/management with an operational focus on developing a new function with an eye to effectiveness and efficiency.

Your Impact:

Success will be measured by the overall performance of the Tableau Services Subcontracting Program team to provide the Global Services organization with a cost-effective, high quality subcontracting network.
Assist with the development of the Subcontractor Manager role within AMER (EMEA/APAC) region

Work closely with regional Account Partners and Delivery teams to ensure adequate subcontractor capacity and skill set coverage

Ability to build and sustain strong relationships with external partners
Experience monitoring metrics/data for trends and issues
Ability to address performance issues and escalations without damaging the subcontractor relationship
Experience with successfully managing a large, diverse workload such as managing multiple projects, accounts, and/or cases
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Strong cross-functional teaming skills and collaborative problem solving
Self-directed and resourceful with strong interpersonal, teamwork, and organizational skills
Ability to bring clarity and structure when managing fluid expectations and evolving demands

Preferred Requirements:

Ability to build, manage and utilize Tableau dashboards
