ABOUT US

DICE is the world’s most-loved discovery and ticketing platform for live shows and live streams, delivering exclusive, high quality entertainment to fans across the world.

We bring fans and creators together with our technology, working closely with the best artists, promoters and venues in music and culture. In April 2020 we launched DICE Live Streaming, connecting fans across the globe with the very best live events.

DICE is a place for people who are ambitious, humble and talented. For those who want to learn at pace and have a true passion for music and culture. Our HQ is in London, we have teams in New York, LA, Paris, Barcelona, Milan, Mumbai and Samara and we’re live in 139 countries. You can read more about what we’ve been up to here in our recent Forbes and Rolling Stone articles.

And now, we’re looking for a Product Manager to join the DICE Product team.

THE ROLE AND TEAM

We focus on helping fans discover the best events, making it as easy as possible to purchase tickets and giving them a great experience of the event itself. This role will involve ownership over the core fan experience; ensuring the best experience to pick up tickets & attend an event. It’s the number one reason fans love DICE & an area we continually look to improve.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
Working with design, research, engineering and fan support to come up with ideas & deliver the best possible fan experience on iOS, Android & Web
Prioritising the most impactful areas that will help the team achieve success
A big part of this will be by collecting feedback from Fan Support, user testing & analysing data based on app usage & fan behaviour
Understanding the main problems, clearly communicating them & documenting requirements in a detailed manner in JIRA
Ensuring the experience is great regardless where in the world a fan is
Presenting updates to the wider company, keeping stakeholders up to date with developments & ensuring various teams are on the same page on what’s being worked on and why
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
A clear prioritisation framework; there’s always more that can be done, but what’s most impactful? Preferably you achieve this by always putting the fan first
Worked closely with iOS, Android, Web & Backend devs; having ensured priorities were clear & worked through questions they had
Having managed an iOS/Android/Web application (all 3 would be ideal)
Has a UX background & utilises this to ensure a quality fan experience
The ability to inspire, motivate and lead engineers and designers
You won’t have any direct reports, but you will be working alongside other product managers & will be responsible for this part of the fan experience

Job Description Summary:
Grant Thornton's Business Risk Services (BRS) provides the advice necessary to help clients manage risk and improve their business performance. Our professionals can deliver objective, value-added solutions that will enable clients to strengthen internal controls and governance processes, implement sound organisational strategies, increase technological capabilities and improve their operational efficiency.
Job Description:
Let’s talk about the job
If you enjoy working on a wide-reaching range of projects that will help businesses and communities flourish, you’ll fit right in. Here are some things you can expect.
Making quality second nature. This means doing what’s right even when no one’s looking. The work that you will do has a major impact on our clients and our firm. We pride ourselves on the high-level standards we have for the work that we do.
Own your own work. – Lead from the front in-regards to delivering client work, engaging the Cyber & Payments Risk team and greater Grant Thornton teams to ensure correct skill utilisation on all projects.
Be a part of a team – Take responsibility for developing more junior team members, understanding their carer aspiration and support in this delivery.
Build your brand – Engenders trust and respect from the client by producing high quality tax advice accurately, delivering to expectations, responding quickly to client demands and delivering to deadlines. Is actively involved in client meetings, concisely and confidently answering client queries. Provides intelligent and creative solutions to client tax issues both reactively and proactively..
Skills to set you apart and the role
Here are a few more skills we are looking for. Don’t worry if you don’t tick every box. It’s important for us to support you in your role and help you to develop along the way.
What you’ll be doing:
Perform and manage technical cyber security and data protection audits and assurance work across a number of clients:
Ideally you will have:
Strong experience implementing or working with ISO 27001, NIST polices and framework
Good understanding of technical security architecture and cloud security.
Strong understanding of cyber security and data security risks and controls;
Good understanding of audit processes, preferably with audit experience;
Strong knowledge of frameworks, standards and regulatory requirements related to information security and data protection;
Good technical knowledge of network security, key IT technologies, commercial security management and monitoring tools and services;
Good knowledge of current and emerging cyber security risks;
Excellent documentation and reporting skills.
Who we're looking for:
Passionate about supporting, advising and helping businesses achieve their potential, you’ll be someone who wants to make a difference and shape your career. You’ll have strong technical skills and experience of providing clients with quality services.
Do you care about the same things we do?
We have six values we work by. When we meet, we’ll want you to show us how they’re important to you, too.
Collaboration: We work together, share ideas and always make time to help each other out.
Leadership: Everyone has the chance to lead their own projects.
Excellence: Quality is central to our purpose. We love what we do, and it shows. We sweat the details. We see things through, no matter how tricky.
Agility: The world moves quickly. To keep up, we stay flexible – changing approaches, changing projects, working offline, online, together and alone to get things done.
Respect: A given, of course: we value each other and our clients. We listen, we understand, we care.
Responsibility: The decisions we make and advice we give affects people’s lives and livelihoods. We take that seriously and always do well by doing what’s right.
Share ideas and profits
Unlike most firms, we’re also a shared enterprise. So when the firm does well, everyone does well by taking home a share of the profits. Of course, to get those profits, we need to share ideas and share responsibility for our work, too.
Bring your whole self
Now you’ve seen our values, it shouldn’t be a surprise that we’re creating a respectful, open, diverse place to work. Building an inclusive culture, where we value difference and respect our colleagues, is not just the right thing to do, it helps our people to perform at the best of their ability and realise their potential.
“We are committed to making sure that the opportunities within our firm are equally accessible for everyone – regardless of background or gender.” Dave Dunckley, CEO
There’s more to life than work
Families, children, sports, night classes…the things you do and the people you’re with outside work matter. They can inspire, motivate and energise you. Inside the office and out. So if you’d like to work flexibly, let us know. We’re happy to look at flexible working options for all our roles, and we’ll always do our best to keep your work and life in balance.
View our video below to see what life is like at Grant Thornton.
Life at Grant Thornton

Title:

Global Markets Operations Manager

Company:

Everest International Insurance

Job Category:

Underwriting

Job Description:

Why join us

Everest is a leading global reinsurance and insurance organization with extensive product and distribution capabilities, a strong balance sheet and an innovative culture. Throughout our history, Everest has maintained its discipline and focus on creating long term value through underwriting excellence and strong risk and capital management.

Our strength is in our people

At Everest, we believe that our future is determined by the actions we take today. Actions that go beyond business strategy and encompass the values important to our employees and the communities in which we operate. Everest’s value commitments include: providing an inclusive work environment that offers employees the opportunity to further their development, supporting our communities through the donation of time and financial resources, maintaining our integrity across all aspects of the group, and being an industry innovator to solve global complex risks.

Job Purpose

To provide support services to the Global Markets underwriting teams and overseeing the underwriting support staff in performing:

Data input and record keeping

Production of operational and management information

Creation and maintenance of documented procedures

Promoting the continuous improvement of productivity, service quality, data quality and customer satisfaction

Process change resulting from regulatory change, market reform or adoption of best practice

Business systems support and training

Maintaining internal & external business relationships including management of 3rd party service providers

Key Accountabilities

Oversee the Global Markets business unit’s Underwriting Analysts and Assistants’, monitor that underwriting support services are delivered to the agreed quality and defined service levels.

Oversee the day-to-day operational management of the Global Markets business unit to ensure adequate control of underwriting, premium, claim and reinsurance processes. Monitor that the Global Markets business unit’s systems and procedures are consistent with Everest “best practice”.

Oversee the day-to-day operational management of all 3rd party BPO partners/providers to ensure adequate delivery of services in line with defined service level agreements and Everest “best practice”.

Work with the Delegated Authority Manager to ensure all Binders are managed in accordance with the Everest Delegated Authority framework, Asta Delegated Authority framework and local country regulatory frameworks.

Ensure that the monthly, quarterly and year-end business timetable is adhered to for the Global Markets business unit, ensuring effective communication with other departments and that all internal and external reporting deadlines are attained.

Produce operational reports and metrics, management information and other statistical data and analysis as required by the COO and Global Markets business unit underwriters in managing the business unit, reporting to committees, Everest Insurance Ireland Board, Asta Syndicate Board, and for brokers, clients and reinsurer presentations as may be required.

Produce exception reports and act on them in a timely manner to ensure accurate risk details are maintained on Everest Underwriting System(s) including premium estimates, exposures, reinsurance cessions and regulatory/business coding.

Work with the COO to achieve operational efficiencies within the Global Markets business unit by the progressive implementation of common systems, working practices, service levels and procedures. Implement process change resulting from regulatory change, market reform or adoption of best practice.

Act as a coach for all systems training and the 1st line of support for all systems issues to enable underwriters to effectively use the systems, tools and resources at their disposal.

Act as a focal point for the Global Markets business unit on systems projects by co-ordinating the business and technical input into requirements specifications, test plans & procedural documentation.

Co-ordinate administration support to underwriters to include attending the Lloyd’s box, organising client meetings and other ad hoc duties as required.

To build and maintain a programme for staff development, promoting self-management, personal development and career progression.

Develop and maintain good working relationships with the Global Markets business unit(s) underwriting staff and key Everest stakeholders, all external customers including Asta, brokers, coverholders, reinsurers, local country regulators and 3rd party service providers.

Any other ad hoc duties or tasks as defined and agreed with the COO.

Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills & Business Experience

Management level Operations experience with a Lloyd’s Managing Agent/Insurance Co.

Superior stakeholder management at all levels.

Professional qualification, e.g. ACII or equivalent experience.

Outstanding communication, both written and verbal.

Experience of managing 3rd party BPO providers.

Ability to lead, motivate, mentor and manage people.

Ability to think proactively and offer solutions to problems.

Ability to understand the bigger picture and visualise the end-to-end process of transactions.

Extensive technology experience including PAS, DMS, Workflow and MS Office suite.

Strong analytical and control skills to ensure integrity of data, ability to audit and self-audit.

Strong project management, prioritisation and time keeping skills.

Type:

Regular

Time Type:

Full time

Primary Location:

London

Additional Locations:

As an effective team member, the for Everest Insurance must champion the Everest Insurance Culture:

• Collaboration: Open and transparent communication with customers and colleagues
• Thoughtful Assumption of Risk: Supporting the Everest goal of carefully writing profitable business by ensuring data quality, prompt and accurate feedback to Underwriters, and operational control throughout the enterprise.
• Execution: Delivering outstanding support to the organization through strong day-to-day business operations, effective project management, and careful oversight of vendors.
• Humility: Caring and respectful approach to service colleagues, customers, and the community.
• Leadership: By example, every day.

Avantia is a fast-paced, private equity owned business. We provide home insurance directly to online consumers and specialise in the UK non-standard market. Our vision is to deliver the world’s most intelligent property insurance. We are making great strides in achieving this by developing a rating engine and machine learning platform that rapidly adapts to new data sources, enabling risk and retail price optimization.

As the saying goes, we’re small but perfectly formed, in that we’re a diverse group of industry professionals, technologists, data scientists and customer champions. We each bring our individual expertise, an appetite for innovation and a shared ambition to do something extraordinary. And, although each week brings new challenges, every week we work as a team to meet them. Our newly re-fitted office in South West London aids this, with plenty of break out space to enable teams from across the business to work together and genuinely make a difference to the overall business.

Our values should give you a sense of our culture, these are not just words on walls, they are a genuine reflection of how we strive to operate:

Adventurous: Wethink big. We try new things. We are always curious.

Agile: We change. We innovate. We find a way through.

Empowered: We trust each other. We work together. We are a small team doing big things.

Working in a fast-paced environment where change happens regularly is part and parcel of the business. But there is also lots of opportunity to enjoy your time outside of work and helping to achieve the right balance for you, is really important to us.

Interested? Read on to find out more about joining our team…

Key Responsibilities

This is a brand-new role created to vendor manage a recently appointed TPA. The role holder will be responsible for delivering a seamless customer experience and commercially minded approach to claims management. Key to the role will be the management of our outsourced claims handler to ensure our we operate with a best-in-class claims operation.

Deliver the HomeProtect Service Experience and Customer Culture:
Ensure the operation is always appropriately resourced by leading the forecasting process, to agree resource requirements and confirm the delivery plan is aligned to these requirements.
Oversee the performance against agreed operational KPI’s, work with the operation to identify any gaps and work with the operation to improve performance.
Maintain sufficient oversight of the team handling HomeProtect claims to ensure the required quality and experience is in place.
Work with the operation to ensure the team deliver a customer experience in line with HomeProtect’ s expectation – working in conjunction with our Customer Experience team and the delivery teams to identify opportunities to further improve, in-line with our Customer Strategy.
Chair the Assurance meetings working with stakeholders across the businesses to develop and delivery complaint and Quality Assurance improvement plans.
Support the Head of Claims & Supply chain in the delivery of the Claims Strategy.
Deliver and demonstrate best in class indemnity control:
Be aware of household claims market, industry trends and new entrants and introduce relevant process improvements where applicable.
Analise our claims data to identify opportunities to tighten our indemnity control without detriment to the end consumer; work with the operation to update or create claims handling philosophies and ensure these are adhered to.
Work with internal/External auditors to implement any improvements to working practices following audit feedback.
Chair the indemnity review meetings to have complete oversight of our indemnity spend by peril against our expectation and prior performance, identify anomalies and work with the delivery teams to understand/address them.
Support the operation dealing with technical referrals on claims reserved up to £250k.
Evidence strong Relationship Management capabilities:
Develop deep working relationships with the management of the delivery teams – align on objectives and take a collaborative approach to issue resolution.
Engage frontline staff to ensure they feel fully engaged with HomeProtect are bought into our customer strategy.
Produce high-level claims summaries to provide an overview of claims performance to be presented internally (within our Monthly Claims Business Review) and to our capacity partners (Monthly Business Review).
Requirements

Experience:
You should have at least a good level of experience in an operational claims leadership role, handling UK household claims.
CII or CIPS qualifications are preferred.
You should have evidential experience of driving customer and commercial improvements into a desk handling team and will be able to articulate the results of this work.
Analytical & hands on:
You will have, as a minimum, an intermediate understanding of MS office programs, including excel.
You will be able to extract meaningful business insights from granular claims MI to inform and improve our claims handling philosophies and meaningful trend analysis to our Underwriting colleagues.
Understand emerging technology capabilities for delivery of claims analytics and seek introduction where appropriate.
Relationship Management:
You understand that key to being successful in your role requires others to deliver for you – as such you will have strong relationship management skills and a track record of influencing others to deliver your requirements.
Benefits

We think we have a great company culture and welcome new team members with open arms. We also offer an attractive range of benefits, like:
The opportunity to work alongside brilliant people, because this isn’t something that every organisation can offer!
Great, supportive managers whose primary purpose is to help you do the best job you can
Opportunities to focus on your personal growth, we want you to develop and build your long-term career with us.
Casual dress code, because we want you to feel relaxed and comfortable
Life insurance
Annual discretionary bonus scheme
Discounted home insurance for you, your friends and your family
Pension contribution
Retail discounts
Free fruit and coffee
In-house wellbeing programme and portal
On top of that we also offer all the standard stuff, like:
25 days’ holiday
Life insurance
Annual discretionary bonus scheme
Discounted home insurance for you, your friends and your family
Pension contribution
Retail discounts
Free fruit and coffee
In-house wellbeing programme and portal
Have we captured your imagination? If so, we’d love to hear from you!

Job Summary
Senior site role that operates as a leader to plan, implement, assure and improve the Business Management System (BMS) to meet the needs & expectations of the sites interested parties and therefore maintain all associated certification and regulatory approvals. To provide the guidance, governance and expertize to the site leadership team to nurture a culture of Quality in all site activities, ensure quality compliance and support the delivery of the site business objectives
Job Responsibilities
Working collaboratively with the site Senior Leadership Team to create and sustain a Quality culture and provide appropriate governance and assurance leadership

Planning, implementation, maintenance and continuous improvement of the site Business Management System (BMS) as a complementary extension to the GKNA Global BMS and in compliance with global BMS governance

Ensuring that the local BMS meets all requirements for programmes, customer needs and third party requirements within the defined scope of the site BMS

Systemic analysis of Business Management Systems data to the site Management Review process ensuring effective, data based, factual inputs to business decisions

Ensuring the site’s audit requirements are integral to the Regional Audit Manager plans, ensuring compliance with BMS internal, customer (2nd party) and external (3rd party) audit requirements and delivering on site follow up activities

Planning, conducting & follow up activities (including systemic analysis of risk/opportunity) of product audit as required by the programmes and activities within the scope of the BMS

Systemic risk management and mitigation for the business management systems with focus on quality and quality compliance

Escalating any BMS risks to the Site Leadership and if appropriate the Regional Director of BMS and for support/co-ordination of appropriate actions to mitigate/address these risks

Coordination, planning, hosting and leadership to ensure successful outcome of all Customer (2nd party) & Certification Body (3rd party) audits and assessments, Supporting Site Local Business Process Managers (LBPM) in resolving any issues raised as part of the audits

Act as the site representation on business management systems and Quality compliance related matters with Customers, Certifying Bodies and Aerospace Authorities

Directing Local Business Process Managers (LBPM) to ensure the adoption of the GKNA Global BMS, adapting and tailoring the local BMS processes that control and improve effectiveness and efficiency, to support the business objectives

Planning and management of the system requirements for hosting and deployment of the local BMS, its stated processes & associated controls and for training people who will be defining/utilising its functions

Recording and measuring of any defined Site Business Management Systems Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and for taking the actions necessary to improve

Managing Continuous Improvement of the BMS as well as forward planning on the integration of new regulation/specification requirements

We are looking for a Product Manager to come revolutionize search marketing with us. This position is a temporary 9 month contract. You’ll be an integral part of the team, growing the Adthena analytics platform including the web application and API. You’ll take responsibility for positive business outcomes, working closely with every discipline to drive the product’s market success.

Every day is an adventure when you are solving market problems in close collaboration with design, engineering, and data science, focusing on driving positive outcomes for our customers and our business. We’re looking for someone with grit and a passion for solving problems, who loves a fast-paced environment and is more interested in creating a great product than polishing a feature deck.

Product at Adthena
You’ll be part of Adthena’s Product team, working with the very best of AI specialists in London. Team members have previously worked on Blockchain, Healthcare AI and Computational Advertising. They all share a passion for user-centric design and harnessing the power of data to find innovative solutions to customer problems.

Our Product team is focused on three areas:
We are restlessly discovering the areas where we can make the most difference for our customers and our business. Everything we build is tied to and measured by the value and outcome it brings our users and buyers as well as its impact on our objectives.

Figuring out what we need to build and prioritising when we build it is a core responsibility. We bring the vision and context to empower great decisions, so we focus on posing the right questions rather than dictating detailed solutions. This involves ensuring that potential risks are mitigated such as value, feasibility, usability and viability risks.

We believe in a collaborative partnership where Product focuses on customer and business outcomes, while Engineering, Design and Data Science focus on how we get there. Product’s main role in execution is to be the voice of the market and make sure we achieve what we set out to do by being the glue that binds teams together. We communicate the “who, what, why and when” to the company and work closely with Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success to ensure our customers’ success.

Note: This posting is for candidates willing and able to work from London. If you are seeking an opportunity to work remotely in a different area, apply to the same position in the remote category. Please avoid applying to both.
Main Responsibilities and Activities:
You’ll contribute to the product vision and direction to achieve Adthena’s key objectives and communicate it to the wider business.
You’ll take ownership of your own objectives and product area, taking on the responsibility for business and customer outcomes.
You’ll engage in market, competitive, and user research to deeply understand customer’s needs and problems. Always represent the voice of the customer.
You’ll contribute to the product roadmap by prioritizing the main areas of focus for your products based on user and buyer value, business viability, and time to impact.
You’ll ideate and collaborate closely with design, development, and data science to come up with and test innovative solutions to problems that work for our customers and our business.
You’ll contribute to the product development lifecycle by gathering customer feedback, writing and prioritising user stories, and ensuring the customer’s needs are met through constant iteration.
You’ll measure and report on user success based on usage statistics, analytics, and feedback.
Requirements
You’ve worked as a product manager on the full lifecycle of digital products.
You have working experience with market research to understand and clearly articulate to the business a market opportunity, competitive analysis, or customer need or problem.
You have worked with user experience teams focused on user-centered design and development teams working in Agile or Kanban.
You work effectively with cross functional teams including recommending controversial approaches to management.
You’re obsessed with the customers and market, always seeking to learn and discover more.
You always champion the customer, market, and product vision to everyone in the building and constantly gather feedback from everyone.
You have a track record of coming up with creative, innovative solutions to needs that customers didn’t even know they had.
You’re a problem solver who likes to have full ownership of an outcome, rolls up their sleeves, and gets shit done.
Bonus Points
You have working experience managing B2B SaaS solutions.
You have built business cases and worked on value-based pricing.
You are accustomed to working with data scientists, or AI product developers.
You’re interested in behavioural science.
You have a technical background with hands-on experience in software development on mobile or web technologies.
You have a passion for machine learning and predictive modelling.
Core Values:
Get Shit Done
Freedom with Responsibility
Smart and Always Improving
Deliver Remarkable Quality

Butler Rose is pleased to be working in partnership with a company in London in the search for a Finance Systems Manager on a full-time permanent basis.

As the Finance Systems Manager you will be an expert in SUN system and help maintain a robust control environment to enable efficient and timely reconciliation and postings are carried out, ensuring that finance systems are embedded into the full IT strategy.

Key responsibilities:

• Deliver subject matter expertise on the Sun accounting system and other allocated finance IT systems
• Be the Technical Administrator for Sun accounting systems and work with the IT department and support vendors to maintain the uptime of the relevant servers
• Project manage all changes to the Sun accounting system ensuring that the necessary consultation, testing and user acceptance sign off is carried out as required
• Prepare and maintain the manual and user guide for the Sun accounting system and any other finance IT systems
• Manage and maintain the chart of accounts and business rules in the Sun accounting system
• Build a suite of standard and ad-hoc reports using Infor Query & Analysis, SUN SRS, SQL Server and Tableau for finance and business users
• Set and maintain standards for data governance and produce guidelines in respect of data integrity and data quality

Key attributes required:

• Qualified Accountant (ACA/ACCA/CIMA or equivalent)
• Solid experience maintaining the finance IT system aspects of the Sun accounting system
• Significant experience of implementing and maintaining a robust finance IT systems control environment
• Highly experienced in working with large volumes of financial transactions on computerised financial systems
• Ability to deliver training to staff on all finance systems, in both groups and one to one settings
• Clear understanding of the regulatory framework of accounting
• Experience in analysing and extracting data from SQL databases
• Strong IT skills to include Word and Advanced Excel capability

Butler Rose is committed to equality in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer.
Butler Rose Ltd is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

Our Organisation

NHS England and NHS Improvement came together on 1 April 2019 as a new single organisation. The NHS Long Term Plan focuses on delivering integrated care to patients at the local level and we can best support the NHS to deliver this as a single integrated organisation.

At the NHS, we are reminded every day of how important life is. As a flexible working friendly organisation, we want to be sure that you can work in a way that is best for us and for our patients, and for you. Speak to us about how we might be able to accommodate a flexible working arrangement whether that’s job share, part time or another flexible pattern. In addition, although the role advertised may have an ‘home’ office base indicated, we remain committed to supporting flexibility around workplace locations. If it works for the service, we will do our best to make it work for you.

Our new operating model represents a strong shift to regional delivery supported by expert corporate teams. Local health systems are supported by our integrated regional teams who play a major leadership role in the geographies they manage.

We are jointly committed to creating and maintaining a fair and supportive working environment and culture, where contributions are fully recognised and valued by all and staff feel empowered to carry out their duties to the best of their abilities. As employers we are committed to promoting and protecting the physical and mental health and well-being of all our staff. This underpins our values as set out in the NHS Constitution, supports us to be an Employer of Choice and ultimately enables our employees to support the effective care of our patients.

An exciting opportunity has arisen to help to help transform the quality of mental health (MH) programmes and services across the East of England.

As Quality Improvement Manager (Transformation), the post holder will work as part of a dynamic team in supporting MH Programme and Clinical network activity. The post holder will support quality improvement in complex pathways of care through expertise in:

Developing effective clinical networks
Change management and quality improvement
Programme and project management.

The successful candidate will lead on elements of the Mental Health Crisis Pathway programme whilst also providing support to some other of the other work streams within the Adult Mental Health Regional Programme.

The Regional Mental Health Programme team, undertake a broad programme of activities to support commissioners and providers with their core purpose of quality improvement and ultimately benefit patient and population health outcomes.

The post is responsible for providing professional expertise to optimise business processes for the Mental Health Programme team.

The post holder will define current processes, facilitate discussions and advise colleagues as to how best practice might be adopted in the definition of future processes, document those processes as they are agreed and support their delivery.

Shortlisting will be completed within one week of the advert closing, with interviews taking place during the following fortnight (ie within 3 weeks of the advert close date).

This is a short term contract due to the nature of the work and national funding, with the possibility for extension beyond a year.

This role involves providing policy and legal leadership of data legislation matters, delivering the supervisory, audit and advisory functions of the Data Protection Officer, leading the work of the organisation around data ethics, and engaging with internal and external stakeholders to build and maintain public confidence about how the organisation acquires, accesses, manages, stores, and uses data for the public good.

The DGLP Branch plays an important role in helping the UK Statistics Authority to fulfil its strategic objectives to harness the potential of data and maximise its impact in ways which are ethical, transparent and for the public good. The UKSA’s strategy “Statistics for the public good” looks to build flexible and integrated analytical capabilities to address COVID-19 and other priorities and enable the organisation to manage data and deliver analysis that cuts across organisational boundaries. To support data integration, the ONS is currently developing an Integrated Data Platform reaching across Government.

This will transform statistical data analysis capabilities through technology and methods to better support public service policymaking and the delivery of Government priorities. The Integrated Data Platform will ensure analysis can be carried out, legally and ethically, across Government in line with priority needs; with appropriate data being made available to the research and academic community to support this analysis.

Responsibilities
Reporting to the Data Protection Compliance Manager, the primary focus of the role is to provide ONS and UKSA with data protection advice in the development and operation of the new Integrated Data Platform. You will also support the Data Protection team in a wide-ranging programme of reviews to audit the organisation’s compliance (including the Integrated Data Platform) with data protection legislation (the Data Protection Act 2018, and the General Data Protection Regulation) to identify good practice and any risks arising. You will work closely with other teams, including Legal Services, Knowledge and Information Management, Security, Risk and Internal Audit, as well as operational and analytical teams supporting the delivery of the integrated data programme.

You will also have opportunities to work flexibly across DGLP, adapting to address priority issues and responding to dynamic business needs.

Responsibilities of the post will include:
• Assisting the Data Protection Compliance Manager with planning and scoping the terms of reference for individual compliance audit assignments.
• Completion of fieldwork and producing high quality, clearly drafted, robust evidence-based reports for review and provide constructive feedback on key findings to the auditees following completion of each audit via a debrief meeting.
• Provide advice, guidance and support to stakeholders and across the organisation (in particular the Integrated Data Platform and programme) to help meet the requirements of data protection legislation.
• Maintain data protection compliance action plans to ensure compliance issues are monitored to completion, and complete a programme of follow up reviews to ensure compliance issues have been satisfactorily resolved.
• Establishing strong and effective working relationships with senior leaders and colleagues across the UK Statistics Authority and Office for National Statistics, to maximise awareness and understanding of data protection legislation and the importance of compliance with the legislation and related organisational policies and procedures.
• Assisting the Data Protection Compliance Manager in drafting papers, and providing advice, support and briefing within the Data Governance, Legislation and Policy Branch’s remit and to the Data Protection Officer.

Person Specification

Essential Skills
• You will have an understanding of data protection legislation and/or experience working within external or internal audit
• You will have experience in developing and delivering projects or audit assignments from planning through to reporting
• You will have strong communication skills including excellent report writing
• You will be able to take responsibility for delivering high quality, accurate work
• You will be self-motivated and organise own workload to ensure effective delivery of work within deadlines
• You will have experience of influencing and working with a wide range of stakeholders, and can build and maintain strong business relationships
• You will be able to demonstrate experience of thriving in deadline driven environments, with the ability to prioritise complex and competing tasks on an ongoing basis
• You will have strong interpersonal skills and be an enthusiastic and hard-working individual and team player
• Completion of in-depth Data Protection Practitioner training (and a willingness to complete if not)

Desirable Skills
• Experience of risk based internal auditing
Behaviours

We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:

Communicating and Influencing
Managing a Quality Service
Delivering at Pace
Working Together
Seeing the Big Picture
Technical skills

We'll assess you against these technical skills during the selection process:

UK data protection legal framework
Benefits

Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, our customers, having fun, and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of the journey!

Role

As a Partner GTM Strategy & Operations Manager, you will partner with the EMEA partner leader in designing the partner strategy aligned to Splunk overall business objectives. You will act as a liaison with the broader Sales Operations organization in driving all annual planning processes and you will be responsible to create an operating model and ad-hoc analytics as well as establish and maintain the rhythm of the business through monthly and quarterly business reviews. You will also engage in strategic initiatives at Global scale. You will ensure end results are achieved through aligning cross functional activities, setting clear goals and objectives, and working with functional owners. To be successful in this role, you will demonstrate your business acumen in combination with a deep understanding of processes to guide decision-making, tackle problems operationally, and provide analytical insight and business judgment to support key initiatives across our business. You know how to translate strategy into execution by affecting change across people, process, technology, data, policy, etc. You have an appreciation for simplification and increasing the ease of doing business - and you are known for rolling up your sleeves to co-create high-quality solutions with business and technical teams.
You are a guru and SME when it comes to analyzing complex problems and you use these skills to measure performance and surface insights into future improvements.

Responsibilities

As the Business Operations lead, you will report directly to the Director, Partner Strategy and Operations, partner with the EMEA Partner leader and have indirect alignment with the Director, Sales Strategy & Operations for EMEA.
Become the business partner to the EMEA Partner Sales leader and drive the operational cadence, including data preparation and analytics for monthly or quarterly business review, annual fiscal planning and more.
Design, develop, maintain and improve critical business dashboard and drive management visibility to support of Splunk’s Partner business efforts and outcomes. Provide leadership insights and recommendations based on the data.
Establish an operating model in partnership with Partner Theater leaders to drive the rhythm of the business for the Americas, inclusive of Public Sector, and assigned Global initiatives. (Forecasting, Monthly Performance check-ins, gap to plan, quarterly business reviews, etc.)
Be the subject matter expert (SME) for Americas and Public Sector leadership for all Partner related operational norms, business data, and operational systems.
Provide operational support through business insights.
Leverage dashboards and ad hoc reporting to drive decision making, track business growth, and allow for advanced business pipeline visibility.
Design and perform analyses incorporating quantitative methods, detecting outliers, and identifying data quality issues across multiple tools and environments.
Collaborate with cross-functional GTM Operations teams to manage the impact of system changes and/or updates to the SFDC reporting environment.
Train and support Partner team to leverage reporting, tools and analysis provided.
Lead Global initiatives with Global Partner leaders and ensure proper and clear communication across Theaters and functions.
Maximise efficiency and effectiveness of partner programs, MDF, and other investments by providing correlation analysis and actionable insights.
Drive annual business planning in collaboration with other sales operations and cross functional teams (Territory planning, comp design, liaison with business units, customer success and other functions).
Self-starter and agile, with profound leadership and communication skills, integrity, high work capacity and executive presence.
Work effectively in matrix org structure, both at Theater and Global levels. Establish networks with peers and senior executives across various functions.

Requirements

Past experience in working as a Business Analyst preferable in finance or partner roles.
Demonstrates strong business acumen & solid understanding of working with partners and indirect organizations
Strong communication and collaboration skills. Highly analytical with attention to details.
Proven experience being successful in driving results through data outcomes
Experience working cross functionally to achieve business goals
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, business administration or relevant
Minimum of 5 years of related experience in business strategy, operations or consulting firms.
Knowledge of program/project management tools, methodologies, and practices.
Strong on execution to deliver high quality information to demanding deadlines.
Ability to translate vision and strategy into clear priorities and direction
Ability to manage conflicting priorities and stakeholders
An excellent understanding of both quantitative and qualitative information and the ability to combine these to form accurate and realistic forecasting and "views" of the business
Reporting and data analysis; able to visually represent data and processes in an easy to understand manner
Advanced Excel, Word and Powerpoint skills. SFDC, Tableau, SQL and other BI tools are a plus

We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

Reports to Director – Operational Resilience


The Operational Resilience Team is a relatively newly established cross-jurisdictional team within Aztec Group whose focus is Client related Internal Controls, Quality Assurance, Supplier Oversight and Business Continuity. A core part of the COO Office, this team will ensure our operations remain robust and resilient to the changing environment in which we operate.

The purpose of this position is to provide support across the Aztec Group on all matters concerning our Internal Controls Framework.

Key responsibilities:


Internal Controls
Provide insight and drive best practice in relation to Aztec’s internal control environment
Oversee the design and delivery of checklist/control updates and new procedures in response to areas such as changes in regulation/legislation, feedback from the business and new risks / incidents identified
Be a subject matter expert for controls to be implemented in new process / systems / areas ensuring that they are designed effectively to adequately manage identified risks.
Quality Assurance
Design and document a QA framework that can be applied to the business
Review and analysis of testing undertaken by other team members
Analysis of findings to provide thematic feedback and recommendations for control and other improvements
Undertake reporting on QA work
Other
Actively manage the performance and development of direct reports
Demonstrate effective communications with the team and the business providing regular reporting feedback so that all targets are met and stakeholders are engaged
Contribute towards the business as a whole, for instance, in identifying improvements and efficiencies that could apply across the business and liaising with the Business Improvement Team, IT and Risk teams to implement
Ad-hoc tasks that may be required to be undertaken as part of a COO office or as the business requires
Skills, knowledge, expertise:
Extensive practical experience in an internal controls or internal audit role within the financial services industry
Proven experience in managing and developing a team
A deep understanding of operational risk and internal controls appropriate to a regulated financial services business
A broad technical understanding of a wide range of platforms and technologies
Knowledge of ISAE3402 controls testing would be an advantage
Very high level of integrity and dependability
Strong internal and external communication and excellent interpersonal skills, together with the ability to develop good working relationships within the business
Positive and proactive approach
Logical approach and ability to analyse data
Solutions orientated critical thinking
Awareness of industry best practice
Proven ability to meet deadlines and proactively identify and deal with problems
We will provide further training for relevant technical knowledge and other management and leadership skills necessary to excel in the role and to enhance your professional development. You will need to be quick to learn new systems and great with people, as close working relationships between our colleagues and clients is at the heart of what we do.

WE PUSH THE BOUNDARIES OF MEDICINE.

LEAPING FORWARD TO MAKE PEOPLE SMILE

Everything we do at KKI, is rooted in the idea of leaping forward to make people smile. We are committed to innovation, for the benefit of the patients who count on us to support them. From medicines for rare and underserved diseases, to the support families need when facing a life-changing diagnosis – our team is proud of all we deliver, but also humble in knowing how much more needs to be done. Quality Assurance Manager

Kyowa Kirin International plc Galashiels, Marlow

UK

RESPONSIBILITIES:

To provide QA support for the manufacture of Kyowa Kirin’s products in order to ensure that each product is manufactured and supplied to the marketplace in compliance with cGMP requirements, Marketing Authorisations, company operating policies and procedures and business requirements.

To act as an UK QA point of contact for the importation of all product imported from EU to UK under RPI scheme ensuring the review and compliant release of all batches imported
Participate in the appropriate project management meetings in order to keep abreast of ongoing activities, identifying and addressing any gaps relating to product quality and GMP compliance including activities such as new CMO site selection, new product introductions and territory expansion
Prepare and maintain Technical (Quality) Agreements with third party contractor manufacturing organisations (CMOs) so that roles and responsibilities between the contracted parties are clearly defined and implemented
Review completed production batch records as necessary, approve master batch records, and other cGMP documents from CMOs / Contract Laboratories prior to release of product for sale and distribution
Regularly review non-conformances e.g. process deviations, out of specification/trend results etc at the CMO to ensure that resulting investigations have identified the root cause(s), that suitable reports have been written and that corrective and preventative actions (CAPAs) have been implemented within suitable time periods
To act as an UK QA point of contact for the importation of all product imported from EU to UK under RPI scheme
To carry out a review and approval of validation protocols and reports during Technical Transfer and process change activities in order to ensure that manufacturing processes and analytical procedures at the CMOs operate in a validated state
Ensure that all changes to GMP documents, processes, equipment and facilities are effectively managed through the CMO and KKI change control processes in order to maintain GMP and regulatory compliance
Ensure that an appropriate response has been provided by the CMO following investigation into customer complaints and that corrective and/or preventative actions have been implemented, as necessary, at the CMO facilities
To review customer complaints and reports in order to ensure that an appropriate response has been provided following an investigation and implementation of corrective actions, as necessary, at the third party contractor facilities and to actively participate in the review and recall of defective product in order to minimise patient risk
To ensure that for each product, a Product Quality Profile is maintained and provided, where relevant, to CMO’s Qualified Person (QP) so that product can be manufactured, controlled and released in compliance with the Marketing Authorisation
Participate in the review and recall of defective product, as necessary, in order to minimise patient risk
To review departmental standard operating procedures (SOPs) impacting upon GxP are reviewed by QA for content and compliance with the appropriate regulatory requirements
Ensure that GMP stability programmes are established, implemented and regular reports issued by the CMO(s), that trends in data and confirmed out of specification results are investigated and reported, as necessary, to QA management in compliance with cGMP and regulatory requirements
Provide regular reports of key performance indicators to senior management, as part of the Quality System, so that the appropriate resources can be allocated and corrective actions implemented, as necessary
Supports the distribution processes for all Kyowa Kirin products under the guidance of the RP and in adherence to GDP

QUALIFICATIONS:

A Life Science degree or equivalent
Excellent working knowledge of GxPs, especially in the interpretation of MHRA and FDA requirements, for the manufacture, control and distribution of commercial product and clinical trial materials
Solid experience working in a QA Specialist or Manager Role related to different types of pharmaceutical formulation types in a commercial environment
Experience working with medical device/combination products
Sound knowledge of QC and Stability chemical analytical testing techniques for parenteral and biologic products
Familiar with the regulatory requirements for validation activities as applied to manufacturing and packaging processes, analytical methods, cleaning procedures, computerised systems
Familiar with the appropriate EU Directives, EU and USA regulatory processes, ICH Guidelines
Familiar with Quality Management Systems e.g. ICH Q10

Physical Requirements:

Occasional Worldwide travel
As this can be a sedentary position the individual needs to be able to withstand long periods of sitting
Ability to use VDU equipment
A degree of flexibility needed with regards to rare occasions where working late/early might be required

Key Competencies specific to the role

Good interpersonal and communication skills
Good analytical and problem-solving skills
Team working
Working experience of Quality Systems
Ability to operate in a “virtual” pharmaceutical environment
Self-starter with a good eye for detail and ability to complete tasks/objectives
Kyowa Kirin Core Competencies: Results Oriented, Sense of Urgency and Flawless in Execution

BENEFITS:

In return for your talent, we will provide support through smart working, adopting best practice, deploying the latest technology and ongoing personal development. Plus:

Competitive salary
Bonus
Pension scheme
Private medical insurance

To meet the expectations of our patients and to truly deliver on our Commitment to Life, we are continually looking for people who embrace this spirit. We are committed to providing a culture that offers both inspiration and reward – in terms of compensation and in work satisfaction. And in turn, we want people who’ll bring their unique ideas and diverse approaches, while also aligning to our ultimate goal of making people smile. If this sounds like a company that aligns with your values, we’d love for you to join us in our efforts.

Description

The Quality Engineering Manager develops and implements quality plans, metrics, projects, and processes necessary to ensure Brooks Automation products are of the highest quality and drives a Zero Defect culture throughout the organization. Brooks product reliability, performance and quality must conform to established company, customer and regulatory requirements.

The Quality Engineering Manager will identify and coordinate cross-functional resources to eliminate quality discrepancies and implement long term Quality improvement plans.

Success in this role will require the ability to foster strong working relationships with functional leaders throughout the organization. The Quality Engineering Manager will work with Manufacturing, Engineering, Sales, Service, Program Management, Product Management, and Supplier representatives to ensure product quality requirements are met and constantly improve.

This specific role will be based in Brooks Life Sciences Wotton, UK site and reports directing to the Senior Vice President of Quality in Brooks Manchester, UK site. This Quality manager role will have ownership of quality for the Brooks Life Sciences C&I (Consumables & Instruments) product line. As Quality manager, this role will be a member of the C&I product leadership team and a member of the Wotton Site leadership team to contribute to the way the site operates.

Position Responsibilities and Key Focus Areas
Leads and coordinates cross-functional teams to achieve quality goals and implement robust corrective and systemic preventive actions
C&I Quality engineers in Manchester and Quality Control Technicians at the Wotton site will report to this position
Identifies and ensures quality requirements are met in new product introductions
Leads quality meetings with site and corporate leadership
Leads problem solving teams utilizing 8D methodology
Manages failure analysis, report generation, customer reviews and local audits
Provides Quality support to Brooks Manufacturing sites and Contract Manufacturers
Conducts Data Analysis and prepares metrics detailing field product quality.
Collect, treat and interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques
Identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Works with staff as necessary to enhance data capture and analysis in support of internal and external quality improvement and reporting efforts as needed
Serves as a resource of aggregating, analyzing, and displaying statistical data
Leads the specification of quality assurance tests; and performs statistical analysis to assess the cost of and determine responsibility for, products or materials that do not meet required standards and specifications.
Assists in the process for ensuring that corrective actions (CAPA) are completed in accordance with relevant ISO requirements (ISO 13485) and that documentation is complete and compliant with requirements
Support all company safety and quality programs and initiatives
Education/Background/Qualifications
B.S. or higher in a technical discipline is required with at least five years of professional work experience as a Quality Manager supporting technical products, experienced in injection molding would be advantageous
Experience with Life Science products and contract manufacturing desired. Medical device regulatory experience, which would include experience of ISO 14971, would also be advantageous
Must be able to demonstrate the application and appropriate use of statistical methods and tools (such as DOE, Hypothesis Testing, ANOVA, Gauge R&R, Statistical Process Control, Capability analyses, Weibull etc.).
Ability to present options and suggestions leading to business level decision making founded in sound data driven analysis
Ability to lead directly and indirectly across multiple sites and prioritize multiple tasks on an on-going basis
Excellent organizational and communication skills, both verbal and written
Proficient in using Oracle, Microsoft Word, Access, Excel, PowerPoint, Minitab and report writing software
Desire to work in a fast paced environment
Willingness to travel up to 25% both Domestic and International

ROLE SUMMARY

Science is the foundation of all that we do at Pfizer. We are seeking a Sr. Manager, Data Science who will join a diverse team of dedicated professionals driven to significantly improve the lives of patients through his/her/their work at a company whose culture is committed to developing and nurturing diverse talent so that each colleague has the opportunity to build a fulfilling career. Regulatory Quality Assurance (RQA) is an independent Quality audit function within the Compliance division, accountable to identify risks and non-compliance associated with Pfizer’s GxP regulated operations. In this role, the Sr. Manager, Data Science will be responsible for leading the delivery and execution of the Good Practice (GXP) digital and data science projects in support of risk management, quality strategy, GXP audit strategy and governance goals and objectives.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES

Digital Strategy / Data Science
Defines and develops data science infrastructure and capabilities including data lake build; data lake co-ownership to ensure robust/validated technical process
Contributes to the design and execution of a hypothesis driven analytics strategy across quality business lines that ensures a strategic, optimized and consistent approach (data standards) to metrics, thresholds, etc. that meet stakeholder needs
Works with QMS Oversight and analytics team to develop and construct complex analytics (KRIs / KPIs / other); communicates findings/insights/trends to applicable functions
Assesses and ensures data quality / validation procedures including documentation, storage (per policies)
Leads the implementation of technology advancements including NLP, AI, etc. (including external benchmarking to pharma and other tech advanced companies)
Uses design processes to ensure integration data are connected to Risk Strategy processes
Provides objective assessments to assist leadership in prioritizing investments in data-science capabilities/projects
Assists GXP audit teams in exploring methodologies to enhance audit strategy based on emerging innovation and technology advancements
Manages and maintains dashboards and reports to support the business
Operational Excellence
Accountable for timely delivery of the digital / data science strategies
Collaborates with RQA leadership, peers and internal stakeholders to drive alignment and execute purposeful digital strategy
Works to ensure quality standards are consistently applied across the program or region
Proactively identifies and drives opportunities for improvement within RQA
Maintains current knowledge of industry trends that impact data science capabilities and strategies
Monitors and maintains expertise in area(s) of focus
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

Candidate demonstrates a breadth of diverse leadership experiences and capabilities including: the ability to influence and collaborate with peers, develop and coach others, oversee and guide the work of other colleagues to achieve meaningful outcomes and create business impact.
Advanced academic qualification/degree in data science / statistics / computer science is required (e.g. PhD); equivalent relevant professional experience will be considered
8+ years of relevant experience in data science and analytical tools/techniques/technologies
Project management experience with proven accountability, and demonstrated excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation, influencing, and problem-solving capabilities a plus
Ability to function autonomously in a matrix model and in a team environment
Proven ability to think innovatively and to execute strategic plans pursuant to the responsibilities of the role
Knowledge of GXPs / quality

Sunshine Act

Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.

Securing data from internal and external attack
Offering users appropriate support and advice

Contributing to organisational policy regarding quality standards and strategic planning
Managing security processes and ISO 27001 accreditation
Being hands-on with systems
What were looking for:
Experience in Office365 administration
Experience in SharePoint implementation and administration

Strong leadership skills
Co-operation skills and the ability to work as part of a team

Ability to manage a team of individuals, each a specialist in their own area
About Support Revolution:

We are a fun, energetic company that likes to reward hard-working employees. As well as a competitive compensation package, we provide a range of flexible benefits from Perkbox; including discounts on many retail outlets, gym membership, and discounted health and dental care. We now have an opportunity for an Investment Operations Manager to join us on a fixed-term contract (FTC) until May 2021. This role is part of our Investment Reporting team within Investment Operations. The team works with a range of investment related partners both internally and externally to Aviva and seeks to be a point of operational excellence within AFO (Aviva Finance Operations).

The Investment Reporting team has responsibility for the sourcing, validation and reporting of accurate investment asset data to cover the wide range of assets held by Aviva markets. Key downstream uses include actuarial asset stressing, regulatory and statutory reporting, credit risk reporting and internal investment management and ALM. These processes rely on high quality accurate data to avoid potential financial losses, regulatory breaches and reputational issues in the marketplace.

The main purpose of this role is to be responsible for the management of the Investment Reporting Operations team - to ensure the quality of deliverables. The role is also responsible for supporting a strong and robust control framework and the ongoing relationships with relevant internal business partners and external service providers.

Aviva use “smart-working” in 2020, and the person in this role can be based anywhere in the UK, as long as they are comfortable regularly travelling to our York offices.

The role’s duties & responsibilities:
Managing a team of Investment Operation and System Analysts, providing management and oversight to a range of deliverables (Investment data controls, mappings, data population and query/issue management)
Monitoring, reviewing and supporting the analysts’ outputs daily
Leading on the resolution of escalated issues and queries
Maintaining positive relationships with internal and external business partners
Working closely with the wider Investment Reporting team to ensure potential issues are communicated and understood
Skills & experiences required:
IOC (Investment Operations Certificate) or equivalent investment qualification is needed
Experience working in an investment operations environment
Line management experience is crucial
Review and quality control deliverables built around business requirements
Assess, process, and filter large amounts of sophisticated information quickly and determine or propose appropriate actions as necessary
Working with large and complex datasets
Excellent collaboration skills with the proven ability to draw on the collective strength of others
What will you get for this role?
A salary up to £45,000 depending on location, skills, experience and qualifications
Generous defined contribution pension scheme
Annual performance related bonus and pay review
Holiday allowance of 29 days plus bank holidays and the option to buy/sell up to 5 additional days
Up to 40% discount for some Aviva products through “My Aviva Extras” plus discounts for Friends and Family (some exclusions apply)
Excellent range of flexible benefits to include a matching share save scheme
Working at Aviva

At Aviva, we’re people with a purpose. To be with you today, for a better tomorrow.

We bring this to life by ensuring managing risk is at the heart of the way we all work. We love people who do the right thing for our customers, and our colleagues. We want people who speak up, who take ownership, and who make good decisions.

The way we do this is important too. We always ‘Care More’. It’s our thing. We’re all about our people – that’s you – so we can be pretty flexible. If you want to work from home some of the time or change your hours so you can pick up your kids or care for someone in your family, we’re very open to that. In fact, we don’t advertise roles as either part or full time, because we know each person has different needs, just as each business area has different needs. So, it’s up to you to discuss working hours during your interview.

We care deeply about being inclusive and that means we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We want our employees to bring their whole self to work and that starts with you.

We interview every disabled applicant* that meets the minimum criteria for the job. Just send us an email once you’ve applied stating that you have a disclosed disability, and we’ll make sure we interview you.

We’d love it if you could submit your application online. If you require an alternative method of applying, please give Daniel Hopchet a call on 0121 234 7625 or send an email to Daniel.Hopchet@Aviva.com.

*As defined in The Equality Act 2010*. By ‘minimum criteria’ we mean you should provide us with evidence which demonstrates that you generally meet the level of competence required and have the qualifications, skills or experience defined as essential to perform the role.

Company Description

Marshall Aerospace and Defence Group is one of the largest independent aerospace and defence companies in the world delivering innovation and excellence in engineering, support solutions and services in the air, on land and at sea.

Since 1909, we have been valued for our integrity, performance and customer focus which we have demonstrated through our innovative solutions and ability to deliver on time and to cost.

We specialise in the conversion and modification of military, civil and business aircraft, alongside defence vehicle engineering and shelter manufacture. Our capabilities include engineering design, manufacture, test and the provision of personnel, training and advice, whilst providing maintenance, integration and product support.

Within our land systems capability, we have designed, manufactured, delivered and supported more than 5000 tactical shelters in over 200 different configurations.

Marshall Aerospace and Defence Group is part of the Marshall Group of Companies that employs over 6,000 people with a turnover in excess of £2.7bn.

We are a respected total solutions provider for the military and commercial sectors.

About us

We are Zip, a rapidly expanding global fintech headquartered out of Sydney, Australia.

We're here to simplify how the world pays for what they need by connecting merchants with consumers and offering them fair and seamless payment solutions, everywhere.

Our values are at the heart of everything we do. They form our Mamba mentality - how we’re better than yesterday, and are used to create game-changing experiences for our customers and our people.

WHAT YOU OWN AND SUPPORT

The New Markets team’s charter is to identify new economically viable regions with uniquely sustainable distribution entry strategies, own the land and expand activities required to accelerate market share growth with a proven playbook, deploy and support the technology and product platform, and to support the operations of the new market until it becomes significant in its presence, revenue contribution and operating practices to join the wider business. The team will function as ‘a bridge’ between Zip’s core experience and new regional learnings and facilitate cross-border knowledge sharing between markets and departments.

The purpose of the Market Launcher / Operations Manager role is to own the playbook and execution of bringing Zip to life in new markets. Reporting to the General Manager (New Markets), you will also be accountable for establishing the business operations and processes in new markets, hiring/training on the local team, and coordinating global resources to ensure a smooth and successful market entry for Zip

ROLE RELATED RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop the north-star vision and playbook for establishing Zip in new markets and continue to iterate
Develop the playbook by understanding Zip business processes, documenting and deploying in new markets
Ownership of establishing and operationalizing the Zip business - technology configuration, establishing business processes and functions - from sales, customer service, finance, etc
Identify and engage local partner - retail, distribution, etc
Collaborate and engage the remote Zip teams to help establish global consistency and local overcome local challenges
Be a guardian of Zip New Market playbook - continuous improvement and customer-first deployment while ensuring subject matter experts around the world and providing input
Work closely with global business units such as Sales and Marketing, Legal, Regulatory and compliance, customer experience, etc to assist local execution establishment
Ensure early product quality and business performance in market
Ensure new market launches are done with the highest quality standards, on schedule, with customer-first approach - thoroughly planned and precisely executed.
Engage and work closely with both local and global teams to own challenges - troubleshoot and solve crucial problems to deliver optimal solutions
Define and establish OKRs / metrics to track success and measure performance for both pre and post-launch
You will involve relevant stakeholders to understand, manage and plan for the impact of product changes to the wider business
WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED
5+ years’ experience in consulting/investment banking and/or within tech start-up companies
A generalist who can wear many hats - you’ll be tasked with the implementation of sales processes, customer/merchant support, financial reporting and processes (fraud, collections, etc) while building Zip’s culture with local considerations
Analytical background: you can mold and understand data to drive action and results
Project management experience with an obsession over details
Excellent communication skills: collaborate effectively at both a local and global level
An entrepreneurial spirit with the drive to get your hands dirty
Flexibility to travel 70-80% of the year
Proven ability to thrive in a fast-moving, team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Proven stakeholder management
A natural leadership style - no problems, just juicy challenges; you’re a hands operator who facilitates collaboration to achieve exceptional outcomes.
At home in a first on the ground, a fast-paced environment and operates with a sense of urgency.
Highly analytical and process driver - a master at excel modeling, business process design
Exceptional communication skills - both written and verbal
Desired experience with:
Experience in FinTech is an advantage (Payments)
New Market entry and launch

MAJOR COLLABORATORS
This role reports to the General Manager, New Markets
You lead through a combination of doing, influencing, and training
You may be required to work with teams and engineers from global offices and facilitate adequate knowledge sharing.
WHAT DOES SUCCESS LOOK LIKE?
Ability to execute the new market's playbook.
Agreed Objectives & Key Results (OKRs) which may include:
Recruiting / Hiring milestones
Monthly Transacting Users (MTU)
Transactions per MTU
Customer Acquisition / Growth Targets
Consumer NPS
We’re looking for someone who always finds new boundaries to cross - a future Zipster who will obsess over excellence and make constant improvements for our customers. We’ve removed the red tape here to get things done quickly, so if you see a problem, own the solution. You've gotta hustle at Zip!

If you only meet some of the requirements for this role, that's okay. We value a diverse range of backgrounds and ideas and believe this is fundamental for our future success. So, if you have the curiosity to learn and the willingness to teach what you know, we'd love to hear from you.

We pride ourselves on creating an inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of their age, cultural background, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, or anything else.

Benefits @ Zip
Share incentives
Flexible working culture
Generous parental leave
Birthday and wellness leave
Fun team with high-growth hustle
Epic offices with a casual dress code
Lots of social events
Free weekly lunches
Thirsty Thursdays!
Join us on our mission to be the first payment choice, everywhere and every day.
