About the job
Summary
Do you have a passion for Statistics and Data Analysis?

The Office for National Statistics (ONS) is the UK’s largest producer of official statistics, covering a range of key economic, social and demographic topics. These include measuring changes in the value of the UK economy, estimating the size, geographic distribution and characteristics of the population, and providing indicators of price inflation, employment, earnings, crime and migration.

Government Statistical Service (GSS) Analytical Learning are seeking to expand the current range of statistical and data science capability programmes delivered in-house. As part of this rapid expansion we are recruiting a Statistics & Data Analysis Training Manager within our Newport, Titchfield and London offices.

The use and management of data is becoming ever more important in a modern economy. Data analytics is driving competitiveness and better public services, improving the lives of citizens. To realise the potential that new data sources hold, we need to be alive to opportunities as they arise and ensure people have the right skills to unleash innovation through statistics and data analysis.

This is a challenging and interesting role that provides the opportunity to develop core statistical, data analysis skills and training functional competencies.
Job description
Launched in March 2016 the Learning Academy is the central Learning and Development unit for the Office for National Statistics. GSS Analytical Learning is part of the Learning Academy and delivers a thriving programme of activities to support the objectives of both ONS and the wider GSS.

As a Training Manager, you will be responsible for a team of Trainers, who deliver high quality training programmes in essential statistical, data analysis and data science skills to colleagues from a variety of backgrounds across the ONS and other government departments.

This role can be based in our Newport, Titchfield or London office. Due to Covid-19 we are currently delivering via virtual classrooms and there is a possibility to continue delivering virtually, even when the whole UK will be back to normal.

This role is responsible for the design, commissioning, delivery and evaluation of high quality statistical, data analysis & data science training at an Awareness, Introductory and Intermediate level which meets the needs of the Government Statistical Service (GSS).

This role reports to the Head of GSS Analytical Learning and is part of the People Capability division within ONS.

Responsibilities
• Manage trainers to deliver quality training at an awareness, introductory and intermediate level
• Work with individuals and teams to conduct learning needs analysis for statistical and data science training and propose appropriate solutions
• Design and sign off high quality statistics and data science training solutions for internal and external clients ensuring they are adequately specified and documented
• Deliver statistical and data science learning to a range of workers at different stages in their development
• Evaluate the effectiveness of learning and maintain/update standards as necessary
• Continuously develop and keep knowledge up to date, collaborating with other business areas working on projects to gain/update practical knowledge
• Ensure the Statistical and Data Science training solutions continue to meet delegate needs by continuous review and stakeholder engagement
• Ensure that all members of staff, new and existing, within the ONS and external, are trained to an appropriate level
• Maintain currency with new and emerging statistical/data science and data analysis methodologies, and acquisition of specialist knowledge on data science subjects.
• The ability to adjust to changing priorities and to respond rapidly to operational tasking demands is required. They will be able to manage and inspire a team of trainers to deliver to the highest standard.

Person Specification:

Essential:
• Experience of statistics and/or data analysis in R and/or Python.
• Excellent communication skills, including the ability to communicate complex topics to a technical and non-technical audience
• Experience of working to tight deadlines without compromising quality.
• Excellent planning and organising skills
• Experience of working as part of a team and developing others
• Problem-Solving skills

Desirable:
• MSc in a related subject
• Experience in other programming languages suitable for large scale data analysis such as Pyspark
• Experience using Rshiny or DASH
Behaviours
We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:
Managing a Quality Service
Delivering at Pace
Developing Self and Others
Communicating and Influencing

Location
Newport, Fareham, London
About the job
Summary
This role provides a unique opportunity to work at the centre of an exciting area of the UK Statistics Authority.

You will work within the Data Governance, Legislation and Policy (DGLP) Branch whose primary focus is to support the National Statistician, Second Permanent Secretary, Deputy National Statisticians, senior executives and the organisation, to manage the governance of the access, use and sharing of data for research and statistical purposes across the Office for National Statistics (ONS) and the UK Statistics Authority (UKSA)
Job description
This role involves providing policy and legal leadership of data legislation matters, delivering the supervisory, audit and advisory functions of the Data Protection Officer, leading the work of the organisation around data ethics, and engaging with internal and external stakeholders to build and maintain public confidence about how the organisation acquires, accesses, manages, stores, and uses data for the public good.

The DGLP Branch plays an important role in helping the UK Statistics Authority to fulfil its strategic objectives to harness the potential of data and maximise its impact in ways which are ethical, transparent and for the public good. The UKSA’s strategy “Statistics for the public good” looks to build flexible and integrated analytical capabilities to address COVID-19 and other priorities and enable the organisation to manage data and deliver analysis that cuts across organisational boundaries. To support data integration, the ONS is currently developing an Integrated Data Platform reaching across Government.

This will transform statistical data analysis capabilities through technology and methods to better support public service policymaking and the delivery of Government priorities. The Integrated Data Platform will ensure analysis can be carried out, legally and ethically, across Government in line with priority needs; with appropriate data being made available to the research and academic community to support this analysis.

Responsibilities
Reporting to the Data Protection Compliance Manager, the primary focus of the role is to provide ONS and UKSA with data protection advice in the development and operation of the new Integrated Data Platform. You will also support the Data Protection team in a wide-ranging programme of reviews to audit the organisation’s compliance (including the Integrated Data Platform) with data protection legislation (the Data Protection Act 2018, and the General Data Protection Regulation) to identify good practice and any risks arising. You will work closely with other teams, including Legal Services, Knowledge and Information Management, Security, Risk and Internal Audit, as well as operational and analytical teams supporting the delivery of the integrated data programme.

You will also have opportunities to work flexibly across DGLP, adapting to address priority issues and responding to dynamic business needs.

Responsibilities of the post will include:
• Assisting the Data Protection Compliance Manager with planning and scoping the terms of reference for individual compliance audit assignments.
• Completion of fieldwork and producing high quality, clearly drafted, robust evidence-based reports for review and provide constructive feedback on key findings to the auditees following completion of each audit via a debrief meeting.
• Provide advice, guidance and support to stakeholders and across the organisation (in particular the Integrated Data Platform and programme) to help meet the requirements of data protection legislation.
• Maintain data protection compliance action plans to ensure compliance issues are monitored to completion, and complete a programme of follow up reviews to ensure compliance issues have been satisfactorily resolved.
• Establishing strong and effective working relationships with senior leaders and colleagues across the UK Statistics Authority and Office for National Statistics, to maximise awareness and understanding of data protection legislation and the importance of compliance with the legislation and related organisational policies and procedures.
• Assisting the Data Protection Compliance Manager in drafting papers, and providing advice, support and briefing within the Data Governance, Legislation and Policy Branch’s remit and to the Data Protection Officer.

Person Specification

Essential Skills
• You will have an understanding of data protection legislation and/or experience working within external or internal audit
• You will have experience in developing and delivering projects or audit assignments from planning through to reporting
• You will have strong communication skills including excellent report writing
• You will be able to take responsibility for delivering high quality, accurate work
• You will be self-motivated and organise own workload to ensure effective delivery of work within deadlines

Benefits
The Office for National Statistics is part of the Civil Service, and as such we share a number of key benefits with other departments, whilst also having our own unique offerings to support our 5000+ valued employees across the business.

Whether you are hearing about us for the first time or already know a bit about our organisation, we hope that the benefits pack attached (bottom of page) will give you a great insight into the benefits and facilities available to our employees, and our fantastic working culture.

We are an organisation that takes the well-being of its employees seriously and lives and breathes the desire to modernise the workplace of the future. Everyone, from our office-based staff in Newport, London and Titchfield, to our field interviewers and airports and ports passenger survey staff, are part of a diverse and inclusive family.

Inclusion & Accessibility

At ONS we're always looking to attract the very best people from the widest possible talent pool, and we are proud to be an inclusive, equal opportunities employer. As a member of the Business Disability Forum and a Disability Confident Leader we’re committed to ensuring that all candidates are treated fairly throughout the recruitment process.

As part of our application process, you will be prompted to provide details of any reasonable adjustments to our recruitment process that you need. If you would like to discuss any reasonable adjustments before applying, please contact the recruitment team in the first instance.

Things you need to know
Security
Successful candidates must pass a disclosure and barring security check.
People working with government assets must complete basic personnel security standard checks.
Selection process details
This vacancy is using Success Profiles, and will assess your Behaviours, Experience and Technical skills.
Assessment at application stage will be based on your job history, skills & experience and personal statement. Your job history and skills & experience should be tailored to demonstrate any skills, knowledge and experience that are relevant to the content of the role.

Your personal statement should be no longer than 1250 words. You should use this space to provide evidence for each essential criteria within the person specification. As the criteria are scored, we would recommend that you give clear examples for each including the impact of your actions.

Success Profiles Behaviour examples are not required at the application stage and are assessed at interview.

ONS Recruitment will be running regular webinars to support candidates with advice on the application and assessment process. To sign up and join the next session please follow THIS LINK to our Eventbrite page.

Shortlisting and Interview

In cases where there is a high number of applications the sift pass mark may be adjusted and candidates will be invited to interview in merit order, i.e. those scoring the highest.

Should you be invited to interview, you will be assessed using various assessment techniques aligned to the Civil Service Success Profiles framework, where you'll be assessed against all the behaviours outlined in the advert.

A presentation will be required at interview. Further information will be provided to successful candidates prior to interview.

Interview will be conducted by Video Conference.

A reserve list may be held for a period up to 12 months from which further appointments may be made.

Product Quality Assurance Manager

ArQit is a world-leading high-innovation organisation: we're building the world's first global quantum safe cloud SaaS system to deliver provable security to data at rest, on the move and in transaction.

ArQit has brought together a world-leading team of pioneers in engineering and cryptography, and we now have an opening for a Product Quality Assurance Manager. As a trusted partner to the business, you will provide advice and guidance on the people aspects of business decisions and ensure these are aligned with our company culture and practices.

The role is based in London but with significant flexibility around working from home. We are committed to maintaining a working environment which is welcoming and supportive.

What you will be doing

ArQit has a new opportunity for an experienced Product/Quality Assurance Manager with the ability to work at both system level and across each of our space, control, user and service segments. The candidate will act as an independent engineering authority to ensure that all elements of the system are fit for purpose. The PA work will largely relate to the Space Segment (satellites), the QA aspects will cover all segments. As Arqit is a relatively new organisation, your expertise is also required in defining and implementing processes and procedures in accordance with ISO9001 expectations.

This role is both challenging and exciting as it involves early engagement in a new organisation whilst at the same time working with state-of-the-art quantum and optical technologies.
Manage, control, and enforce Product Assurance/Quality Assurance requirements (within the Requirements Management Tool) and processes throughout the system with initial focus on the LEO satellites that form part of the Space Segment.
Define the associated PA/QA Plan and oversee implementation of the required in-house processes and procedures.
Control the flow down of PA/QA requirements to each of the Segment Subcontractors and manage subsequent requirement baselines between project reviews.
Prepare for ESA based milestone reviews (PDR, CDR) by responding to and auctioning associated Review Item Discrepancies (RIDs)
Track non-conformances, RFD/RFWs, and requirement non/partial compliances throughout the System lifecycle.
Oversee qualification campaigns for space hardware and assist with the definition of the overall qualification approach.
Review and oversee direct supplier quality processes and inspect supplier equipment.
Review, oversee and audit subcontractor PA/QA processes.
What would be an ideal background for this role?
Educated to degree level in Physics, Engineering, Computer Science or a related technical discipline (minimum 2:1).
Significant experience in a Space Segment Product Assurance function.
Working knowledge and experience of ECSS standards and notably in respect to PA/QA assurance standards.
Experience of working with subcontractors in respect to PA/QA issues.
Experience of ISO9001 standards and implementation approaches.
Strong communication, organisational and time management skills.
Able to work autonomously within a small dynamic team.
Able to work in UK, and able to obtain UK security clearance
Able to travel as necessary.
There will be some (not extensive) European travel.

ABOUT US

DICE is the world's most-loved discovery and ticketing platform for live shows and live streams, delivering exclusive, high quality entertainment to fans across the world.

We bring fans and creators together with our technology, working closely with the best artists, promoters and venues in music and culture. In April 2020 we launched DICE Live Streaming, connecting fans across the globe with the very best live events.

DICE is a place for people who are ambitious, humble and talented. For those who want to learn at pace and have a true passion for music and culture. Our HQ is in London, we have teams in New York, LA, Paris, Barcelona, Milan, Mumbai and Samara and we're live in 139 countries. You can read more about what we've been up to here in our recent Forbes and Rolling Stone articles.

And now, we're looking for a Marketing Operations Manager to join the B2B Marketing and Sales Operations team.

THE ROLE AND TEAM

This is an exciting opportunity to join the newly formed B2B Sales and Marketing Operations team, responsible for the entire sales funnel and partner acquisition strategy execution. The team is responsible for bringing DICE to new heights, supporting both the Live and Streaming teams in acquiring new partners and setting them up for success once acquired.

Having recently integrated Salesforce as our CRM and Pardot as our Marketing Automation platform, we're looking for a B2B Marketing Operations Manager that can set our partner CRM strategy up for success. As well as setting the foundations of our CRM processes for B2B, you'll work with the rest of the sales and marketing team to scale our efforts and optimise performance.

You are someone that enjoys looking at processes, identifying gaps and working to close them. You also love diving into details and have excellent project management skills as well as stakeholder management. You keep up to date with the latest Salesforce developments and find ways to use new technologies and releases to advantage the team.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
Develop the B2B CRM Strategy in alignment with the B2B division objectives, ensure alignment with the wider B2C CRM strategy
Engage stakeholders on B2B CRM programs, informing them on insights and learnings
Coordinate with stakeholders across the business and partner agencies to lead campaign briefings; agreeing objectives, measurements and reporting
Target audience segments to grow the marketing and sales funnel through the B2B marketing campaign calendar
Operationalise ways of working to drive efficiencies and best practice across local markets
Create campaign toolkits, such as email templates, to share with local markets to be able to repurpose content aligned to the calendar
Coordinate the database dashboard, reporting and insights
Manage all email and drip campaigns including dynamic workflows, lists, tracking and execution using Pardot
Grow new leads by converting website traffic through calls-to-action, landing pages and lead generation content
Optimise and segment the lead scoring, grading and nurturing processes
Establish closed-loop analytics to understand how marketing activity turns into customers, and continually refine our process to convert better-qualified leads
YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Proven experience in B2B marketing with strong expertise in Pardot
Ability to influence others through excellent communication and creative thinking
Strong project management experience, with the ability to use data to inform decisions
High attention to detail, organised with good time management,
Adaptable to change, with strong problem-solving skills and a good sense of judgement
Ability to present to executives to gain support for change management initiatives to seek an investment that delivers growth
Proficient with dynamic workflows and marketing automation software, (strong preference for Pardot experience)
Expert in Microsoft Office and working knowledge of Salesforce, Google Analytics and HTML
Pardot Specialist certification
All applications are actively being reviewed as we begin the interview process now. Final closing date for applications is Friday 13th November 2020.

Job Title: Band 8a Clinical Coding Audit and Training Manager
Job Description:
An excellent opportunity has arisen to provide the Auditing and Training lead to the Royal Free London NHS Foundation on the delivery of the Clinical Coding audit and training function. The successful candidate will develop and implement a comprehensive clinical coding audit strategy and training programme for the coding department.

Working together with the management team you will provide assurance to the Trust and assist in the development of the clinical coders. You will have extensive clinical coding experience, hold the ACC, Audit and Training Qualification and have evidence of successful completion of the auditors and trainers annual log book. On-going training and support will be available with opportunities to gain new experiences, working closely with other services including commissioning and finance teams.

The post holder will provide comprehensive training to the coding staff in order to achieve and maintain the highest level of competency and accreditation. You will be responsible for the development and implementation of individual mentorship, training and audit programmes, to ensure that coders are confident and effective in their roles and to facilitate the achievement of the necessary quality standards and information governance requirement. You will be required to carry out the Data Security and Protection Toolkit coding audit, complemented by a formal annual report.

The post holder will be highly numerate with excellent analytical and problem solving skills to assimilate complex information to enable effective decision making. Knowledge of National Coding Standards, audit methodology and policies is essential along with a detailed understanding of ICD10, OPCS4 ,HRG4+, Payment by Results and health service data /financial flows.

We are looking for an experienced team player to continue the excellent work of the department and build on existing high standards. If you like the challenge of working in a busy, fast moving environment and can demonstrate your ability to deliver clinical coding audits and training, then you may be the person to join our team.
Company Name:
Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust
3.9

Job Description:
Job Purpose: *
Our Operations team power the movement of our stock! The Farfetch Group stock pool is global, high value and complex to navigate. We have thousands of items being imported, exported, and transferred between our sites every single day. Now we are a publicly listed company experiencing phenomenal growth, Farfetch have a responsibility to ensure the processes that underpin stock movements reporting are SOX compliant. It’s our ambition to be 100% SOX compliant always, without exception, to reduce any risk to our business.

This role reports into the Farfetch Head of Fulfillment (Europe) and you will work alongside our Global Operations teams and our network of global fulfilment partners. The purpose of the role is building a blueprint for SOX compliance specific to stock management. Applying your expertise in SOX compliance you will be instrumental in implementing and championing best practice. Applying an auditor’s lens to everything you do, you will identify and remedy any risks which compromise the integrity of our stock data and audit results, building long term solutions to drive continuous improvement.
Key Responsibilities: *
Define the parameters and specifications required to achieve 100% SOX compliance, building a view of what success looks like and aligning the team to this vision.
Partner with internal stakeholders across the Farfetch Group such as the Operations and Audit teams and external stakeholders including Auditors, to gain insight of current challenges and risks to compliance.
Build the compliance roadmap for the Operations team, prioritising efforts and laying the foundations for excellence.
Define and coach internal and external stakeholders on the responsibilities they have to influence stock movement and stock reporting as defined in the SOX register, highlighting the importance of SOX compliance.
Conduct regular audits of the processes being carried out internally and externally (3PL’s), implementing new processes concerned with the reporting of stock movement wherever there is room to improve compliance.
Learn from best practice stock management and reporting being carried out in any corners of our business, driving synergy and applying this best practice to the wider group.
Operationalize the compliance roadmap by introducing a comprehensive suite of compliance data and best practice compliance reporting, familiarizing the team with this data and building dialogue around the insights on a continuous basis.
Be guided by high quality data, flagging and escalating any risks to the relevant operations team for full investigation, being accountable for risks until they are resolved.
Drive and influence behavioral change around how tools and systems are utilised by internal and external teams, driving a ‘system first’ response to allow for accurate reporting on our stock position at any point in time.
Plan and prepare the business for periodic audits, driving a shift towards continuous auditing practices.
Facilitate quarterly and yearly meetings with our third-party auditors, delivering the results of the Farfetch stock audits and actioning any feedback stemming from audits carried out by our external auditors.
Skills & Experience: *
Degree in related field, such as Inventory Management or Supply Chain Management or equivalent technical workplace qualifications.
Experience in Retail and E-commerce, with a focus on multi-channel environments.
Experience in SOX procedures for publicly listed companies.
Comfortable in a logistics and operations environment, with previous exposure to a warehouse or with auditors.
Natural ability to build effective relationships throughout the business.
Excellent organisational skills.
Skilled at presenting data in an impactful way.
Professional demeanour, reliable, flexible, strategic with a hands-on approach, with the ability to stay calm under pressure.
Strong warehouse management system and ERP knowledge.
Knowledge of luxury fashion retail advantageous.
Senior stakeholder management skills with an ability to influence all levels of the organisation.
Ability to think strategically and innovatively and to that in to a viable, operational plan
Strong commercial and financial acumen, with an ability to speak business language.
Excellent communication skills with proven track record of building effective relationships with senior leadership teams.
Ability to challenge and influence at all levels and work collaboratively and efficiently with large groups of stakeholders.
Agile and decisive.
Thrives on complex challenges with a problem-solving approach.
Analytical, able to interpret opportunities, trends and issues in data.

Support the development and leading the delivery of the audit plan through a deep and broad understanding of the risks facing the business for the area of responsibility including additional ad hoc/bespoke audit work as requested.

If you love a challenge, have experience leading teams in fast paced operational environments, and have a passion for learning, we want you on our team.

As a Learning and Development Manager and a member of the leadership team in one of our Fulfilment Centres, your role will be to manage the learning needs of all employees in the building.

In this dynamic and challenging role, you will be very close to the action and spending time on the warehouse floor with the teams who make our Fulfilment Centres great. Amazon has seen rapid growth over the last few years and we plan to keep on growing. This means a lot of new employees to train and coach. A lot of people to help stay curious and keep learning.

In this role, we are looking for a learning professional who has the ability and initiative to understand the business needs, analyse issues and influence solutions/outcomes. We are also looking for a team player who not only leverages his/her own team to respond effectively to a variety of training scenarios, but is able to work closely with a central EU team to effectively prioritize and deploy training programs based on customer need from training processes at scale to ongoing leader development.

This individual must be self-driven and have the capability and confidence to interface effectively with senior leaders and multiple stakeholders, both face to face and across geographies.
In this role, you will be essential to the growth and success of Amazon and our team members, from our hourly associates to our senior leaders.

Your Responsibilities:
· Plan, develop, deliver, and evaluate all training initiatives to develop leaders at the site, working in collaboration with the senior team and Amazons central Leadership function.
· To identify and align individual leadership development plans, build a catalogue of learning content according to business needs and facilitate delivery and completion of training.

· Provide coaching and feedback on leadership related topics working with leaders both in a 121s and facilitated workshops to identify leadership, coaching and management skills development opportunities.
· Collaborate with the senior management team to create and implement talent development processes, identify future talent and provide ongoing support for individual growth.
· End-to-end ownership of the associate and leader training programs at site: from needs analysis stage, to management and execution of training.

· Ensure that new starters, and current employees learning new skills, quickly develop the knowledge and ability to settle in and become experts at what they do.

· Lead, manage and coach your salaried Learning Specialist and team of trainers to be the best they can be. Understand what motivates your team, support them to develop a career plan and actively support them to achieve it.

· Identify gaps in existing learning content and work with network teams to innovate, feeding back needs, and participating in creation and testing of content. Play an integral role in gathering customer feedback on key network training initiatives.

· Take a data driven approach to understanding performance issues. Take action to improve the quality and effectiveness of training and coaching at your site for associates as well as leaders and managers.
· Build relationships and influence your site leadership team colleagues to address issues that inhibit effective learning.
Partner with different stakeholders to identify opportunities to improve the quality of training and coaching.


· Lead projects (with support from your EU colleagues) to continuously improve the design of training materials, the quality of our instruction, and effectiveness of our coaching interventions.

· Support the delivery of local and EU wide projects to improve how the site operates. Identify any additional training materials and train your trainers in new processes/changes to existing processes.

· Provide a safe learning environment. Partner with Human Resources, Health & Safety and Engineering colleagues to ensure all compliance and safety training is delivered within the agreed timescales.

Planning and executing the recruitment and training of the best instructors from within our Amazon community to deliver training and coaching.
Ensure that you deliver the European standard training content.

Basic Qualifications

· A bachelor's degree or equivalent
· Excellent verbal and written communicator; experience in engaging multiple stakeholders.
· Managed and developed a team, and achieved collective success
· Data skills and the ability to understand how Learnings activities and responsibilities play into the metrics that drive how the site is managed
· The ability to work in fast-paced ambiguous environments, adapting quickly to changing circumstances, processes and priorities
· Experience in a technical training role; and experience using Training Needs Analysis process;
· Assessing performance gaps, analysing learning needs, designing and developing customer-centric solutions, and evaluating the effectiveness of learning programs.
· Full proficiency in MS Office
· Knowledge of Psychometric testing
· Experience in Business and Leadership Coaching

Preferred Qualifications

· Experience in change management and process improvement activities, designing scalable solutions and implementing these at pace and at scale.
· Familiar with instructional design principles and have created, edited and administered training content and programs.
· Experience as an HR or L&D Business partner for an Operations focused organization.
· Ability to influence leaders at all levels to understand their role in employee development and help build their skills.
· Masters degree in related discipline: Human Resources, Instructional Design, Organizational Psychology, Adult Education, etc.
· Fluency in additional European languages is desirable.

We are looking for experienced auditors to join our Audit Corporates practice. We currently have full-time opportunities in our London office.

The Role:

As an Audit Manager, you will be involved in all aspects of leading and delivering audit engagements, from planning through to completion on a broad spectrum of Corporates clients. The role will include executive level client interaction and exposure to multiple clients on an annual basis, as well as daily tasks such as:
Leading a field work team including supervising and coaching more junior members of staff to help them reach their full potential
Reporting to audit Partners and Directors on all salient points arising from audits
Planning and execution of audit fieldwork and statutory reporting across a portfolio of clients
Project management of all aspects of audit including agreeing audit timelines, team briefings, and supervision and delivery of audit work
Budgeting and monitoring the financial performance of projects, focusing on optimising profitability
Identifying, researching and helping to resolve complex audit issues
Preparing client deliverables, building relationships with the client staff and acting as an ambassador for the firm
Keeping up to date with KPMG's product and service offerings and identifying the sales opportunities that will help us grow our business
Working on audit tenders and working as part of the relevant independence team on these tenders. Tasks may include: reviewing global engagement records in sentinel; analysing and categorising the records; contacting partners globally for engagement information; preparing data and drafting Independence reports; liaising with the UK Ethics and Independence team
You may also have the opportunity to work on specific audit related projects across the audit function
Required Experience and Background:
Self-driven and resilient and able to thrive in a pressurised environment
Well-developed team management and supervisory skills and the ability to effectively communicate with a wide range of individuals both internally and externally at different levels of seniority
The desire to work in a diverse environment, gain exposure to an international working environment and undertake new challenges
Strong project management techniques including decision-making ability, analytical skills, time management, prioritisation, organisation and evaluative skills
Monitors and upholds high quality of service and products to clients (internal and external)
Required Qualifications and Skills:
Fully qualified ACA/ACCA or international equivalent
Recent, extensive external audit experience at Manager level within a 'Big 4’ or mid-tier firm
Team management experience with the ability to motivate a team and lead by example
The ability to effectively communicate with a wide range of individuals both internally and externally at different seniority levels
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal
Strong IT literacy, including Excel, PowerPoint and Word
Sound practical knowledge of IFRS
Previous exposure to a range of Corporates sectors such as telecommunications, media, energy, utilities, and/or oil&gas

MAIN PURPOSE OF JOB:

Systems, supplier and customer facing role
Managing team’s priorities whilst ensuring customer audits, internal audits and standard audits are handled to a high standard and an excellent performance.
Liaising with the quality and hygiene team via their managers/supervisors to support site compliance with BRC and customer requirements.
Supports the site with the “audit ready” agenda. Prepare for and manage site audits and assessments alongside the Site Quality Manager. Playing a major role in external audits.
Decision making for supplier approval and supplier evaluation activities, including suppliers auditing schedules. Responsible for ensuring BRC and customers’ standards requirements are effectively communicated to suppliers and managing the supplier relationships and approval and monitoring programme.
Responsible for maintaining Food Safety & Quality Management systems, creating food safety and quality training materials and providing technical systems training as required.
Role involves liaising with all operational departments (Quality, Production, Engineering, Warehouse) including Sales, Procurement and NPD.
Deputises for Head of Technical and Quality.

KEY TASKS:
 Provide technical support, advice and expertise daily
 Provide legislative and regulatory expertise to the site management team
 Ensures that Quality manuals are developed and maintained in adherence to standards or business changes. Ensure the site policies and procedures are updated and managed to demonstrate alignment with best practice and legal/customer compliance.
 Identify Quality System weaknesses and change as necessary to strengthen, maintain and improve.
 Supporting the Head of Technical and Quality during Crisis Management and where required confident to liaise with Environmental Health Officers, Trading Standards officials, DEFRA, FSA as agreed with the crisis management team.
 Effectively manage emerging food safety and quality issues, TACCP and VACCP studies. Reporting to the site management team at an agreed frequency (for example in monthly reviews) and investigation for Horizon scan alerts or any emerging food safety, quality, legal or ethical risk or trends
 Driving supplier approval and monitoring activities for new and existing products and services
 Effectively manage any negative trends in customer complaints alongside the Site Quality Assurance Manager - KPI
 Customer facing where complaints or technical matters require a higher authority level of response
 Ensure that appropriate HACCP systems are implemented and reviewed at least annually by the Site Operations team.
 Challenge the suppliers following tracking and monitoring supplier performance and reporting to Site Management – KPI
 Ensuring delivery and drive of RM Curtis’ and customers’ Ethical Trade Policy and standards across the business’ supply base, including SEDEX maintenance.
 Provide expertise for testing schedule reviews (including quality checks and due diligence checks) as necessary
 Ensure schedule of internal audits is followed and working with all internal auditors towards close off non-conformances or actions, KPI
 Organise and host customer and third-party audits as necessary
 Ensuring traceability presented during audits, test recall or other traceability exercises is accurate, complete and achieved in a timely manner.
 Ensure generating of accurate raw materials and finished product specifications and labelling for all products produced on site or on behalf of RM Curtis.
 Liaise with the Quality, Commercial, Procurement and NPD Team to resolve raw materials issues and validate safety parameters to deliver legal compliance and to act as the customer’s liaison point for key reviews related to the quality management system.
 Liaise with the Technical Team Leader to ensure the team is following closely critical paths, stage and gate process and product development, including trials, artwork, labelling and quality parameters delivering strong project management to the team
 Commercial awareness. Constantly propose/implement cost savings solutions.
 Provide the direct reports with the necessary tools and skills to carry out their roles as efficiently and effectively as possible. Conduct regular reviews (performance and personal development) with the direct reports setting goals and achievements and guide them to deliver the same for their teams.

At Lacoste PCL, we’re reinventing the sneaker industry. We’ve got plans to expand the confines of shoe innovation, focusing on performance and fashion.

We proudly celebrate our incredible history; founded by René Lacoste in 1933, you might know us for our legendary polo shirts… but we’re so much more. Since January 2018, Pentland and Lacoste formed a joint venture, and we’re the force behind Lacoste footwear globally. Now we’re on to the next big breakthrough, and we want you to be a part of it.

You can expect to feel right at home as soon as you enter our beautiful and creative space in North London, and our team is a truly friendly and welcoming bunch.

You’ll thrive in our environment if you’re ready to meaningfully collaborate. As one of our core values, it will be an important part of your life here. You won’t go a day without someone coming over to your desk to get your opinion or seeing a group of creatives getting excited over an idea they’ve had.

We also work and act resiliently (another value!) and we’re not afraid to give or receive candid and honest feedback. We know it’s imperative so we can keep growing and getting better.

As a small and non-hierarchical team of around 75, you’ll get the opportunity to collaborate cross-functionally, regardless of job role. When you join us, we promise you’ll always be learning something new or feeling challenged, in the best way possible.

The role in a nutshell..

As a Senior Manager, your role will encompass three key areas of our business – Materials, Sustainability and 3D. You will actively lead on product creation, from toolbox to concept. You will drive material innovation and material sustainable developments, responding to the needs of the business. This will be in partnership with the Design Managers and Category Leads, to satisfy the creative briefs.

This role has recently been extended to cover the responsibility of our small 3D team. You will help the team to effectively transition footwear designs into prototypes, all the way through to commercialisation and production. You will ensure that all tools, technologies and process are effortless, so that our design and development team can bring amazing products to life.

We are looking for someone who can effectively lead, challenge, and develop their direct reports, ensuring they are managed effectively and have the skills, motivation and passion to meet the needs of the business.

What we’d love to see..

Development Tooling / Processes

Work with briefs from Design, to develop and explore new material concepts and innovations, in keeping with creative direction of the partner design team
Drive sustainable material strategy within PCL and align with brand strategy target
Ensure the availability of sustainability materials on our material toolbox, which support the materials strategic sustainability direction
Maintain up to date reference library and toolbox of materials for both sample making and research purposes
Collaborate with cross-functional business partners (Category/Development/Design) to identify strategic Material Management information needs
Develop tools and reports that enable Product teams to make fact based, faster material and product decisions
Establish and provide regular Material Market relevant trend data
Monitor seasonal KPIs. Develop and execute regular in-depth reporting of material management data focusing on material usage reports across our key material types (leather, synthetic and textiles)
Drive the department internal process management and continuous improvement of all material development processes globally
Create, maintain and communicate the Materials relevant timelines. Ensure representation of Materials key milestones in Product Creation Calendars.
Oversee and be accountable for ensuring the delivery of material data accuracy and colour and material article creation and upload on to PLM to facilitate on time BOM upload
Colour Palette: collaborate with Design to maintain updated, seasonal color palette and execute/distribute lab dips
Implement procedures to assure quality from the earliest stage of product development through to commercialisation
Ensure the effective action and recording of article testing. Liaise closely with Product Development on failing articles and proactively support alternative selection process
Support the nominated supplier process: Facilitate validation and Induction of any necessary new tier 2 vendors in line with CR, RSL & Pentland Sourcing Principles. Executing Vendor performance reviews and managing performance plans
Build and manage relationships with all key stakeholders: Tier 1 and Tier 2 vendors, Sourcing, Supply Chain, Lacoste Paris and others to ensure strategies are realised and alley parties are appropriately and consistently informed
Partner with stakeholders in Asia to resolve any material QC issues during production
Own and tracks project status and by partnering development and design

3D Design

Lead the 3D Design team and implement the right process to help deliver 3D footwear design to drive better informed decisions
Execute all new tooling and some styles and SKU’s in 3D to help sell in process
Work alongside manufacturing partners to send them accurate 3D tech packs in order to reduce the ambiguity within footwear specifications, which in turn will produce more accurate physical samples
Be the voice of 3D Design for the brand, educating the business on the function and helping to solidify within the business

Highly Desirable Skills..

Footwear product development and relevant industry relevant experience
General Knowledge of Sustainable Practices and Materials
Solid relevant experience gained within the footwear industry
Excellent knowledge across competitor sector
People management/ Coaching experience
Effective communication skills
Good Microsoft office skills
Design and development packages experience – Adobe Packages & BP readers (Myriad), PLM experience
Some 3D Design experience is advantageous

Our Values..

Integrity

Be loyal to our principles
Commit to having honest conversations
Future proof our industry, our environment and our brand

Enterprise

Innovate and break the mould
Learn from the world around us
Consistently seek to create and improve
Question and challenge

Courage

Lead the pack and be audacious
Voice and act on our ambitions
Challenge the status quo and other people
Be accountable for your actions
Allow room for tenacity and the results could go beyond expectations

Resilience

Learn from your mistakes and take responsibility
Maintain the agility to change direction & be spontaneous
Keep moving forwards
Be optimistic in all ventures
Accept respectful challenge

Collaboration

Seek out ways to be inclusive
Look for ways to rally each other’s strengths
Be confident to know when you are the expert
Be united in your goals and support one another
Be solutions focused, together

We're looking for a confident, creative PR superstar with a demonstrated background in B2B communications.

You'll help us grow by embedding yourself in the TransferWise for Business team to truly understand the product and its customers, and thereby maximise the news pipeline in the UK and across Europe. You'll be comfortable creating narratives and news to capture the attention of all types of businesses, from entrepreneurs, freelancers and small businesses to scale-ups and larger enterprises, as well as delivering product announcements and partnership news. You'll be hands on, delivering news yourself (as opposed to via an agency), as well as acting as a conduit for stories to global PR managers as appropriate. Management experience is needed as you'll also be expected to grow and manage a team over time.

You should be a creative writer with a knack for untangling and explaining complex business products and developments in an easy to understand and relatable manner, and own a black book of press contacts in the small business trade, enterprise and national business media. You need to be comfortable with ambiguity and working in a fast paced environment with an experienced team of cross-functional stakeholders.

A bit about the job:


There are three key areas you will work on:

1. Owning Business Product Communications in UK and Europe

Embedding yourself within the Business product team to own the news flow as our product grows. You'll run the comms for product developments and new client announcements, as well as TransferWise's commentary on business industry news and developments. You'll be comfortable working with and developing specialist spokespeople such as our Head of TransferWise for Business, as well as expert product managers. You'll understand how to take a creative approach to make the seemingly mundane a hot news topic.

2. Creating News to Capture the Business Audience

Developing creative communications to build awareness of TransferWise with influential business media, as well as making TransferWise part of the wider business conversation through news hijacking and events. You'll feel comfortable putting together a six month creative PR plan to sustain news coverage, with your ideas extending way beyond safe YouGov surveys and forward features - see TransferWise's 20 under 20 programme for inspiration.

3. Supporting Business Product Communications Globally

As the only member of the PR team concentrating solely on the Business product, you'll act as a conduit for the team's stories globally. While you'll be most hands-on in the European market, you'll also be happy to support local country PR managers worldwide with your product knowledge.

What will you need?
Solid, varied experience of working in B2B communications. This could be in-house at a startup or bigger company, or in a PR agency. Experience of working with tech or fintech firms is a plus but not a necessity.
Proven ability to understand and simplify complex information. The details of TransferWise for Business partnerships vary by client size and type, and require a precise comms eye.
Innate understanding of what makes a good story for business media and how to secure great quality media coverage - along with existing media relationships in the UK as a minimum.
An ability to work proactively and independently in a fast-paced, high-growth company. You have a hands-on approach and can get results whether you're working independently or as part of the wider PR team. We get it done.
Outstanding planning and organisational skills with proven experience of strategic coordination of people, information, diary management and relationships.
A genuine, enthusiastic interest in our mission and developing and communicating great ideas to make financial services fairer for the business community.
The ability to scrutinise complex and technical data. You'll be able to understand and analyse complex concepts and turn them into simple and compelling messages.
Excellent written and spoken English.
Ideally, proficiency in a second European language.
What you'll get:


A front row seat at one of the hottest technology companies in the world and a chance to truly be a part of something great and challenging.

It goes without saying that you'll be a part of a fun, friendly atmosphere, with plenty of opportunities to grow personally and professionally.

Who we are:


TransferWise was founded in 2011 with a clear mission: money without borders. We're helping people and businesses send and receive any currency effortlessly - whenever, wherever - and making the world a bit better by helping to make the financial system fair.

We're currently 2,000 people strong across 13 global offices and our customers use TransferWise to transfer billions of dollars every month. TransferWise for Business is a fundamental part of this growth.

We're looking for a PR Manager to join our established Europe-wide comms team, building PR for our business product in the region. You'll be the first PR Manager dedicated solely to this product, working closely with the TransferWise for Business team, as well as local country PR Managers. You'll be based in our London office and report into our Head of PR for EMEA.

What it's really like to work here?


At TransferWise, we do things a bit differently. There's no corporate nonsense and no old-fashioned hierarchy. Instead, we work in self-sufficient, autonomous teams. Each team picks the problems they want to solve and does it - so there's no micro-management or people telling you what to do. You will get tons of guidance and support from talented, super-smart colleagues from all over TransferWise.

The way we work doesn't suit everyone. But, if freedom, autonomy, and head-scratching professional challenges rock your world, we could be a match made in heaven.

Please note we cannot offer sponsorship for this position

Job Title: Manager - Insurance Operations - open to flexible working
Job Description:
Drawing on its reputation for providing deep industry experience and leading consulting services to the Insurance industry, EY is currently further expanding its Financial Services Performance Improvement practice.

We are seeing continued and growing demand from insurers and brokers to assist them in dealing with their most pressing challenges: profound regulatory change, economic uncertainty, ongoing cost and competitive pressures, changing customer expectations and technology-driven disruption. We help our top tier insurance clients with the major transformational changes they are undertaking to respond to these challenges, through simplifying their business models, improving their processes, implementing data and technology-driven solutions, while focussing on customer needs in established and developing markets. We expect these industry developments to continue and lead to an increasing in demand for our consulting services.

The opportunity

We are currently seeking high achieving and motivated Managers, who show strong potential and enthusiasm for growing and developing a consulting career with EY. You will be working within our Performance Improvement Insurance team, consulting with our Top Tier insurance clients and working on projects focussed on addressing their most significant challenges.

Your key responsibilities

Managing the design and delivery of complex transformation projects and leading workstreams on engagements for key Specialty and General Insurance clients
Leveraging your own network and relationships for EY to further enhance EY’s reputation in the market
Identifying opportunities for new business and supporting proposals and bids
Managing engagement teams and third parties
EY internal operational activities (chargeability, billing, quality and risk management)
Acting as a career counsellor to a small team (1-3 people)

Skills and attributes for success

Having completed a graduate scheme or structured development programme with a recognised financial services provider
Previous experience of working in a client facing or consulting role
Strong track record in project delivery, with an ability to develop and deliver high quality output against project objectives and meet tight deadlines
Good understanding of the insurance value chain (including sales, distribution, customer management, underwriting, claims management, policy servicing and reinsurance)
Excellent client stakeholder management skills and ability to build relationships
Intellectual strength, curiosity and flexibility to navigate ambiguous client requirements, challenge the status quo, rapidly understand complex problems and rationalise these into a workable solution
Ability to work under limited supervision (self-starter) in unstructured environments
Flexibility to travel to, and work in, other locations is essential

To qualify for the role you must have (within Insurance)

Operational improvement experience – an understanding of how change can be enabled through operating model design, capability definition and development, process improvement, application and technology platforms
Transformation experience – end-to-end, technology-driven change through the full lifecycle (discovery, business requirements definition, technical design, implementation, testing, post go-live support and run)
Revenue enhancement/distribution strategy experience, including market assessment, opportunity identification, channel dynamics, business planning
A demonstrable understanding of the Specialty and General Insurance markets, commercial dynamics and change levers

Ideally, you’ll also have

The ambition to build / develop a career in advising insurance clients around operational improvement and revenue enhancement at EY
The drive and commitment to achieving solutions with the ability to work under pressure
A strong interest and commitment to developing and delivering leading edge solutions to insurance industry clients

What we look for

A team player who openly supports, encourages and shares knowledge with colleagues
The ability to coach and mentor junior colleagues and provide on-the-job training
Commitment to actively engaging with our D&I agenda and championing social purpose-driven change

What working at EY offers

We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development, and with FlexEY you can select benefits that suit your needs, covering holidays, health and well-being, insurance, savings and a wide range of discounts, offers and promotions. Plus, we offer:

Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Join us in building a better working world.

Apply now.

Who we are

EY is committed to being an inclusive employer and we are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. We strive to achieve the right balance for our people, enabling us to deliver excellent client service whilst allowing you to build your career without sacrificing your personal priorities. While our client-facing professionals can be required to travel regularly, and at times be based at client sites, our flexible working arrangements can help you to achieve a lifestyle balance

Please note: Prior to finalizing your application, you will be asked to provide personal information across several dimensions of diversity and inclusiveness. The information you provide is kept entirely confidential and will not be used to evaluate your candidacy. We collect this data to help us analyse our recruitment process holistically and implement actions that promote diversity and inclusiveness. While optional, we encourage you to provide this information to hold us accountable towards our goal of building a better working world. We ask because it matters!

More about the role

Here, at New Look, everything that we do is for the love of fashion.

We’ve been bringing the latest fashion to the high-street since 1969. We’re now a global, multichannel brand offering on-trend, value-fashion for women, men and teenage girls. Even after 50 years we’ve stayed true to our original mission of delivering fabulous products at a price our customers can afford.

We invented fast fashion and it’s our colleagues today that continue our journey to create a New Look that everyone loves.

It’s our values that inspire us every day - we play to win, we are customer obsessed, we work as one…and it starts with you.

We are always on the lookout for talented, passionate people to join our New Look team.

Job Purpose

The post holder is responsible for the day to day management of internal audit services across the organisation, including:
o To be responsible for the management of the annual internal audit plan, as agreed by the Audit Committee, in accordance with the Code of International Standards for the Professional Practice of Internal Auditing of the Institute of Internal Auditors (the Standards) and New Look organisation policy.
o Provide a professional and objective internal audit and consultancy service to the business on the full range of assurance matters and be responsible for the execution of financial and operational audits, reviews and special projects.
o To work closely with the Risk Manager in respect of the Risk Management Strategy and annual work programme to ensure this aligns to the audit activity.

Accountabilities and Responsibilities – this is what you’ll be doing
o To lead audit reviews and set the standard for their delivery, meeting with the client manager to discuss the objectives and scope.
o To ensure an appropriate Internal Audit Quality Assurance and Improvement Programme is maintained,
o To manage 3rd party internal auditors, including co-sourced audit resources in the completion of audit reviews. This includes monitoring performance and quality, providing advice and guidance as required. The postholder will be required to manage and conduct audits to work globally for New Look.
o To ensure all audits are completed in accordance with the Code of International Standards for the Professional Practice of Internal Auditing of the Institute of Internal Auditors (the Standards) and New Look organisation policy.
o To ensure the design and completion of all aspects of the audit process, including the design of appropriate tests in respect of every audit to a standard determined by the organisation.
o To ensure a draft report is produced in respect of every audit undertaken and within a timescale agreed by the client manager. To ensure that recommendations in audit reports are agreed with client managers including implementation dates of same.
o To lead for all levels of management as required with regard to the audit process including agreeing recommendations in reports with client managers and agreeing implementation dates of same.
o To provide advice to managers as required on the management of their risks.
o To carry out follow up reviews to ensure compliance with previously agreed recommendations.
o To conduct any reviews or investigations as required into matters of fraud or irregularity, working with colleagues and external organisations as required.
o To report on a half yearly basis to the Audit Committee, to include providing an annual opinion over assurance, level of controls and risk management across New Look. To support the Audit Committee regarding queries relating to internal audit matters.
o Additional duties reasonably required of the role.

Skills and Education

Minimum level of education or qualifications:
• CMIIA/PIIA/CIA qualified.
• Extensive experience in similar internal audit management role in a large, preferably global organisation.
• Evidence of continuous professional development and commitment to learning.
• Suitable degree level qualification preferred in a related business discipline or a recognised professional qualification in business and risk management.

Essential skills/knowledge

• Ability to complete internal audit work to a high professional standard, in accordance with the International Standards for the Professional Practice of Internal Auditing of the Institute of Internal Auditors (IIA).
• Excellent influencing and negotiation skills, with the ability to persuade managers, staff and partner organisations.
• Good communications skills in order to convince managers of the need to improve their control frameworks.
• Ability to provide peer review to audit colleagues.
• Ability to lead and supervise other auditors.
• Clear determination to deliver beyond expectations and a passion for continual improvement.
• Focused on the needs of the customer, both internal and external.
• Motivate, inspire and support the team to deliver first class work output.
• Build strong relationships with key stakeholders across the business.
• Set clear deliverable objectives which effectively impact on strategy.
• Working closely with other areas of the business, identify and reduce exposures through team and partnership working and development.
• Establishing best practice and reduced impact on operations through an aligned and consistent approach across the business.
• Leadership in the development and implementation of internal audit and risk management strategies, including business impact analysis.
• The identification and implementation of opportunities that will enhance service delivery.
• Demonstrate the ability to work effectively with senior management, excellent stakeholder management skills.
• Ability to work calmly in a crisis situation when under pressure to deliver quickly.
• Thorough understanding and demonstrable experience of applying modern internal audit techniques.
• Detailed understanding of risk management and corporate governance frameworks.
• Excellent understanding of control self-assessment techniques.
• A track record and proven experience of leading a range of different audit reviews, preferably in a retail environment.
• Detailed understanding and experience of methods to directly investigate matters of fraud and irregularity, provide guidance to other auditors to complete reviews and where required work with external organisations to investigate such matters.
• Experience of working effectively both alone and as part of a team.
• Demonstrable experience of delivering quality audit reports to a deadline.
• Proven track record in delivering effective programme management and cost savings.
• Excellent communication methods across all business levels and media.
• Excellent IT knowledge, MS Office suite skills, experience of audit and risk management software, preferably use of IDEA (information data extraction and analysis) or similar packages.
• Excellent negotiation skills.

Desirable Skills/knowledge:

• Additional language skills.
• Advanced skills in MS Excel.

Behavioural Skills
o “Embrace the pace” as part of a busy team.
o Confident working individually and as part of our team.
o Supporting the wider aims and ambitions across the New Look group.
Our Behaviours
o Delivering excellent services to all stakeholders.
o Being a role model to inspire others within and external to New Look.
o Keen to extend the boundaries to improve customer services with fresh and innovative ideas for service development.
o Ambitious, keen to progress career, energetic and enthusiastic, gregarious, effective communicator

Job Title: Senior Quality Management Specialist - Medical Devices / Pharmaceutical
Reporting to: Site Quality Manager
Career Band: 5
Position Location: East Grinstead

Thermo Fisher Scientific is the world leader in serving science - we have revenues of more than $24 billion, a track record of stability and consistent growth, and approximately 75,000 employees.

Our mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We help our customers accelerate life sciences research, solve complex analytical challenges, improve patient diagnostics, deliver medicines to market and increase laboratory productivity.

When you're part of the team at Thermo Fisher, you'll do important work that supports a powerful mission.

About the location:

Our East Grinstead site manufactures Sensititre products (mainly an Anti-microbial Susceptibility Test, AST). The products are used in Veterinary, Clinical and Research markets. The site often works with pharmaceutical companies to help bring a drug to market.

We have approximately 120 employees based at this location.

The role:

We are expanding the Quality team at our East Grinstead site and we're looking for an experienced Quality Management Specialist to join us. This role will you offer variety, interesting work and a range of challenges. You will provide support and leadership for junior members of the team, be involved in and take the lead on a range of projects, including work related to COVID, work with internal and external stakeholders, and you will deputise for the Site Quality Manager when needed.

The role will be based on site, however due to the pandemic at present and for the foreseeable future we team members are working circa 3 days a week onsite and 2 days a week from home. Moving forward we expect to be able to offer some remote/flexible working.

Your key responsibilities will include:
Maintain compliance to the requirements of the Quality System and help ensure the Quality Assurance team meets the QMS objectives for the site.
Undertake QA responsibilities regarding failure investigations, hold and recall investigations, risk assessments and field actions, ensuring all necessary reviews are timely documented and completed.
Ensuring compliance and assisting in audits, including Quality Management Systems (ISO 13485:2016, MDSAP) and the In-Vitro Diagnostics Directive. Ensure corrective actions are implemented for issues arising from the audits.
Perform internal audits to ensure compliance to external regulatory requirements
Responsible for reviewing and approving quality documents in line with local quality procedures.
Lead, process, co-ordinate, monitor and track change control and ensure all requirements are met and complete.
To act as coordinator and/or QA Representative on Corrective Action investigations.
Lead in the role of Risk Management and PMS; with knowledge of ISO14971.
Support Technical File maintenance and IFU updates
Provide metric data for Management meetings, Management Review, measurement of site quality goals and data trend analysis.
Provide technical and Quality support of projects, ensuring relevant data is completed
Review and sign off for validation and drug development files from a QA perspective
Ensure training program for Quality functions and relevant documentation is up-to-date and lead in Quality training for the site e.g. GMP etc.
Assist with mentoring and leading a small team of Quality Assurance professionals
Deputise for the Quality Manager in their absence
Some management responsibilities for the QA Admin and Apprenticeship roles
We're looking for someone who has/is:
Proven experience in a QMS role, preferably within Medical Device Directive (MDD) or IVD In-Vitro Diagnostics (IVD) - pharmaceutical experience will also be considered
Degree in microbiology or a related field
Experience working on audits
Experience with writing concise/accurate reports
High attention to detail
Excellent interpersonal skills - able to work with a broad range of stakeholders, both internal and external
Able to work flexibly to ensure deadlines are met
Competent in the use of the MS Office suite
What's in it for you:
Competitive base salary
Annual bonus
Potential for flexible working
Development opportunities
Free on-site car parking
Competitive contributory pension
Private medical insurance
Flexible benefits
With Thermo FisherScientific, it's not just a career. It's a chance torealiseyour best - professionally and personally.
