Job Description

To ensure that all buildings are compliant to Statutory, Health and Safety and Technical Legislation

To ensure all asset data is accurate and up to date in Maximo and produce accurate and timely reports on all areas of compliance for both the Client and Account Manager

To act as QHSE and compliance expert and advisor for all activities on all sites

To ensure compliance with the Maintenance Quality Management System across the whole contract portfolio

Responsible for producing and managing Management Information for Asset and Compliance Information

Main Duties

To ensure all sites are statutory compliant, technically compliant and are operated safely in accordance with HSAW 1974

To advise Mitie and client management on statutory and technical compliance and on all aspects of QHSE

To ensure all assets are managed correctly

Ensure employees work in a safe and diligent manner

To ensure all staff comply with all Health and Safety policies and procedures

To arrange and/or deliver QHSE and compliance training

To undertake additional duties in line with capabilities as required

Carry out investigations into near misses, accidents and H&S breaches and produce detailed reports

Carry out investigations into any compliance failings of suppliers and site team

Ensure suppliers are using approved products and that all works being planned is working in line with the clients and our own Environmental Plans

Provide proactive advice and assistance to engineering staff across the portfolio

Ensure compliance with legislation and improve the maintenance strategy for the contract

Ensure the delivery of SLA’s relating to PPM performance through regular review and as appropriate ensure modifications and amendments are conducted

To meet with and audit employee and sub-contractor competences and working practices

To audit and monitor works in accordance with Quality procedures

Carry out Health and Safety “Tool Box Talks”

Carry out safety inspections as and when required in line with Quality Procedures

Implement the account compliance spread sheet, electronic files and hard copy files and maintain up to date records

Communicate with clients on a regular basis to ensure correct levels of customer care

Communicate with the Account Manager, Operations Managers and Supervisors to ensure consistency across the contract and information is shared to review and audit RAMS and permits to work

Ensure that a good understanding of the contract is achieved and that you make time available to be familiar with documentation and manuals as required to fulfill the role

Ensure that site Log Books are in place and used correctly on all sites and are audited regularly

Ensure team members are suitably dressed for work and have the required PPE and tools to carry out their jobs

Advise Management of building risks such as asbestos, water hygiene, cooling towers, closed systems and fire risk and produce Management Plans for all

Update the Management team and Client of any new legislative changes or ACoP relative to the contract

Attend as Representative for the contract at all Monthly QHSE Meetings and ensure meeting notes and actions are briefed to Mitie management and communicated to the whole team

Ensure all QHSE Communications are communicated to all staff and are available for them to read

Ensure that all staff are up to date on all training and a training program is produced to maintain staff at the required level

Manage the Compliance spread sheet and demonstrate performance across the account

To provide monthly and ad-hoc reports as required to the Account Manager and Client

Implement processes for services to comply with OHSAS 18001 and BS 8800:2007

Provide cover/assistance for other members of the Management Team in their absence

Audit all the supply chain effectively to ensure they are compliant and work to Mitie and GEM requirements

Qualifications

· Sufficient experience of operational and senior QHSE management

· NEBOSH Certificate in Occupational Safety & Health or equivalent, ideally diploma level

· Ideally a technical qualification or background and experience of working in a technical environment

· Internal Auditor qualification and auditing experience

· Demonstrable understanding of the Maximo CAFM system and its function in respect to frequencies, asset lifecycle and compliance

· Good interpersonal skills

· Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to communicate effectively at all levels

· Good presentation and report writing skills

· Ability to effectively deliver QHSE training

· Experience with practical implementation of ISO 9001, 14001, OHSAS 18001 & QUENSH

· Strong leadership and Management skills

Successful candidate will be subject to in-depth and intrusive security clearance process.

Additional Information

Health and Safety responsibilities
• Follow Group and company policies and procedures at all times;
• Report any apparent deficiencies in systems of work or equipment provided that may result in failure of service delivery or risk to health and safety or the environment;
• Use all work equipment and personal PPE properly and in accordance with training received;
• Report any issues or training needs to your Line manager and /or via your divisional incident reporting system;

Information Security
• Ensure compliance with Mitie's information security procedures in all activities;
• Proactively identify and report security risks to your manager;
• Report actual and suspected security incidents;

Note
This job description Is intended to give the post holder an appreciation of the role envisaged for this position and the range of duties undertaken. Specific tasks and objectives will be agreed with the post holder throughout the period of employment. The job description may be varied from time to time by the Company to reflect changes in the post holder’s role and/or the needs of the business.

The Team

Led by the Group Director of Internal Audit and reporting to the Audit Committee, we are a select team of independent professionals who seek to deliver valuable, pragmatic insights and assurance to the business and the Audit Committee.

The Role

The role will focus primarily on technology risks and technology assurance reviews, reporting directly to the Technology Audit Principal with the occasional opportunity to undertake business and operational reviews.

The Opportunity

This is a great opportunity for an individual who wants to make a mark across the business. Assignments will focus on IT/technology, however, will also spread into integrated operational, projects, commercial and compliance audits which will give great exposure and opportunities for gaining experience and personal growth. This is a global coverage role, so the opportunity exists to periodically visit international markets too.

Should you join the team, you can be sure that the majority of work you do will be risk-based and prioritised against the key risks and strategic opportunities of Just Eat.

Key responsibilities
Delivery of audit planning, fieldwork and reporting – This will require supporting the Technology Audit Principal in planning, independently performing risk and control analysis, executing audit testing and preparing reports for IA management review and finalisation.
Project management – Managing yours, your manager’s, supporting auditors and business stakeholders’ time across the business to deliver each audit effectively and efficiently.
Relationships – Managing relationships with stakeholders and helping build our reputation as a business-astute, highly professional and capable audit team.
Quality – Deliver all aspects of work in accordance with our methodology to the Technology Audit Principal for quality review.
Audit and risk operations – Being proactive and contributing to team operations, including quarter-end reporting, audit issue follow-ups, enterprise risk management activities and any other team activities.
Required skills and experience
Ideally CISA or equivalent, CISSP is desirable given the technology environment.
Proven experience across IT/technology processes including Information and cybersecurity, cloud and SaaS systems (e.g. AWS, GCP), application controls, change management, agile and waterfall development, DevOps, networking, database management, identity and access management (e.g. Okta) and resilience and disaster recovery planning. Technology frameworks experience such as CoBIT, NIST Cybersecurity and ITIL 4 also desirable.
Proven experience in managing and delivering end-to-end audit cycle
Strong written communication skills and has considerable experience in writing polished and punchy audit reports.
Strong analytical and data-driven credentials linked to smart auditing and providing unique data-driven insights back to the business.
Excellent communication and influencing skills
Travel - 10% to 20% travel time expected for the role

About “STL”*
STL* (Sterlite Technologies Limited) is a data networks innovator, driving end-to-end hyper-scale data network solutions beyond tomorrow.
STL* designs, delivers and integrate digital networks for our customers. With core capabilities in Optical Interconnect, Virtualised Access Solutions, Network Software and System Integration, we are the industry’s leading end-to-end solutions provider for global digital networks. We partner with global telecom companies, cloud companies, citizen networks and large enterprises to deliver solutions for their fixed and wireless systems for current and future needs. We believe the networks of tomorrow are fundamentally different from the traditional ones. These hyper-scale networks are denser, deeply fiberised and software-defined with computing at the edge. With our unique silicon to software capability, we design, build and manage solutions for such hyper-scale networks. From frugal 5G and mini data centre kiosks to bring connectivity, apps and critical services to the remotest areas to powering data-hungry applications for new tech such as augmented reality, enterprise IoT and autonomous cars, we are innovating to make digital ubiquitous.
STL* serves 100+ countries, has 3 Innovation centres, 358 patents filed globally and readying for exponential growth over the next five years.
www.stl.tech*
STL Values*
STL, *a company, advancing in leaps and bounds, places tremendous emphasis on values. A fundamental ideology is crucial to manoeuvre an organisation towards success. Through a stable value system, STLers are enabling an unprecedented transformation. Not just a digital transformation; it is something as expansive as people and a best-in-class global culture.
*Respect & Empathise*
*Hunger to Learn*
*Promises Delivered*
*Keep it Simple*
Role Purpose*
STL* (Sterlite Technologies Ltd) are continuing to grow rapidly and to support the next stage of our growth in the United Kingdom we are recruiting for a *GIS & Delivery Systems Manager. *The role will manage, guide and mentor the objectives of the automation and delivery team to successfully deliver and operationally support the end to end delivery of software automation. The prime focus will be on the infrastructure and workflow to enable the organisation to continuously improve the quality and speed of service delivery, documenting and enabling all areas of the department to step away from repetitive tasks and concentrate on delivering efficiently, digitally transformed services. Align development and maintenance processes with departmental standards and help evolve these standards to include automation where it can add value. They must create and maintain relationships with stakeholders at all levels who use the team's services and who govern the data that is held in them. Best practice systems and standards that are implemented at Group level but this role will be responsible for adapting and advising the processes and automation needed for the local UK market requirements.
Role Responsibilities*
Lead, manage and own the end-end system mapping for the STL – UK delivery engine and associated automation development. Focussing on the development and interpretation of the STL GIS software automation, "LEAD360" and "FTTx MANTRA" delivery engine automation.
Using project management and technical leadership expertise, produce plans which ensure the success of the automation services. Engender a low-concurrency, high-velocity delivery culture within teams and the management of projects, seeking to deliver value to the users in the shortest sustainable time.
Working with key stakeholders, develop a strategic roadmap for the introduction and delivery of automation services which aligns with changes in both the technical landscape and the business and client needs.
Develop and maintain a lifecycle plan for all services that the team runs.
Contribute, and encourage others to contribute, to communities of best practice (e.g. testing, security, user experience) in the development of policies and procedures which aim to showcase the best way across different delivery streams.
Lead the delivery, automation development and support for the GIS system which supports the design team. This tool will be critical to the practical and quality designs produced for clients and is of primary focus system for delivery.
Work across departments and Group departments to ensure best Industry practices are supported in the agile development of the systems.
Work with supply chain to evaluate new partners, systems and automation benefits when needed, including commercial, support and partnership roadmaps.
Please note this role description is indicative and not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Role duties, responsibilities and activities may reasonably change at any time with or without prior notice.
Skills & Experience*
5+ Years of experience automating processes for infrastructure delivery and knowledge of the software design patterns that a software delivery team will use.
5+ Years of experience of managing teams of people to define and deliver departmental and organisational system scaled outcomes.
5+ Years of working or leading GIS system developments and integrations, specifically Telecommunications in a GIS environment and related innovation in real-time data upload of field records.
Essential experience and working knowledge in GIS systems such as Comsof, GE Smallworld, 3GIS, ESRI, MapInfo and/or QGIS.
Significant experience of developing and managing enterprise-scale services that are incredibly granular and diverse, meeting the needs of both the local and Group organisations.
Experience in a technical lead role in the implementation of complex and significant enterprise-wide services.
Ability to plan, estimate and keep track of significant change projects with an appreciation of the long-term issues.
Capacity and resource planning skills such that a team can consistently deliver their objectives.
Experience of budgetary planning.
Experience of leading and managing a highly technical team ensuring a safe a productive work environment.
Demonstrable ability to present your ideas and your area to a broad audience.
Experience in successful leadership of a team, with the ability to inspire and develop high performance
High learning agility, adaptability and track record of exceptional results
Results-oriented change agent with analytical skills
Determination to succeed in a new environment whilst building sustainable relations with our suppliers
Experience using Enterprise Project Management, SAP Ariba, Signavio or Tableau is an advantage.

ROLE SUMMARY

Science is the foundation of all that we do at Pfizer. We are seeking a Senior Manager, Documentation Management who will join a diverse team of dedicated professionals driven to significantly improve the lives of patients through his/her/their work at a company whose culture is committed to developing and nurturing diverse talent so that each colleague has the opportunity to build a fulfilling career. Regulatory Quality Assurance (RQA) is an independent Quality audit function within the Compliance division, accountable to identify risks and non-compliance associated with Pfizer’s GxP regulated operations. The Senior Manager, Documentation Management is responsible for RQA business process design, strategy, development and implementation. This individual develops and implements quality programs to ensure consistency and compliance within departments, SOPs and regulatory requirements. This role leads cross functional projects to share best practices and knowledge with functional counterparts and ensures all colleagues are adequately trained to meet the needs of the business.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES
Design and manage the framework and strategy to support process standards across RQA
Work with the RQA Leadership Team and audit process BPOs (GxP) to determine the SOPs and other critical policy/process documents that need to be developed and/or updated and establish their prioritization
Manage critical audit process and strategy projects that contribute to efficient, effective and compliant RQA processes
In partnership with the BPOs, develop and implement the strategy for a comprehensive quality control/monitoring program that facilitates consistency and compliance with SOPs, work instructions, Corporate and Healthcare Compliance policies and Regulatory requirements, and enables monitoring of processes and standards
Mentor colleague(s) responsible for process monitoring
Guide business process subject matter experts (SMEs) in the development, implementation and maintenance of appropriate SOPs and guidelines that help to assure data integrity, accuracy, and consistency and support the business needs of RQA and Pfizer Inc.
Lead the identification and initiation of continuous process improvements to enhance the quality of operations, systems and services
Own the strategy to provide, implement and manage an easily accessible, centrally controlled document management system to store local SOP’s, guidelines and other standard documents and templates. Support, maintain, propose and track enhancements associated with all audit systems
Lead/Participate on cross functional projects teams and share knowledge and best practices with Medical and Pfizer counterparts
Ensure revised documents are provided to Training manager to develop necessary training guides and included in training curricula
Compare and contrast RQA generated gaps against inspectional gaps, track and report audit effectiveness
Participate on and coordinate internal audits as applicable
Value stream map as needed RQA processes and linkages with other departmental processes to create continuous improvement opportunities
Ensure RQA SOPs and standards are periodically reviewed and in compliance with internal / external requirements
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

Candidate demonstrates a breadth of diverse leadership experiences and capabilities including: the ability to influence and collaborate with peers, develop and coach others, oversee and guide the work of other colleagues to achieve meaningful outcomes and create business impact.
BS (advanced degree strongly preferred)
8+ years industry or other relevant experience
GxP experience is preferred
Continuous improvement expertise, a plus
Excellent project management, presentation development and communication skills
Global perspective within the context of business needs and impact
Demonstrated business acumen and solid understanding of the business processes of the RQA organization
Demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, respond to tight timelines, and meet frequently changing priorities
Customer-oriented approach and ability to effectively work in cross-functional teams
Proven experience in contributing to the planning and implementation of processes to optimize business operations
Last Date to Apply for Job: November 22, 2020

Employee Referral Bonus Eligible

Sunshine Act

Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.

ROLE SUMMARY

Science is the foundation of all that we do at Pfizer. We are seeking a Senior Manager, Documentation Management who will join a diverse team of dedicated professionals driven to significantly improve the lives of patients through his/her/their work at a company whose culture is committed to developing and nurturing diverse talent so that each colleague has the opportunity to build a fulfilling career. Regulatory Quality Assurance (RQA) is an independent Quality audit function within the Compliance division, accountable to identify risks and non-compliance associated with Pfizer’s GxP regulated operations. The Senior Manager, Documentation Management is responsible for RQA business process design, strategy, development and implementation. This individual develops and implements quality programs to ensure consistency and compliance within departments, SOPs and regulatory requirements. This role leads cross functional projects to share best practices and knowledge with functional counterparts and ensures all colleagues are adequately trained to meet the needs of the business.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES
Design and manage the framework and strategy to support process standards across RQA
Work with the RQA Leadership Team and audit process BPOs (GxP) to determine the SOPs and other critical policy/process documents that need to be developed and/or updated and establish their prioritization
Manage critical audit process and strategy projects that contribute to efficient, effective and compliant RQA processes
In partnership with the BPOs, develop and implement the strategy for a comprehensive quality control/monitoring program that facilitates consistency and compliance with SOPs, work instructions, Corporate and Healthcare Compliance policies and Regulatory requirements, and enables monitoring of processes and standards
Mentor colleague(s) responsible for process monitoring
Guide business process subject matter experts (SMEs) in the development, implementation and maintenance of appropriate SOPs and guidelines that help to assure data integrity, accuracy, and consistency and support the business needs of RQA and Pfizer Inc.
Lead the identification and initiation of continuous process improvements to enhance the quality of operations, systems and services
Own the strategy to provide, implement and manage an easily accessible, centrally controlled document management system to store local SOP’s, guidelines and other standard documents and templates. Support, maintain, propose and track enhancements associated with all audit systems
Lead/Participate on cross functional projects teams and share knowledge and best practices with Medical and Pfizer counterparts
Ensure revised documents are provided to Training manager to develop necessary training guides and included in training curricula
Compare and contrast RQA generated gaps against inspectional gaps, track and report audit effectiveness
Participate on and coordinate internal audits as applicable
Value stream map as needed RQA processes and linkages with other departmental processes to create continuous improvement opportunities
Ensure RQA SOPs and standards are periodically reviewed and in compliance with internal / external requirements
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

Candidate demonstrates a breadth of diverse leadership experiences and capabilities including: the ability to influence and collaborate with peers, develop and coach others, oversee and guide the work of other colleagues to achieve meaningful outcomes and create business impact.
BS (advanced degree strongly preferred)
8+ years industry or other relevant experience
GxP experience is preferred
Continuous improvement expertise, a plus
Excellent project management, presentation development and communication skills
Global perspective within the context of business needs and impact
Demonstrated business acumen and solid understanding of the business processes of the RQA organization
Demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, respond to tight timelines, and meet frequently changing priorities
Customer-oriented approach and ability to effectively work in cross-functional teams
Proven experience in contributing to the planning and implementation of processes to optimize business operations

Sunshine Act

Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.

Job Details

Who we are...

Tableau joined the Salesforce Ohana in 2019 as an analytics trailblazer. Within Tableau Sales, the Global Services organization is supported by the Global Services Operations team which has a diverse purview including business analytics, procurement activities, business operational support, Tableau Education services, and the Tableau Services Subcontracting Program. In Global Services, we value an inclusive approach to attracting and growing talent. Whether we’re providing functional support, building programs, or rolling out the latest process improvements, we are focused on providing a great professional experience while continuing to develop an effective operational foundation for Global Services.

What you'll be doing...

We are looking for an Operations Manager to help us build out a new function within the Tableau Services Subcontracting Program. As we mature our subcontracting operations, you’ll manage our EMEA/APAC Professional Services and Education subcontractor relationships including performance management, develop growth and nurture plans, and iterate on the building of supporting processes. You’ll be responsible for tasks throughout the subcontractor lifecycle including onboarding, resource vetting, escalation management, and portfolio reviews. This role provides a unique combination of relationship building/management with an operational focus on developing a new function with an eye to effectiveness and efficiency.

Your Impact:

Success will be measured by the overall performance of the Tableau Services Subcontracting Program team to provide the Global Services organization with a cost-effective, high quality subcontracting network.

Assist with the development of the Subcontractor Manager role within AMER (EMEA/APAC) region
Develop and nurture strong relationships with key training and consulting partners in the EMEA/APAC region
Execute on subcontractor program functions throughout the subcontractor lifecycle including partner onboarding, oversight, logistics, and portfolio reviews
Monitor subcontractor performance in areas including process compliance, quality, revenue, and strategic fit
Oversee issue resolution and escalation management related to subcontractors in the EMEA/APAC region
Identify potential improvements that can enhance the overall value, efficiency, and effectiveness of the subcontracting program and subcontractor experience
Work closely with regional Account Partners and Delivery teams to ensure adequate subcontractor capacity and skill set coverage

Minimum Requirements:

Ability to build and sustain strong relationships with external partners
Experience monitoring metrics/data for trends and issues
Ability to address performance issues and escalations without damaging the subcontractor relationship
Experience with successfully managing a large, diverse workload such as managing multiple projects, accounts, and/or cases
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Strong cross-functional teaming skills and collaborative problem solving
Self-directed and resourceful with strong interpersonal, teamwork, and organizational skills
Ability to bring clarity and structure when managing fluid expectations and evolving demands
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Ability to balance thoroughness, high quality, and efficiency within a high volume of tasks

Preferred Requirements:

Experience in an operational role with success in identifying and executing process and program improvements
Ability to build, manage and utilize Tableau dashboards
Experience in a partner-related role in the software, professional services, or related industry
Proficiency in languages other than English

Quality Manager - QMS ISO 13485 - Letchworth Garden City and Homebased

Due to expansion plans of a Medical Devices company based around Letchworth Garden City, Hertfordshire, we are looking for an experienced Quality Manager who will be able to establish a QMS from scratch, specifically to ISO 13485 standards.

You will also be creating and managing technical files for a number of Medical Devices lines for Class I, Class IIa and Class IIb Medical Devices. This is a unique role that will allow you to split your role from being in the office and working from home, however this split will need to be agreed between yourself and the company to make sure you still have the support you need to be successful.

This is not a Quality Manager role where you will be leading a team, you will be providing all of the Quality Assurance duties yourself. As the company grows there may be new roles that will report into you, but this is not going to happen quickly. So, if you are not happy working on the quality duties yourself, this is not the role for you.

Apart from having a Quality Assurance, to ISO 13485 standards, background it would also be highly advantageous if you have a good understanding of Regulatory Affairs too.

Part of your role will be working alongside the manufacturing teams for these medical devices, due to this it would be highly beneficial if your Medical Devices Quality Assurance experience came from a Quality Engineering background, however this is not essential.

You will be rewarded with an excellent starting salary, end of year bonuses, health insurance and other benefits.

I expect a lot of interest in this role and expect the organisation to move quickly with their hire, so if you are interested in this role I suggest you make an application now or risk missing out.

For more information, please feel free to call Andrew Welsh, Director of Medical Devices recruitment and Scientific recruitment specialists Newton Colmore Consulting, on +44 121 268 2240 or make an application and one of our team at Newton Colmore Consulting will contact you.

Newton Colmore Consulting is a specialist recruitment company within the Medical Devices, Scientific Engineering, Data Science, Machine Learning, Scientific Software, Robotics, Science, Electronics Design, New Product Design, Human Factors, Regulatory Affairs, Quality Assurance and Field Service Engineering sectors.

Programme Test Manager / Consultant

Sogeti UK, Part of the Capgemini Group

Join a world-leading IT consultancy and thought leader within the software testing field

Base Location – You can choose from either; London / Birmingham / Bristol / Manchester

About Sogeti and the Capgemini Group

Sogeti UK is renowned for being the Testing & Quality Assurance specialists and we’re looking for talented individuals with a passion for quality assurance and testing who want to join a market leading Digital Assurance and Quality Engineering organization as consultants. You’ll help grow our expert testing capabilities as we expand our family of testing professionals and maintain our position as a “Leader” of Next-Generation Software Testing Services (As of 2019, reported by NelsonHall).

Globally, Sogeti is part of the Capgemini Group, Sogeti operates in more than 100 locations globally. Working closely with clients and partners to take full advantage of the opportunities of technology, Sogeti combines agility and speed of implementation to tailor innovative future-focused solutions in Digital Assurance and Testing, Cloud and Cybersecurity, all fuelled by AI and automation.

Capgemini is a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services. The Group is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year+ heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company of 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of €17billion.

The Role

As a Sogeti UK consultant, you will be part of the Testing & Quality Assurance specialists and represent Sogeti by providing expert solutions to our customers to help us maintain our position as a leader in the market. You will work on different client sites in a range of industries that include; well known global brands, government, finance, insurance, aerospace and media/digital. You will gain exposure to a variety of tools and technologies that will allow you to continuously develop as a subject matter expert in testing.

As a Programme Test Manager / Consultant at Sogeti, you can:-

Work with the latest testing tools and upskill in different technologies through our work on various customer sites.
Work onsite, representing the global Sogeti brand with a range of customers to gain invaluable experience, quickly. Customers include well known global grands, government, finance, insurance, aerospace and media/digital.
Gain experience within a market leader in Next-Generation Software Testing Services.
Have a genuine and transparent career path mapped out; We prefer to promote from within rather than recruit externally so you’ll have every opportunity to develop.
Develop yourself with continuous learning and development by providing you the tools and support to drive your own career in the direction you want!

As a Programme Test Manager / Consultant, we’re looking for:-

Programme / Portfolio Test Management experience working for a consultancy.
Previous experience of shaping, creating and implementing programme level test strategies. Including Automation approaches and Non-Functional test approaches.
Programme level quality assurance and providing strong test governance of dev partners/suppliers activities.
Excellent stakeholder communication skills, able to summarise a complicated data set into meaningful progress reports.
Previous experience of working on a cloud reporting migration E2E, would be beneficial.
Previous experience of integrating Agile and Waterfall methodologies.
Preferably exposure to a DevOps environment.
Experience navigating around a complicated set of supplier relationships.
Experience with Test Management tools.
Experience of managing remote teams, including nearshore and offshore.
Project budget management, including “Fixed Price” commercial deals.
Flexibility on travel / work locations during the working week.
ISEB / ISTQB or equivalent certification in testing at foundation level or above.

A typical first project at Sogeti UK will have the following key tasks & responsibilities:-

Responsible for defining and implementing the approach (Strategy) to testing within the programme.
Work with the Test Leads and Programme’s Project Managers to ensure that the testing is conducted in line with their strategic direction and the strategy.
Assist in defining the test environment strategy for the programme.
Work with the suppliers and portfolio areas to ensure ongoing compliance to the customer’s testing strategy.
Lead the review of requirements, from a testing perspective.
Work with the customer’s procurement team to ensure that any contracts with suppliers adequately consider testing and quality.
Identify the areas of testing risk; provide ongoing visibility of those to the programme management team.
Actively drive testing efficiency throughout the supply chain.
Manage the testing team supplied by Sogeti, ensuring we deliver on our commitments.
Provide ad hoc consultancy on testing as required.
Provide a consolidated view of test progress across all work streams during the preparation and execution phases.
Potentially acting as the Account Engagement Lead, our most senior delivery role for the account.

Our inclusive Culture

Sogeti UK positively encourages applications from eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity. We foster an inclusive culture that enables everyone to achieve their full potential and enjoy a fulfilling career with us. Our comprehensive flexible benefits package and lifestyle policies enable our employees to balance their individual, family and work-life needs.

Location
Blackpool, Leeds, London, Manchester, Newcastle-upon-Tyne, Sheffield
About the job
Summary
The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare, pensions and child maintenance policy. As the UK’s biggest public service department, we operate on a scale that is almost unmatched anywhere in Europe and most people in Britain come into contact with us at some point in their lives.

DWP Estates Directorate are accountable for the delivery of all aspects of real estate services and the work we do is critical in ensuring the vital work that the Department undertakes is enabled effectively. The DWP commercial estate is the largest within Government and our diverse national property portfolio reflects this scale. It is s a unique mix ranging from modern corporate centres, multi-occupied Service Centres, to its frontline high street services.

We are responsible for the Department’s 800+ workplaces, that provide workplaces for 85,000 employees and a UK wide presence for all those that visit us. Ultimately, the Department relies on us to provide safe and secure buildings that are fit for purpose and meet the needs of the business. The work you will be undertaking is therefore crucial in us meeting the needs of all those who use our services.

This senior management role based within the Policy and Compliance team, reporting to the Head of Estates Health, Safety and Environment, will be the key link to the asset management compliance on behalf of the Estates function. With over 200,000 assets, it will involve working across the Estates teams and closely with the Integrator and supply chain to monitor and drive continuous improvement in asset management data accuracy and timely completion of statutory inspections, testing, planned preventative maintenance and associated remedial work. You will be the focal point for Estates in relation to asset compliance and will be reviewing systems such as computer aided facilities management systems to ensure the Estates function receives accurate and timely reports and checking the delivery of the scheduled work so that asset and building compliance can be maintained.
Job description
• Lead accountability in driving Estates asset management compliance in relation to statutory, agreed industry standards and appropriate maintenance regimes to provide safe and efficient buildings
• Recognise the key asset risks for the Estate such as Fire, Water, Asbestos, Gas, Electricity and Lifts and to closely monitor their specific legal requirements with our partners
• Monitor and review asset management on behalf of Estates in relation to performance of planned preventative maintenance
• Analysis of data, reports and systems provided and held by partners to provide an accurate and timely understanding of asset management compliance to Estates
• Responsibility for developing, planning and delivering an Estates asset management audit process
• Work across Estates, the integrator and supply chain to improve and maintain accurate asset data
• Liaising and driving through partners the statutory and general compliance of assets across the Estate
• Being the subject matter expert for the Estates on the systems used by the integrator and supply chain for planned preventative maintenance and work order management in relation to assets
• Lead the support the development and implementation of continuous improvement in asset management processes
• Responsible for advising Estates and working collaboratively with partners on the legal and recognised standards such as SFG20 in relation to assets and how these need to be applied to maintain standards or achieve legal compliance
• Lead responsibility for devising in conjunction with partners suitable reporting metrics to enable the Estates to have a suitable grasp and understanding of its asset management compliance
• Responsibility for feeding prompt and relevant information in relation to statutory certification or reporting to colleagues within Estates Health and Safety and work with them and partners to drive any required resolutions
• Support understanding and decisions in relation to Capital Expenditure and Life Cycle Works through working across the Estates functions playing a strategic role in the forward planning of renewal, maintenance and repair programmes
• Lead point of contact in relation to enforcing authorities during either site audits which they may undertake or requests for information in relation to asset management
• Seek to identify financial risks associated with the Estates asset management and bring these to the attention of Estates colleagues

Responsibilities
Essential Skills, Knowledge & Experience

• Sound understanding of asset management and planned preventative maintenance schedules
• Up to date knowledge of the legislation and industry standards in relation to providing a safe Estate
• In depth knowledge of building asset types and their significance on legal compliance
• Previous experience working with an Integrator model and the use of technology to manage the Supply Chain (Desirable)
• Experience of resolving differences in interpretation or misunderstanding of the compliance related contractual obligations within the Supply Chain
• Previous use and work with planned preventative maintenance systems or similar information platforms
• Ability to analyse significant amounts of data produced by computer aided facilities management systems supporting a large portfolio
• Experience in working with partner organisations and supporting effective decision making leading to improved performance
• Involvement with project management in relation to asset management and being persuasive in identifying key areas of work required and prioritisation
• Influential and able to lead key senior stakeholders, colleagues and customers towards commercial solutions that give a balance of optimal performance whilst delivering on business and portfolio strategy

Leadership attributes and behaviours

• Works with others to actively and constructively identify areas for improvement and simplify efficient processes to use fewer resources
• Identify gaps in overall partnership working, and continuously seek and act on feedback to improve own, teams’ and partner performance
• Uses sound judgement, evidence and knowledge to arrive at accurate, expert and professional decisions and advice
• Encourages joined up teamwork within own team and working collaboratively with others including the wider government, sharing information appropriately and building professional relationships
• Takes ownership for results by working to agreed goals and activities and dealing with challenges in a responsive and constructive way
• Display confidence when making difficult decisions and challenges within complex situations, whilst understanding own level of responsibility and empowering others to make decisions as appropriate
• Plans, organises and manages times and activities effectively to deliver high quality performance

Qualifications/professional memberships

Essential

• NEBOSH Diploma (or equivalent)

Desirable

• Chartered Membership of IOSH (CMIOSH)
• Educated to degree level
• Working towards IWFM (Level 4-5) with a preference if already held
Qualifications
Qualifications/professional memberships

Essential

• NEBOSH Diploma (or equivalent)
Behaviours
We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:
Seeing the Big Picture
Changing and Improving
Making Effective Decisions
Delivering at Pace
Benefits
• Learning and development tailored to your role
• An environment with flexible working options
• A culture encouraging inclusion and diversity
• A Civil Service pension

Security

Selection process details
This vacancy is using Success Profiles, and will assess your Behaviours, Strengths and Experience.
STAGE 1 - APPLICATION & SIFT

As part of the application process you will be asked to provide a Personal Statement against the essential criteria as outlined above. You will also be asked to provide a short CV.

Your CV should be fairly short and just evidence very brief details of your work history and experience.
Please do not submit a speculative application where you do not meet at least 50% of the essential criteria as these applications will be unsuccessful. Do not include competency examples within your application as these will not be assessed in the sift and will only be used at interview stage.

Further details around what this will entail are listed on the application form.

There will be an initial sift of applications based on the Personal Statement only, so please ensure you evidence how you meet the Essential Skills, Knowledge & Experience requirement contained in the vacancy in this section. This will form a short list for interview.

STAGE 2 - INTERVIEW

All candidates who are successful at the sift stage will undertake a single virtual video interview.

The interview will follow a blended approach which will help us assess candidates Behaviours and Strengths. You will also be asked a specific Technical Question in relation to the role.

The sift will take place w/c 19 October and interview dates will be w/c 2 November. Due to the current situation with COVID19 the interviews are scheduled to take place virtually.

Apply now

Location:

London, United Kingdom

Company:
KPMG UK
We are looking for experienced auditors to join our Audit Corporates practice. We currently have full-time opportunities in our London office.

The Role:

As an Audit Manager, you will be involved in all aspects of leading and delivering audit engagements, from planning through to completion on a broad spectrum of Corporates clients. The role will include executive level client interaction and exposure to multiple clients on an annual basis, as well as daily tasks such as:
Leading a field work team including supervising and coaching more junior members of staff to help them reach their full potential
Reporting to audit Partners and Directors on all salient points arising from audits
Planning and execution of audit fieldwork and statutory reporting across a portfolio of clients
Project management of all aspects of audit including agreeing audit timelines, team briefings, and supervision and delivery of audit work
Budgeting and monitoring the financial performance of projects, focusing on optimising profitability
Identifying, researching and helping to resolve complex audit issues
Preparing client deliverables, building relationships with the client staff and acting as an ambassador for the firm
Keeping up to date with KPMG's product and service offerings and identifying the sales opportunities that will help us grow our business
Working on audit tenders and working as part of the relevant independence team on these tenders. Tasks may include: reviewing global engagement records in sentinel; analysing and categorising the records; contacting partners globally for engagement information; preparing data and drafting Independence reports; liaising with the UK Ethics and Independence team
You may also have the opportunity to work on specific audit related projects across the audit function
Required Experience and Background:
Self-driven and resilient and able to thrive in a pressurised environment
Well-developed team management and supervisory skills and the ability to effectively communicate with a wide range of individuals both internally and externally at different levels of seniority
The desire to work in a diverse environment, gain exposure to an international working environment and undertake new challenges
Strong project management techniques including decision-making ability, analytical skills, time management, prioritisation, organisation and evaluative skills
Monitors and upholds high quality of service and products to clients (internal and external)
Required Qualifications and Skills:
Fully qualified ACA/ACCA or international equivalent
Recent, extensive external audit experience at Manager level within a 'Big 4’ or mid-tier firm
Team management experience with the ability to motivate a team and lead by example
The ability to effectively communicate with a wide range of individuals both internally and externally at different seniority levels
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal
Strong IT literacy, including Excel, PowerPoint and Word
Sound practical knowledge of IFRS
Previous exposure to a range of Corporates sectors such as telecommunications, media, energy, utilities, and/or oil&gas

Job Segment:
Audit, Telecom, Telecommunications, Manager, Project Manager, Technology, Finance, Management

Apply now

Our Organisation

NHS England and NHS Improvement came together on 1 April 2019 as a new single organisation. The NHS Long Term Plan focuses on delivering integrated care to patients at the local level and we can best support the NHS to deliver this as a single integrated organisation.

At the NHS, we are reminded every day of how important life is. As a flexible working friendly organisation, we want to be sure that you can work in a way that is best for us and for our patients, and for you. Speak to us about how we might be able to accommodate a flexible working arrangement whether that’s job share, part time or another flexible pattern. In addition, although the role advertised may have an ‘home’ office base indicated, we remain committed to supporting flexibility around workplace locations. If it works for the service, we will do our best to make it work for you.

Our new operating model represents a strong shift to regional delivery supported by expert corporate teams. Local health systems are supported by our integrated regional teams who play a major leadership role in the geographies they manage.

We are jointly committed to creating and maintaining a fair and supportive working environment and culture, where contributions are fully recognised and valued by all and staff feel empowered to carry out their duties to the best of their abilities. As employers we are committed to promoting and protecting the physical and mental health and well-being of all our staff. This underpins our values as set out in the NHS Constitution, supports us to be an Employer of Choice and ultimately enables our employees to support the effective care of our patients.

Based in Skipton House (London), the Provider Development directorate works with regional teams, local health systems and the provider sector to ensure that we have strong and successful providers, working collaboratively within strong and successful systems, in the best interests of local patients, populations and staff. Provider policy sits within this directorate.

We are a friendly team responsible for developing evidence-based advice and recommendations on high profile, important issues to support NHS England and NHS Improvement and the provider sector to make decisions that improve the delivery of care.

Our team looks beyond the headline questions to understand the real issues behind them, drawing on multiple sources of information on the provider sector and our knowledge of the policy and regulatory landscape. We use a range of structured tools to tackle each issue and engage widely to understand different perspectives and move thinking forward.

Our current work programme covers a broad range of high profile and interesting areas, including:

delivery of NHS long term plan commitments to support small rural acute providers and facilitate provider collaboration with systems
deep dive reviews into important issues facing providers in response to Covid-19 that fall at the interface between national policy and operational delivery
policy development and advise on providing-facing issues, including the NHS oversight framework, legislation, independent provider regulation and policy.

The role of the Senior Manager is to support, and lead as appropriate, the design and delivery of major policy and strategy projects, leading and delivering workstreams and managing stakeholders at all levels internally and externally.

This role involves:

owning the development of policy workstreams to support the development of the provider landscape and policy across NHS England and NHS Improvement.
delivering key strategic projects spanning the themes of oversight and improvement, the use of regulatory levers including competition and procurement, driving improvement in quality, integrated and new models of care and efficiency and productivity in the NHS.
developing policy and strategy for Provider Development and supporting decision makers within the organisation.
working collaboratively with national health and care bodies, including the government, and the sector itself.

The post holder manages Analysts and discrete workstreams

We aim to be an inclusive team that is flexible and supports a wide range of lived experience and obligations beyond work. We would encourage anyone that matches the person specification to make an application. However, we recognise that sometimes people have a question about working on our team that is not covered in the job description or person specification. If you would like an informal discussion about the role or how we are supporting inclusivity, please contact Steve Beales (steve.beales@nhs.net).

If you would like to speak to members of our team and find out more about how we work in practice, please register to attend a virtual open evening on Wednesday November 11, 5-6pm.

Email NHSI.Policyteam@nhs.net to confirm your place and for any further details.

Job Title: Band 8a Clinical Coding Audit and Training Manager
Job Description:
An excellent opportunity has arisen to provide the Auditing and Training lead to the Royal Free London NHS Foundation on the delivery of the Clinical Coding audit and training function. The successful candidate will develop and implement a comprehensive clinical coding audit strategy and training programme for the coding department.

Working together with the management team you will provide assurance to the Trust and assist in the development of the clinical coders. You will have extensive clinical coding experience, hold the ACC, Audit and Training Qualification and have evidence of successful completion of the auditors and trainers annual log book. On-going training and support will be available with opportunities to gain new experiences, working closely with other services including commissioning and finance teams.

The post holder will provide comprehensive training to the coding staff in order to achieve and maintain the highest level of competency and accreditation. You will be responsible for the development and implementation of individual mentorship, training and audit programmes, to ensure that coders are confident and effective in their roles and to facilitate the achievement of the necessary quality standards and information governance requirement. You will be required to carry out the Data Security and Protection Toolkit coding audit, complemented by a formal annual report.

The post holder will be highly numerate with excellent analytical and problem solving skills to assimilate complex information to enable effective decision making. Knowledge of National Coding Standards, audit methodology and policies is essential along with a detailed understanding of ICD10, OPCS4 ,HRG4+, Payment by Results and health service data /financial flows.

We are looking for an experienced team player to continue the excellent work of the department and build on existing high standards. If you like the challenge of working in a busy, fast moving environment and can demonstrate your ability to deliver clinical coding audits and training, then you may be the person to join our team.
AT* - Apprenticeship Training. Where AT* is entered next to the job title indicates that this vacancy is for an apprenticeship role.
By applying for this role, you accept if successful, that your personal data may be transferred from the Trust to another NHS organisation where your employment transfers within the NHS. This is in accordance with the streamlining programme which aims at saving you time and improving efficiencies within the NHS when your employment transfers. Therefore we require you to complete your stat and Man e-learning modules prior to joining our organisation.
If you require sponsorship to work in the UK, to avoid disappointment, please check to ensure you are eligible under the UKVI points based system.
Please see announcement from UKVI re arrangements in a Brexit ‘no deal’ situation for EU people to still be recruited and come and work here for up to 36 months. https://www.gov.uk/guidance/european-temporary-leave-to-remain-in-the-uk.

You will be asked to capture an image of the relevant documents as well as a selfie using your smartphone/tablet (if available) for Facial Matching via a unique Guestlink email.
The Trust will request a DBS (CRB) if post involves regulated activities. The Trust is compliant with the Disclosure and Barring Service Codes of practice and the Rehabilitation of offenders act.

Job Title: Safety Manager - Clinical Trials Services - Remote
Job Description:
Position Summary:

This highly visible role combines your clinical drug safety operations and project launch experience with your
project management expertise.

The Safety Manager provides leadership, management and general oversight and direction for clinical trials,
pharmaceutical/biological product safety reporting and related activities.

The Safety Manager may be involved in other therapeutic and product areas and post-marketing safety reporting
as required.

Responsibilities include oversight of drug safety operations including management and development of safety
staff, development and maintenance of project specific Safety Management Plan (SMP) and safety department
Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), case quality and reporting evaluation and compliance, client satisfaction,
adequate resource planning and allocation, and project financial performance and team performance.

Essential functions of the job include but are not limited to:

Management, support, direction, coordination and planning for drug safety reporting and related activities.
Strategic input, including providing subject matter expertise for drug safety services in the planning, setup,
maintenance and closure of projects, including costing, budgeting, resourcing, workflow and process design
and analysis.
Staff training and mentoring.
Monitor performance of direct reports and provide constructive feedback and coaching.
Liaison with internal (e.g. business operations, account management) and external stakeholders (e.g.
clients, third party vendors, health authorities, business partners).
Represent Safety if and when required for internal and external matters.
Provide support in internal and external audits and inspections and ensure that corrective actions are
implemented as appropriate.
Prepare and/or review project‑specific SMP
Assist with clinical trial case processing and QC and other activities as needed
Review and update proposals (RFP), budgets and contracts as required.
Represent safety during bid-defense meetings

Qualifications:

Minimum Required:

Minimum of 5 years of experience in clinical trial drug safety in the Pharma/CRO industry,minimum of 2
years in Manager/Lead role in drug safety or equivalent.
Degree in Pharmacy or Nursing preferred, but other Life Science, or other health-related field, or equivalent
qualification
Excellent knowledge of European drug safety and regulations, drug development, and
ability to apply global safety regulations
Proven track record of developing client relationships and functioning as a subject matter expert
Experience with Oracle Argus Safety Database
Proven ability to review and manage the safety budget
Supervisory experience
Solid understanding of all aspects of medicinal product project life-cycle
Resource planning and strategy.
Development and maintenance of Safety Department SOPs

Other Requirements:

Communicates and collaborate effectively and efficiently on safety issues to internal and external
stakeholders.
Ability to deliver on commitments and understanding of service culture
Maintain consistency of excellent safety assessments. In accordance with departments SOP and guidelines
Serve in cross-functional teams as Drug Safety expert.
Attend and/or lead safety operations discussions during client meetings
Monitor regulatory and quality compliance of safety reporting throughout trial.
Lead or contribute to process development and/or process improvements that support Drug Safety
Experience in evaluation of safety data and the preparation of safety reports (Individual and aggregate safety
reports in accordance with ICHE2A and C)
Customer focus, commitment to quality management and problem solving
Effective communication and negotiation skills

Proven Ability to:

Build effective project teams, motivate, delegate, and drive timely/quality decision-making and operational
performance
Gain trust and confidence with a variety of clients and within Precision
Create a sense of urgency and take a proactive, solutions-based approach
Prioritize and manage multiple, varied tasks with enthusiasm and attention to detail
Thrive in a matrix environment and to value the importance of teamwork
Work independently with limited oversight guidance

Preferred:

Experience in ICHE2D, E and EMA GVP
Early phase oncology clinical trial experience
Experience with managing safety database transition/migration
Fluency in major European language

Skills:

Demonstrates excellent scientific/clinical or analytical knowledge base, with ability to assess data and
understand the safety/medical or process implications.
Demonstrates excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong critical thinking, problem solving and decision-making skills
Excellent attention to detail, teamwork and initiative.
Able to plan effectively to create, update and maintain core safety documents in a timely manner.
High level of IT skills in Microsoft Office products.

Precision Medicine Group is an integrated team of experts in fields from advanced lab sciences to translational informatics, clinical trial delivery, and regulatory affairs, payer insights to marketing communications. Together, we help our pharmaceutical and life-sciences clients conquer product development and commercialization challenges in a rapidly evolving environment.

Business Title: IT Compliance Manager – McCann & CMG - Mid-level permanent role

Reports to: Director of IT Compliance – McCann & CMG

Department: IT

Office Location: Flexible

Job Function

The IT Compliance Manager is responsible for assisting the Director of IT Compliance to promote and support IT Compliance activities, within McCann Worldgroup and CMG, and ensure the agencies complete their annual SOX processes; Documentation, Testing and Issue Management, as well as providing assistance to all sites in-scope for an Internal Audit and PWC visits.

The position requires an individual who can proactively work with McCann and CMG agency businesses globally, IPG CISO office and IPG IT Compliance in the support of IPG IT Compliance objectives. The position requires an individual with a combination of technology centric and business management skills.

A key part of the role will be to review client Information Security questionnaires and contracts, liaising with agency client teams, IT, Finance and Legal. This will include Data Privacy provisions e.g. CCPA and GDPR, with specific reference to IT requirements.

Job Responsibilities

· Be responsible for managing the annual SOX programme within the agencies.
· Work with all agencies to ensure SOX Narratives & Management Testing are completed.
· Carry out reviews of SOX Narratives and Management Testing and liaise with the agencies to clarify quality of work.
· Maintain and update the IT Compliance portal and send regular communication to agencies to ensure they remain aware of IT Controls needs.
· Communicate and ensure compliance with IPG’s security policies and standards. This includes maintaining and updating the IT Compliance portal and the sending of regular communication to agencies to ensure they remain aware of IT Control requirements.
· Working within IPG’s Compliance tool (Openpages) to review documentation, testing and Issues and ensure information remains accurate and up to date.
· Work with the agencies to remediate issues and complete testing of controls to close issues
· Provide regular reports to the Director and the agencies of Compliance status
· Ensure that all IT activities are aligned closely with business objectives while ensuring Information Security policies, programs and systems are compliant with business and legal / regulatory requirements.
· Work proactively with IPG CISO, IT Compliance, McCann and CMG Management, including Finance, Legal and account teams.
· Work with IPG CISO to participate in and provide feedback on the review of the IPG IT SP&P’s
· Assessment of controls applicability within the ever changing and evolving technology landscape
· Gain and maintain strong relationships with McCann and CMG IT Management and support continuous improvement of the ISMP program
· Provide support to agency management to meet Client Contractual requirements and promote policies and procedures of ISMP program.
· Help co-ordinate information security and risk management projects with staff from the McCann & CMG agencies and IT organizations where required.
· Manage security incidents and events to protect IPG assets, including intellectual property, IT assets, fixed assets and the company's reputation.
· Responsible for the review of Client Information security requests, questionnaires, Contracts & RFP that include IT requirements, including Data Privacy requirements, liaising with Client Teams, Legal, Finance and IT.
· Liaise with IT teams in McCann and CMG to ensure they are kept aware of the ongoing requirements for maintaining IT Controls
· Become the key point person for all IT Compliance activity and enhance the IT Compliance skills of IT contacts in the offices.
Job Requirements
The ideal candidate is an integrator of people and processes, should possess solid domain competency in the field of information security and:
· Bachelors Degree in business administration or a technology-related field, or equivalent work- or education-related experience.
· Minimum of four to five years’ experience in an information security or IT positions preferably within the advertising/media/communications industry.
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills to both a technical and non-technical audience; interpersonal and collaborative skills
· Strong knowledge of technological trends and developments in the area of information security and risk management.
· Knowledge of security and control frameworks, such as ISO, COBIT, NIST, COSO and ITIL.
· Experience with contract and vendor negotiations, as well as responding to client inquiries in relation to information security.
· Ability to work well in a multi-cultural and diverse environment.
Professional certification, such as a CISSP, CISM, CISA would be an advantage.
· Competent with MS Office, particularly Excel, and familiarity with Openpages would be a benefit.
McCann Worldgroup, part of the Interpublic Group (NYSE: IPG), is a leading global marketing solutions network with over 20,000 employees united across 100+ countries by a single vision: To help brands play a meaningful role in people's lives.

Effies Most Effective Agency Network in Europe 2020 (4th consecutive year)

IPA Effectiveness Network of the year 2018, 2019

WARC Most Effective European Network 2019, 2020

Campaign EMEA Agency of the year 2018, 2019

Cannes Lions Network of the year 2019

Euro Effies Network of the year 2019

Epica European Network of the year 2019

Worldgroup today spans— and integrates— a broad range of global practices including:

• McCann (advertising)
• MRM//McCann (digital marketing/relationship management)
• Momentum Worldwide (sponsorship & experiential)
• McCann Health (professional/dtc communications)
• CRAFT (global production)
• UM (media management)
• Weber Shandwick (public relations)
• FutureBrand (consulting/design)

Job Title: Production Quality Engineer - Motorsport

Reporting to: Production Manager

Job Location: Slough. Primarily office based with ad hoc domestic and international travel.

Company:
We are a fast growing, entrepreneurial and forward-thinking manufacturer of fluid transfer systems to the F1, motorsport and high-end automotive markets with full UK manufacturing facilities. Highly regarded in our market, we aim to build on our leadership by continuously expanding our commercial and engineering resources.

We have a challenging mix of ongoing serial production and development projects involving new leading edge technologies to be taken from prototype to small volume manufacture. The role requires an individual willing to play a key role in the engineering team involved in quality, supplier selection and management, design for manufacture, manufacturing tool design and production processes.

Salary:
Based on experience and qualification. Benefits include: [23 days holiday], and excellent transport links: walking distance from Slough train station and on-site parking.

Working Hours: 37.5hrs per week, although flexibility is often required in order to meet customer deadlines.

Key Candidate Attributes:
Have experience in a QA and production engineering capacity involving mechanical and components, ideally in an aerospace or automotive environment involving hose and tube manufacture
Demonstrated experience in creating, updating and documenting build processes with a view to improving both efficiency and quality
Demonstrated hands-on experience in creating and commissioning practical jigs and fixtures and other production tooling withing the manufacturing setting
Demonstrated experience in implementing 5S in a manufacturing environment
Must hold at least an HNC Engineering qualification
Able to operate our software supported MRP II environment
Ability to develop and maintain PFMEA, PPAP and Control Plans from DFMEA and product descriptions
Ability to analyse data, identify key problems and implement solutions to permanently eliminate them using Six sigma and 8D
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Must be able to communicate clearly across the company, its suppliers, and its customers
Be practical, efficient, and able to prioritise workload in a busy working environment
Be enthusiastic about joining a small but growing team and be proactive in identifying opportunities to improve quality and productivity
General Responsibilities:
To improve production processes and methods such that quality and cost are optimised, not least through creation and commissioning of production tools
The person in this position will be a critical player in maintaining and continuously improving a quality system to meet customer requirements, driving down the cost of quality and eliminating sources of customer dissatisfaction
An active role in updating and maintaining the current ISO-9001 certified quality system
Tracking and reporting key quality metrics and identifying process and production engineering opportunities - and coming up with practical solutions
Failure analysis of field returns and assignment of corrective actions to appropriate functions
Maintaining supplier quality including supplier performance ratings, communication of issues, corrective action and system auditing
Maintaining customer required Quality Systems, including: APQP tools (PFMEA, DFMEA, Control Plans, PPAP)
Document Control, Corrective and Preventive Actions, Supplier Quality
Auditing - Internal and Supplier Systems
Identify top field issues. Track returns through the warranty process and ensure that timely root cause analysis is completed and followed through corrective actions with suppliers and/or internal company processes.
Supporting design with technical and manufacturing methods
Opportunities to be involved with design for manufacture
Day-to-day administration, filing and updating of spreadsheets/databases as required

Job Description
Regulatory / Regulatory Affairs Manager, Central London, UK
We are looking for a Regulatory Affairs professional to join a growing R&D based pharmaceutical company based in Central London.
This role is with one of our favourite clients. This is an exciting company that has recently marketed 3 new product and has 5 coming up in development. There is a feeling here, that this is a start up, they have a flat structure and a relaxed culture where all the cross functional teams are sitting under one roof in their HQ in London. But don’t be mistaken, although they have independence and pursue their own development and strategy in Europe, they are actually part of a large, global pharmaceutical organisation.
They are looking for a versatile Regulatory Manager, with some EU (CP, DCP, MRP) or at least UK, Ireland post approval experience and some clinical/CTA and labelling experience. This person needs to be willing to learn and develop as well as roll up their sleeves and get on with it. You won’t be rushed in this company where the quality of your work is more important than the quantity and your personality and soft skills are most valued.
In the short term you will be focusing on post-marketing activities, supporting the expansion on the recently approved products as well as lead (with support) responses to queries from the health authorities. In the near future the role will gradually change to give you the opportunity to work on and manage CTAs and new MAAs for the novel chemical entities coming up in development.
In return the package is competitive and it comes with a bonus, the week has 35 working hours. Meanwhile, our client has committed to do digital hiring using Skype (VC), and has a new digital on-boarding and induction training process in place to allow a smooth transition during MERS-COV-2 outbreak. During the next period, new hires will be allowed to work from home full-time, until such a time occurs when normal working returns.
