Job Title: Evaluation and Learning Manager: ODA Policy and Thematic Projects
Job Description:
Brief Description

Salary: £31,305 per annum
Grade: UKRI D
Contract Type: Open Ended
Hours: Full Time/Part Time (minimum 30 hours a week)
Closing Date: 6th December 2020

Research and Innovation (R&I) is at the heart of UK economic growth, the Industrial Strategy and an outward looking Global Britain. We are seeking an Evaluation and Learning Manager to join our International Development Team to assist with the delivery of the Global Challenges Research Fund (GCRF) and Newton Fund.

The GCRF is a £1.5 billion fund announced by UK Government to support cutting-edge research that addresses the challenges faced by developing countries; this could be through challenge-lead disciplinary and interdisciplinary research or through providing an agile response to emergencies where there is an urgent research needed. The Newton Fund is a £735 million UK Investment Fund with partner countries providing matched resources within the Fund. The Newton Fund aims to promote the economic development and social welfare of either the partner countries or, through working with the partner country, to address the wellbeing of the communities.

The purpose of the International Development Team is to lead the development and delivery of UKRI activities that form part of the UK’s Official Development Assistance (ODA) commitment. The Evaluation and Analysis Unit within the International Development Team provides leadership for all ODA evaluation, programme monitoring and reporting, and data analysis. Evaluation work focuses on both process and outcomes, looking at individual programmes, policies and strategically important themes. The unit works closely with all UKRI delivery partners and programmes teams, Finance and BEIS.

The Evaluation and Learning Manager will coordinate and manage MEL activities for UKRI’s ODA policies and for strategically important thematic areas across UKRI’s ODA portfolio.

Key Responsibilities:
Developing and implementing MEL frameworks, to include process and outcome evaluations, for key ODA policy areas
Designing, tendering and managing contracted evaluations for strategically important cross-cutting areas, covering key regions, challenge areas and ways of working
Carrying out desk research on key areas in the international development research sector to underpin thematic evaluation work
Designing and implementing the MEL framework for the GCRF Challenge Leader initiative
Feeding into the UKRI Evaluation Governance Group to ensure shared knowledge and collaborative working across Delivery Partners where appropriate
Contributing to ongoing case study work, ensuring that case study stock covers all aspects of the UKRI ODA portfolio
Responding to ad hoc requests for evidence and information relating to ODA policy and key thematic areas.
Organization Description

What is UK Research and Innovation?

Operating across the whole of the UK with a combined budget of more than £6 billion, UK Research and Innovation is a new entity that brings together nine partners to create an independent organisation with a strong voice for research and innovation, and a vision to ensure the UK maintains its world-leading position in research and innovation. UKRI will build on the successful elements from the current funding system and maximise the contribution of each of the component parts to create the best environment for research and innovation to flourish.

Building on success

The UK has a world class research and innovation system. Our expertise spans all fields of knowledge, from the discovery of penicillin and monoclonal antibodies, to the jet engine and the world-wide web. Our inspirational creative industries are strong in art, design and the innovative use of new materials and technologies. Our universities and laboratories produce a disproportionate percentage of the world’s top research, and their academics are highly-sought as international colleagues and co-authors and are among the world’s best at attracting overseas students Nor is this excellence confined to university campuses and research centres. Our engineering, automotive and pharmaceutical industries are successful in part because of the superb graduates they can hire and the top rate researchers that support them.

Our partners

The nine UK Research and Innovation partners each bring unique assets to this cooperation. Innovate UK helps businesses to identify the commercial potential in new technologies and turn them into the new products and services that will drive economic growth and increase productivity; Strong discipline-facing Research Councils encourage breadth and diversity, curiosity-driven research, and priority-driven initiatives; Research England’s work on knowledge exchange will focus on capacity and culture in universities and provide balance to the funding system. It will drive quality and impact through the REF and work closely with its counterparts in the devolved administrations.

Shortlisting and Interview Criteria

Essential:
Educated to degree level or have relevant experience
Strong quantitative and/or qualitative analysis skills
Excellent problem-solving skills, including the ability to quickly understand new and complex issues and to apply solutions
Ability to offer new insights and generate original ideas with practical application
Excellent communication (both written and verbal) skills with the ability to produce clear, concise and accurate presentations and written documents. This includes the ability to interpret and present complex information to a wide range of audiences
Ability to influence and persuade others, and to work with people of all levels and to build good relations with them
Strong initiative, being able to think and adapt quickly, and to work independently
Ability to effectively plan, organise and manage time and activities to deliver a high-quality outcome and experience of dealing with challenges in a responsive and constructive way.
Desirable:
Experience of evaluation (or research) approaches, methodologies and techniques
An understanding of the role of research and innovation in the international landscape and different types of data collected to demonstrate impact it has, particularly in the context of development.
UKRI supports research in areas that include animal health, agriculture and food security, and bioscience for health which includes research on animals, genetic modification and stem cell research. Whilst you may not have direct involvement in this type of research, you should consider whether this conflicts with your personal values or beliefs.

To enable us to hire the very best people we will conduct a full and comprehensive pre-employment check as an essential part of the recruitment process on all individuals that are offered a position with UKRI. This will include a security check and an extreme organisations affiliation check.

Limited parking subject to waiting list.

Employee Benefits

UK Research and Innovation recognises and values employees as individuals and aims to provide a pay and reward package that motivates staff to the best of their ability. The reward and benefit package includes a flexible working scheme, an excellent Defined Benefit pension scheme, 30 days annual leave allowance and a number of other benefits.

Developing Talent

We are committed to developing employees in their roles throughout their career. Learning and development plans enable employees to continue their professional development through training and development opportunities such as e-learning, classroom training and on-the-job experiences. We encourage our employees to share their learning across teams and organisations.

Equal Opportunities

We strive to make decisions based on individual merit and ability. We welcome applications from all sections of the community and promote equality of opportunity in accordance with the Equality Act 2010. As holders of Disability Confident Employer status, we guarantee to interview all applicants with disabilities who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.
Location: Swindon, Wiltshire, South West England, England

Job Description:
Your opportunityThis role at Deloitte within the Audit & Assurance service line, will enable you to work with some of the largest and most successful companies listed in the UK or US.
They are complex, influential and exciting. Auditing them takes a broad skillset. You’ll develop relationships far beyond the main finance team, providing valuable insights to the company’s Board of Directors and leadership teams. All making for a more interesting and rewarding experience. As you progress, you’ll have opportunities for foreign travel and overseas secondments to key markets of the Americas, Asia-Pacific (APAC) and EMEA. You’ll quickly expand your international and UK networks

We are proud to offer flexible working arrangements which allow our people to choose the most suitable working arrangement that works for them. Whether this is working 4 days per week, taking the summer months off work, or more flexibility around your working pattern, we consider both formal and informal working arrangements that allow our people and our clients the best outcome.
If you would like to hear more about our flexible working arrangements, please let us know.

Your role
As a Manager within the Audit and Assurance practice you will have responsibility for: Audit and Assurance planning and the delivery of the Audit and Assurance plan to the client;Day to day management of field teams, including reviewing work of staff members;Liaison with key client staff providing timely reporting and management information;Management of reporting requirements, including attendance at meetings; Leading teams on challenging engagements, including transaction and project work; Developing and mentoring more junior members of staff;Involvement in tendering for new clients.Working effectively in diverse teams within an inclusive team culture where people are recognised for their contribution
Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.

Location:
London with occasional domestic and international travel.

Work pattern:
This is a permanent contract opportunity. The role is to be worked on a full-time basis.
Your professional experienceACA/ACCA qualification (or equivalent);Previous experience of working with IFRS and/or UK or US GAAP reporting standards;The ability to present client data in a clear and concise format;Ability to develop effective client relationships;Project management experience;Highly proficient oral and written communication skillsIndustry, FTSE Listed or International audit and assurance experience
Salary:
Market Rate. Opening Date: 05.11.2020, Closing Date: 03.12.2020. Full Time

Your service line: Audit & Assurance
In an industry best known for looking back, Deloitte looks beyond.
Our Audit & Assurance team understand the most important decisions are the ones we are yet to make. Crafting the future in an informed and clear-sighted way means understanding current conditions, as well as the trends that are shaping tomorrow. That is why we use our expertise in audit to show where things stand now, and to help inform the next step. With the assurance we provide, we help our clients to look ahead with strength and confidence across all of their accounting, regulatory and transaction needs.

Innovation is the key, underpinned by audit quality. You will be joining a diverse team of experts capable of delivering meaningful and durable change for both our clients and our profession.

Personal independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.

About Deloitte

Our Purpose & Strategy
To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.
What do we do?
Deloitte offers global integrated professional services that include Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Legal, Risk Advisory and Tax Consulting. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities whatever the role, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.
Beyond the UK: Deloitte North and South Europe
The UK is part of Deloitte North and South Europe (NSE), the second largest member firm in the Deloitte network. Deloitte NSE combines operations in Belgium, Central Mediterranean (Italy, Greece, Malta), Ireland, the Middle East (Bahrain, Cyprus, Egypt, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Oman, Palestinian Ruled Territories, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates, Yemen), the Netherlands, the Nordics (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden), Switzerland and the UK. Deloitte NSE brings together 2,700 partners and over 50,000 people, combining our unmatched breadth and depth of capabilities in audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, and tax and legal across the region. Being part of Deloitte NSE supports our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services and will create more opportunity and growth for our people.
What do we value?
What brings us all together at Deloitte? It’s how we approach the thousands of decisions we make every day. How we behave, our beliefs and our attitudes. In other words: our values. Whatever we do, wherever we are in the world, we lead the way, serve with integrity, take care of each other, foster inclusion, and collaborate for maximum impact. These five shared values lead every decision we make and action we take, guiding us to deliver impact how and where it matters most.
Being a Leader at Deloitte
Cultural fit and purpose-led leadership is crucial for Deloitte. Our leaders always set the example and inspire their colleagues. They make quality time for people and take an interest in them. They know what matters to people - both inside and outside work – and value them as individuals; always finding opportunities to develop them while showing respect and appreciation.
We expect colleagues at all levels to embrace and live our purpose and our leadership culture by challenging themselves to identify issues that are most important for our clients, our people, and for society and make an impact that matters. We know leadership comes in all shapes and sizes, but our Leadership Charter helps all of our people understand what we’re looking for:

We live our purpose: we act as a role model, embracing and living our purpose and values, and recognising others for the impact they makeWe develop talent: we develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunitiesWe drive performance: we deliver exceptional client service; maximise results and drive high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and bordersWe believe positive influence can make an impact that matters: we influence clients, teams, and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships with increasingly senior peopleWe move, together, towards a strategic direction: we understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning people to objectives and setting priorities and direction.Ref.RTWPROG
WPFULL SLAUDA

Job Description


Regulatory Affairs Manager CMC - Berkshire, UK

Regulatory Affairs CMC Manager to work on biological products in development for a successful Biopharmaceutical company based in the South East, M4 Corridor.

The location is easily commutable by train from London, Reading, High Wycombe, and Windsor and is easily accessible by car with company car parking available.

This role offers great projects to work on a real career development plan designed to give you all the experience you need to make the jump up to Snr Manager Regulatory Affairs CMC.

Our client is a leading, science-based Biopharmaceutical company with some exciting new products coming in Phase 2 and Phase 3, as well as a busy early development pipeline. This company has already grown to become a major research driven organization and are committed to increasing access to high-quality healthcare products around the world. This company is now expanding their Regulatory CMC team globally and is seeking to hire a Regulatory Affairs CMC Manager.

What would your duties be?
As a Regulatory Affairs CMC Manager you will be working on a variety of projects. Based on your strengths and experience you would either be supporting a new MAA/BLA for a product in Phase 3 or working on working on CTAs/IMPDs for biologics in early development.
You will have both strategic and operational input for a variety of projects, potentially from early phase through to MAA as part of the Global Regulatory Affairs CMC development team.
Specific skills and competences:
It is essential to have at least 4 – 5 years of Regulatory Affairs CMC experience supporting and authoring RA CMC documents for mAbs, vaccines, recombinant proteins, Cell Therapies or ATMP’s etc. Some IMPD/IND experience is necessary. Initial MAA experience for a biological dug candidate will be an advantage.
You would be a good communicator who is also eager to learn and develop.
Experience in direct communication with the Health Authorities on CMC matters.
This is a permanent opportunity and the salary is very competitive and includes a good bonus and an extensive company benefits package. There is also good flexibility to work 2 – 3 days a week from home (during normal circumstances).

ICBC Standard Bank Plc (ICBCS) is 60% owned by Industrial and Commercial Bank of China and 40% by Standard Bank. ICBCS benefits from a unique Chinese and African parentage and an unrivalled global network and level of expertise.

ICBCS is a leading financial markets and commodities bank, driven to deliver the right outcomes for our stakeholders, clients, counterparties and the markets in which we operate. We deliver products in an environment which considers the appropriate needs of our clients, whilst providing guidance and expertise to ensure our employees understand our business and uphold the highest levels of conduct. We want passionate and talented individuals who are motivated by high growth potential being achieved in doing business the right way.

Headquartered in London, ICBCS also has operations in Shanghai, Singapore, and
New York.

Division Summary
ICBC Standard Bank is a firm believer in technical innovation, to help us guarantee exceptional client service and leading edge financial solutions. Our growing global success reflects our commitment to the latest solutions, the best people, and a uniquely flexible and vibrant working culture. To help us drive our success into the future, and in expanding the size of our team, we are looking for an IT Internal Audit Senior Manager to join our dedicated team at our London offices.

Job Purpose
The prime purpose of this role is to undertake a range of internal audits of both the IT infrastructure and the IT applications which support the Global Markets trading activities across Commodities, Fixed Income, FX and Money Markets, Credit and equity derivatives, and Structured Credit, and also the support functions of the Bank, including Operations, Compliance, Risk and Finance.
The role includes planning, project managing, executing and documenting audit testing, and reporting findings:
Both functional and integrated IT audit work within Front Office and Back Office covering infrastructure and applications.
To carry out other ad hoc reviews and investigations as requested by management, with respect to IT.

The expectations of this Senior Manager role encompass the following:
Understanding the business
Detailed understanding of a Global Markets trading environment, both from an IT infrastructure and IT applications perspective.
Detailed understanding of the current regulatory environment and developments with respect to IT risks and controls, regulatory rules and guidelines, and key current industry topics.
Being risk focused
Able to determine the risk based scope of IT audit testing for both specific IT audit and for integrated audit assurance through appropriate analysis and differentiate between what is important and what is not to propose a preliminary scope of work. Appropriately apply professional scepticism.
Expected to raise findings and articulate the results and impact of audit work, both verbally and in writing, to contribute to a quality internal audit product.
Expected to be actively involved in the quarterly risk assessment and annual audit planning process, demonstrating an ability to apply both business and industry understanding to the internal audit assessment of technology risk in the Bank.
Efficient and effective service delivery
Expected to plan and execute audits from planning through to audit reporting in line with agreed timeframes.
Expected to project manage audits to ensure completion and documentation of audit testing in line with agreed budgets.
Expected to be able to use and apply an appropriate mix of audit approaches and testing methods, including data analysis techniques, on individual assignments to deliver efficient and effective audit testing.
Expected to be resilient and determined to see projects through to completion.
People
Team player who recognizes the Bank-wide and departmental goals and objectives and strives to achieve them.
Draw upon technical competency, to operate effectively and supportively within a medium sized Internal Audit team, and build strong relationships with management
Strong relationship management skills with management at an audit and portfolio level.
Pro-active individual who will share technical knowledge and understanding, escalate questions for broader consideration, consultation, and discussion whilst maintaining appropriate personal accountability.
Key Responsibilities
Planning and execution of IT audit work and reporting the results to management.
Conduct ad hoc reviews and special investigations as requested from time to time by management.
To ensure IT audit work is documented in accordance with internal and professional standards.
Maintain leading edge industry knowledge and technical competence.
To provide cost-effective and value added recommendations to management and contribute to enhancing the overall internal control environment.
To ensure that audit reporting addresses all key control weaknesses.
Provide input to the quarterly risk assessment and annual planning process.
To develop effective ongoing relationships with senior IT management.
Providing assurance in other locations. Whilst the job will primarily be London based, there are a number of overseas locations in which audits may be scheduled. It is not anticipated that the travel requirement will exceed 15%.
Preferred Qualifications and Experience
Degree or equivalent
CISA, RICS, or CISM, or equivalent IT qualification.
Formal experience of providing audit assurance (pre-requisite), ACA (preferred).
Good level of post qualification IT audit experience preferably in Financial Services.
Knowledge, technical skills and expertise
A proven track record of understanding of IT processes and controls, within a Global Markets environment.
Deep knowledge of current industry practices and understanding of recent regulatory developments.
A flexible individual with an ability to undertake a varied portfolio of audits is required. The individual will need to demonstrate a track record of being adaptable and tackling new subject areas independently.
The job holder should be a self-starter with sufficient experience as to be able to undertake assignments with limited supervision.
Key personal attributes which distinguish those that are successful in this role:
Global outlook
Resilience
Client focus
Good attention to detail
Results and outcomes orientated
High level of integrity and values driven
The role would suit someone who is:
Able to navigate complexity
Enjoys working in a changing environment
Willing to work in new and different areas
Looking to broaden their audit experience
Open to the opportunities, and looking for the profile, that working in a medium sized audit function can offer

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Business Development Manager to join us at the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA).

The Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency enhance and improve the health of millions of people every day through the effective regulation of medicines and medical devices, underpinned by science and research. This is a full-time, fixed-term position within the Clinical Practice Research Datalink (CPRD) division.

CPRD, jointly funded by the agency and the National Institute of Health Research (NIHR), is the UK’s preeminent research service providing anonymised NHS data for retrospective and prospective research. CPRD services are designed to maximise the way anonymised NHS clinical data can be used to safeguard public health and improve the efficiency of clinical research. For more than 30 years, data provided by CPRD have supported a range of drug safety and epidemiological studies that have impacted on health care and resulted in over 2,600 peer-reviewed publications. The UK is in a unique global position to use patient records in novel ways for patient recruitment, clinical trials management and follow up. In addition to supporting high quality observational research, CPRD is developing world leading services based on real world data to support clinical trials and intervention studies.

CPRD is facing growing demand for its innovative real-world data services supporting observational research and improving the efficiency of patient recruitment and clinical study management. The Senior Business Development Manager is responsible for increasing the uptake of CPRD’s products and services by academic and commercial organisations worldwide and delivering a high quality customer management service. We are seeking a dynamic individual with extensive experience leading business development teams within the life sciences or health research sector, to join our expanding organisation.

Key Responsibilities:

Developing and implementing CPRD’s business development strategy.
Investigating and realising new market opportunities to grow CPRD’s client base across commercial and non-commercial sectors in the UK and internationally
Negotiating research contracts
Managing an efficient business development function
Proactively engaging with existing and potential customers
Overseeing CPRD communications
Delivering business development improvements to facilitate CPRD achieving its strategic goals

The successful candidate will have the following:

Extensive experience leading business development teams within the life sciences or health research sector
Track record of successfully promoting research products and services to academic and commercial markets
Be an expert in contract negotiation
Possess excellent interpersonal skills.
Degree in healthcare or life sciences
Hands-on research experience in an academic, government, not for profit or industry health research setting

If you would like to know more about this role, please click on the Job Description and Person Specification.

Closing date: 29th November 2020

If you need assistance applying for this role or have any other questions please contact careers@mhra.gov.uk

Candidates will be subject to UK immigration requirements as well as Civil Service nationality rules.

Our process requires that you apply through our careers site, where you will be asked to complete your application and answer some competency-based questions. Applicants are assessed on whether they meet any mandatory requirements as well as the necessary skills and experience for the role. Applicants are scored on their competency answers so please ensure you have read these thoroughly and allow sufficient time. You can view the competencies for this role in the job description.

In accordance with the Civil Service Commissioners’ Recruitment Principles our recruitment and selection processes are underpinned by the requirement of selection for appointment on the basis of merit by a fair and open competition. If you feel your application has not been treated in accordance with the Recruitment Principles and you wish to make a complaint, you should firstly contact Mira Mepa, Head of Recruitment and Operations, Mira.Mepa@mhra.gov.uk.

Sr. Manager, Global Trade Compliance

Tapestry

London, LND, GB

#job-location.job-location-inline {
display: inline;
}

Explore the possibilities across our global house of brands.

Defined by inclusivity rather than exclusivity, Tapestry embraces the exploration of individuality and invests in helping you grow personally and professionally. Every individual in our global house has the opportunity to make an impact, learn and be part of our growing and unique story.

At Tapestry, we have the freedom to express ourselves and run with our best ideas across Coach, Kate Spade New York, and Stuart Weitzman. We share a profound belief in both our individual and collective potential, and know that with hard work and dedication, anything is possible.

The position is responsible for supporting the Sr. Director of Global Trade & Customs in ensuring company’s processes, internal controls and reporting are compliant with European Customs and other government agencies requirements. The position will also provide international compliance support regarding country of origin marking, product valuation, tariff classification, duties paid, product compliance, etc. and continuously assess potential compliance risks and opportunities.

The successful individual will leverage their proficiency in Trade & Customs Compliance to…

Develop and roll-out a best in class customs compliance and risk mitigation program
Focus on building a program for ensuring compliance with applicable trade laws and regulations, as well communicating these requirements to internal and external partners.
Review and update polices and manuals as needed
Develop and deliver training on Trade Compliance topics as needed to internal and external partners
Conduct periodic reviews of controls and documentation
Collaborate with colleagues in US and abroad on various compliance topics
Leverage trade compliance and optimization software tools to support trade function like Product classifications, global trade content, tariff analyzer, DPS, and FTA modules
Communicate and maintain oversight with Customs Brokers and other agents
Identify opportunities to streamline, harmonize and support roll-out of compliance best practices
Provide commercially focused advice on all aspects of customs/import taxes relating to the group’s international supply chain
Support business development and other projects like Brexit, bonded warehouses, providing advice and solutions in respect of customs/import taxes
Management of audits, applications for rulings and other negotiations with customs authorities
Proactively identify opportunities to reduce customs/import tax costs, mitigate risks and improve cash flow and cash management strategies
Increase knowledge and awareness for the region on global customs/import taxes including providing technical guidance and training
Support product compliance and regulatory affairs issues to drive our global lifestyle strategy
Partner on all regulatory affairs matters and product compliance with teams to ensure OGA requirements are addressed and compliance standards applied consistently across Europe.
Act as the conduit for the flow of information between Legal, Quality, Finance, Logistics and relevant business partners to ensure other trade compliance matters such as product labeling, country of origin marking, quality standards, product safety standards, and rules covering testing of product are complied with.
Monitor and disseminate new and changing product compliance laws and regulations.
Maintain global repository of OGA requirements by category and agency to enable growth, ensure regulatory compliance, and reduce supply chain disruption
Support the Vice President of Global Trade Services on various projects, as needed
Conduct research on various trade topics
Support long-term strategic initiatives
Work cross-functionally and divisionally to drive global trade agenda
The accomplished individual will possess…
5+ years of experience within industry or Big 4 with extensive knowledge of customs and indirect taxes applicable to global supply chains
Working knowledge of WTO, regional and local import tariff rules and practices together with working knowledge of other taxes payable on the shipment of tangible goods (e.g. import VAT)
Practical experience of customs/import tax valuation and compliance processes, from extraction of data and preparation of documentation to the handling of disputes
Sound commercial awareness and understanding of business drivers
Good organizational skills and ability to prioritize personal workload
Self-starter with ability to work effectively in multicultural, international teams focused on identifying practical solutions
Excellent English writing and speaking skills (Spanish speaking a plus) with the ability to present complex subject matter clearly and succinctly
Our Competencies for All Employees
Drive for Results: Can be counted on to exceed goals successfully; is constantly and consistently one of the top performers; very bottom-line oriented; steadfastly pushes self and others for results.
Customer Focus: Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers; gets first-hand customer information and uses it for improvements in products and services; acts with customers in mind; establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect.
Creativity: Comes up with a lot of new and unique ideas; easily makes connections among previously unrelated notions; tends to be seen as original and value-added in brainstorming settings.
Interpersonal Savvy: Relates well to all kinds of people, up, down, and sideways, inside and outside the organization; builds appropriate rapport; builds constructive and effective relationships; uses diplomacy and tact; can diffuse even high-tension situations comfortably.
Learning on the Fly: Learns quickly when facing new problems; a relentless and versatile learner; open to change; analyzes both successes and failures for clues to improvement; experiments and will try anything to find solutions; enjoys the challenge of unfamiliar tasks; quickly grasps the essence and the underlying structure of anything.
Perseverance: Pursues everything with energy, drive, and a need to finish; seldom gives up before finishing, especially in the face of resistance or setbacks.
Dealing with Ambiguity: Can effectively cope with change; can shift gears comfortably; can decide and act without having the total picture; isn’t upset when things are up in the air; doesn’t have to finish things before moving on; can comfortably handle risk and uncertainty.
Our Competencies for All People Managers
Strategic Agility: Sees ahead clearly; can anticipate future consequences and trends accurately; has broad knowledge and perspective; is future oriented; can articulately paint credible pictures and visions of possibilities and likelihoods; can create competitive and breakthrough strategies and plans.
Building Effective Teams: Blends people into teams when needed; creates strong morale and spirit in their team; shares wins and successes; fosters open dialogue; lets people finish and be responsible for their work; defines success in terms of the whole team; creates a feeling of belonging in the team.
Managerial Courage: Doesn’t hold back anything that needs to be said; provides current, direct, complete, and “actionable” positive and corrective feedback to others; lets people know where they stand; faces up to people problems on any person or situation (not including direct reports) quickly and directly; is not afraid to take negative action when necessary.
Tapestry, Inc. is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer and we pride ourselves on hiring and developing the best people. All employment decisions (including recruitment, hiring, promotion, compensation, transfer, training, discipline and termination) are based on the applicant’s or employee’s qualifications as they relate to the requirements of the position under consideration. These decisions are made without regard to age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic characteristics, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, national origin, alienage, citizenship, disability, marital status, military status, pregnancy, or any other legally-recognized protected basis prohibited by applicable law. Visit Tapestry, Inc. at http://www.tapestry.com/

Job Title: Goods In/Logistics Section Manager - London Meals (Abbeydale)
Job Description:
Goods In / Logistics Section Manager, London Meals - Abbeydale
Competitive salary - £35,000-£40,000
Monday to Friday – 40 hours
Private Medical
Band C

The role

The Goods In/Logistics Section Manager is there to manage, organise and control all activities within the logistics / Goods in function including evaluation of current processes to identify opportunities for improving efficiencies and performance, key focus on H&S ,Material variance ,team development & customer service.
What will you do?

Health & Safety - To pro-actively manage to ensure that a safe working environment exists for all employees in the operation and that as a minimum the operation meets the standards set out in the Group Health & Safety policy.
Quality Standards - To ensure the team are performing to quality standards in terms of Good Manufacturing Practice (G.M.P.), product quality, food safety, hygiene and housekeeping within the area to ensure that both Business and customer standards are kept and audit requirements are fully met.
Performance Management - To manage performance and attendance of the team including first level formal written disciplinary action, performance review, absence management (including return to work procedures)
Training & Development - To ensure that operatives are coached and trained in all aspects of their role including health and safety and food safety standards and quality procedures.
Continuous improvement – Manage improvement activities including KPI’s waste management and production control processes and associated administration and record keeping. Ensure the delivery of agreed KPIs across the operation through the team, making sure that KPIs are understood and utilised to support performance improvement plans and day to day activities.
Resource Management - Plan, organise and measure labour and material requirements within your area to ensure that both short- and long- term agreed targets are met.
Communication - To ensure that the workforce in the area is well informed on relevant business news and to encourage effective cross-functional links and that channels of communication are clear and available.
Recruitment - Involvement in the selection process for direct reports and responsible for their supervision and coaching.
Employee Relations - Encourages the Bakkavor values and a positive culture, whilst fostering good employee relations through fair, consistent and effective people management.
Administration – carry out the necessary administrative tasks and produce data/ reports as required including TMS, holiday management, RTW , Material variance and any other relevant data

About you
Previous management experience within a fast paced logistics environment
Ability to lead, develop and motivate a team.
An understanding and commitment to meeting and exceeding the requirements of customers (both internal and external).
Ability to be flexible e.g. with working hours.
A good level of computer literacy required with experience of a variety of Microsoft Office Packages including, Excel and Word.
A good level of Numeracy skills required. Able to interrogate numerical data, variance reports
Strong organisational skills.
Able to communicate clearly and accurately at all levels, including clear and legible handwriting.
A strong understanding of the Health and Safety standards, GMP and the implications for the Goods In Operation.
About us
Bakkavor is the leading provider of fresh prepared food in the UK, which is one of the most advanced, innovative and dynamic food markets in the world.

In London, Bakkavor Meals employs over 2,400 people across three sites and a distribution centre in the Park Royal area. These sites specialise in making chilled ready meals, houmous dips, deli products and savoury accompaniments, and are part of Bakkavor's Meals sector which has eight factories in total in the UK.

Req ID
9984BR

Location
Abbeydale - London

Contract Type
Permanent - Full Time

Country
UK

Business Area:
Experienced Professionals

Salary Range
£35,000-£40,000

Division Summary

ICBC Standard Bank is a firm believer in technical innovation, to help us guarantee exceptional client service and leading edge financial solutions. Our growing global success reflects our commitment to the latest solutions, the best people, and a uniquely flexible and vibrant working culture. To help us drive our success into the future, we are looking for an Internal Auditor to join our dedicated team at our London offices.

Job Purpose

The primary purpose of this role is to undertake a range of internal audits which support the Global Markets trading activities (across Fixed Income, FX and Money Markets, Credit, Structured Solutions, Commodities), and Investment Banking, and also cover the support functions of the Bank including Operations, Compliance, Finance, and Risk.

The role-holder will be required to support planning of the audit scope, execution & documentation of audit fieldwork, and draft findings for reporting across the business as follows;

Global Markets and Investment Banking audits.
Thematic audits that also cover supporting functions (including Compliance, Operations, Risk, Finance, and HR).
To carry out other ad hoc reviews and investigations as requested by management.

The expectations of this role encompass the following:

Understanding the business

Knowledge of Global Market products and support functions within a Global Markets environment, both from an internal operational perspective and an external market driven perspective.
Supporting the senior manager to have responsibility for the FICE business portfolio and provide regular risk assessment updates, and be the primary point of contact for business and functional management.
Awareness of the current regulatory environment and developments.

Being risk focused

Expected to determine the risk based scope, of small and medium sized audits through appropriate analysis and differentiate between what is important and what is not to propose a preliminary scope of work.
Expected to raise and draft findings and articulate the results and impact of audit work, both verbally and in writing, to contribute to a quality internal audit product.
Expected to be actively involved in the quarterly risk assessment and annual audit planning process.

Efficient and effective service delivery

Expected to be able to use and apply an appropriate mix of testing approaches including data analysis techniques on individual assignments to deliver efficient and effective audit testing.
Expected to be resilient and determined to see projects through to completion.

People

Team player who recognises the Bank-wide and departmental goals and objectives, and actively strives to achieve them.
Can effectively operate in a small to medium sized team through supportive team work.
Strong relationship management skills with management at an audit and portfolio level.
Pro-active individual who will share knowledge, consult, and escalate questions for broader consideration and discussion.

Key Responsibilities

Plan and execute audit work through to draft findings.
Ensure audit work is documented in accordance with internal and professional standards.
Maintain leading edge industry knowledge and technical competence.
Ensure that audit reporting addresses all key control weaknesses.
Provide input to the quarterly risk assessment and annual planning process.
Develop effective ongoing relationships with business stakeholders.
Provide assurance in other locations. Whilst the job will primarily be London based, there are a number of overseas locations in which audits may be scheduled. It is not anticipated that the travel requirement will exceed 15%.

Preferred Qualifications and Experience

ACA or equivalent qualification
Big 4 trained background with a good level of post qualification experience preferably in the Financial Services industry, preferably including Global Markets experience, OR experience of working in Internal Audit, auditing Global Markets trading products and the related internal control environment within Financial Services.
An area of portfolio specialism based upon previous internal audit experience.

Knowledge, technical skills and expertise:

A proven track record of understanding the risks, processes and controls within a Global Markets environment.
Knowledge of current industry practices in compliance matters including financial crime and understanding of current regulation and ongoing developments.
A flexible individual with an ability to undertake a varied portfolio of audits is required. The individual will need to demonstrate a track record of being adaptable and tackling new subject areas independently.
The job holder should be a self-starter with sufficient experience as to be able to undertake assignments with limited supervision.

The key personal attributes which will distinguish those that would be successful in this role:

Global outlook
Resilience
Client focus
Good attention to detail
Results and outcomes orientated
High level of integrity and values driven

The role would suit someone who is:

Able to navigate complexity
Enjoys working in a changing environment
Flexible and willing to work in new and different areas
Looking to broaden their audit experience
Open to the opportunities, and looking for the profile, that working in a medium sized audit function can offer

Quality Assurance Manager - Training Services

United Kingdom

Summary of Role
Raytheon UK is looking for a dynamic and high performing Quality Assurance Manager. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing the Quality Aspects of a major Naval Training programme and for raising awareness of Quality and Mission Assurance across the business, facilitating a culture of learning and improvement in order to drive process and systemic improvement.

This is a complex role that will be highly rewarding and high profile, with extensive communication and interfacing with both internal and external stakeholders, demanding excellent interpersonal skills and high levels of energy and stamina. The right candidate will be experienced in supervising and managing a Quality Engineering team and facilitating the identification and implementation / flow-down of required Customer, Company & Regulatory requirements. The work will require travel to vendors, customers and Raytheon sites, both within the UK and abroad.

Role Profile:
Working alongside highly skilled colleagues to assure the business develops, delivers and maintains products and services that meet or exceed our customer requirements.

Duties will also include:

Providing assurance through audit and review
Championing continuous improvement and develop your coaching and facilitating skills through the use of six sigma techniques to help teams deliver timely business and process improvements and address root causes
Working with customers, suppliers and subcontractors in a collaborative way to build lasting relationships
Taking on responsibility to assure compliance with contractual, regulatory and other sector specific requirements
Interfacing and communication with programme, functional and leadership to support the goals of the business
Full people management and development responsibility for programme Quality Engineering team
Developing and driving the Program Quality objectives and strategy. Anticipating future risks and developing innovative mitigations
Supporting external agency, accreditation body & customer audits

Skills:
We are looking for people who can quickly gain the trust and respect of their colleagues, suppliers and customers. To be considered you will need to possess the following:

Experience within a Training and/or Quality Engineering organisation
Basic understanding of configuration and data control processes and procedures
Experienced Internal Auditor or training to ISO9001/AS9100
Degree or equivalent qualification in engineering, quality or business management
High attention to detail and capable of delivering to agreed timescales
Enjoy coaching/facilitating to get the best out of teams and individuals
Team orientated, but able to work under own initiative and take the lead when required
Enjoy problem solving, and have good analytical skills
Excellent at developing and managing relationships and helping others and teams succeed, ideally within a ISO44001 framework
Current holder of or eligibility to obtain SC level MoD security clearance

About Raytheon UK:
With facilities in Broughton, Waddington, Glenrothes, Harlow, Gloucester, Manchester with presence across other customer sites also. Raytheon UK is invested in the British workforce and the development of UK technology. Across the country Raytheon UK employs 1,700 people and supports 8,000 jobs. As a prime contractor and major supplier to the U.K. Ministry of Defence, Raytheon continues to invest in research and development, supporting innovation and technological advances.

Raytheon UK is a landed company, part of the Raytheon Technologies organisation and sits within the Raytheon Intelligence & Space business

About Raytheon Technologies:
Raytheon Technologies Corporation is an aerospace and defence company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial, military and government customers worldwide. It comprises four industry-leading businesses – Collins Aerospace Systems, Pratt & Whitney, Raytheon Intelligence & Space and Raytheon Missiles & Defence. Its 195,000 employees enable the company to operate at the edge of known science as they imagine and deliver solutions that push the boundaries in quantum physics, electric propulsion, directed energy, hypersonics, avionics and cyber security. The company, formed in 2020 through the combination of Raytheon Company and the United Technologies Corporation aerospace businesses, is headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts.

Raytheon Career Development:
Raytheon has a wealth of resources available to help you develop your career from the moment you join. Activities range from on-line learning modules, to external training and support for taking professional qualifications relevant to your role.

Standard Benefits:

25 days holiday + statutory public holidays
Contributory Pension Scheme (up to 10.5% company contribution)
6 times salary ‘Life Assurance’
Flexible Benefits scheme with extensive salary sacrifice scheme’s.
Enhanced sick pay scheme
Enhanced Family Friendly Policies, including enhanced Maternity & Shared Parental leave.
37hr working week, with an early finish Friday (hours may vary depending on role, job requirement
or site specifics arrangements).

Flexible working arrangements can be considered wherever we can (depending on the role) please enquire or highlight any request to our Recruitment team to explore flexible working
possibilities.

Canteen facilities available at Harlow & Glenrothes sites and Manchester & Gloucester offer free snacks & drinks (hot & cold).

Diversity:
Diversity is a core business imperative at Raytheon. We are an equal opportunity employer that promotes inclusiveness and always employs the best professionals for the job. Foresters Financial is a financial services provider offering savings, investment, and protection products which helps families and individuals reach their financial goals, protect their families and improve communities.

We are looking for a QA & Test Manager to join our Business Solutions and Delivery organisation. The ideal candidate will lead quality and testing efforts across legacy and digital applications, working closely with multi-disciplined teams to ensure product and software quality.

You will own the Quality Assurance and Testing function which includes scheduling, coordinating the management of testing and releases across multiple applications and digital platforms across the portfolio. Including Salesforce cloud and a leading API platform. The role will work closely with both delivery partners and internal teams. You will be responsible for implementing and managing release processes for features through development, test, and the production pipeline. Leading the effort of defining the IT strategic direction for regression coverage, testing tools and CI /CD to ensure quality of software.

The releases can be inclusive of whole application releases as well as updates and patches, security improvements, hardware upgrades, projects and service updates. Where necessary you will facilitate the handover from project testing to Service Management and provide the tools and service needed to achieve smooth transition.

Key Responsibilities & Duties

Coordinate and guide testing efforts for the organisation across the full spectrum of IT efforts, from asset support changes to large scale programs. This includes test strategies and plans, data requirements for testing, risks and risk mitigation – working with PM, Asset Owners, Business Reps, etc. to develop testing schedules and plans that support the needs of the business and IT.
Coordinate release content and effort across the appropriate teams using techniques and approaches pertinent to the size of the deployment and in a structured and transparent way
Work with Release Management to plan and execute scheduled releases for multiple salesforce instances
Organising and controlling the QA/test process and pipeline
Ability, traceability, and control of the testing process to deliver high-quality software
Communicate plans and changes to stakeholders at the right times
Work with Release Management to conduct reviews against acceptance criteria; including business and operational readiness, test validation, and Go/No-Go decisions
Control the risks, issues & dependencies that affect the release and resolve them in an appropriate manner
Monitor progress to ensure releases are delivered on time and within budget, and that they meet their stated quality criteria
Regular reporting of status and metrics
Work with partners and internal teams to understand impacts of code branch approaches and resolve build problems and merge conflicts
Develop scripts and lead automation to build, integrate, and deploy software releases to various platforms; ensuring release train to support regular deployments of new features to digital channels
Communicate all key release plans, commitments, and changes including requirements, QA plans, schedule, and scope changes
Participate in Design Authority meetings to understand the impact of such changes on upcoming releases
Maintain a release repository and manage key information such as build and release procedures, dependencies, and plans

Knowledge, Skills and Experience

BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject desirable
5-7 years of test management and/or project management experience
Minimum 3 years of experience managing Salesforce testing and Salesforce integrations along with core development and delivery skills
Formal test manager qualification (ISTQB)
Salesforce service cloud, communities, and marketing cloud experience
Advanced knowledge of software development lifecycle
Excellent Agile and Scrum process understanding
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Proven interpersonal and consultative skills
Analytical thinking and problem-solving capabilities
Proven experience of CI/CD tools and frameworks (e.g. Azure DevOps)
Demonstrated ability to coordinate cross-functional work teams toward task completion
Demonstrable maturity in managing teams, and stakeholder management
Demonstrated effective leadership and analytical skills
Experienced working with third party providers.
Ability to adapt to increased responsibilities

As well as an opportunity to work with talented people we offer a competitive salary, life cover, pension scheme into which the company will contribute up to 10% of total earnings and a performance based discretionary bonus scheme.

Excellent digital skills and understanding of marketing/online technologies

Effective communication skills and works in a collaborative way across multiple teams

Farfetch exists for the love of fashion. We believe in empowering individuality. Our mission is to be the global platform for luxury fashion, connecting creators, curators and consumers.
We’re a diverse and global community made up of Farfetchers, our partners and our customers, which we believe is at the heart of our success. Everything we do is centred around our values - Be Human, Think Global, Be Revolutionary, Todos Juntos, Be Brilliant, Amaze Customers - which define our beliefs and our actions. We welcome difference and foster a consciously inclusive environment for everyone. We are Farfetch For All.

Operations
We’re passionate about operational excellence, acting with our customers always in our heart. From Content Creation, to Payments and Fraud, to Delivery and Customer Care Services, we’re creating seamless and luxury experiences for our customers all around the world.

London
Our London office is located in Old Street, London’s tech hub, home to a broad range of teams including Commercial, Marketing, and Product. We have large open plan spaces and a feature staircase connecting our 3 floors, encouraging our collaborative and open culture. We also have a big outdoor terrace where we can have lunch and host social events when the sun comes out!

Our Operations team power the movement of our stock! The Farfetch Group stock pool is global, high value and complex to navigate. We have thousands of items being imported, exported, and transferred between our sites every single day. Now we are a publicly listed company experiencing phenomenal growth, Farfetch have a responsibility to ensure the processes that underpin stock movements reporting are SOX compliant. It’s our ambition to be 100% SOX compliant always, without exception, to reduce any risk to our business.
This role reports into the Farfetch Head of Fulfillment (Europe) and you will work alongside our Global Operations teams and our network of global fulfilment partners. The purpose of the role is building a blueprint for SOX compliance specific to stock management. Applying your expertise in SOX compliance you will be instrumental in implementing and championing best practice. Applying an auditor’s lens to everything you do, you will identify and remedy any risks which compromise the integrity of our stock data and audit results, building long term solutions to drive continuous improvement.
What you'll do
Define the parameters and specifications required to achieve 100% SOX compliance, building a view of what success looks like and aligning the team to this vision.
Partner with internal stakeholders across the Farfetch Group such as the Operations and Audit teams and external stakeholders including Auditors, to gain insight of current challenges and risks to compliance.
Build the compliance roadmap for the Operations team, prioritising efforts and laying the foundations for excellence.
Define and coach internal and external stakeholders on the responsibilities they have to influence stock movement and stock reporting as defined in the SOX register, highlighting the importance of SOX compliance.
Conduct regular audits of the processes being carried out internally and externally (3PL’s), implementing new processes concerned with the reporting of stock movement wherever there is room to improve compliance.
Learn from best practice stock management and reporting being carried out in any corners of our business, driving synergy and applying this best practice to the wider group.
Operationalize the compliance roadmap by introducing a comprehensive suite of compliance data and best practice compliance reporting, familiarizing the team with this data and building dialogue around the insights on a continuous basis.
Be guided by high quality data, flagging and escalating any risks to the relevant operations team for full investigation, being accountable for risks until they are resolved.
Drive and influence behavioral change around how tools and systems are utilised by internal and external teams, driving a ‘system first’ response to allow for accurate reporting on our stock position at any point in time.
Plan and prepare the business for periodic audits, driving a shift towards continuous auditing practices.
Facilitate quarterly and yearly meetings with our third-party auditors, delivering the results of the Farfetch stock audits and actioning any feedback stemming from audits carried out by our external auditors.
Who you are
Experience in SOX procedures for publicly listed companies.
Comfortable in a logistics and operations environment, with previous exposure to a warehouse or with auditors.
Natural ability to build effective relationships throughout the business.
Skilled at presenting data in an impactful way.
Strong warehouse management system and ERP knowledge.
Senior stakeholder management skills with an ability to influence all levels of the organisation.
Ability to think strategically and innovatively and to that into a viable, operational plan.
Strong commercial and financial acumen, with an ability to speak business language.
Excellent communication skills with proven track record of building effective relationships with senior leadership teams.
Thrives on complex challenges with a problem-solving approach.
Experience in Retail and E-commerce, with a focus on multi-channel environments, would be a bonus.
The purpose of the role is building a blueprint for SOX compliance specific to stock management. Applying your expertise in SOX compliance you will be instrumental in implementing and championing best practice.

Role Profile


Alongside a deep historical expertise in equities, with the acquisition of Yield Book by LSEG in August 2017, the ISD Analytics business gained deep expertise in fixed income risk analytics - and particularly in the modelling of US securitized assets. The Yield Book products have a client base of over 350 clients, and include a wide range of Buy and Sell side institutions globally. Customers include 43 of the top 50 fixed income money managers in the U.S., investment management firms, banks, central banks, insurance companies, pension funds, hedge funds, broker dealers and regional dealers.

The RMBS Product Manager reports directly to the Head of Securitized Product Management within the Information Services division at LSEG and will also work closely with Analytics Research, Technology and Sales / Relationship Management. The role will also play a key role in the integration planning and execution of RMBS related product initiatives as part of the integration of Refinitiv and LSEG. In addition to planning for Integration and execution, the role will support the current securitized related analytics enhancements, drive client and internal stakeholder engagement, and contribute to the global analytics product strategy. The role will contribute to client engagement programmers and work with individual and groups of clients to support their take-up and ongoing use of our benchmarking, data and analytics products and services. For both Integration and BAU, collaborate with sales, marketing, and research functions have a fully coordinated approach to product strategy, development, client input, and engagement.

Play a key role in Analytics integration planning and execution for RMBS Securities related to the Transaction
Develop a deep understanding of Yield Book’s suite of models and associated products and work on enhancing product offering for RMBS Data, Cash flows and Models.

Work closely with Sales, Client Services and Marketing for a successful go to market strategy.

Collaborate with key internal stakeholders to implement successful outcomes for both Integration and BAU activities.

Proactively engage with clients, actively follow market trends, changing regulations, and underwriting requirements to ensure Yield Book’s products remain at the forefront of market evolution
Write white papers and blogs on product initiatives

Strong technical and analytical skills
Expertise in fixed income analytics with specialization in Securitized Products

Amazon Advertising operates at the intersection of eCommerce and advertising, offering a rich array of digital display advertising solutions with the goal of helping our customers find and discover anything they want to buy. We help advertisers reach Amazon customers on Amazon.com, across our other owned and operated sites, on other high quality sites across the web, and on millions of Kindles, tablets, and mobile devices. We start with the customer and work backwards in everything we do, including advertising. If youre interested in joining a rapidly growing team working to build a unique, world-class advertising group with a relentless focus on the customer, youve come to the right place.

The Senior API Partner Development Manager will be responsible for leading major efforts integrating Amazons Advertising API offering with external advertising solutions. You will develop and grow relationships with external partners (3rd party solution providers) and their developer teams and work to understand their business and product. You will also work very closely with our Engineering and Product team to ensure that our Advertising APIs fulfill the needs of our external partners. Furthermore, you will work with our external partners to ensure the right integration of our advertising offering into their solution. Our group functions as a start-up within Amazon, and offers a creative, fast paced, entrepreneurial work environment where youll be at the center of Amazon innovation. You will have a direct impact on your customers by making it easy and efficient for these partners to help Amazon sellers advertise their products, increase sales and promote their brands through Amazon advertising. This person can sit in the San Francisco, CA or New York City office.

Job Responsibilities:
· Manage and grow relationships with existing portfolio of 3rd party solution providers, building technology solutions on top of the Amazon advertising API supporting Sponsored Ads
· Capture Voice of Partner and quantify impact of feature requests to feed into product roadmap and influence prioritization of product development
· Effectively manage C-level relationships
· Organize and lead Quarterly Business Reviews with external partners
· Lead Joint Business Planning with external and internal partners
· Act as single point of contact that can effectively help API partners manage and grow their business on Amazon
· Identify opportunities to enable business development and engage with marketing teams to execute on these opportunities
· Influence third-party partners to adopt critical and valuable Advertising API features

· Manage and grow relationships with existing portfolio of 3rd party solution providers, building technology solutions on top of the Amazon advertising API supporting Sponsored Ads
· Capture Voice of Partner and quantify impact of feature requests to feed into product roadmap and influence prioritization of product development

The ideal candidate has deep experience in online advertising managing strategic partnerships and has understanding of product/advertising feeds, and a keen sense for a great customer experience and how to measure improvements against it. This role is an opportunity to make a significant impact on the future vision for the Amazon Sponsored Ads business.

Infection Control Manager

London / South East

At Churchill, we put our people first so that they can deliver outstanding service to our clients. We recognise that our client’s environment reflects their brand and provides a better workplace for their people. We never compromise on quality and are unrivalled in our attention to detail.

We are searching for an Infection Control Manager to be responsible for the delivery of our PRISM offering, which is the Prevention, Investigation, Monitoring and Reporting of the spread of bacteria within the built environment.

Do you have what it takes to join our team? Do you understand infection prevention and the spread of bacteria? Are you able to confidently report on findings? Can you review data and suggest ways to improve processes?

This is an opportunity for you to be part of a business, built on strong foundations, named in The Sunday Times, Grant Thornton Top Track 250, Britain’s private mid-market growth companies. We are driven to Always Do Right and we are looking for people who share our values. Our independence gives us the freedom to do what we believe in. We believe it’s our responsibility to do right by our clients, our society and our planet.

As an Infection Control Manager, you will be responsible for:

Client education and wellbeing, as well as the education of cleaning staff regarding infection control protocols and policies.
Scientific research to recommend, implement and monitor policies and procedures for clients regarding sterilisation, disinfection and cleaning best practice.
Infection education development for the business regarding infection prevention and conduct education sessions for the wider team.
Developing current outbreak intervention procedures and have a complex understanding of public health England/Scotland/Wales expectations.
Collecting, recording and analysing business hygiene and lab reports to assess commonality between buildings, interpret the data analytics and trend reports to make the appropriate recommendations for action.
Completing full building audits, access scientific reports married with onsite ATP testing to recommend best course of action for cleaning procedures. Presenting results internally & externally where needed.
Performing any other reasonable job related task that may be directed by the senior management of the company as requested.

As an Infection Control Manager, you will have the following expertise and attributes:

Previous infection control management experience.
Experience providing exceptional customer service, building and maintaining relationships, ideally in a client facing environment.
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment, with excellent time management skills.
Working knowledge of Health and Safety systems in the cleaning industry would be highly desirable.
Confident communicator with ability to train and coach employees.
High attention to detail, recording and reporting information accurately.
Problem – solver approach, able to demonstrate use of own initiative.
Flexible approach to work, able to work unsocial hours if necessary and ability to drive to different sites for work.
Experience gained within the healthcare industry, or similar, would be highly beneficial.
