Job Description Summary

Monitor and support a range of risk management processes and systems and interpret a range of data, managing the efficient and effective production of high quality analysis, anticipating stakeholder needs.

Job Description

At Lloyds Banking Group, we have a clear purpose; to help Britain prosper and to become the best bank for our customers. What we do makes a genuine difference to families, businesses and communities, and we’re playing a central role in crafting a growing UK economy.

In this rare and impactful role, you’ll be joining the Pricing Model Validation team within the Chief Operating & Market Risk Science department.

Job description/what would you get involved with?

We welcome you to a team which cover pricing, counterparty credit, and market risk measurement modelling. We are also responsible for the independent review and analysis of the derivative pricing models used for valuation and risk.

You’ll develop and benchmark pricing models in an independent C++ library, provide theoretical analysis and review of pricing models across asset classes understanding the mathematical models used and their implementation methods.

You’ll also provide qualitative analysis and stress testing of pricing models used for pricing and/or risk calculation.

Other responsibilities include:

To model the annual review for pricing models
Undertake algorithmic trading validation work to be complaint with MiFID regulation
Undertake trade surveillance validation work to be complaint with FCA regulation

What skills and experience can you bring to the role?

To be considered, it is essential that you have

A numerical or statistical background (evidenced through a higher qualification to at least Masters level in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics or Finance, or via demonstrate commercial experience in a quantitative role)
Strong analytical skills
Programming experience in C++ including library architecture design
Excellent written and oral communication skills with an ability to communicate quantitative models in a clear and concise manner
Theoretical understanding and familiarity with derivative pricing models, stochastic calculus, partial differential equations and Monte Carlo simulation
Ability to work independently to deadlines and under time pressure

It would also be beneficial if you had experience of working in a Model Validation or Front Office Quant role.

The role is based at Lloyds Banking Group, 10 Gresham Street, London. EC2V 7AE

This advert opens for applications on the 31st of July and closes on the 20th of August (for those applying through Find a Job please note THIS IS NOT THE 30 AUGUST 2020 CLOSING DATE QUOTED ABOVE)

And in return...

It is a very exciting time to join LBG. Together we'll continue our market leading, ground breaking transformation and you'll help us realise the Group's vision to become the Best Bank for Customers. Here, you'll grow as a person and develop your career.

The salary range is £55,889 – £61,771 plus benefits (NOT THE 52,947 - £58,830 QUOTED ABOVE)

As well as a competitive salary, you’ll receive:

Discretionary Performance Share Award
Generous pension contribution
A flex benefits cash pot you can adjust to suit your lifestyle (4% on top of your basic salary)
Private health cover
Share schemes
30 days holiday plus bank holidays

In return for your expertise, you'll enjoy our total dedication to your ongoing personal and professional development. We'll help you perform at your best today, so you can fulfil all your potential in the future.

Lloyds Banking Group is committed to building a workforce which reflects the diversity of the customers and communities we serve, and to building an inclusive environment where all our colleagues can be themselves and succeed on merit. We're an equal opportunity employer and deeply value diversity within our organisation.

We've gained industry recognition including Stonewall Top 100 Employer, Top 30 Employer for Working Families, Gold Standard 2014 from the Business Disability Forum and Top 50 Employer for Women.

So if you have the skills we’re seeking and you’re looking for your next step, we’d love to hear from you!

At Lloyds Banking Group, we're driven by a clear purpose; to help Britain prosper. Across the Group, our colleagues are focused on making a difference to customers, businesses and communities. With us you'll have a key role to play in shaping the financial services of the future, whilst the scale and reach of our Group means you'll have many opportunities to learn, grow and develop.

We're focused on creating a values-led culture and are committed to building a workforce which reflects the diversity of the customers and communities we serve. Together we’re building a truly inclusive workplace where all of our colleagues have the opportunity to make a real difference.

At Space Ape, we are focused on building world-class player experiences. Our games are fun, fresh and brimming with personality, so we want to share them with everyone. We believe the best games are a combination of art and science, we pair analytical product people with creative skills for great results.

The Role


We are looking for a highly organised Product Manager to drive the product vision of one of our six games in development. The game team has an established vision and thesis but are on the search for someone to crack the code of what it will take to make the game a hit.

The game will be one where the economy design, balancing and analytical feature design will be a huge lever in the game’s success. In other words it will be the kind of game that will make best use of your analytical skills. Our studio DNA includes free to play, strategy and live ops based games, so there will always be a place where you can have a huge impact.

You will be responsible for ensuring the success and growth of the game by developing a product vision, strategy and roadmap. You will inspire, coordinate and empower designers, developers, artists and data scientists to evolve live games and deliver an optimised and personalised experience to millions of players.

This is a role for someone who sees career growth coming from being the first Product Manager on a game that becomes a global phenomenon, more so than someone who aspires to lead a product management organization spanning many games. That said, there will be plenty of opportunities to mentor and learn from some of the best in the business by collaborating with teams across Space Ape and the broader Supercell family.

Responsibilities
End to end management of product. Prioritise features based on business value, collect and analyse requirements, write clear and detailed specs, create wireframes and define A/B tests.
Drive experimentation and lead testing/tuning efforts for specific features.
Analyse results of the features, iterate based on data to improve performance.
Plan the long-term direction of the game. Set Milestones make sure they are hit.
Work with Tech to strike a balance between new features, tools, and technical debt.
Own the metrics. DAU, ARPU, D1/D7/D30 retention. LTV. Creating impact as a result of your changes.
Own revenue and other quarterly objectives by pushing initiatives and improvements to all teams.
Work closely with Dev. team to ensure release of relevant and timely content.
Prioritise features, content, and promotions based on development time and impact.
Work with designers on ideas, specs, and game design settings to create impactful features.
Review, create, and critique specs; providing real time feedback.
Requirements
Proven track record of improving metrics within a live game, as a Product Manager, Live Ops Manager or similar.
A proven track record of improving stats on a live game
Data driven and analytical with exceptional attention to detail. SQL experience an advantage.
Goal oriented, passionate and autonomous on projects
Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with all disciplines and departments.
Skilled expertise in software development methodologies and project management. Agile / Scrum experience is preferred.
Ability to juggle many things at once and bring order to chaos. Excellent problem solver.
Must have a background in a related field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Management, or Game Design.
Why Space Ape is right for you
Be a part of one of several small empowered teams who inspire and challenge one another in the pursuit of our mission
Autonomy to make your own impact with the support to help it happen
Designated ‘Ape Space’ creative time where you are free to work on game concepts and ideas away from your day to day
The freedom to further your skill set the way you want with a generous training budget
Competitive compensation and benefits
An award winning studio that in 2017, 2018, 2019, & 2020 was crowned one of the best companies to work for in the UK by gamesindustry.biz.
Help run and create games which bring joy to millions of players all over the world
4.7/5.0 Glassdoor rating - Check out our reviews
Entered a long-term strategic partnership with Supercell in 2017
This position is in London, but you're not? No matter where you would be moving from, our dedicated people will help you from beginning to end.
About Space Ape

At Space Ape we pride ourselves on our passion and the trust we place in our people. We look for driven, productive, team players who are relentless in their pursuit of our mission. There’s no bureaucracy here, we just get things done. Space Ape’s mission is to make the highest quality and most successful mobile games in the world. Founded in 2012 we’ve since launched four games that have been installed by over 100 million people and generated over $200m revenue. We currently have two games in soft launch [https://beatstar.com/] and [https://apps.apple.com/nl/app/id1520552339] and 3 more entering soft launch soon.

Our studio is currently 110 strong and built around the belief that small empowered teams make the best games. This philosophy enables us to innovate, move faster and have the creative ownership required to make the greatest games on mobile.

All communication regarding your application will be dealt with in line with our recruitment privacy policy

Company Description

OVERVIEW

A global leader in Communication the Groupe is positioned at every step of the value chain, from consulting to execution, combining marketing and digital business transformation. As a privileged partner in its clients’ transformation and journey to enhance personalization at scale. Through a unified and fluid organization, its clients have a facilitated access to expertise across 100+ countries and a its internal network of 83,000 professionals.

Publicis Production (Prodigious) is an award-winning production studio with 3500 production experts across 40 countries worldwide. We are proud makers, producing everything from CG animation to DOOH, to print and live action TVCs for some of the world’s leading brands.

Tag WW brings together world class craftsmanship across a full range of visual, verbal and digital techniques to create a production engine that turns ideas into high-impact creative assets that make brands stand out every time and everywhere. We have a presence in 195 cities across 40 countries and work with 40 of the top 100 global brands.

In July 2020, Publicis Production and Tag WW won the global account for GSK, to work as its production partner with innovation and problem solving at the core. In a hugely exciting development for the future of production we have created an entirely new production model to manage international demand through Circle.

Our model: Circle is an intelligent feedback loop of data, enabled by tech integration, where every decision, execution and reaction creates another layer of learning for our systems, ensuring content relevance and reduction of waste.

Our agency: Circle is the symbol of our seamless union – the partnership with Tag/ ITG and Publicis and the extension of our partnerships with GSK.

Our Mission as the partner supporting GSK to drive efficiency, effectiveness and reduce wastage. Going beyond the usual dashboard limitations of scheduled reviews and interventions by bringing production, data and media intimately and seamlessly together and building a data first, creatively driven solution for every brand, campaign and action.

We will defeat the crippling disease of wastage through informed decision making, consistently leveraging our knowledge of the market, audiences, channels, platforms, partners and formats in the creation of creative assets.

Job Description

The Global Operations Manager will provide leadership and direction for a specific workstream / group of work streams while also managing and continuously building on the client partnership. The role requires building and overseeing a delivery team to deliver key campaign assets across multiple brands and markets.

The Global Operations Manager will work with other roles in the service layer and the onsite teams supporting our client across various brands and delivering on their creative production needs. The service layer and onsite teams deliver a truly transformation work-stream for the specific region in a two-part production model. Agile onsite work as well as planned content production across all channels.

This is a very demanding and dynamic role that will require the Global Operations Manager to have strong experience in a similar role in their specific workstream, managing teams, key internal and external stakeholders as well as clients. Critical knowledge of the creative and production processes, understanding key timings for inputs as well as being able to mitigate risks, solve problems and deliver on brand consistency by being aware and collaborating with regional teams is essential.
The Global Operations Manager will have 10+ years' experience in a client facing role preferably within Consumer healthcare, FMCG or Beauty categories
Knowledge / Expertise within a specific workstream / multiple workstreams (Digital, Print / Packaging, Imaging, TV, Online Video)
Excellent data driven experience in managing operations
Be able to build and maintain key relationships with agencies, partnerships, clients and key stakeholders
Manage and oversee teams and client accounts, across multiple markets
Responsibility to ensure that the operational metrics of on time delivery and quality are met and we are consistently exceeding client SLAs across individual workstreams
Work in a collaborative way with teams locally and virtually to ensure knowledge is shared across the board in a timely manner and all content/assets are delivered on time
Work closely with the data insights team ensuring that learnings are discussed with creative agencies and clients at key points within the creative development process
Manage operational efficiencies through key metrics of utilization, productivity and 24-hour planning for resource management
Be financially minded able to work on business planning and forecasting
Contribute to the smooth running of the business overall, delivering against client KPIs
Have a leadership attitude, supporting teams as needed and working together to manage any challenges
Have excellent communication skills, ability to present with gravitas and engage the most senior clients and stakeholders
Critical work planning and time management skills, able to prioritize and manage multiple briefs/campaigns at the same time

The customer journey starts with a question. And consumers expect answers. Yext puts businesses in control of their facts online with brand-verified answers in search. By serving accurate, consistent, brand-verified answers to consumer questions, Yext delivers authoritative information straight from the source — the business itself — no matter where or how customers are searching. Taco Bell, Marriott, Jaguar Land Rover, and businesses around the globe use the Yext platform to capture consumer intent and drive digital discovery, engagement, and revenue — all from a single source of truth. Yext's mission is to provide perfect answers everywhere.

As a Platform Manager, you will be responsible for providing platform configuration and data management services to our clients and partners. Our team is looking for people who are fired up and love coming to work every day. We are building a market and educating clients on the power of data, as we work to hit aggressive goals. We like to spend time together - we work hard and play hard. Professional working proficiency in Italian is required because this role will be supporting both our UK and Italian regions.

What You'll Do

Manage & prioritize multiple inbound client configuration or data management requests and drive to completion
Interpret client and other stakeholder requests, tailor your conversations according to their needs, and effectively communicate these needs to other internal teams as necessary
Partner closely with the account managers to ensure we are exceeding client expectations
Analyze and Import client or partner data, and provide quality assurance over the information and content loaded into the Yext Platform
Serve as a subject matter expert to clients as well as internal teams
Act as an escalation point for the customer support teams on complex client issues
Test new product features and workflows and provide feedback to product management
Contribute to internal resources and deliver meaningful product feedback to leadership and relevant teams

What You Have

BA/BS degree or similar college level education
1+ years of operations, customer support, or analyst experience
All candidates, who may not have the above-listed years' experience, but can demonstrate the necessary skills, may apply and will be considered
Proficient in data analysis and manipulation with solid spreadsheet (Excel)
Outstanding and effective interpersonal skills; along with strong ability to communicate complex issues across departments and with external contacts
Detail-oriented, organized, process-driven
Ability to work quickly and accurately in a high-volume environment
Autonomous worker with excellent time management skills
Ability to thrive in a cross-functional team environment
Interest in technology
Ability to speak and write in English and Italian fluently and idiomatically

Yext is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, genetics, sex, pregnancy or childbirth, sexual orientation, gender (including gender identity or nonbinary or nonconformity and/or status as a trans individual), age, physical or mental disability, citizenship, marital, parental and/or familial status, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Job Category
Customer Success Group
Job Details


Who we are...

Tableau joined the Salesforce Ohana in 2019 as an analytics trailblazer. Within Tableau Sales, the Global Services organization is supported by the Global Services Operations team which has a diverse purview including business analytics, procurement activities, business operational support, Tableau Education services, and the Tableau Services Subcontracting Program. In Global Services, we value an inclusive approach to attracting and growing talent. Whether we’re providing functional support, building programs, or rolling out the latest process improvements, we are focused on providing a great professional experience while continuing to develop an effective operational foundation for Global Services.

What you'll be doing...

We are looking for an Operations Manager to help us build out a new function within the Tableau Services Subcontracting Program. As we mature our subcontracting operations, you’ll manage our EMEA/APAC Professional Services and Education subcontractor relationships including performance management, develop growth and nurture plans, and iterate on the building of supporting processes. You’ll be responsible for tasks throughout the subcontractor lifecycle including onboarding, resource vetting, escalation management, and portfolio reviews. This role provides a unique combination of relationship building/management with an operational focus on developing a new function with an eye to effectiveness and efficiency.

Your Impact:

Success will be measured by the overall performance of the Tableau Services Subcontracting Program team to provide the Global Services organization with a cost-effective, high quality subcontracting network.
Assist with the development of the Subcontractor Manager role within AMER (EMEA/APAC) region
Develop and nurture strong relationships with key training and consulting partners in the EMEA/APAC region
Execute on subcontractor program functions throughout the subcontractor lifecycle including partner onboarding, oversight, logistics, and portfolio reviews
Monitor subcontractor performance in areas including process compliance, quality, revenue, and strategic fit
Oversee issue resolution and escalation management related to subcontractors in the EMEA/APAC region
Identify potential improvements that can enhance the overall value, efficiency, and effectiveness of the subcontracting program and subcontractor experience
Work closely with regional Account Partners and Delivery teams to ensure adequate subcontractor capacity and skill set coverage
Minimum Requirements:
Ability to build and sustain strong relationships with external partners
Experience monitoring metrics/data for trends and issues
Ability to address performance issues and escalations without damaging the subcontractor relationship
Experience with successfully managing a large, diverse workload such as managing multiple projects, accounts, and/or cases
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Strong cross-functional teaming skills and collaborative problem solving
Self-directed and resourceful with strong interpersonal, teamwork, and organizational skills
Ability to bring clarity and structure when managing fluid expectations and evolving demands
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Ability to balance thoroughness, high quality, and efficiency within a high volume of tasks
Preferred Requirements:
Experience in an operational role with success in identifying and executing process and program improvements
Ability to build, manage and utilize Tableau dashboards
Experience in a partner-related role in the software, professional services, or related industry
Proficiency in languages other than English
About Salesforce

Founded in 1999, Salesforce is the global leader in Customer Relationship Management (CRM). Companies of every size and industry are using Salesforce to transform their businesses, across sales, service, marketing, commerce, and more by connecting with customers in a whole new way. We harness technologies that can revolutionize companies, careers, and, hopefully, our world.

Salesforce is built on a set of four core values: Trust, Customer Success, Innovation, and Equality. By making technology more accessible, we're helping create a future with greater opportunity and equality for all. This has taken our company to great heights, including being named one of the FORTUNE "100 Best Companies to Work For®" for 12 years in a row.

There are those who choose to work with the best and brightest. And then, there are those who want to do more than just a job. They are the ones improving lives, not only their careers. Having an impact now instead of later. Doing something that’s so much bigger than themselves, an industry, and their company.

JobDescription :
Role: Product Manager, Enterprise Delivery

Grade (relevant for internal applicants only): 11

Location: London, UK

The Team: As part of the Digital Platform and Enterprise Delivery Team, you will deliver the data flow strategy with ground floor innovation through simplification and abstraction of complex data processes across the business. Digitizing Platts by focusing on Machine-to-Machine interaction, this cross-functional team provide APIs for raw data delivery, streaming functions for real time, and bulk delivery for voluminous requests. We deliver content and analytics to internal platforms and direct to external consumers where, when and how it’s needed.

The Impact: Platts creates over 10,000 daily assessments used for 1,500+ cleared financial instruments that transact in excess of $10 billion every day. We stream over 20,000 bids, offers and trades a month from more than 450 of the top commodity trading companies globally. Furthermore we track 60,000 plus vessels live, create over 1,000 weekly reports, monitor nearly 90% of the world’s refineries and much, much more. In a nutshell, we have a lot of data.

The role, building business problem solving APIs within our API framework, offers unrivalled exposure to the real time commodity markets, a unique perspective on how this data is valued across all walks of business, and the ability to shape and build the future of this data flow. As the cornerstone of analytics, exposure to knowledge graph and AI technologies gives the role tangible depth in real world application of this data.

Strategic responsibilities:
Interact directly with clients and the developer community to understand, define, iterate and deprecate API capability roadmaps and requirements as the commodity market evolves
Lead internal product planning to define the data and component APIs for client requested datasets and functionality
Insist on a consistent, scalable and sustainable API suite across all delivery mediums preventing silo developments for individual downstream consumers
Align with diverse internal business units on strategy and goals, assessing their development needs, fit and integration requirements
Working responsibilities:
Define success metrics, use data to drive decision-making and present both financial and technical points of view to c-suite
Write user stories and executable requirements, process flow diagrams, and acceptance test criteria for APIs, overseeing quality assurance and deployment
Lead sprints to build and refine APIs, partnering with the engineering team on short-cycle design and scrum interactions, meeting dates against objectives and deliverables, driving decisions and escalating appropriately
Build out and evolve Platts developer portal to DX guidelines providing a consistent mechanism to deliver API information to consumers
Create a consumer-developer communication forum including: sharing the technical roadmap, public issue trackers, clear release notes and changelogs, etc.
Evangelise a simplification agenda with: novice compatible documentation, plain development practises, consistent method and library use, appropriate versioning and name spacing, etc.
Encourage a Self-Service approach by providing input into entitlement and making our APIs more approachable and easy to use in trial and test scenarios
What We're Looking For: We are seeking a Product Manager with demonstrable experience of consumer led API product development and management, coupled to a strong consumer side Developer Experience (DX) ethos. Deploying our technical scrum teams, you will own, drive and create APIs to deliver features and functions across a diverse suite of datasets that are both simple to use and fundamental to the global commodities trading and risk markets. This person will be held accountable for execution. Tangible deliverables and measurable success are common in your past. You are able to demonstrate experience of successful delivery on scope, on time, and on budget.

Required skills:
5+ years product experience at global FinTech or cloud company, building best-in-class APIs, developer experience and documentation for trading communities
Working knowledge of derivatives trading and resulting client API expectations
Track record delivering both complete and micro-service structured API solutions for RESTful and Real Time deployment
Exposure to real time platforms such as Apache Kafka and familiarity with the Kong stack of API tools a bonus
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in technical or science major
Experience with both Agile and Lean methodologies
Experience with commodity markets
Customer-first mind-set with ability to understand and act on customer insight, generate new product and service offerings ideas based on customer data and insights
Strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to link product design and features to strategic objectives while using data and metrics to substantiate assumptions and recommendations
Diplomacy and tenacity when managing and communicating with stakeholders at all levels of business alongside a firm ability to assume positive intent
Open Date: 4th November 2020

Closing Date: 4th December 2020

Salary: Competitive

At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with confidence. We’re the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping.

S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.platts.com.

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, sex, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or other legally protected categories, subject to applicable law.

Job ID :
252668

Posted On :
7/18/2020 12:05:34 AM

Location :
London

ABOUT US

DICE is the world’s most-loved discovery and ticketing platform for live shows and live streams, delivering exclusive, high quality entertainment to fans across the world.

We bring fans and creators together with our technology, working closely with the best artists, promoters and venues in music and culture. In April 2020 we launched DICE Live Streaming, connecting fans across the globe with the very best live events.

DICE is a place for people who are ambitious, humble and talented. For those who want to learn at pace and have a true passion for music and culture. Our HQ is in London, we have teams in New York, LA, Paris, Barcelona, Milan, Mumbai and Samara and we’re live in 139 countries. You can read more about what we’ve been up to here in our recent Forbes and Rolling Stone articles.

And now, we’re looking for a Product Manager to join the DICE Product team.

THE ROLE AND TEAM

We focus on helping fans discover the best events, making it as easy as possible to purchase tickets and giving them a great experience of the event itself. This role will involve ownership over the core fan experience; ensuring the best experience to pick up tickets & attend an event. It’s the number one reason fans love DICE & an area we continually look to improve.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
Working with design, research, engineering and fan support to come up with ideas & deliver the best possible fan experience on iOS, Android & Web
Prioritising the most impactful areas that will help the team achieve success
A big part of this will be by collecting feedback from Fan Support, user testing & analysing data based on app usage & fan behaviour
Understanding the main problems, clearly communicating them & documenting requirements in a detailed manner in JIRA
Ensuring the experience is great regardless where in the world a fan is
Presenting updates to the wider company, keeping stakeholders up to date with developments & ensuring various teams are on the same page on what’s being worked on and why
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
A clear prioritisation framework; there’s always more that can be done, but what’s most impactful? Preferably you achieve this by always putting the fan first
Worked closely with iOS, Android, Web & Backend devs; having ensured priorities were clear & worked through questions they had
Having managed an iOS/Android/Web application (all 3 would be ideal)
Has a UX background & utilises this to ensure a quality fan experience
The ability to inspire, motivate and lead engineers and designers
You won’t have any direct reports, but you will be working alongside other product managers & will be responsible for this part of the fan experience
All applications are actively being reviewed as we'll begin the interview process shortly. Final closing date for applications is Friday 27th November 2020.

Job Title: IA Technology - Data Quality - Audit Manager - VP
Job Description: The IA Technology - Data Quality - Audit Manager - VP delivers the Data Quality audit plan, providing independent third-line assurance that the end-to-end Data Quality processes at Citi have been properly understood, assessed and mitigated via first line programs and second line assurance activities. Key Responsibilities: Develops and executes (and ongoing updates) a robust Data Quality audit plan by reviewable entity by assigned area, that provides thorough, risk based coverage (including issue validation for regulatory and audit issues) for addressing Data Quality risks across Citi, in accordance with Internal Audit standards, relevant government statutes and regulations and Citigroup and Citibank policies. Executes independent assessments of end-to-end Data Tracing capability that provides assurance over accuracy of critical data in key regulatory and management reports. Delivers on time high quality audit reports, Internal Audit and Regulatory issue validation and (where appropriate, branch examinations, as well as business monitoring and governance committee reporting. Manages audit activities for a component of a product line, function, or legal entity at the regional or country level including a portion of the audit annual plan. Applies in-depth level of expertise in one or more of the corporation's businesses and leverages this knowledge into a leadership role in one or more teams. Proactively advances integrated auditing concepts and use of technology. Manages a complex and critical unit within Internal Audit, including a small to medium sized team of Internal Audit professionals. Recruits staff, develops talent, builds effective teams, and manages a budget. Possesses a broad and comprehensive understanding of different Internal Audit standards, policies and local regulations; applies a broad and comprehensive knowledge of high risk areas including: Consumer or Investment Banking, technology management; project/program management; regulatory compliance or supplier management. Leads the professional development of Internal Audit staff. Develops effective senior line management relationships and has a strong understanding of the businesses. Applies an in-depth understanding of the inter-relationships of business and support units throughout the corporation and how they impact the overall control environment and the audit approach. Uses excellent communication skills in order to influence a wide range of internal audiences including respective product, function, or regional executive management partners. May negotiate internally often at higher levels on matters which will have a major impact on the area managed. Demonstrates strong judgment, political astuteness, and sensitivity to cultural diversity. Possesses strong project management and interpersonal skills, makes sound decisions, exhibiting initiative and intuitive thinking. Consulted often by others for advice and opinions and recognized as a leadership role model. Participates in major business initiatives and pro-actively advises and assists the business on change initiatives. Frequently involved in matters that require complex judgments and solutions based on sophisticated analytical thought such as identifying solutions for a variety of complex and novel audit control issues. Analyzes reporting findings; Recommends appropriate interventions where needed. Proposes creative and pragmatic solutions for risk and control problems. Partners with Directors and Managing Directors to develop approaches for addressing broader corporate emerging issues. Serves as lead reviewer for all types of reviews. Reviews and approves Business Monitoring Quarterly Summaries. Qualifications and Competencies BA/BS or equivalent. Related certifications (CPA, ACA, CFA, CIA, CISA or similar) are a plus. Statistical, Computer Science or Computer Engineering qualifications will be an advantage. Senior level experience in a related role with experience in business, functional and people management, with proven abilities in taking responsibility for executing concurrently on a portfolio of high quality deliverables to stakeholders according to strict timetables. Specific subject matter expertise regarding Data Quality control disciplines. Demonstrates experience in managing teams and managing integrated internal audit and assurance delivery within a matrix reporting environment. Effective negotiation skills, a proactive and 'no surprises' approach in communicating issues and strength in sustaining independent views. This individual must be an articulate and effective communicator, both orally and in writing, with an energetic, charismatic and approachable style. Strong interpersonal skills for interfacing with all levels of internal and external audit and management. Exceptional candidates who do not meet these criteria may be considered for the role provided they have the necessary skills and experience. Valuing Diversity: Demonstrates an appreciation of a diverse workforce. Appreciates differences in style or perspective and uses differences to add value to decisions or actions and organizational success. DATA CENTRES |MANAGER

£85,000 PER ANNUM PLUS PACKAGE

FLEXIBLE LOCATION UK OR EUROPE

Capstone have been instructed by a leading property investment and development company, that operate across the UK and continental Europe, to recruit an Associate Data Centre Manager. Our client is a FTSE 250 organisation with an enviable reputation in the commercial and industrial property sectors.

The role is to implement the Data Centre leasing & marketing strategy with the aim of maximising occupancy, increasing rental income and strengthening the income quality of the portfolio. The role will report to a Director based in the UK and the successful candidate can be based in the UK or Europe allowing for travel.

Main duties:

To create and realise new opportunities from market knowledge and contacts ultimately generating new lease agreements and income, collaborating with local colleagues in each region to jointly grow our portfolio.
Identify new development opportunities and prepare appraisals and cash flows to demonstrate project viability in accordance with target metrics and coordinate the preparation of all Board Papers to secure capital approval for pre-let and potentially some speculative schemes.
Audit their existing landbank for suitable development opportunities creating compelling IC papers to grow the sector working with colleagues in Technical Development.
Contribute to the Group Data Centre research programme focusing on skills, energy & ESG, leading elements as required.
Identify and secure additional business from existing and new customers
Engage with potential Customers to find solutions to their business needs looking at ways they can work with them to mutually expand their portfolio together on a pan European basis.
To identify acquisition opportunities through market and occupier contacts that complement the existing development programme and enhance portfolio returns in conjunction with the Director Group Data Centres and the Business Unit Director's.
To increase their technical expertise to address the ESG agenda for Data Centres working closely with other key stakeholders.
Liaise with the Asset Management and Leasing teams to actively seek leasing, development and redevelopment/refurbishment opportunities that will contribute to portfolio out performance, including joint marketing of empty units capable of data centre use.
Liaise with internal and external marketing specialists to develop compelling promotion materials, including press coverage and social media stories.
Establish and maintain a high profile for the company with existing and potential customers, property agents, business groups, trade associations and the public sector via appropriate Marketing and relationship building.

To be considered:

MRICS status
Good working knowledge of planning, investment, project management and development sectors
Excellent collaboration skills
Strong negotiation skills and a track record in sound business deals
Strong networking, interpersonal, report writing and presentation skills
Proficient in Argus Valcap and development appraisal software
Previous experience of working across Europe

For more information or to be considered for this role please email your CV to d.williams@capstone-recruitment.com or call Daniah Williams MRICS 020 3994 0340 / 07944 454965.

Title:

Global Markets Operations Manager

Company:

Everest International Insurance

Job Category:

Underwriting

Job Description:

Why join us

Everest is a leading global reinsurance and insurance organization with extensive product and distribution capabilities, a strong balance sheet and an innovative culture. Throughout our history, Everest has maintained its discipline and focus on creating long term value through underwriting excellence and strong risk and capital management.

Our strength is in our people

At Everest, we believe that our future is determined by the actions we take today. Actions that go beyond business strategy and encompass the values important to our employees and the communities in which we operate. Everest’s value commitments include: providing an inclusive work environment that offers employees the opportunity to further their development, supporting our communities through the donation of time and financial resources, maintaining our integrity across all aspects of the group, and being an industry innovator to solve global complex risks.

Job Purpose

To provide support services to the Global Markets underwriting teams and overseeing the underwriting support staff in performing:

Data input and record keeping

Production of operational and management information

Creation and maintenance of documented procedures

Promoting the continuous improvement of productivity, service quality, data quality and customer satisfaction

Process change resulting from regulatory change, market reform or adoption of best practice

Business systems support and training

Maintaining internal & external business relationships including management of 3rd party service providers

Key Accountabilities

Oversee the Global Markets business unit’s Underwriting Analysts and Assistants’, monitor that underwriting support services are delivered to the agreed quality and defined service levels.

Oversee the day-to-day operational management of the Global Markets business unit to ensure adequate control of underwriting, premium, claim and reinsurance processes. Monitor that the Global Markets business unit’s systems and procedures are consistent with Everest “best practice”.

Oversee the day-to-day operational management of all 3rd party BPO partners/providers to ensure adequate delivery of services in line with defined service level agreements and Everest “best practice”.

Work with the Delegated Authority Manager to ensure all Binders are managed in accordance with the Everest Delegated Authority framework, Asta Delegated Authority framework and local country regulatory frameworks.

Ensure that the monthly, quarterly and year-end business timetable is adhered to for the Global Markets business unit, ensuring effective communication with other departments and that all internal and external reporting deadlines are attained.

Produce operational reports and metrics, management information and other statistical data and analysis as required by the COO and Global Markets business unit underwriters in managing the business unit, reporting to committees, Everest Insurance Ireland Board, Asta Syndicate Board, and for brokers, clients and reinsurer presentations as may be required.

Produce exception reports and act on them in a timely manner to ensure accurate risk details are maintained on Everest Underwriting System(s) including premium estimates, exposures, reinsurance cessions and regulatory/business coding.

Work with the COO to achieve operational efficiencies within the Global Markets business unit by the progressive implementation of common systems, working practices, service levels and procedures. Implement process change resulting from regulatory change, market reform or adoption of best practice.

Act as a coach for all systems training and the 1st line of support for all systems issues to enable underwriters to effectively use the systems, tools and resources at their disposal.

Act as a focal point for the Global Markets business unit on systems projects by co-ordinating the business and technical input into requirements specifications, test plans & procedural documentation.

Co-ordinate administration support to underwriters to include attending the Lloyd’s box, organising client meetings and other ad hoc duties as required.

To build and maintain a programme for staff development, promoting self-management, personal development and career progression.

Develop and maintain good working relationships with the Global Markets business unit(s) underwriting staff and key Everest stakeholders, all external customers including Asta, brokers, coverholders, reinsurers, local country regulators and 3rd party service providers.

Any other ad hoc duties or tasks as defined and agreed with the COO.

Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills & Business Experience

Management level Operations experience with a Lloyd’s Managing Agent/Insurance Co.

Superior stakeholder management at all levels.

Professional qualification, e.g. ACII or equivalent experience.

Outstanding communication, both written and verbal.

Experience of managing 3rd party BPO providers.

Ability to lead, motivate, mentor and manage people.

Ability to think proactively and offer solutions to problems.

Ability to understand the bigger picture and visualise the end-to-end process of transactions.

Extensive technology experience including PAS, DMS, Workflow and MS Office suite.

Strong analytical and control skills to ensure integrity of data, ability to audit and self-audit.

Strong project management, prioritisation and time keeping skills.

Type:

Regular

Time Type:

Full time

Primary Location:

London

Additional Locations:

As an effective team member, the for Everest Insurance must champion the Everest Insurance Culture:

• Collaboration: Open and transparent communication with customers and colleagues
• Thoughtful Assumption of Risk: Supporting the Everest goal of carefully writing profitable business by ensuring data quality, prompt and accurate feedback to Underwriters, and operational control throughout the enterprise.
• Execution: Delivering outstanding support to the organization through strong day-to-day business operations, effective project management, and careful oversight of vendors.
• Humility: Caring and respectful approach to service colleagues, customers, and the community.
• Leadership: By example, every day.

Everest is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or creed, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, genetics, physical or mental disability, age, marital status, civil union status, family or parental status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. As part of this commitment, Everest will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact Everest Talent Acquisition at 1-908-604-3000.

We believe in the power of scientific simulations coupled with cutting-edge gaming technology to transform decision making and planning in highly uncertain, rapidly evolving, complex environments. In the National Security and Defence sector, a unique opportunity exists to impact high stakes real-world outcomes by enabling decision makers to explore, interact and experiment with rich simulations of interconnected real world systems – what we refer to as a single synthetic environment.

Synthetic environments give decision makers a constantly improving picture on how to best prepare for crises and threats. Improbable’s platform offers new capabilities to the defence industry with a library of models, enabling defence developers to reuse and repurpose existing models and build new models of the real world in a fast, efficient and iterative way.

We are at a critical juncture for the Defence organisation with a breadth of opportunities to attack in 2021 and beyond. The people, processes and learnings that we put in place this year will have a significant impact on the possibility of success for our business going forward.

Your Mission

Our Defence Division Project Management team is responsible for delivering significant, high-value programs of work, blending delivery management, customer engagement, commercial acumen and product feedback.

This role will own the bid and delivery of a substantial new programme which will likely involve a solution delivery phase leading to sustained service delivery.

This role is suited to someone looking to leverage their experience with technology programme and service management to implement modern, novel digital solutions in aid of the Defence and National Security missions.

Please note due to the nature of this role you will be expected to meet requirements associated with obtaining UK security vetting clearance.
Areas for Impact
Help guide the team to deliver capabilities that contribute to overall programme success and ensure we deliver contractual performance that exceeds expectations
Lead the programme, focussing not only on delivery quality but also building process and guidance to increase our business capability for future programmes and services
Lead efforts to accurately scope and track customer requirements, with a wider appreciation of both the product roadmap and commercial opportunities
Identify opportunities to improve our Project Management capability and processes.
We'd like to hear from you if you identify with the following:
Current or recent UK security vetting clearance (SC) is advantageous but not mandatory.
You have significant experience scoping and delivering complex technology programmes with ongoing service wrap, particularly if involving the delivery of cloud-hosted solutions in consultation with clients and close partnership with other commercial organisations
You champion best practice and exemplary behaviour whilst maintaining mission focus and perseverance in navigating bureaucracy to implement a first-of-type solution
You collaborate with customers and product, engineering, partner and customer success teams and third-party partner organisations to track the status of technical execution and maintain forward progress despite dynamic priorities and uncertainties
You use your written and verbal communication skills to report risks, opportunities, and technical progress to internal and external project stakeholders
You have led the development of project schedules and service lines and coordinate user workshops, integration events and operational evaluations
You use advanced critical thinking skills to proactively implement solutions to programme issues or arm relevant stakeholders with data necessary to make informed decisions including advocating for organisational change when necessary.
While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Equal Opportunity
The best ideas are often the least expected and require new ways of thinking; that’s why our teams at Improbable are made up of an incredible range of talented people. Improbable is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, colour, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any other legally protected status.

Our client is an award-winning multidisciplinary consultancy and due to increasing projects, they now need an experienced Quality Technical Inspector to join their team working across projects in London and north of London. Current Quality Technical Inspectors, Clerk of Works, Building Control Inspectors, Senior Site Managers can be considered. The role will be predominantly site based.

With around 300 staff and 6 offices, the consultancy work across multiple projects sectors including commercial, healthcare, education, industrial, retail, mixed-use and residential and offering services across a wide range of disciplines including Architecture, BIM, M&E, Engineering, Surveying, Project Management and H&S.

Role & Responsibilities
Regular site inspections of construction work to monitor progress and quality
Verify compliance with contractual drawings specifications, warranty standard and Employer’s Requirements
Prepare specific reports under the direction of a team leader
Identify discrepancies and prepare supporting written reports
Close liaison with main contractors and site teams to review and advise on quality management
Occasional need to visit manufacturers to review quality
Working on a variety of construction projects across Education, Healthcare, Commercial, Government, Justice Buildings, Leisure, Community Builds and Residential (Project values £6m – £300m)
Required Skills & Experience
Experience in both new-build and refurbishment projects
Previous experience working as a Clerk of Works, Senior Site Manager, Building Control Surveyor or Technical Inspector
Detailed knowledge of various forms of construction
Experienced in producing site inspection reports
Ability to read construction drawings
Microsoft Office
MICWCI, MCIOB, MRICS, ICWCI preferred but not essential
UK Driving Licence and own vehicle
What you get back
Salary Competitive + Benefits
Contributory Pension Scheme
Social events and leisure activities
Health and wellbeing program
Apply

If you meet the criteria above, send us your CV and portfolio. We receive a large number of applications so if you do not hear back within 7 days consider your application unsuccessful this time. We will keep a copy of your details on file for future vacancies.

In accordance with GDPR, by applying for this position you give us your consent to process your data in-line with our Privacy and Data Protection Policies which can be read on the privacy policy page on our website.

Referral

Quality Technical Inspector Job in London– Your Property Recruitment Specialists (Recruiter: Kelly Armour Job Ref: 11217)

A bit about the role.

We are growing quickly. It's exciting. We are eager to feed more dogs and help them live healthier and happier lives. We believe that solving meaningful problems which will improve our customer experience, improve our operational efficiencies, and enable our teams to scale effectively is the way to do that. That's where you come in.

We’re looking for a Product Manager to own and drive the vision, roadmap and execution of our operational and internal tooling platform to deliver on team scaling, customer experience, and commercial goals.

As part of a cross-functional Product Engineering Team, you'll be reporting to the Head of Digital Product, and working closely with our Platform Software Engineers. You'll also be working closely with our Operations, Data, Customer Love teams and key 3rd party partners.

In this role you can expect to:
Work with key internal partners and leadership across the company to define the vision, strategy and execution of a best-in-class digital platform that enables and supports company growth and scaling.
Manage and prioritise a backlog of initiatives to deliver value to our customers and internal teams, with the right balance of short-term and longer-term goals in mind.
Champion internal teams' needs by generating qualitative and quantitative insights to inform the right priorities for the team to deliver on.
Clearly define, spec and manage the end to end delivery of key initiatives closely with your delivery team of highly-motivated and passionate Software Engineers.
Work closely with your engineering team to ensure the quality and reliability of our platform remains extremely high.
Define and analyse useful metrics to inform the success of products, features or improvements to the platform.
Communicate openly and clearly with the rest of the company, keeping them aligned on the direction of the platform.
A bit about you.
Obsessed with dogs. Naturally.
Passion for start-ups & Product Management.
You have a clear understanding of technical Product Management, working with APIs and 3rd party integrations.
You have strong project management skills, and know how to ensure a project is delivered on time.
You can show off a track record of delivering impactful products that have achieved commercial and customer goals.
Your communication skills are on-point and you can quickly and easily gather support for your ideas, and champion them with exec-level communication.
You have the ability to grasp long-term strategic plays & initiatives that drive customer engagement and company growth.
You can make tough decisions quickly, and you're right most of the time about them.
A bit about us.

At Butternut, we put the food back into dog food. We believe dogs deserve to eat the healthiest, most natural and tastiest food with none of the nasties. That’s why we make freshly prepared dog food. Cooked like you would at home. Delivered in perfect portions.

Our goal is to help dogs live healthier, happier and longer lives whilst leaving humans smiling after every interaction. We’ve come a long way since our co-founders (Kev & Dave) hand-delivered the first Butternut Box, we now feed a lot of dogs across the UK - but we want to feed dogs everywhere. And to do this, we need a team of brilliant people who share that ambition to come and work with us.

A bit about what we offer.
24 days holiday (plus 8 bank holidays)
£500 personal learning & development budget
Co-working office space at Huckletree West
Butternut Box employee discount.
Cycle to work scheme
Pension with NEST
Flexible working arrangements
Friday drinks & monthly team socials
Lots of office dogs (Chambo, Willow, Pugwash, Bella, Gizmo, River, Pip and many more….)
❗️A few things to note:
There is no specific date this role will go down but we normally experience a high volume of applications so if you are interested we suggest applying as soon as possible.
We aim to respond to all applicants personally. Our recruitment team is small so do bear with us.
We don’t use external recruitment agencies for assistance on roles.
We're not afraid of putting extra weight on candidates from underrepresented groups. We want strong, diverse teams built from different backgrounds, experiences, and identities. We're ready for the ongoing work that goes into building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do the best work of your career.

Job Description Summary:
Grant Thornton's Business Risk Services (BRS) provides the advice necessary to help clients manage risk and improve their business performance. Our professionals can deliver objective, value-added solutions that will enable clients to strengthen internal controls and governance processes, implement sound organisational strategies, increase technological capabilities and improve their operational efficiency.
Job Description:
Let’s talk about the job
If you enjoy working on a wide-reaching range of projects that will help businesses and communities flourish, you’ll fit right in. Here are some things you can expect.
Making quality second nature. This means doing what’s right even when no one’s looking. The work that you will do has a major impact on our clients and our firm. We pride ourselves on the high-level standards we have for the work that we do.
Own your own work. – Lead from the front in-regards to delivering client work, engaging the Cyber & Payments Risk team and greater Grant Thornton teams to ensure correct skill utilisation on all projects.
Be a part of a team – Take responsibility for developing more junior team members, understanding their carer aspiration and support in this delivery.
Build your brand – Engenders trust and respect from the client by producing high quality tax advice accurately, delivering to expectations, responding quickly to client demands and delivering to deadlines. Is actively involved in client meetings, concisely and confidently answering client queries. Provides intelligent and creative solutions to client tax issues both reactively and proactively..
Skills to set you apart and the role
Here are a few more skills we are looking for. Don’t worry if you don’t tick every box. It’s important for us to support you in your role and help you to develop along the way.
What you’ll be doing:
Perform and manage technical cyber security and data protection audits and assurance work across a number of clients:
Ideally you will have:
Strong experience implementing or working with ISO 27001, NIST polices and framework
Good understanding of technical security architecture and cloud security.
Strong understanding of cyber security and data security risks and controls;
Good understanding of audit processes, preferably with audit experience;
Strong knowledge of frameworks, standards and regulatory requirements related to information security and data protection;
Good technical knowledge of network security, key IT technologies, commercial security management and monitoring tools and services;
Good knowledge of current and emerging cyber security risks;
Excellent documentation and reporting skills.
Who we're looking for:
Passionate about supporting, advising and helping businesses achieve their potential, you’ll be someone who wants to make a difference and shape your career. You’ll have strong technical skills and experience of providing clients with quality services.
Do you care about the same things we do?
We have six values we work by. When we meet, we’ll want you to show us how they’re important to you, too.
Collaboration: We work together, share ideas and always make time to help each other out.
Leadership: Everyone has the chance to lead their own projects.
Excellence: Quality is central to our purpose. We love what we do, and it shows. We sweat the details. We see things through, no matter how tricky.
Agility: The world moves quickly. To keep up, we stay flexible – changing approaches, changing projects, working offline, online, together and alone to get things done.
Respect: A given, of course: we value each other and our clients. We listen, we understand, we care.
Responsibility: The decisions we make and advice we give affects people’s lives and livelihoods. We take that seriously and always do well by doing what’s right.
Share ideas and profits
Unlike most firms, we’re also a shared enterprise. So when the firm does well, everyone does well by taking home a share of the profits. Of course, to get those profits, we need to share ideas and share responsibility for our work, too.
Bring your whole self
Now you’ve seen our values, it shouldn’t be a surprise that we’re creating a respectful, open, diverse place to work. Building an inclusive culture, where we value difference and respect our colleagues, is not just the right thing to do, it helps our people to perform at the best of their ability and realise their potential.
“We are committed to making sure that the opportunities within our firm are equally accessible for everyone – regardless of background or gender.” Dave Dunckley, CEO
There’s more to life than work
Families, children, sports, night classes…the things you do and the people you’re with outside work matter. They can inspire, motivate and energise you. Inside the office and out. So if you’d like to work flexibly, let us know. We’re happy to look at flexible working options for all our roles, and we’ll always do our best to keep your work and life in balance.
View our video below to see what life is like at Grant Thornton.
Life at Grant Thornton
#LI-MK1

Discovery is excited to be recruiting for a new Customer Service Manager as part of the Customer Care department. The successful candidate will be supporting the Customer Experience Director in driving global best in class customer satisfaction.

CS Managers are responsible for cultural fits, brand identity consistency, sharing product updates and customer feedback, training and coaching, performance report to local stakeholders, agency management and budget management.

Job responsibilities

Interface with all business teams to ensure that service levels are achieved and maintained

Proactively works closely with Product, Marketing, Video content operations and business teams to continuously improve our service and reduce customers pain points

Actively seeks solutions and provides trends & feedback to the Customer Experience Director and senior management team to drive technology and operational improvements; interface effectively with internal development teams and service owners

Demonstrates timely, accurate and professional customer service. Maintains a positive and professional demeanour and portrays the company in a positive light

Functions as an authority for operational policies, procedures, and services

Functions as an authority and escalation point for the Customer Service agency

Contributes to strengthen the relationship with the agency by proactively aiding teammates with difficult customer contacts. Demonstrates effective communication and cooperation with agency and co-workers to manage team workload and morale

Serves as a role model by displaying good judgment, positive work ethic, strong interpersonal skills, adherence to policies and demonstrates a commitment to excellent customer service

Analyses volume of incoming contacts for the team and directs workflow accordingly

Maintains quality and volume using metrics to ensure that individuals and team are at or above standard for skill group

Build and maintain accurate FAQ articles

Pro-actively suggest new ways to improve on customer services and support journeys

All other duties and special projects as assigned

Candidate expectations

Minimum 5-year experience in Customer service and 3 years as a managerial position. Ideally in a digital environment

Previous experience with call centres

Experience in International and digital environment

Fluent in English – any additional language is a bonus

Strong communication skills

Excellent organisation and prioritisation skills

Confident with Excel and PowerPoint and other MS Office tools, and GSuite

Knowledgeable on CRM systems – Zendesk ideally

Track record of efficient budget management

Excited and motivated by change, multi-tasking and fast paced environment

Available for regular travelling

Ability to motivate and inspire large groups of people is a must

Experience analysing and reporting data

Confident in managing real time environment and live events

Understand mind-set of super fans

Preferred Qualifications

Demonstrates effective communication, composure and professional attitude

Dynamic and motivational

Excellent written and oral communication skills

Demonstrated ability to coordinate between technical resources and business stakeholders

Demonstrated project management skills

Demonstrated ability to multitask in a dynamic, fast-paced, cross-functional environment

Explore our passion for discovery

Global companies and governmental entities rely on us to solve their most complex data challenges. Our employees collaborate to reduce risks and create opportunities for customers in more than 100 countries. We’re adaptable, curious and ambitious. That’s why here, you’ll have the freedom to drive change, the trust to find your own path, and the space to explore more.

Job Title: Product Manager - Location is flexible, Cardiff preferred

Job Summary:

LexisNexis Risk Solutions is seeking a Product Manager to join our growing Cardiff based team, who would take up a key role in our customer management portfolio, working closely with the product and technical teams and the wider group of stakeholders. You will act as a Product Owner for your assigned portfolio, working in a dynamic team. Not only will you be working on exciting projects and with cutting edge technologies, you will be surrounded by a team of like-minded professionals from whom you can learn and grow.

Responsibilities:
Product delivery and development lifecycle: defining and prioritising changes, leading the execution of a product roadmap for a feature, focusing on improving customer experience; working closely with the development team, fellow product managers and wider organisation
Strategy: contribution to development and execution of the product strategy
Customer focus: interacting with customers to gather requirements and understand key customer needs and market basics, ensuring we build the right things at the right time
Data driven decision making and analysis: ability to drive conclusions from data and recommend and execute relevant actions to help drive the further product development and increase customer satisfaction
Go to market and product marketing lifecycle: working closely with the internal business partners (e.g. Sales, Marketing, Customer Support) to gather and assess product needs in the marketplace, manage customer feedback providing input and expertise to the marketing and other customer materials
Experience / Qualifications:
Product Management and product owner experience
Domain knowledge in data is essential, consumer preferred
Committed to delivering high quality to the users, keeping the customers at heart of every product decision
Great organisational and prioritisation skills and attention to details with the ability to make decisions under pressure
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to connect and communicate with a wide range of stakeholders at various levels of seniority
Understanding of Agile methodologies, for example Scrum and Kanban
Women in Technology

LexisNexis Risk is very supportive of women in Technology and has been a founding signature for the Tech Talent Charter. We have the following initiatives in place to support women in technology:
Mentoring scheme for women in technology
Women’s network forum
Regularly run events for schools about careers in technology to inspire the next generation of girls in technology

Avantia is a fast-paced, private equity owned business. We provide home insurance directly to online consumers and specialise in the UK non-standard market. Our vision is to deliver the world’s most intelligent property insurance. We are making great strides in achieving this by developing a rating engine and machine learning platform that rapidly adapts to new data sources, enabling risk and retail price optimization.

As the saying goes, we’re small but perfectly formed, in that we’re a diverse group of industry professionals, technologists, data scientists and customer champions. We each bring our individual expertise, an appetite for innovation and a shared ambition to do something extraordinary. And, although each week brings new challenges, every week we work as a team to meet them. Our newly re-fitted office in South West London aids this, with plenty of break out space to enable teams from across the business to work together and genuinely make a difference to the overall business.

Our values should give you a sense of our culture, these are not just words on walls, they are a genuine reflection of how we strive to operate:

Adventurous: Wethink big. We try new things. We are always curious.

Agile: We change. We innovate. We find a way through.

Empowered: We trust each other. We work together. We are a small team doing big things.

Working in a fast-paced environment where change happens regularly is part and parcel of the business. But there is also lots of opportunity to enjoy your time outside of work and helping to achieve the right balance for you, is really important to us.

Interested? Read on to find out more about joining our team…

Key Responsibilities

This is a brand-new role created to vendor manage a recently appointed TPA. The role holder will be responsible for delivering a seamless customer experience and commercially minded approach to claims management. Key to the role will be the management of our outsourced claims handler to ensure our we operate with a best-in-class claims operation.

Deliver the HomeProtect Service Experience and Customer Culture:
Ensure the operation is always appropriately resourced by leading the forecasting process, to agree resource requirements and confirm the delivery plan is aligned to these requirements.
Oversee the performance against agreed operational KPI’s, work with the operation to identify any gaps and work with the operation to improve performance.
Maintain sufficient oversight of the team handling HomeProtect claims to ensure the required quality and experience is in place.
Work with the operation to ensure the team deliver a customer experience in line with HomeProtect’ s expectation – working in conjunction with our Customer Experience team and the delivery teams to identify opportunities to further improve, in-line with our Customer Strategy.
Chair the Assurance meetings working with stakeholders across the businesses to develop and delivery complaint and Quality Assurance improvement plans.
Support the Head of Claims & Supply chain in the delivery of the Claims Strategy.
Deliver and demonstrate best in class indemnity control:
Be aware of household claims market, industry trends and new entrants and introduce relevant process improvements where applicable.
Analise our claims data to identify opportunities to tighten our indemnity control without detriment to the end consumer; work with the operation to update or create claims handling philosophies and ensure these are adhered to.
Work with internal/External auditors to implement any improvements to working practices following audit feedback.
Chair the indemnity review meetings to have complete oversight of our indemnity spend by peril against our expectation and prior performance, identify anomalies and work with the delivery teams to understand/address them.
Support the operation dealing with technical referrals on claims reserved up to £250k.
Evidence strong Relationship Management capabilities:
Develop deep working relationships with the management of the delivery teams – align on objectives and take a collaborative approach to issue resolution.
Engage frontline staff to ensure they feel fully engaged with HomeProtect are bought into our customer strategy.
Produce high-level claims summaries to provide an overview of claims performance to be presented internally (within our Monthly Claims Business Review) and to our capacity partners (Monthly Business Review).
Requirements

Experience:
You should have at least a good level of experience in an operational claims leadership role, handling UK household claims.
CII or CIPS qualifications are preferred.
You should have evidential experience of driving customer and commercial improvements into a desk handling team and will be able to articulate the results of this work.
Analytical & hands on:
You will have, as a minimum, an intermediate understanding of MS office programs, including excel.
You will be able to extract meaningful business insights from granular claims MI to inform and improve our claims handling philosophies and meaningful trend analysis to our Underwriting colleagues.
Understand emerging technology capabilities for delivery of claims analytics and seek introduction where appropriate.
Relationship Management:
You understand that key to being successful in your role requires others to deliver for you – as such you will have strong relationship management skills and a track record of influencing others to deliver your requirements.
Benefits

We think we have a great company culture and welcome new team members with open arms. We also offer an attractive range of benefits, like:
The opportunity to work alongside brilliant people, because this isn’t something that every organisation can offer!
Great, supportive managers whose primary purpose is to help you do the best job you can
Opportunities to focus on your personal growth, we want you to develop and build your long-term career with us.
Casual dress code, because we want you to feel relaxed and comfortable
Life insurance
Annual discretionary bonus scheme
Discounted home insurance for you, your friends and your family
Pension contribution
Retail discounts
Free fruit and coffee
In-house wellbeing programme and portal
On top of that we also offer all the standard stuff, like:
25 days’ holiday
Life insurance
Annual discretionary bonus scheme
Discounted home insurance for you, your friends and your family
Pension contribution
Retail discounts
Free fruit and coffee
In-house wellbeing programme and portal
Have we captured your imagination? If so, we’d love to hear from you!
