Job Summary
Senior site role that operates as a leader to plan, implement, assure and improve the Business Management System (BMS) to meet the needs & expectations of the sites interested parties and therefore maintain all associated certification and regulatory approvals. To provide the guidance, governance and expertize to the site leadership team to nurture a culture of Quality in all site activities, ensure quality compliance and support the delivery of the site business objectives
Job Responsibilities
Working collaboratively with the site Senior Leadership Team to create and sustain a Quality culture and provide appropriate governance and assurance leadership

Planning, implementation, maintenance and continuous improvement of the site Business Management System (BMS) as a complementary extension to the GKNA Global BMS and in compliance with global BMS governance

Ensuring that the local BMS meets all requirements for programmes, customer needs and third party requirements within the defined scope of the site BMS

Systemic analysis of Business Management Systems data to the site Management Review process ensuring effective, data based, factual inputs to business decisions

Ensuring the site’s audit requirements are integral to the Regional Audit Manager plans, ensuring compliance with BMS internal, customer (2nd party) and external (3rd party) audit requirements and delivering on site follow up activities

Planning, conducting & follow up activities (including systemic analysis of risk/opportunity) of product audit as required by the programmes and activities within the scope of the BMS

Systemic risk management and mitigation for the business management systems with focus on quality and quality compliance

Escalating any BMS risks to the Site Leadership and if appropriate the Regional Director of BMS and for support/co-ordination of appropriate actions to mitigate/address these risks

Coordination, planning, hosting and leadership to ensure successful outcome of all Customer (2nd party) & Certification Body (3rd party) audits and assessments, Supporting Site Local Business Process Managers (LBPM) in resolving any issues raised as part of the audits

Act as the site representation on business management systems and Quality compliance related matters with Customers, Certifying Bodies and Aerospace Authorities

Directing Local Business Process Managers (LBPM) to ensure the adoption of the GKNA Global BMS, adapting and tailoring the local BMS processes that control and improve effectiveness and efficiency, to support the business objectives

Planning and management of the system requirements for hosting and deployment of the local BMS, its stated processes & associated controls and for training people who will be defining/utilising its functions

Recording and measuring of any defined Site Business Management Systems Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and for taking the actions necessary to improve

Managing Continuous Improvement of the BMS as well as forward planning on the integration of new regulation/specification requirements

Your Vision

Are you dreaming of a career where everyday you feel that you are making a positive impact in this world? Where you look forward to arriving at work each day, because your team, workspace and the products are inspiring and meaningful. Then you are in the right place - join us at Intelligent Change and empower people all around the world to live their best life.

Are you a creator? Do you get a kick out of seeing an idea come to life? Are you a stickler for process, deadlines and love to under promise and over deliver? Are you lovely to work with? If yes, then read on!

Intelligent Change is looking for a Product Development Manager to oversee all aspects of product development. The Product Development Manager's responsibilities include overseeing all aspects of design finalisation, sampling, supplier relationships and delivery to help grow Intelligent Change to be a global leader in lifestyle publishing and media. To be successful in this role, you should be confident in the production process, deliver to deadlines, and be passionate about creating sustainably crafted products that truly have the potential to change peoples lives.

You are a growth-oriented and thoughtful leader that contributes to an uplifting team setting, loves a transparent company culture and has excellent communication skills.

Ultimately, you’ll be an integral part of Intelligent Change's sustainable growth.

You’re Good At:
Energetic: you inspire those around you with your calls to action
Leadership: you collaborate with the entire team and production partners to meet deadlines
Enterprising: you seek out and partner with innovators and simplify the complexities of the traditional supply chain
Management: you know that great things can be accomplished in creative sustainable ways
Digital: Fluent in technology + all things digital and you are adept at learning new things quickly
Agile: Extremely adaptable and flexible, at ease with the unpredictable
Considered: You know every action has an impact on quality, cost and the earth
Responsibilities:
Fully own the critical path for all product development initiatives
Create clear product development timetables, set key mile stones and deliver on defined 'ship' dates
Issue considered briefs to designers ensuring compliance with brands standards
Source and form close collaborative partnerships with suppliers globally who share Intelligent Change's production values
Ensure there are efficient procedures to obtain and sign off on sample
Deliver product specifications to the marketing team
Partner with the operations team to develop product profit margins
Taget North American production partners to minimise carbon footprints within that market
Have an eye for design, and actively lead the product ideation process
Work with experts on carbon footprint data and create impact reports moving forward
Work with suppliers to improve the production of existing products, exploring new materials and processes
Investigate new material innovations
Articulate product sustainability and material statements
A Little More About Intelligent Change:

We’re a company that creates tools to positively change people’s lives. We’re a team united by our shared values of positive attitude, growth mindset and extreme ownership.

Intelligent Change has been positively changing lives around the world for the past 6+ years. Our best seller - Five Minute Journal has sold almost one million copies worldwide.

Tim Ferriss, Emma Watson, Camila Mendes, and Jim Kwik are only some of the inspiring individuals who use and publicly recommend our products.

Requirements

What you’ll need
A positive mindset - seeing inefficiencies and challenges as possibilities for greatness
Experience in the giftware and/or publishing industries
Adobe software experience and the ability to change print files
A passion for, and understanding of sustainability in design and production
Tenacity, and the ability to deliver on deadlines
Highly organised, detailed and focused on delivery
Strong excel skills with commercial understanding of margins, product supply chain, logistics costs and processes
Exceptional communication skills, and receptive to feedback
Problem-solving aptitude
Experience of publishing, wellness or adjacent businesses is highly meritorious
Benefits

Why join us?

Working at Intelligent Change can accelerate your career as you will have the ability to lead and build a business directly with founders. We’re a team that loves what we do and we all thrive on our ability to make an impact. There are many benefits that come with working with us such as:
Competitive compensation
Comprehensive health and dental benefits
Weekly optional remote working Fridays

We are looking for a Product Manager to come revolutionize search marketing with us. This position is a temporary 9 month contract. You’ll be an integral part of the team, growing the Adthena analytics platform including the web application and API. You’ll take responsibility for positive business outcomes, working closely with every discipline to drive the product’s market success.

Every day is an adventure when you are solving market problems in close collaboration with design, engineering, and data science, focusing on driving positive outcomes for our customers and our business. We’re looking for someone with grit and a passion for solving problems, who loves a fast-paced environment and is more interested in creating a great product than polishing a feature deck.

Product at Adthena
You’ll be part of Adthena’s Product team, working with the very best of AI specialists in London. Team members have previously worked on Blockchain, Healthcare AI and Computational Advertising. They all share a passion for user-centric design and harnessing the power of data to find innovative solutions to customer problems.

Our Product team is focused on three areas:
We are restlessly discovering the areas where we can make the most difference for our customers and our business. Everything we build is tied to and measured by the value and outcome it brings our users and buyers as well as its impact on our objectives.

Figuring out what we need to build and prioritising when we build it is a core responsibility. We bring the vision and context to empower great decisions, so we focus on posing the right questions rather than dictating detailed solutions. This involves ensuring that potential risks are mitigated such as value, feasibility, usability and viability risks.

We believe in a collaborative partnership where Product focuses on customer and business outcomes, while Engineering, Design and Data Science focus on how we get there. Product’s main role in execution is to be the voice of the market and make sure we achieve what we set out to do by being the glue that binds teams together. We communicate the “who, what, why and when” to the company and work closely with Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success to ensure our customers’ success.

Note: This posting is for candidates willing and able to work from London. If you are seeking an opportunity to work remotely in a different area, apply to the same position in the remote category. Please avoid applying to both.
Main Responsibilities and Activities:
You’ll contribute to the product vision and direction to achieve Adthena’s key objectives and communicate it to the wider business.
You’ll take ownership of your own objectives and product area, taking on the responsibility for business and customer outcomes.
You’ll engage in market, competitive, and user research to deeply understand customer’s needs and problems. Always represent the voice of the customer.
You’ll contribute to the product roadmap by prioritizing the main areas of focus for your products based on user and buyer value, business viability, and time to impact.
You’ll ideate and collaborate closely with design, development, and data science to come up with and test innovative solutions to problems that work for our customers and our business.
You’ll contribute to the product development lifecycle by gathering customer feedback, writing and prioritising user stories, and ensuring the customer’s needs are met through constant iteration.
You’ll measure and report on user success based on usage statistics, analytics, and feedback.
Requirements
You’ve worked as a product manager on the full lifecycle of digital products.
You have working experience with market research to understand and clearly articulate to the business a market opportunity, competitive analysis, or customer need or problem.
You have worked with user experience teams focused on user-centered design and development teams working in Agile or Kanban.
You work effectively with cross functional teams including recommending controversial approaches to management.
You’re obsessed with the customers and market, always seeking to learn and discover more.
You always champion the customer, market, and product vision to everyone in the building and constantly gather feedback from everyone.
You have a track record of coming up with creative, innovative solutions to needs that customers didn’t even know they had.
You’re a problem solver who likes to have full ownership of an outcome, rolls up their sleeves, and gets shit done.
Bonus Points
You have working experience managing B2B SaaS solutions.
You have built business cases and worked on value-based pricing.
You are accustomed to working with data scientists, or AI product developers.
You’re interested in behavioural science.
You have a technical background with hands-on experience in software development on mobile or web technologies.
You have a passion for machine learning and predictive modelling.
Core Values:
Get Shit Done
Freedom with Responsibility
Smart and Always Improving
Deliver Remarkable Quality

This is a really exciting role working within our Product Team however with a strong data focus. We are looking for someone who has experience defining a logical data model and also has experience with data standardisation, working on how we scale data pipelines to aggregate multiple data sources in.

If you are looking for a challenge that involves working with a lot of data then please read on . . .

Our Purpose

To make a more open land market to empower the next generation of property developers to build the homes (& places) we need for an ever growing and diverse population

“Like all great tech companies, we started with a problem.

Andrew (an east-London, quasi-hipster software engineer) wanted to build a house. And I (Jonny, a Geordie, ex-town planner turned software developer) knew the pain of the property industry systems he’d need to use to build that house.

We both knew that fixing those systems – making it easier to access that data – would help a whole load of people.

And thus LandTech was born – an ecosystem helping to make the entire house building process more efficient.

We started with LandInsight, the hugely successful (and multi-award-winning) site-sourcing platform. Then we added LandEnhance to help get planning permission, and LandFund to help secure funding.

But, not content to just be the fastest-growing PropTech company in the UK, we’re now heading international. Because all those problems we’re fixing aren’t just UK problems – they’re worldwide.

We’re helping to build more houses. Better houses. Plus the roads, schools, hospitals, and gyms to go with them.

Help us make that happen” - CEO/Co-Founder, Jonny Britton

Some achievements & awards so far:
Top 10 SaaS Companies to work for - Sales Confidence, 2018 & 2019
Excellence in People Development - PropTech, 2018
Fastest-growing Business - PropTech, 2018
Department Purpose

The Product team at LandTech is a diverse mix of Designers and Product Managers who share some core values. We’re curious, we have a passion for deeply understanding our users’ needs and we’re determined to deliver high quality user experiences.

We do a lot of research to figure out what matters to our users, determine which problems we want to solve and in what order. Once we’ve homed in on a problem we work collaboratively to design and test the solution, build it and launch. We’re growing quickly so there’s always exciting new projects in the pipeline.

Role Remit & Outline

As part of the Product team, reporting to the Head of Product, this new role will develop and own a global data platform.

Main Accountabilities including the following:
Own our global data product roadmap. You will be a strategist who will set the high-level vision and direction for our data strategy, and turn it into actionable tasks. You’ll ensure our data strategy helps us meet our product-wide strategy, and will also be commercially minded.
Own our central product data model and data products including an existing API
Collaborate closely with the other PMs, understanding their data needs for the various products they manage. You’ll work with individuals across our Product and Engineering teams, advising on data best practices.
Bring innovation to our data services, looking for opportunities to develop our proposition further
Act as an evangelist for our data services internally and externally, and as the first point of contact with the rest of the business for data queries
You will manage the data product backlog, and lead sprint planning and scoping sessions, bringing an ability to prioritize and execute to our data services
Help us develop an efficient product development process by identifying and removing roadblocks to realise product milestones.
Key Deliverables:
You will deliver scalable global data services that can be leveraged by all LandTech products
You’ll lay out a vision for developing our data products proposition

Butler Rose is pleased to be working in partnership with a company in London in the search for a Finance Systems Manager on a full-time permanent basis.

As the Finance Systems Manager you will be an expert in SUN system and help maintain a robust control environment to enable efficient and timely reconciliation and postings are carried out, ensuring that finance systems are embedded into the full IT strategy.

Key responsibilities:

• Deliver subject matter expertise on the Sun accounting system and other allocated finance IT systems
• Be the Technical Administrator for Sun accounting systems and work with the IT department and support vendors to maintain the uptime of the relevant servers
• Project manage all changes to the Sun accounting system ensuring that the necessary consultation, testing and user acceptance sign off is carried out as required
• Prepare and maintain the manual and user guide for the Sun accounting system and any other finance IT systems
• Manage and maintain the chart of accounts and business rules in the Sun accounting system
• Build a suite of standard and ad-hoc reports using Infor Query & Analysis, SUN SRS, SQL Server and Tableau for finance and business users
• Set and maintain standards for data governance and produce guidelines in respect of data integrity and data quality

Key attributes required:

• Qualified Accountant (ACA/ACCA/CIMA or equivalent)
• Solid experience maintaining the finance IT system aspects of the Sun accounting system
• Significant experience of implementing and maintaining a robust finance IT systems control environment
• Highly experienced in working with large volumes of financial transactions on computerised financial systems
• Ability to deliver training to staff on all finance systems, in both groups and one to one settings
• Clear understanding of the regulatory framework of accounting
• Experience in analysing and extracting data from SQL databases
• Strong IT skills to include Word and Advanced Excel capability

Butler Rose is committed to equality in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer.
Butler Rose Ltd is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

ROLE OVERVIEW

We’re looking for a confident, experienced, extremely organised and process-driven person; who is passionate about understanding and solving business and user problems through technology.

Croud invests heavily in Technology and Tools to support the work of the teams. The Product Manager plays a key role in shaping Croud’s multi-stream product strategy, as well as ensuring delivery against the product roadmap and driving adoption by ownership of user training and product evangelism.

Reporting to the Head of Product, this role is crucial in ensuring that Croud’s product planning, specification and delivery processes are all adhered to in order to ensure that Croud meets its strategic objectives.

Talking to different user groups on a regular basis, this role plays a key role in driving adoption by working to really understand user challenges, helping shape and deliver solutions that are effective, efficient and to time; and delivering training and support to users to drive adoption whilst measuring and monitoring impact of all releases through appropriate metrics.

The right hire will share Croud’s values:

Passion: loving what you do and being driven to excel with each new project
Imagination: meeting challenges creatively and ready to try new ideas
Integrity: accountable and always excellent to one another

RESPONSIBILITIES
Help drive Croud’s product processes, from idea generation and discovery to prioritisation, specification and delivery
Help shape, update and communicate the product roadmap
Define and constantly optimise feature specs, customer journeys, UX flows, and UI designs
Use quantitative and qualitative data to inform and refine the roadmap’s prioritisation process
Define the goals, set priorities and manage the product development process
Support cross-functional teams throughout the project from inception to delivery
Create clear documentation for the development team and QA process
Post delivery, support the creation of training materials and work on user adoption with the broader team
Ongoing management of bug fixes and product refinements

Key stakeholders:

Line Manager: Head of Product
Key stakeholders: Product Director, Technical Director, Chief Technology Officer, Product Executive
Other stakeholders: Engineering Team, Operational Teams

PERSON SPECIFICATION
Demonstrable proven product management experience, including working with a range of cross-functional teams
Extremely organised, process-driven and passionate about best-in-class documentation processes, from feature specifications and discovery to user feedback
Clear project management experience within a previous role to deliver against delivery targets is crucial
Proven track record of defining strong customer experience requirements and a passionate commitment to the customer and to product quality
The experience of working with users or clients to drive effective product improvement in the past
The ability to demonstrate knowledge and basic understanding of digital marketing channel operations without the requirement of being an expert
Experience using design patterns and user feedback to create wireframes for all appropriate development work
Inherently collaborative and leading personality that enables you to win hearts and minds of your peers to successfully execute the product roadmap

Our Organisation

NHS England and NHS Improvement came together on 1 April 2019 as a new single organisation. The NHS Long Term Plan focuses on delivering integrated care to patients at the local level and we can best support the NHS to deliver this as a single integrated organisation.

At the NHS, we are reminded every day of how important life is. As a flexible working friendly organisation, we want to be sure that you can work in a way that is best for us and for our patients, and for you. Speak to us about how we might be able to accommodate a flexible working arrangement whether that’s job share, part time or another flexible pattern. In addition, although the role advertised may have an ‘home’ office base indicated, we remain committed to supporting flexibility around workplace locations. If it works for the service, we will do our best to make it work for you.

Our new operating model represents a strong shift to regional delivery supported by expert corporate teams. Local health systems are supported by our integrated regional teams who play a major leadership role in the geographies they manage.

We are jointly committed to creating and maintaining a fair and supportive working environment and culture, where contributions are fully recognised and valued by all and staff feel empowered to carry out their duties to the best of their abilities. As employers we are committed to promoting and protecting the physical and mental health and well-being of all our staff. This underpins our values as set out in the NHS Constitution, supports us to be an Employer of Choice and ultimately enables our employees to support the effective care of our patients.

An exciting opportunity has arisen to help to help transform the quality of mental health (MH) programmes and services across the East of England.

As Quality Improvement Manager (Transformation), the post holder will work as part of a dynamic team in supporting MH Programme and Clinical network activity. The post holder will support quality improvement in complex pathways of care through expertise in:

Developing effective clinical networks
Change management and quality improvement
Programme and project management.

The successful candidate will lead on elements of the Mental Health Crisis Pathway programme whilst also providing support to some other of the other work streams within the Adult Mental Health Regional Programme.

The Regional Mental Health Programme team, undertake a broad programme of activities to support commissioners and providers with their core purpose of quality improvement and ultimately benefit patient and population health outcomes.

The post is responsible for providing professional expertise to optimise business processes for the Mental Health Programme team.

The post holder will define current processes, facilitate discussions and advise colleagues as to how best practice might be adopted in the definition of future processes, document those processes as they are agreed and support their delivery.

Shortlisting will be completed within one week of the advert closing, with interviews taking place during the following fortnight (ie within 3 weeks of the advert close date).

This is a short term contract due to the nature of the work and national funding, with the possibility for extension beyond a year.

For further details / informal visits contact:

Name: Emma Willey

Job title: Senior MH Transformation Lead

Email address: emma.willey@nhs.net

Telephone number: 07702 405473

Our commitments to you

We are passionate about creating an inclusive workplace that promotes and values diversity. We know through experience that different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds create a stronger and more creative work environment that delivers better patient outcomes. We welcome applications irrespective of people's age, disability, sex, gender identity and gender expression, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, sexual orientation, or other personal circumstances. We have policies and procedures in place to ensure that all applicants are treated fairly and consistently at every stage of the recruitment process, including the consideration of reasonable adjustments for people who have a disability.

Applications are welcomed from applicants who wish to apply for a position on the basis of a smarter or flexible working arrangement. Where candidates are successful at interview, such requests will be taken under consideration and accommodated where the needs of the service allow.

Please note that we currently do not accept applications via CV or recruitment agencies.

The NHSBSA is responsible for the processing of your application; a privacy notice is attached to advise you on how we will process your personal data.

After applying via NHS Jobs, your submitted application will be imported into our preferred third-party recruitment system. All subsequent information regarding your application will be generated from apps.trac.jobs. If you are appointed to a post, information will also be transferred into the NHS Electronic Staff Records system.

You will not be able to track the progress of your application or receive messages through NHS Jobs, and furthermore, as an employer, we will not be able to respond to any e-mails sent to us via NHS Jobs. If you have a query relating to your application, please contact the recruitment team on nhsei@nhsbsa.nhs.uk or 0300 330 1369.

Disclosure and Barring Service Check

This post is subject to the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act (Exceptions Order) 1975 and as such it will be necessary for a submission for Disclosure to be made to the Disclosure and Barring Service (formerly known as CRB) to check for any previous criminal convictions.

Tier 2 Certificate of Sponsorship

Applications from job seekers who require current Tier 2 sponsorship to work in the UK are welcome and will be considered alongside all other applications. However, non-EEA candidates may not be appointed to a post if a suitably qualified, experienced and skilled EU/EEA candidate is available to take up the post as the employing body is unlikely, in these circumstances, to satisfy the current Resident Labour Market Test which will be in place until the end of December 2020. UK Visas and Immigration requires employers to complete this test to show that no suitably qualified EEA or EU worker can fill the post. For further information please visit the UK Visas and Immigration website.

From 6 April 2017, Tier 2 skilled worker applicants, applying for entry clearance into the UK, have had to present a criminal record certificate from each country they have resided continuously or cumulatively for 12 months or more in the past 10 years. Adult dependants (over 18 years old) are also subject to this requirement.

Guidance can be found here Criminal Records Checks For Overseas Applicants
